         $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');\n          $copy.find('script').remove();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);\n      }\n  //]]\u003e\n href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/173429036\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Lora\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4632071-lora\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Lora\"  \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/173429036?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 20, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Lora\" class=\"user\" name=\"Lora\" href=\"/user/show/4632071-lora\"\u003eLora\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780590353403\" href=\"/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\u003cspan class=\"uitext greyText\"\u003eRecommends it for: \u003c/span\u003e\n           \u003cspan class=\"uitext reviewText\"\u003eanyone who is still waiting to read it\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003eRecommended to Lora by: \u003c/span\u003e\n      Tina, Morgan, my own curiosity\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=lib-read\"\u003elib-read\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=book-to-movie\"\u003ebook-to-movie\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=middle-grade-lit\"\u003emiddle-grade-lit\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=surprised-me\"\u003esurprised-me\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer173429036\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9371981851681000886\"\u003eI'm going to keep this brief since there isn't much to say that hasn't already been said. *clears throat*\u003cbr /\u003eI think the reason I waited so long to read this series is because I just couldn't imagine myself enjoying reading about an eleven-year-old boy and his adventures at a school of wizardry. I thought it would be too juvenile for my taste. I was wrong, of course.\u003cbr /\u003eI can honestly say that I loved every minute of this. It's a spectacular little romp with funny, courageous, and endearing characters t\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9371981851681000886\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI'm going to keep this brief since there isn't much to say that hasn't already been said. *clears throat*\u003cbr /\u003eI think the reason I waited so long to read this series is because I just couldn't imagine myself enjoying reading about an eleven-year-old boy and his adventures at a school of wizardry. I thought it would be too juvenile for my taste. I was wrong, of course.\u003cbr /\u003eI can honestly say that I loved every minute of this. It's a spectacular little romp with funny, courageous, and endearing characters that you can't help but love.\u003cbr /\u003eIt has talking chess pieces, singing hats, a giant three-headed dog named Fluffy, a hilarious giant with a dragon fetish, a master wizard that's just a little bit crazy, mail carrier owls, goblins running a bank, unicorns, centaurs(!), trolls . . . and probably much more that I'm forgetting. \u003cbr /\u003eAnd then there's the lead characters: Hermione, the young scholar who starts out prim and up-tight but soon becomes a true friend; Ron, the boy who has little money but who has an abundance of family and loyalty to his friends to make up for it; and then there's Harry, the boy who starts out sleeping in a closet and ends up being a hero. Harry is kind to those that deserve it, fearless when it counts the most, and wonderfully intelligent. What's not to love? \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIn regards to the ending: \u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[I feel silly saying this about a middle grade novel, but I didn't suspect Quirrell a bit! If there were hints that he was the true culprit and not Snape, I obviously missed them. \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFAVORITE QUOTE: \u003ci\u003e\"But from that moment on, Hermione Granger became their friend. There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.\"\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNow, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to start \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling\"\u003eHarry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*******************************************************\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy reviews of other titles in this series:\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/173434838\"\u003eHarry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9371981851681000886\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n href=\"/review/show/346176116?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJul 26, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Khanh (the Grinch)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Khanh (the Grinch)\" href=\"/user/show/4527753-khanh-the-grinch\"\u003eKhanh (the Grinch)\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4527753-khanh-the-grinch?shelf=all-time-favorites\"\u003eall-time-favorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer346176116\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer3117271061571780937\"\u003eRereading for the 3rd time for the group read.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOnce upon a time, there was a 10th grader named Khanh who didn't get along with people very well. She wasn't an outcast in school, and all the bullying and teasing stopped with the commencement of high school, but she had always been a bookworm and has generally preferred the company of her own thoughts.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1384328297i/6850034._SY540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eLunchtime had always been dedicated not to eating, but to sitting in the library, browsing through books.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e(Not to worry, she got her nutrition in 5th\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3117271061571780937\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eRereading for the 3rd time for the group read.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOnce upon a time, there was a 10th grader named Khanh who didn't get along with people very well. She wasn't an outcast in school, and all the bullying and teasing stopped with the commencement of high school, but she had always been a bookworm and has generally preferred the company of her own thoughts.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1384328297i/6850034._SY540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eLunchtime had always been dedicated not to eating, but to sitting in the library, browsing through books.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e(Not to worry, she got her nutrition in 5th period in the form of a giant 6-inch M\u0026amp;M studded cookie and a package of Sour Patch Kids and/or a package of Reese's Pieces. Ah, the effortless metabolism of youth.)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOne day, there were shiny new books on her school library's \"New Releases\" shelf. Harry Potter, books 1 through 3. She had heard of the books before, of course, since they were a constant presence on the NYT bestsellers list, but she had always avoided them, thinking of them as children's novels.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAt the grand age of 14, surely she was too old for a little kid's fantasy novel. She had read the \u003ci\u003eOutlander\u003c/i\u003e series earlier that year, after all. And it had sex in it. SEX! She didn't really quite understand everything in the book, but the point is, she had read them. Surely, at 14, Khanh was ready for more mature novels.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd that did not include Harry Potter. \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter is 11. Khanh is 14.\u003c/b\u003e There is a vast difference in their ages. Khanh was a \u003ci\u003eteenager\u003c/i\u003e, dammit.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBut the Harry Potter books were new. Brand new. They were shiny, they had never been touched by another reader. And Khanh was tempted.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eShe picked up the first book in the series: \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/i\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe end.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eOr rather, the beginning.\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"3117271061571780937\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review346176116\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/80615382?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMay 08, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"★ \" class=\"user\" name=\"★ \" href=\"/user/show/2683062\"\u003e★ \u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan        Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2683062?shelf=5-star-excellent\"\u003e5-star-excellent\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca href=\"/review/list/2683062?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer80615382\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12726126618478348968\"\u003eMy original review was a comparison of sorts between Harry Potter and Twilight. However, this is stupid as the two are incomparable. Honestly, its not even worth discussing. Its not just that Twilight doesn't come close, it is the fact that Harry Potter transcends other similar works. Its peerless. To quote Samuel L. Jackson in Pulp Fiction: It \u003ci\u003e\"ain't the same fuckin' ballpark, it ain't the same league, it ain't even the same fuckin' sport.\" \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere was a day when I thought I needed to defend Harr\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText12726126618478348968\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eMy original review was a comparison of sorts between Harry Potter and Twilight. However, this is stupid as the two are incomparable. Honestly, its not even worth discussing. Its not just that Twilight doesn't come close, it is the fact that Harry Potter transcends other similar works. Its peerless. To quote Samuel L. Jackson in Pulp Fiction: It \u003ci\u003e\"ain't the same fuckin' ballpark, it ain't the same league, it ain't even the same fuckin' sport.\" \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere was a day when I thought I needed to defend Harry Potter, in the midst of the now dead Twilight craze, and you can see that below in what was my original review. It is a testament to the power of this series, that while various other franchises (Twilight, Hunger Games) have surged into popularity and then faded, Harry Potter remains unwaveringly strong after nineteen years. It is clear readers hold just as much admiration for these books as they always have. Time has not dimmed that.\u003cbr /\u003eI will, one day, write an essay about what these books mean to me. Eternal, this is the one that started it all. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003eOriginal review (circa 2010) \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eA note in regard to the on-going Potter vs Twilight debate: \u003cbr /\u003eGo ahed, tell me \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/41865.Twilight__Twilight___1_\" title=\"Twilight (Twilight, #1) by Stephenie Meyer\"\u003eTwilight\u003c/a\u003e is better. \u003cbr /\u003eTell me that James is scarier than Voldemort, \u003cbr /\u003eThat the Cullens are a better family than the Weasly's \u003cbr /\u003eThat Edward is cooler than Harry, \u003cbr /\u003eand Bella is smarter than Hermione. \u003cbr /\u003eTell me that \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/941441.Stephenie_Meyer\" title=\"Stephenie Meyer\"\u003eStephenie Meyer\u003c/a\u003e is more talented than \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling\" title=\"J.K. Rowling\"\u003eJ.K. Rowling\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eGo ahead, \u003cbr /\u003eI dare you. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThose who think the topic of Harry Potter or Twilight is worth debating and arguing over, \u003cbr /\u003eare utterly stupid. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eQuite frankly-this book is amazing. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"12726126618478348968\" href=\"#\" class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer108852775\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan Duh. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003e Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOH LORDY. Every time I read this book it brings back so many memories, and also gets me excited to read the rest of the series again as well because there is so much foreshadowing!! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFor example:\u003cbr /\u003e-Sirius Black is casually mentioned in the first chapter\u003cbr /\u003e-Mrs. Figg is talked about a bit, as she looks after Harry from time to time (or all the time, ayyyy?)\u003cbr /\u003e-it always cracks me up when Hagrid says you'd have\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6551636883706902061\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003eReview for Illustrated Edition\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ePerfect. Duh. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003e Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOH LORDY. Every time I read this book it brings back so many memories, and also gets me excited to read the rest of the series again as well because there is so much foreshadowing!! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFor example:\u003cbr /\u003e-Sirius Black is casually mentioned in the first chapter\u003cbr /\u003e-Mrs. Figg is talked about a bit, as she looks after Harry from time to time (or all the time, ayyyy?)\u003cbr /\u003e-it always cracks me up when Hagrid says you'd have to be mad to try and rob Gringotts... Damn crazy kids.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAlso here was a line in Dumbledore's chocolate frog card bio that said AND I QUOTE, \"Professor Dumbledore enjoys chamber music and tenpin bowling.\" HAHAHAHA WHAT EVEN. NOW I'M IMAGINING HIM BOWLING DRAMATICALLY TO CHAMBER MUSIC.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling is the queen forever and always.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003eRe-Read in July 2012\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eGINNY'S FANGIRLING IN THIS BOOK IS JUST TOO GOOD.\u003cbr /\u003eAlso, the Dursleys aren't as bad as people think they are, because after all, they DID pick Harry up at the end of the year rather than just abandoning him. So THAT'S worth something.\u003cbr /\u003emmmm, this book smells so good. itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/86964275\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"K.D. Absolutely\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2156200-k-d-absolutely\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"K.D. Absolutely\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471967140p2/2156200.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/86964275?book_show_action=false\"\u003eSep 06, 2014\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"K.D. Absolutely\" class=\"user\" name=\"K.D. Absolutely\" href=\"/user/show/2156200-k-d-absolutely\"\u003eK.D. Absolutely\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003eRecommended to K.D. by: \u003c/span\u003e\n      Purplycookie, Jzhun and Ruby\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2156200-k-d-absolutely?shelf=501\"\u003e501\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2156200-k-d-absolutely?shelf=childrens\"\u003echildrens\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer86964275\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13908868695059240124\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eHow can more than half of my Goodreads friends be wrong with this?\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI have to get this right. As of this writing, I have \u003cb\u003e98\u003c/b\u003e Goodreads friends. \u003cb\u003e61 (62%)\u003c/b\u003e of them have read J. K. Rowling's \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/i\u003e. Out of those who read this, \u003cb\u003e39 (64%)\u003c/b\u003e rated this with 5 stars. \u003cb\u003e11\u003c/b\u003e of them with 4 stars. All the others gave 3 or 2. Only 2 rated this with 1 star. One of them admitted not being able to finish it. \u003cs\u003eShe should not have rated it really since she did not read its entirety. (But she\u003c/s\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText13908868695059240124\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eHow can more than half of my Goodreads friends be wrong with this?\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI have to get this right. As of this writing, I have \u003cb\u003e98\u003c/b\u003e Goodreads friends. \u003cb\u003e61 (62%)\u003c/b\u003e of them have read J. K. Rowling's \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/i\u003e. Out of those who read this, \u003cb\u003e39 (64%)\u003c/b\u003e rated this with 5 stars. \u003cb\u003e11\u003c/b\u003e of them with 4 stars. All the others gave 3 or 2. Only 2 rated this with 1 star. One of them admitted not being able to finish it. \u003cs\u003eShe should not have rated it really since she did not read its entirety. (But she is my friend and it is her right, so why question?)\u003c/s\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWhen the book came out in 1998, I was not yet a bookworm so I brushed this aside. I read only those books that my brother told me to read. He was the bookworm but he would not be caught reading any book being pushed by media hype. However, when Warner Bros. released the film adaptation in 2001, my daughter was 6 years old and I thought that, since there was too much hype, the movie must be good and we would have a memorable time with our first ever father-daughter movie date. I was wrong. She not only got scared because of the darkness inside the movie house but she trembled with fear during the life-size human chess game, in that scene when Ron was sacrificed. We left the movie in that scene with my daughter crying and me cursing it: \u003ci\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003eI will never read Harry Potter\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/i\u003e.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy daughter is now 15 going 16. She is not fond of movies and she still does not show interest on reading Harry Potter. However, I am now a bookworm and the other week, I was with my 4 Goodreads friends and 3 of them raved (two of them, again) about Harry Potter books. Oh well, first-time fathers can make mistakes about first movie date with their daughters, Book 1 is included in 500 Must Read Books and the book must be a quick read. So the following day, I bought my copy.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAfter 13 years of the book's existence and me ignoring it, did I finally make a good decision of reading it? Are all of those 39 friends of mine in Goodreads wrong in giving this 5 stars? Most of them did not bother writing a review. Maybe those would be too long or maybe they read this when they were not in Goodreads yet. But I am in Goodreads already so I can make this review long.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThese are what some of them say:\u003cblockquote\u003e \u003ci\u003e\u003cb\u003eit was a great book \u003cbr /\u003ei enjoyed reading it\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e For an eloquent reviewer, she must have been too happy to express herself. \u003cblockquote\u003e \u003ci\u003e\u003cb\u003eSuch a great story and creative way of writing. I love Harry Potter.\u003c/b\u003e \u003c/i\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e Yes, I agree about the story being great and J. K. Rowling being creative. \u003cblockquote\u003e \u003ci\u003e\u003cb\u003eI was secretly wishing I was studying in Hogwarts too! It was silly, but I was simply enraptured by Harry Potter. Honestly, I still am :) It was a great book. I enjoyed reading it\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e Coming from one of my favorite reviewers in Goodreads. I do not share her wanting to be a sorcerer though. \u003cblockquote\u003e \u003ci\u003e\u003cb\u003eHonestly, I don't know anybody who'd refuse to even entertain the thought of attending a school for wizards.\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e Another one of my favorite reviewers. That seems to have nailed this. Young people wanting to be in Hogwarts and study sorcery. That should be it! The world seems to be a dreadful place that we would all like to have powers to turn our enemies into frogs, pigs, ride on a broomstick and get the Snitch and earn points (money) for our family!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOh well, the Bible says that sorcery is Satan's work. The book even used the word Transfiguration as a subject in the sorcery school. Blasphemy.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eJust kidding. This is a work of fiction and I am not too old to appreciate it. I was just kidding. To be frank, I tried hard not to like this. I thought that giving this a 1 or 2 will freak out my friends and somehow get votes from those who are, up to now, ignoring this book. \u003ci\u003eI told you so! Why waste your time? \u003c/i\u003e. However, unless you are a grumpy old man/woman, there is nothing not to like about this book. I maybe too old for it but hey, talent is talent and J. K. Rowling \u003ci\u003ehas\u003c/i\u003e it!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy 39 friends are indeed right!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"13908868695059240124\" href=\"#\"    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      Nov 11, 2016 09:03PM\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 86964275, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_46540413\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/46540413\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Stephen\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1413439-stephen\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Stephen\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1311616811p2/1413439.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/46540413?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 04, 2013\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Stephen\" class=\"user\" name=\"Stephen\" href=\"/user/show/1413439-stephen\"\u003eStephen\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eliked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=ya\"\u003eya\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=potteresque\"\u003epotteresque\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=1990-1999\"\u003e1990-1999\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=comfort-food\"\u003ecomfort-food\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer46540413\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2203760265994864185\"\u003eOn my list of \u003cb\u003ereasons\u003c/b\u003e why \u003cb\u003emy daughters\u003c/b\u003e are the \u003cb\u003ebestest thing\u003c/b\u003e to ever happen to me, \u003cb\u003eNumber 14,577\u003c/b\u003e is that they gave me, at \u003cb\u003e41 years old\u003c/b\u003e, the perfect \u003cb\u003eexcuse\u003c/b\u003e to revisit the \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e series. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWhen my oldest angel told me she wanted to start reading the Harry Potter books, I couldn’t have been happier. As I was collecting all seven volumes off the shelf to bring up to her room, I started feeling nostalgic for the whole Hogwarts gang, and I realized that I’d never done more than a perfunctory revie\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText2203760265994864185\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eOn my list of \u003cb\u003ereasons\u003c/b\u003e why \u003cb\u003emy daughters\u003c/b\u003e are the \u003cb\u003ebestest thing\u003c/b\u003e to ever happen to me, \u003cb\u003eNumber 14,577\u003c/b\u003e is that they gave me, at \u003cb\u003e41 years old\u003c/b\u003e, the perfect \u003cb\u003eexcuse\u003c/b\u003e to revisit the \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e series. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWhen my oldest angel told me she wanted to start reading the Harry Potter books, I couldn’t have been happier. As I was collecting all seven volumes off the shelf to bring up to her room, I started feeling nostalgic for the whole Hogwarts gang, and I realized that I’d never done more than a perfunctory review of this first volume. I figured it was high time to rectify that oversight.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry deserves it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHowever, with over a million ratings, and almost two reviews for every day I’ve been alive, I think I can dispense with any plot distillation or character profiles. It has all been eloquently said before. Therefore, I just want to briefly express what I see as the essential magic at the heart of the series, and why I think it has resonated so strongly with so many people. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHere goes...\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOnly rarely does a story come along that can so completely wrap you up in a warm blanket of contentment and good feelings. One that can hold at bay, even if only for precious moments, the nasty brutishness of what often passes for daily life. These stories do that. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt’s an escape into a world of optimism, honor, and hope, where things always look hopeful and anything is possible. Who wouldn't want to hang around in a place like that, especially when it is decorated with sorting hats, kindly giants, magic wands and Quidditch.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eGranted...no aspect of the story is revolutionary, or even particularly noteworthy, from the standpoint of blazing new trails within the fantasy genre. It isn’t great literature, and nothing about its technical merits makes it befitting of even a fraction of its unprecedented success. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFine...acknowledged. And? So what!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe virtue of this story is the postive feelings it conjures in its readers. Harry’s story is something that radiates acceptance, inclusion, and friendship. It invokes a sense of belonging. Inside these pages, you can find the impetus to see the better angels of humanity’s nature, and feel just a little better about the world around you.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHow is that not worthy of praise?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs for Harry himself, he’s just a good kid. The quintessential everyman who makes good. A loving boy with a clear head on his shoulders and a caring heart that pumps affection for the world around him. He’s someone you can’t help but like. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHe’s not perfect. He makes mistakes, he’s occasionally short sighted, and I know many of us wish he would stick up for himself a little more. Maybe reduce his aunt and uncle to a pair of fatty stains on the carpet, or give Dudley an atomic wedgie until his skivvies scrape against his pancreas. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut that’s not Harry. He’s a better person than that. That’s why we love him. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMaybe all of the above is a bit much. Like I said, I was feeling nostalgic and maybe the gush got a tad away from me. Let’s just say that these stories are perfect comfort food and reading them will make you happy. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI’ll certainly settle for that. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs for the rating, I Initially only gave this first volume 3 stars, and I’m not going to change that now. As much as I love the series as a whole, I don’t think it reaches stratospheric heights until \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling\"\u003eHarry Potter and the Goblet of Fire\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eStill, this is where it all began. As such, it should be read and savored knowing that it only gets better.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e3.0 stars. Highly Recommended. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"2203760265994864185\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n most important novels in the modern history, Sorry, it's \u003cb\u003eThe Most Important ONE.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eThis Review al\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4563264466270173843\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eIt's Always Great, Coming back Home..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg Harry Potter is not just a story..it's a Life..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472432297ra/20192894.gif\" width=\"470\" height=\"264\" alt=\"\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003eThe Boy Who \u003cs\u003eSaved\u003c/s\u003e Flourished the Book Industry\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003c/b\u003eIt's really One of the most important novels in the modern history, Sorry, it's \u003cb\u003eThe Most Important ONE.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eThis Review also for those who hate the series !\u003cbr\u003ePlease bear with me..\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWithout it,most of the Book stores and publishers may have the same fate of the Video stores Blockbuster LLC, which despite being super popular in the 90s, closed all the stores by 2013 ,shutting down forever.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411425655i/11225976._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eYes, without this novel, and with the rapid change in technology, the ease of making e-books and reading it in PCs, Smartphones,Tablets ,etc, the publishing and trade of new paper books may decrease rapidly.\u003cbr\u003e It'd be limited for religious or some educating books, classic and small novels., even these kinds of books goes just electronic…. and the books be just like an old Video Tape.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411427520i/11226186._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA Dystopia ,right? very gloomy idea to the world without This novel,\u003cb\u003e The One.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWell, in the case you think I'm exaggerate..Let's have\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA \u003ci\u003eBrief !!!\u003c/i\u003e History of Literature in the 90s\u003cbr\u003e------------------------------------------\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWell, let’s back to the early 90s , where TV is in every house,even in every room ,Video sets are there too, rental video stores everywhere and satellite receivers and cable channels growing fast, with many channels for kids and teenagers making them attached more and more into screens, not to mention Video Games, Game boy and Nintendo… \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThose from this new generation who read are “weirdos\" or \"nerds” to the rest of their peers.\u003cbr\u003eAnd for those “few who read” book stores mostly got for them just comics and graphic novels, which most of them created early this century.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411429565i/11226560._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"400\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe classic novels they read just for schools and education, otherwise they merely know the movies that based on.\u003cbr\u003eThe new novels that make a best seller are the ones which made ,or will be made, into movies for Julia Roberts, Tom Cruse or any of the 90s Hollywood celebrity , or the ones by Stephen King because ,of course, will be made into movies too.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eEven these novels didn't live up the selling numbers of Tolkien, Charles Dickens, Agatha Christie -what’s with the British authors and selling numbers :)?- also in Russia no more Dostoevsky and Tolstoy , no more Hugo in France.\u003cbr\u003eAlso in \u003cb\u003eEgypt\u003c/b\u003e no more like Naguib Mahfouz and the great authors of the 50s to 70s...No new big hit for novels, most of the selling books are those of Speculation about strange and mysterious things in the world or in religion,Dreams explications , cocking books or just celebrities rumors.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411582524i/11251816._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"390\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWhile in US and UK it selling books mostly the self help books, or those which teach how to make Computers programs or even web sites -this brand new huge technology leap back then.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584118i/11252020._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"401\" height=\"174\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNo new novels to attract the new generation of kids and teenagers, just some few successful highlights like R.L.Stine’s Goosepumbs in 1992 which make a very good success, and translated in many countries including Egypt.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584118i/11252021._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"188\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd in Egypt there’s also a very successful project made by The Modern Arabic Institution for Publishing \u0026amp; Distribution which made “Pocket Novels” for youth , by brilliant Egyptian writers,who presented excellent variety of novels of many genres, Sci-Fi, Action Thriller, comics, Romance .etc.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584118i/11252022._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"401\" height=\"274\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThere’s also “Reading for All”,project by the first lady “Susan Mubarak” which printed a huge verity of important books and novels from all over the world in very cheap prices.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584576i/11252145._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"401\" height=\"274\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBut all these effort didn't attract “more and more” of new youth readers ,it just made more and more books for those few who already reads.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe vast numbers of those who don’t just read will increase if there isn't a big new attractive reading experience to get them into reading, specially with the more channels, more movies.\u003cbr\u003eBut the BIGGEST Obstacle for them to read came out in \u003cb\u003e1994\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411611859i/11255857._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"220\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/b\u003eand became a real phenomenon by 1995...it’s the \u003cb\u003ePlaystation \u003c/b\u003e, the giant Japanese gaming leap..\u003cbr\u003eFootball, Crash , Pepsi man, and the comics heroes also have their games , so why reading Superman , Batman’s comics when you can play them....\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e*************************************************\u003cbr\u003e*************************************************\u003cbr\u003eSo by 1996,with this growing leap in Gaming, as also the Computer 3D games getting even much improves, Books get replaced bit by bit by a gaming controls.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo do you think it’s wise for publishers to publish a book for new writer?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOf course not, it may even cover it’s publishing cost.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo it was very normal when in this year, 1996, when \u003cb\u003eJoanne\u003c/b\u003e, a 31 years old lady from England , handed the manuscript for her first novel to 12 publishing houses, all of them rejected it...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA manuscript of over 200 pages of a novel, that she had hard times in her personal and professional life while writing it, and for children??? Seriously is there still any who still read? it’s 1996, the era of Playstation and Video Games.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBut then, the Modest\u003cb\u003e “Bloomsbury“\u003c/b\u003e agreed to publish it ,with 2 advises for her, first that she’d get a day job, since it’s a little chance of making money in children's books. - later she received a grant from the Scottish Arts Council to help her continuing writing.-\u003cbr\u003eBut the significant advice was to change her pen name cause young boys might not want to read a book written by a woman..so with her name and her grandmother’s \"Kathleen\" come the 2 initial of her pen name…\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003eJ . k . Rowling\u003c/blockquote\u003e \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd in \u003cb\u003e26th June 1997\u003c/b\u003e ,with 1,000 copies, 500 of which were distributed to libraries..come out in UK, to our world The Greatest\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411626851i/11258422._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"333\" height=\"720\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHarry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd Baam , everything happened so fast..\u003cbr\u003eBefore the end of this year the novel awarded many important litural awards in the UK, an American important publisher , Scholastic , won the rights to publish the novel in US, with a huge check Rowling would never dreams of.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eJust with small change, The title changes from Philosopher's Stone to the Sorcerer's Stone , as the American publisher saw that Philosopher's may not be that attractive to young readers..\u003cbr\u003eAnd Thanks to Harry Potter ,now Every young readers know much more about Philosopher's Stone from their other reads.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIn 1998 Book 2 released in UK ,1999 in US, winning more literary prizes. Becoming a Top Selling books in UK, US and many other countries which start to publish the translation for the first book.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411667189i/11263200.jpg\" width=\"363\" height=\"280\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd on 8 July 1999, The \u003cb\u003eFirst Breaking Record\u003c/b\u003e made when Book 3 sold 68.000 copies in just three days after its release in the United Kingdom..and more copies when it released late 1999 in US..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWith the fast growing popularity of Harry Potter among readers , more records had been broken both in UK and US....\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411659710i/11262277._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e The 3 books takeover the top spot in the charts of best selling books for weeks and months, and it was still the hardcover editions.\u003cbr\u003eThis conquer made some literary magazines and newspapers separate the Harry Potter books selling records from the rest of the top selling books, splitting its lists into children Books and adult books sections under pressure from other publishers who were eager to see their books given higher ranking. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eAnd then it was year 2000 , where everything is about to change .... forever..\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe Playstation 2 is out there, and even higher leap in Computer Games..\u003cbr\u003eBut even with this much of temptations, thousands of children, teens and parents gathered in the midnight of 8 July 2000 in UK and US at the same day in front of stores, not electronic stores or Apple stores -as theses days- , it was Bookstores, for may be the first time in the Book Stores History , to buy a copy of ...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411670472i/11263478._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"260\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd They didn't mind to find out that the book is over 700 page, it was even for their pleasure, more than double the size of any of the first 3 novels..double the thriller, double the fun..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411670796i/11263575._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"260\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOver 3 million copies sold at that day only in the US , a new world record...a totally unexpected one.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003ehuge story, bigger plot , mysterious and very well written. \u003cbr\u003emore literate prizes for Rowling... more translated editions to more than 40 language. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd huge budget for the upcoming first movie of the series, which beautifully visualize the magic of the novel by the faithful producers and the director...and it also made some records , but that's not our subject now. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270149.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e******************************************\u003cbr\u003e******************************************\u003cbr\u003eBy the announcement of pushing the publishing date of book 5 to mid 2003 , and even by 2 movies out so far, the hunger for reading Harry Potter kept on.. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAlso , as more readers start to increase into this generation, Publishers and book stores start to promote for more books for those readers who are hungry for more..\u003cbr\u003eOlder fantasy books , like Lord of the Rings -which was a super successful movie by then too- Narnia , Golden Compass and many other novels which finally getting more reprinted editions...and so Book stores to get more and more readers.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270150._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"224\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMore countries welcomed the Harry Potter phenomenon.. The English edition AND the local translated ones ,both been sold everywhere worldwide.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270151._SX540_.png\" width=\"400\" height=\"186\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e Even in \u003cb\u003eEgypt\u003c/b\u003e English edition sold at many books stores and,hopefully some new book stores specialized in English novels start to open in Cairo and Alexandria by 2002-2003..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eand finally in summer 2002, Nahdet Masr for publishing and distribution got the rights and published the Arabic edition, although it cut some of the lines for the length issues, fearing it may won't attract more readers , but the edition still hold the magic of it..making a very good sales.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411758298i/11270181.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e****************\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe good news is,the literary movement didn't stop there, more new books come out for the increasing demand from the readers..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eLife of Pi\u003c/b\u003e , the 2002 man Booker winner make very good sales numbers by.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270152._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"401\" height=\"200\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd in April 2003 Dan Brown (previously published 3 novels, making good sales) released a novel that made huge fuss around and making a new sales records , \u003cb\u003eThe Da Vinci Code\u003c/b\u003e.. \u003cbr\u003eThe funny thing that there's a reference in this novel that Harry Potter is the second most selling book in history after the Bible..., a speculation that happens to be true in less than 5 years after that. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA month later,May 2003, Khaled Hosseini released his first novel -do you think publishers would agree if there's no Harry Potter before? ,He'd may be rejected by 12 publishers like you know who :)- , \u003cb\u003eThe Kate Runner \u003c/b\u003ewhich also made a very good records too.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd that's didn't affect the main reason for this new 'literal renaissance'.\u003cbr\u003eAll that didn't affect the Records Breaker to break records one month later..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411758082i/11270171._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"290\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOn 20 June 2003 book 5\u003cb\u003e 'Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix'\u003c/b\u003e comes out , ten thousands of all ages conquer the book stores in UK, US and other countries too to get the one they been waiting for at least 2 years... shipping agents like FedEx made the delivery to many countries to get the book at the same time.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eA New world Record \u003c/b\u003e,5 millions copy at the first day only..\u003cbr\u003eFor the first time in France a non french language book placed in no.1 of the bestselling book....\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411758082i/11270172._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"220\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSome kids got a headache called 'Harry Potter Headache' as they read the whole 850 pages of the book five, the biggest so far, at the same day without resting.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd in \u003cb\u003eEgypt\u003c/b\u003e, in September the same year, the Arabic edition of book three comes out with unexpected sales records, first edition run out of the stores by the first week only although it's nearly the beginning of the School year, and the movie of this 3rd book still filming. \u003cbr\u003eِAnd the price of the book get higher 20% in 2 days and still with increasing demand..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMore English books and novels sold in Egypt too, along with the Arabic ones, publishing more books for new Egyptian writers along with more of the famous ones , Alaa El Aswany's first novel 'Yaqubean's Building' makes very good selling numbers..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411759045i/11270248._SY540_.gif\" width=\"300\" height=\"420\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e2004 the Arabic edition of Book Four makes a price war between book stores and magazines stands.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eJanuary 2005 , an abridged translated edition of Book Five make many readers angry in Egypt , specially that many already read the English edition before, so the publisher release an unabridged one by May.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd in the same year's summer, on 21 July, \u003cb\u003eA higher record \u003c/b\u003ethat breaks all the previously ones\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411759919i/11270289.jpg\" width=\"344\" height=\"500\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e 6.9 million copy of book 6 sold in US in its first day... A huge book, may didn't fans' expectations of being full of action , but it get a twist that blow minds about one of the most interesting characters, \u003cb\u003eProfessor Snape.\u003c/b\u003eThat made many fans and even big authors like Stephen King and Salman Rushdie talk about for months..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e****************\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe pre-final book followed by a massive variety of new novels, new authors....Twilight series, Percy Jackson series, and more new novels, more books sales not only in US, UK but worldwide...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBut still Potter is the Records Big Breaker...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg bigger than any time before..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411781936i/11273745.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"251\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e A huge record for pre-orders online reach to one million copies by Amazon, and total sales of \u003cb\u003e11 millions copies in UK and US in the first day only.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411781936i/11273746._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"251\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe book sold at the same day almost in every country,even in Israel which made a big religious fuss about the book stores being open in their holy Saturday, But it's Harry Potter after all, the world's most unusual, unexpected phenomenon and sales records breaker.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411781936i/11273747.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"289\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd that's not bad, it was the Miracle of bringing back readers to book stores, thousands of topics went online asking 'what to read next'....\u003cbr\u003eIndeed, although there's the ebooks, ereaders , etc , still there's thousands of new books and novels published and sold every year , in every where in the world.\u003cbr\u003eThe gaming devices is increasing yes, not as expected though by the 90s and early 2000s \"remember Nokia N-Gage\"- but so do the reading devices which first come out by Sony in 2004,make big step by Amazon's Kindle in 2007...the ebook applications on every device.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411835645i/11285409._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"218\" alt=\"0\" novels, some are just a rip off others and some are really original and brilliant. in UK, US , Egypt ..ever where all over the globe..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNo matter a Playstation 4 is out, or new xbox, the books still there...with its most beloved magic..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411835645i/11285410.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"218\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe magic of books is back and , I believe, to stay..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDon't you see with me that the magic of Harry Potter is one of the main factors of this magic?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\u003cbr\u003e“This boy will be famous. There won’t be a child in our world who doesn’t know his name”\u003c/b\u003e\n  \u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411836005i/11285585.jpg\" width=\"365\" height=\"238\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThat's what Rowling wrote at the very early pages of her first book..The one that rejected by 12 Publishing Houses in 1996...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWell, what about now?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eGod, Talked too much in the \"Brief\" introduction , didn't I?\u003cbr\u003eWell, that's it for this review... I guess some still think it's just the Propaganda that made that all....Well I'll try to prove them worng by the upcoming next 6 reviews at the other 6 Books of the series..\u003cbr\u003eLinks will be here as soon as it'd done .. \u003ca href=\"http://www.khassab.net/news/?p=3444\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eوللمقالات العربية ايضا\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/a\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow I'll be back to go around Hogwarts.....\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411082784i/11192136._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"273\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFor the Zillionth time I guess..\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411082784i/11192137._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"197\" alt=\"0\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHope to see you there too, come on and try first year :)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380396313i/763769.jpg\" width=\"395\" height=\"315\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFrom Hogwarts\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMohammed Arabey\u003cbr\u003eThe Craziest Potterhead of Egypt\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1381936688i/5444084.jpg\" width=\"401\" height=\"217\" alt=\"\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eRe-reading the new edition -Guess I'm addicted to new editions BUT this one really rocks..\"Bloomsbury-2014\"\u003cbr\u003efrom 12 Sep. 2014\u003cbr\u003etill 23 Sep. 2014\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"4563264466270173843\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));;
