itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/882178969\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Bookworm Sean\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/27788046-bookworm-sean\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Bookworm Sean\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457171461p2/27788046.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/882178969?book_show_action=false\"\u003eOct 02, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Bookworm Sean\" class=\"user\" name=\"Bookworm Sean\" href=\"/user/show/27788046-bookworm-sean\"\u003eBookworm Sean\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747532743\" href=\"/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/27788046-bookworm-sean?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/27788046-bookworm-sean?shelf=children-of-all-ages\"\u003echildren-of-all-ages\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/27788046-bookworm-sean?shelf=5-star-reads\"\u003e5-star-reads\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer882178969\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer430553746509863766\"\u003eHere are three reasons why Harry Potter rocks my socks:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e1.A Better World\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOne of the main reasons \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e is so wonderful is because Rowling shows you a boring world; it is the world of reality, dry, boring and ordinary. Then under it she reveals fantasy; she reveals everything a reader longs for: she reveals pure escapism. I still want to go to Hogwarts. I always will. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475396409ra/20716497.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e2. We’re all a bit like Harry\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOkay so not many of us are orphans, and not many of us are practically abused in their own homes\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText430553746509863766\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eHere are three reasons why Harry Potter rocks my socks:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e1.A Better World\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOne of the main reasons \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e is so wonderful is because Rowling shows you a boring world; it is the world of reality, dry, boring and ordinary. Then under it she reveals fantasy; she reveals everything a reader longs for: she reveals pure escapism. I still want to go to Hogwarts. I always will. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475396409ra/20716497.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e2. We’re all a bit like Harry\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOkay so not many of us are orphans, and not many of us are practically abused in their own homes, but a lot of us feel isolated in the world, a lot of us wish for a fantastic group of friends as a child. I know I did, and this again leads back to my first point. Not everyone finds a Ron and Hermione.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1475396409i/20716498.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"175\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e3. The magic\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSeems a bit of an obvious point doesn’t it? But, seriously, not many books have such a well-developed system. We have different categories, spell names, potions and books, lots of books on magic. And who doesn’t like books on magic? \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475396409ra/20716499.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"430553746509863766\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review882178969\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link882178969\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=882178969\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_882178969'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_882178969\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/882178969?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e216 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_882178969\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_882178969\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=216\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=882178969\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_882178969\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 882178969, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003e11 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/882178969?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=1\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_882178969' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/882178969/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView all 11 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv id=\"comment_157512609\" class=\"brown_comment\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_photo\"\u003e\n    \t\u003ca alt=\"Chelle\" href=\"/user/show/4865432-chelle\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461529781p1/4865432.jpg\" alt=\"4865432\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_body\"\u003e\n    \u003ca style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/4865432-chelle\"\u003eChelle\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer8517633188214780701\"\u003eCurrently rereading Harry Potter books with my son, he enjoyed reading but have never heard him so excited to talk about a book with me! We're\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText8517633188214780701\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eCurrently rereading Harry Potter books with my son, he enjoyed reading but have never heard him so excited to talk about a book with me! We're starting Prisoner of Azkaban tonight :)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"8517633188214780701\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      Oct 02, 2016 11:35AM\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv id=\"comment_157547009\" class=\"brown_comment\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_photo\"\u003e\n    \t\u003ca alt=\"Amber\" href=\"/user/show/23016460-amber\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1420736662p1/23016460.jpg\" alt=\"23016460\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_body\"\u003e\n    \u003ca style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/23016460-amber\"\u003eAmber\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10521276286099002373\"\u003eis this your first time reading the whole series? If so, I hope you enjoy reading it.\u003c/span\u003e\n\n    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      Oct 03, 2016 08:57AM\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_882178969' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 882178969, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1743783698\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1743783698\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Maggie\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/51318038-maggie\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Maggie\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478924580p2/51318038.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1743783698?book_show_action=false\"\u003eSep 01, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Maggie\" class=\"user\" name=\"Maggie\" href=\"/user/show/51318038-maggie\"\u003eMaggie\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=5-stars\"\u003e5-stars\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=middle-grade\"\u003emiddle-grade\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=2016-reads\"\u003e2016-reads\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1743783698\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer3786627252999992522\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e \u003ci\u003eThis boy will be famous. There won't be a child in our world who doesn't know his name.\u003c/i\u003e \u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEveryone grew up with Harry Potter. They read all the books when they were young and watched all the films. They would re-watch and re-read them. They would fall in love with the Wizarding World and would completely adore Harry, Ron, and Hermione. They would talk about them non stop, about Hogwarts, about its teachings, about them wanting to become students there and pretending they are, about joining the HP\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3786627252999992522\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003e❝This boy will be famous. There won't be a child in our world who doesn't know his name.❞\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEveryone grew up with Harry Potter. They read all the books when they were young and watched all the films. They would re-watch and re-read them. They would fall in love with the Wizarding World and would completely adore Harry, Ron, and Hermione. They would talk about them non stop, about Hogwarts, about its teachings, about them wanting to become students there and pretending they are, about joining the HP fandom, about loving every character and instantly missing the world. Everyone would adore Harry Potter and knew about it since they were young ones.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eExcept me.\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI didn't grow up with Harry Potter. Not because I didn't get to, but because I chose not to. I know, it's like living a life where everything has been a lie. Worse even. It's just, the movies would appear on my tv. From the first one, to the next and the next, and every time I saw the trailer for the upcoming one, I wouldn't be interested and would skip it when I came to it. I wouldn't bother and wouldn't care, and that made a big problem in my life now. Here I am now, being left out because of such poor choices and decisions I made when I was 7, 8, 9, and older until now. But now, as 2016 and having over 500 friends that are caught up and have read the recently published novel, \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter and the Cursed Child,\u003c/i\u003e I have finally read the first book and am able to continue the series and watch the films. Now, here I am, wishing to go back to my past and change this nightmare and actually watch the films or read the books because I have literally missed on so much, missed too much, and have been missing too much. I have been out of this world and never realized how good it is, and how special it already has become.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003eThere is no good and evil, there is only power, and those too weak to seek it.\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI find it stupid of me to write a review for Harry Potter, especially being the first one. I also find it stupid of me how I just recently decided to check this out and finally read it. But still, I guess I can still write a review. Of course, my thoughts would be quite similar to everyone else. Thoughts and opinions, nothing negative, maybe, maybe not. But, here goes nothing.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e is one of the most famous, loved, and top series out there. It is loved, adored, cherished, and amazing for HP fans every time they read it. No matter how many times it is read, it fills the person's heart with warmth and happiness, as they are going back to the wizarding world. As for me, I have finally entered it and feel young and new and early to this, because I am new to this all.\u003cbr /\u003eOther than that, Harry Potter is considered a Children's book but in my opinion, it's in between middle grade and young adult because it can be hard to read for some. Although it was very very easy for me to read and understand, I see myself reading this all these years before and having a lot of trouble pronouncing some names. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter, a story about a young wizard that didn't even know he was a wizard. Harry Potter, a 10 year-old boy, who turned 11, is living with his horrible, rude and awful \"family\", The Dursleys. Mrs. Dursley is known as Harry Potter's mother's sister. The problem is, they didn't like each other, nor blend in with each other. They were different. Her sister was a witch, while she was just a Muggle, a person who cannot seek the magic and find it, nothing and no one special because they aren't able to turn things into other things, aren't able to fly on a broom, cast a robe on fire, defeat a villain, confuse a troll, aren't able to do anything, really. Well, she wasn't, besides treat Harry with such disrespect and treat her ugly and fat son with such caress and would spoil him because he was such a little brat that would get what he wants. Really though. There would be 36 presents under a Christmas tree and as he counts them, he pouts and is upset because it's less than what he had the year before. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDUDE I BARELY GET A BARNES AND NOBLE GIFT CARD CHILL!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe reason for Harry living with this family and having to go trough all this trouble and mess, is because he was actually given to them by Professor Albus Dumbledore, known as one of the greatest wizards and the headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. When Harry was a baby, his parents were killed by Everyone-Knows-Who but as he tried killing Harry, he really wasn't able to. His mother was killed because she was trying to stop him, but as he tried killing Harry, he couldn't bare to do it and left him a scar, the scar that has made Harry known and popular for surviving this evil person. Once saved and taken, the only people they can rely on are The Dursleys, and as Harry grows, they expect them to tell him he is a wizard and tell him everything and fix all the lies. Except they don't.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs days pass, Harry has been getting letters from someone he doesn't know. He doesn't know who it is and what they want, but he knows there is something going on, due to the amount of letters being sent. After getting the chance to open the first one, his Uncle Vernon decides to snatch it away from him, read it, and burn it. He knows, he knows who it is and what they want, but he doesn't want Harry to know. But even with him burning letter by letter and collecting them all, letters keep arriving and arriving, until the person finally shows up face-to-face with The Dursleys and Harry on his 11th birthday.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHe's huge, introduced as a half-giant and half-human, known as Rubeus Hagrid. Hagrid is the one who tells Harry the truth, telling him he is a wizard, and a well-known one as well. He's got talent, and has some of the same abilities as his parents. One being a witch and the other being a wizard, Harry is known as a wizard as well. And as Hagrid tells him the truth, Harry does too. \u003cb\u003eHe doesn't know what he is talking about and doesn't know what is going on.\u003c/b\u003e He doesn't believe he is a wizard, and doesn't believe the reason for his parent's deaths. But of course, Hagrid decides to tell him the truth and tell him his parents did not die on a car crash, for that seemed impossible, but they were killed by Everyone-Knows-Who and is the reason for his scar.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHis aunt, finally admitting herself into being a witness of knowing the truth, got everything out of her chest and was able to tell him the truth. She wouldn't even mention her sister, because she pretended to not have one. She was considered perfect and brave, while she was nothing and unnoticed. Nothing has changed, but she didn't even bother trying to care care of her niece as her sister is dead, protecting Harry from wherever she is. And as Hagrid tells Harry the rest, he actually takes Harry with him even when Mr. Dursley \"forbids him.\" He can't do anything, since he is a Muggle and Harry has already been accepted to Hogwarts School and nothing can change. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWhen Harry leaves with Hagrid, they go and buy him what he needs, including clothes and supplies for the school. As they go to the shop, he is introduced as Harry himself but is instantly known by everyone else. Everyone is pleased to meet him and feel proud because they have shaken his hand. He's famous, his name is everywhere, and he can be considered a legend for what happened. But even with all this going on, Harry is still a little confused and figuring things out. As Harry and Hagrid get what they need, it's time for Harry to go to school, where he meets Ron Weasley, as to what I know, one of his best friends. Ron is small, red-haired, has freckles, pale, and has two twin brothers going to Hogwarts with him. He's not accepted into the other groups, and that is why he blends in with Harry and becomes his friend. Harry also meets Hermione Granger, known as someone annoying and as a nightmare to them both because of how bossy and unrealistic she can be. Of course, they are all so small and Hermione is a little nerd that enjoys every teaching at this school, so I was just like \"we get it.\" \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDays pass, and Harry is being trained. He's a neutral to broom-stick flying, is able to play Quidditch, the most popular game in Hogwarts, is given special supplies, and is of course, known by everyone. Other than that, Harry suspects his own secrets and wants to find out truths, but in order to do that, he must find a way to find them and figure them out. With the help of his two friends, he might just be able to figure out the real reason behind him being a wizard, more about his parents, history about himself, who this \"You-Know-Who\" person is, remember his past, and see how his life really will be changed, forever.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003eHumans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter was easy to read, understand, and there was no hesitation when it came to rating it 5 stars. Now, I hate myself once again and ask myself, again, \"Why the fuck did I not read this earlier?\" The answer is obvious, because I already know it and it's because I was never a fan of it. I hate speaking about my past, but this is one ugly past and I hate it. I hate the choice I made and I hate myself for allowing it. But soon I'll get over it and will be able to re-read this as many times as I will be able to during my last 3 years of being a teen. Yes, a 15 year-old that has not read Harry Potter simply because she chose not to when she was able to and when she was young. \u003cu\u003ePATHETIC.\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe fantasy is cute, I will say. It's easy to understand and the book is easy to fly through. It's not long, it's not hard, and it's not boring. It's gripping, fun, and everything is filled with some kind of magical element that has me turning page by page. Having no regrets anywhere, I am finally able to talk about HP and the world of wizards, where students learn how to make potions, talk to ghosts, learn about other creatures, transform things into other things, read minds, become invisible, fly in the air with a broomstick, play soccer in the air, have a feast and enjoy it all, learn magic, have a wand, and just be filled with happiness because of the friends and families considered in the houses. Well, I guess in most.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEverything was fun to read. I laughed at some parts and found the story to be more affective to me as Harry was figuring out his new and changed life. He was confused, but he found out a lot more. There's still more, but I know that as he grows, I will be able to follow along the late ass journey and see where he grows to and how. I'll see how strong he gets and find out some strengths and weakness'. I'll be able to join an invisible magic carpet and fly through the series because I just want to know what happens next and how everything goes. I want to see Harry become a better person and be able to prove Draco and his stupid friends wrong about what they think. I want his friendship with Ron to grow and become stronger. I want Hermione to stop being so talkative and take a little break of being so bossy. But more importantly, I want to have a fun journey reading this and feeling like I'm on an adventure. Reading it for the first time feels like one. I've never watched the films. I've watched parts, but skipped them. Now, I won't skip anything. It's like an adventure where I'm dived in and can't seem to leave because I'm so alive and intrigued.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWhat can I say about Harry Potter that others have not said? Nothing. Reviews are always similar, and this one might be too. Everyone loves it, and so did I. So will I, I should say. , Yes, I had trouble pronouncing some names at first but got used to it after. Yes, I rolled my eyes at times because there were moments where I was annoyed. But nothing was boring, and even when I rolled my eyes, there was a reason for that eye rolling scene. Maybe it was Hermione being annoying, or Draco being a rude boy, mocking an adorable red-haired. Or both. But I was also laughing. I would always laugh when it came to Hagrid. Since the beginning, I instantly loved him and considered him hilarious. I love how he turned Dunley into a pig but failed because he was already too much of a pig. I remember laughing and noticing my parents looked at me weirdly, but that's okay because I needed a novel where I was happy and ended up laughing at times. Oh and also, Hagrid is honestly so nice and adorable guys, I love him. He's so funny and protective and is such a good friend to Harry. I loved everything he did for him and was glad he was the first one to introduce himself to Harry. He cared for him since he was a baby and saw him as 11, bring him a present and giving him another one at the end. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRon is honestly the cutest. I don't understand how anyone could be mean to him. He may be weak, but he has his own strengths. He's so adorable and small and I hated how Draco treated him. There were some times unnecessary and I hated Draco for it, but I'll probably end up loving Draco some time throughout the series and probably regret it because I know he's still gonna be really mean throughout the series. I'm sure. I haven't spoiled myself, so I have no idea how his or anyone else's life goes, but I do know that he changes in some way. Hermione is a small and cute nerd as well, but sometimes I hated how sassy she was and bossy. She hated losing points for her house and because she, Ron, and Harry were in the same house, they had to work together and find a way to become friends to find out other truths and earn points for Gryffindor. She took everything very serious and showed off at times because of her perfect test grades and assignments, but I was glad she was able to put up with Ron and Harry while they put up with her.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMalfoy Draco was someone I did not like, at all. Like I said, he mocked and made fun of Ron and I hated him for it. He showed off as well but in the bad way, thinking he was really cool just because he's in Slytherin and how used to the wizarding world he is. He didn't show much care about Harry and his past, and would try to get in a fight with Harry while Harry tried fixing the problem. He payed no attention and took it too far with Harry. He was a newbie as well, so I don't see what the point was. But the other point is that I don't have expectations for Draco but I hope I don't end up hating him in all books and hope there is some change, at least slightly good.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe friendship between Harry, Ron and Hermione was probably one of my favorites. I know it didn't work out at first and they honestly hated her, but I was so happy it literally had to work toward the middle. Thanks to the troll, she became their friend and actually was able to cooperate with them. She didn't yell at them for fighting the troll, but instead told them to be careful and send word if anything goes wrong when Harry went for the mirror again. As it was ending, she was saying goodbye to Harry and Ron and was even awkward because she couldn't really figure out what to say. But also, my heart was really happy when she hugged Harry because it felt real and it felt like something I had been waiting since the beginning. It was friendship goals as they were becoming friends, and it just made me happy seeing them all together, same house, same team, same classes. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe writing of course is, like I said, easy to understand. There were no words that were confusing in any way or words that got me mixed up because of how similar they sounded, and there were no problems. I didn't know what was gonna happen next and I know books are always better than movies, but I will watch the films after or after finishing one book just to see the differences. I hear they are kind of the same, just that the book provides some more information and detail. Like always, it's no surprise. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003eThere are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOverall, I am so proud of myself for getting the first book over with, now wanting the 2nd and the 3rd and the rest. Really excited to see where this all goes to, and how Harry becomes a better wizard.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"3786627252999992522\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border href=\"/user/show/2745288-wendy-darling\"\u003eWendy Darling\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eliked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Audio CD 9781855496705\" href=\"/book/show/49771.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=uk\"\u003euk\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=middle-grade\"\u003emiddle-grade\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=illustrated\"\u003eillustrated\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=boarding-school\"\u003eboarding-school\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=audio\"\u003eaudio\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=read-2015\"\u003eread-2015\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer71436041\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7896932813808086681\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eCurrent project: \u003c/b\u003ere-reading HP. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy history: \u003c/b\u003eI was a young adult when this first book came out, and the print book never really grabbed me when I gave it a try. I found that I very much enjoyed the American audiobooks with Jim Dale narrating, however, so I read the first few books this way. But this came to an end when I misplaced the fourth book and no longer had a long commute--I never did reach the end of that wretchedly long quidditch game, so I gave up. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut here it is, 2015 and I'm trying ag\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7896932813808086681\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eCurrent project: \u003c/b\u003ere-reading HP. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy history: \u003c/b\u003eI was a young adult when this first book came out, and the print book never really grabbed me when I gave it a try. I found that I very much enjoyed the American audiobooks with Jim Dale narrating, however, so I read the first few books this way. But this came to an end when I misplaced the fourth book and no longer had a long commute--I never did reach the end of that wretchedly long quidditch game, so I gave up. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut here it is, 2015 and I'm trying again! This time I'm doing the wonderful Stephen Fry narration on audio. It's interesting to come into these books after all this history, both in the sense of the cultural impact of these stories as well as the knowledge of how much children's lit, as art and as industry, has changed for the better because of them. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eRe-read reaction: 3.5 stars\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWith this first book (and I suspect with the next few), I still feel the way I did before. I admire the incredibly imaginative ideas so much, but the writing isn't quite as rich or the character development isn't quite as deep/emotional as I'd like just yet. It's a pretty straightforward story, albeit one embellished with fantastic details. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut \u003cb\u003eI LOVE HERMIONE GRANGER\u003c/b\u003e, always have, and I've heard the later books are much darker. And it's still a lovely experience to have the books read to me like a bedtime story. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy favorite parts\u003c/b\u003e of this book: \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe mirror of Erised, owl post (pleeease may I have an owl), and the thing hidden under the turban. And:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003eIt takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWell done, Neville. You deserved the same number of house points as the other children, in my book. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"7896932813808086681\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review71436041\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link71436041\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=71436041\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_71436041'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_71436041\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/71436041?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e193 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_71436041\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_71436041\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/207710836?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=1\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_207710836' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id='comments_form_review_207710836' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 207710836, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1530857\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1530857\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Harold Bloom\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/105351-harold-bloom\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Harold Bloom\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1180495290p2/105351.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1530857?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMay 29, 2007\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Harold Bloom\" class=\"user\" name=\"Harold Bloom\" href=\"/user/show/105351-harold-bloom\"\u003eHarold Bloom\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003edid not like it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\u003cspan class=\"uitext greyText\"\u003eRecommends it for: \u003c/span\u003e\n           \u003cspan class=\"uitext reviewText\"\u003echildren, the carrion-eaters of scholarship\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/105351-harold-bloom?shelf=therabblement\"\u003etherabblement\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1530857\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer1215621261590850445\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eCan 35 Million Book Buyers Be Wrong? Yes.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTaking arms against Harry Potter, at this moment, is to emulate Hamlet taking arms against a sea of troubles. By opposing the sea, you won't end it. The Harry Potter epiphenomenon will go on, doubtless for some time, as J. R. R. Tolkien did, and then wane.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe official newspaper of our dominant counter-culture, The New York Times, has been startled by the Potter books into establishing a new policy for its not very literate book review. Rather than crowd o\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText1215621261590850445\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eCan 35 Million Book Buyers Be Wrong? Yes.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTaking arms against Harry Potter, at this moment, is to emulate Hamlet taking arms against a sea of troubles. By opposing the sea, you won't end it. The Harry Potter epiphenomenon will go on, doubtless for some time, as J. R. R. Tolkien did, and then wane.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe official newspaper of our dominant counter-culture, The New York Times, has been startled by the Potter books into establishing a new policy for its not very literate book review. Rather than crowd out the Grishams, Clancys, Crichtons, Kings, and other vastly popular prose fictions on its fiction bestseller list, the Potter volumes will now lead a separate children's list. J. K. Rowling, the chronicler of Harry Potter, thus has an unusual distinction: She has changed the policy of the policy-maker.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eImaginative Vision\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI read new children's literature, when I can find some of any value, but had not tried Rowling until now. I have just concluded the 300 pages of the first book in the series, \"Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone,\" purportedly the best of the lot. Though the book is not well written, that is not in itself a crucial liability. It is much better to see the movie, \"The Wizard of Oz,\" than to read the book upon which it was based, but even the book possessed an authentic imaginative vision. \"Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\" does not, so that one needs to look elsewhere for the book's (and its sequels') remarkable success. Such speculation should follow an account of how and why Harry Potter asks to be read.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe ultimate model for Harry Potter is \"Tom Brown's School Days\" by Thomas Hughes, published in 1857. The book depicts the Rugby School presided over by the formidable Thomas Arnold, remembered now primarily as the father of Matthew Arnold, the Victorian critic-poet. But Hughes' book, still quite readable, was realism, not fantasy. Rowling has taken \"Tom Brown's School Days\" and re-seen it in the magical mirror of Tolkein. The resultant blend of a schoolboy ethos with a liberation from the constraints of reality-testing may read oddly to me, but is exactly what millions of children and their parents desire and welcome at this time.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIn what follows, I may at times indicate some of the inadequacies of \"Harry Potter.\" But I will keep in mind that a host are reading it who simply will not read superior fare, such as Kenneth Grahame's \"The Wind in the Willows\" or the \"Alice\" books of Lewis Carroll. Is it better that they read Rowling than not read at all? Will they advance from Rowling to more difficult pleasures?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling presents two Englands, mundane and magical, divided not by social classes, but by the distinction between the \"perfectly normal\" (mean and selfish) and the adherents of sorcery. The sorcerers indeed seem as middle-class as the Muggles, the name the witches and wizards give to the common sort, since those addicted to magic send their sons and daughters off to Hogwarts, a Rugby school where only witchcraft and wizardry are taught. Hogwarts is presided over by Albus Dumbeldore as Headmaster, he being Rowling's version of Tolkein's Gandalf. The young future sorcerers are just like any other budding Britons, only more so, sports and food being primary preoccupations. (Sex barely enters into Rowling's cosmos, at least in the first volume.)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e----------------------------\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe first half of a little piece I wrote from the \u003ci\u003eJournal\u003c/i\u003e in July 2000. Rest is available at [\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://wrt-brooke.syr.edu/courses/205.03/bloom.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttp://wrt-brooke.syr.edu/courses/205...\u003c/a\u003e].\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"1215621261590850445\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1530857\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" A hater with no life, no imagination, no childhood, and you should be ashamed of yourself that you are one of the only people in the whole gods damned world who is dumb enough to hate on Harry Potter. If you don't like Harry Potter, then what the hell do you like? Oh ya that's right, you're from the 17th centre so you're a big Shakespeare fan. Whoops, forgot to mention, it's the 21st centry by the way, and Hamlet has absolutely nothing to do with Harry Potter. One Harry Potter is at least a trillion times better than all of Shakespeare's plays combined.\u003cbr /\u003eAnd I just though you should know, the world is round.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca   \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/351586900?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 27, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Jessica ❁ ➳ amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext href=\"/review/list/10336538-jessica-silverbow-rabid-reads?shelf=buddy-reads-are-the-best\"\u003ebuddy-reads-are-the-best\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/10336538-jessica-silverbow-rabid-reads?shelf=audible\"\u003eaudible\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer351586900\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer14008012297348117108\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eReviewed by: \u003ca href=\"http://rabidreads.ca/2016/01/review-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-illustrated-edition-by-j-k-rowling-jessicadhaluska.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eRabid Reads\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI wasn't going to review this for Rabid Reads, but then I was reminded of the multitudes of unfortunates who haven't read HARRY POTTER yet . . . \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI ask myself:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe:\u003c/b\u003e How can this be?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eSelf:\u003c/b\u003e *shrugs awkwardly*\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe:\u003c/b\u003e The HARRY POTTER books breathed new life into readers of all ages. They're amazing, wonderful, fantastic, addicting, SUPERLATIVE--\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eSelf: \u003c/b\u003e *nods emphatic agreement*\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo what's the deal people?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBoiled down to its most basic elements, HARRY POTTER AND THE SORCERER'S STONE is u\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText14008012297348117108\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eReviewed by: \u003ca href=\"http://rabidreads.ca/2016/01/review-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-illustrated-edition-by-j-k-rowling-jessicadhaluska.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eRabid Reads\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI wasn't going to review this for Rabid Reads, but then I was reminded of the multitudes of unfortunates who haven't read HARRY POTTER yet . . . \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI ask myself:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe:\u003c/b\u003e How can this be?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eSelf:\u003c/b\u003e *shrugs awkwardly*\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe:\u003c/b\u003e The HARRY POTTER books breathed new life into readers of all ages. They're amazing, wonderful, fantastic, addicting, SUPERLATIVE--\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eSelf: \u003c/b\u003e *nods emphatic agreement*\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo what's the deal people?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBoiled down to its most basic elements, HARRY POTTER AND THE SORCERER'S STONE is urban fantasy. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFor kids? Absolutely.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFor adults? ALSO absolutely.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eRowling creates a wondrous world of magic that exists alongside the normal, the \"muggle\" world.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIn this magic world, the objects and PEOPLE in pictures move, chess pieces are both sentient and opinionated about your game-playing strategy. Jelly beans come in EVERY flavor, so part of the fun is never knowing whether the funny yellow one is going to be toffee . . . or earwax. Creatures of legend--centaurs, hippogriffs, dragons, goblins, etc.--are part of everyday life. \u003ci\u003eIf\u003c/i\u003e you're a wizard.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBut all of the world-building is secondary to Harry himself. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe boy who lived.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHarry was only a year old when he was given over to his only living relatives. The Dursleys of 4 Privot Drive are happy in their normalcy, their mediocrity. They think \u003ci\u003ethings\u003c/i\u003e properly account for the worth of a person, they indulge their already horrible son, and they \u003ci\u003emore than\u003c/i\u003e neglect Harry . . . They're dismissive of him. They humiliate him. They \u003ci\u003estifle\u003c/i\u003e him. And they do all of these things thoughtlessly. As if he's not a real person . . . B/c he's \u003ci\u003eother.\u003c/i\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eTheir abuse is so offhand, you have to be an adult, or least a mature reader to recognize it for what it is. Younger readers just see a hateful villain. A hateful villain who does such ostentatiously self-centered things to poor Harry that they can alternately \"Yayyyyyy,\" and \"Booooooo,\" with enthusiasm. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI've heard similar comparisons made about Robin Williams' Genie in Disney's \u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0103639\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAladdin\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e--the character was complex enough for adults to enjoy while being thoroughly entertaining to children.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo that's my sale. Harry Potter isn't just for children, it's for EVERYONE. In my humble opinion, what Rowling has done with these books makes Disney's Genie look like amateur hour (and I quite like Aladdin. FYI).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd as the recent popularity of coloring books for adults has proven, people of all ages like pretty things, and that is why this new illustrated version is spectacular:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451755894i/17599142.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"400\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451758303i/17599459.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"400\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452182023i/17657582.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"400\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSO. We have an engaging premise: a child mysteriously defeats the most powerful dark wizard in memory, becoming instantly famous in one world, a world full of wonder and magic, is raised ignorant of his past by negligent relatives, only to be reintroduced to the magical world when he comes of age to attend the equivalent of middle school.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWe have the earlier referenced fantastical world-building. We have well-developed, often hilarious or reprehensible characters (depending on whether they're meant to be Good or Bad). And we have addictive individual story plots that build into the best Good vs. Evil story arc since LOTR. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd children LOVE it. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo will you. More than highly recommended. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1421060968i/13316940.jpg\" alt=\"Jessica Signature\" width=\"205\" height=\"101\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e1/2/16:\u003c/b\u003e Getting starting one day late on the HARRY POTTER BR over at \u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/group/show/148164\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eBB\u0026amp;B\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e. *shrugs* Harry Potter is good today, yesterday, and tomorrow. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451755744i/17599105.jpg\" width=\"450\" height=\"505\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy other reviews for this series:\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/401598778\"\u003eHarry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter #2)\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"14008012297348117108\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; title=\"Pearl Angeli\" class=\"user\" name=\"Pearl Angeli\" href=\"/user/show/31514572-pearl-angeli\"\u003ePearl Angeli\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\"           Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/31514572-pearl-angeli?shelf=i-laughed-hard\"\u003ei-laughed-hard\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/31514572-pearl-angeli?shelf=owned-physical-copy\"\u003eowned-physical-copy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1487954606\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer986669884034380387\"\u003eBeyond amazing! Way to start the new year! :)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI've read \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/b\u003e way back in High School but I wasn't able to finish it because sad to say, my book was lost. :( And now, thanks to my lovely friend \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/11178197-allison\"\u003eAllie\u003c/a\u003e who gave me a copy of this book, I became interested to read it once again and bring back the old times' feels. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd WOW! Just WOW! Thank goodness I decided to read it again because it felt so magical and magnificent and totally breathtaking! -- exactly what I've felt t\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText986669884034380387\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eBeyond amazing! Way to start the new year! :)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI've read \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/b\u003e way back in High School but I wasn't able to finish it because sad to say, my book was lost. :( And now, thanks to my lovely friend \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/11178197-allison\"\u003eAllie\u003c/a\u003e who gave me a copy of this book, I became interested to read it once again and bring back the old times' feels. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd WOW! Just WOW! Thank goodness I decided to read it again because it felt so magical and magnificent and totally breathtaking! -- exactly what I've felt the first time I've read this.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1451807770ra/17606597.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e is such a great, well-fleshed out character. Despite being parentless and being bullied both in the Muggle world and Hogwarts by some kids, he still stood up and even became a great friend to \u003cb\u003eRon\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eHermione\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eNeville\u003c/b\u003e, and the others. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis story had lots of exciting adventures and I really enjoyed everything that happened in this book. It was just so awesome! The secondary characters are also perfect. I especially love Hermione and her genius mind! Ron's loyalty towards Harry is also awe-inspiring, as well as Neville's adorable clumsiness. When it comes to its plotline, it's amazingly done. The twist was unpredictable and there was humor in every page that made me laugh. What's even great are the lessons and the message that are instilled to every reader, fantasy and magic aside.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003e\n    \u003cb\u003e\"It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.\"\u003c/b\u003e\n  \u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI loved all the chapters and my favorites are:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eThe Boy Who Lived, The Vanishing Glass, Diagon Alley, The Journey from Platform Nine and Three-Quarters, The Sorting Hat\u003c/i\u003e, and \u003ci\u003eQuidditch\u003c/i\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNo wonder why this book and the whole series continues to be a real sensation. \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling\" title=\"J.K. Rowling\"\u003eJ.K. Rowling\u003c/a\u003e is so brilliant she bewitched me with her world! So excited to find out more about this series and to see what's in store for Harry in the next books. :)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eRating:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445993136i/16730745.jpg\" width=\"200\" height=\"45\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cp\u003e\n    \u003ca href=\"https://pagesofpearl.wordpress.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472382775i/20186886._SX540_.jpg\" alt=\"Pages of Pearl\" width=\"400\" height=\"150\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1464648592i/19260109.png\" width=\"250\" height=\"180\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"986669884034380387\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1740525771?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 27, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Christy\" class=\"user\" name=\"Christy\" href=\"/user/show/11284813-christy\"\u003eChristy\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Kindle Edition \" href=\"/book/show/13562891-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11284813-christy?shelf=2016-ya-challenge\"\u003e2016-ya-challenge\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1740525771\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13912378698938492032\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://s1279.photobucket.com/user/Christyb23/media/Book%20Reviews%209/stencil.facebook-post_zpsodkfg2ma.jpg.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472360889i/20184211._SX540_.jpg\" alt=\" photo stencil.facebook-post_zpsodkfg2ma.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm 30 years old and I've finally started the \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e series. I know what you're thinking- it took me long enough! I say better late than never! I remember when the first movie was released in 2001. My sister was reading the books and so was my best friend. In 2001 I was in high school, and though I loved the movie, I was reading Sylvia Plath and Wally Lamb and had no interest in the young adult genre. Now, totally different story! I'm all about reading some YA. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSince I've seen the movies,\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText13912378698938492032\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://s1279.photobucket.com/user/Christyb23/media/Book%20Reviews%209/stencil.facebook-post_zpsodkfg2ma.jpg.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472360889i/20184211._SX540_.jpg\" alt=\" photo stencil.facebook-post_zpsodkfg2ma.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm 30 years old and I've finally started the \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e series. I know what you're thinking- it took me long enough! I say better late than never! I remember when the first movie was released in 2001. My sister was reading the books and so was my best friend. In 2001 I was in high school, and though I loved the movie, I was reading Sylvia Plath and Wally Lamb and had no interest in the young adult genre. Now, totally different story! I'm all about reading some YA. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSince I've seen the movies, there wasn't a ton of new material in this book for me (though my I've heard that the further I get into the series, the more new material I'll come across). I enjoyed reading this one lots and I'm looking forward to reading the rest of the magical Harry Potter books this year! \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"13912378698938492032\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1243637962?book_show_action=false\"\u003eOct        Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=finished-series\"\u003efinished-series\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=2015\"\u003e2015\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1243637962\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4030107326771741972\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e“There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter is the most amazing series that I have ever read in my whole life, and it probably forever will be. I will never love any books as much as I love these. I don't think I have to tell you guys about how good this book is because most of you have already read it anyway.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI haven't written a review so far because I just did not feel the need to put this\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4030107326771741972\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e“There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter is the most amazing series that I have ever read in my whole life, and it probably forever will be. I will never love any books as much as I love these. I don't think I have to tell you guys about how good this book is because most of you have already read it anyway.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI haven't written a review so far because I just did not feel the need to put this obvious opinion into words. I don't think anything I write here hasn't been said already. But I've just read the illustrated edition by Jim Kay and if it is possible, it makes this book even more outstanding than it already is. Jim Kay is awesome. Maybe you have read \u003ci\u003e A Monster Calls \u003c/i\u003e and already know him. If not, you should definitley reconsider your life choices.\u003cbr /\u003eI am certainly going to buy an edition of this, it's so pretty I could die. Looking forward to the illustrated sequels!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e1000/5 stars.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"4030107326771741972\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11990189051877660125\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/b\u003e\u003ci\u003e is one of the most celebrated books of all time for one simple reason...because it deserves to be!\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444565802ra/16518163.gif\" width=\"400\" you have the right to a speedy trial\"\u003c/b\u003e review\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003e \u003cb\u003eTHE DEFENSE\u003c/b\u003e \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e - Rowling's prose is absolutely magical\u003cbr\u003e - Story is not only exciting but often sweet as well\u003cbr\u003e - Lead characters are all captivating\u003cbr\u003e - Comic relief (mostly from Ron) is blended perfectly with the more dramatic events\u003cbr\u003e - Never a dull mo\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11990189051877660125\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/b\u003e\u003ci\u003e is one of the most celebrated books of all time for one simple reason...because it deserves to be!\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444565802ra/16518163.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"b\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'll write a full review when I have time, but for now here's my...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"Book, you have the right to a speedy trial\"\u003c/b\u003e review\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003eTHE DEFENSE\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e - Rowling's prose is absolutely magical\u003cbr\u003e - Story is not only exciting but often sweet as well\u003cbr\u003e - Lead characters are all captivating\u003cbr\u003e - Comic relief (mostly from Ron) is blended perfectly with the more dramatic events\u003cbr\u003e - Never a dull moment\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003eTHE PROSECUTION\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e - Rowling is occasionally too over-the-top for her own good (especially during Harry's time with the Dursleys)\u003cbr\u003e - After reading this, anything else you do may seem like a waste of time that you could have used to read Harry Potter again!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003eTHE VERDICT\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSome books are worth reading once, this one is worthy reading many times! A brilliant adventure that anyone can enjoy!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11990189051877660125\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return
