p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780590353427\" href=\"/book/show/121121.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3101094-jillian-bookishandnerdy?shelf=all-time-favorites\"\u003eall-time-favorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer83066282\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17831406612539778552\"\u003eRereading Harry Potter always feels like coming home. It was so nice to start at the beginning with Harry before he knew he was a wizard. The wonder and amazement he felt as he arrived at Hogwarts. The friendship that formed among Harry, Ron, and Hermione. Also seeing the little things when I know now how everything ends and ties together. It's just the coziest, most beautiful feeling to be back at Hogwarts and I cannot wait to continue my reread of the series. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e----------------------------------\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17831406612539778552\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eRereading Harry Potter always feels like coming home. It was so nice to start at the beginning with Harry before he knew he was a wizard. The wonder and amazement he felt as he arrived at Hogwarts. The friendship that formed among Harry, Ron, and Hermione. Also seeing the little things when I know now how everything ends and ties together. It's just the coziest, most beautiful feeling to be back at Hogwarts and I cannot wait to continue my reread of the series. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr href=\"/review/list/614778-ahmad-sharabiani?shelf=childrens-young-readers\"\u003echildrens-young-readers\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/614778-ahmad-sharabiani?shelf=20th-century\"\u003e20th-century\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer107775515\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10984925147830140261\"\u003eدخترم نخست اولین جلد «هری پاتر» را خواند، سپس برای برادرانش قصه را باز نمود و آنها خواندند، هر روز در خانه صحبت از هری بود و جادو، با خود گفتم بخوانم و خواندم، دنیای خیال انگیز نویسنده را گسترده دیدم، داستانی که دنیای خیالی آفریده بود و آن را آهسته باز مینمود. خود را در آن روزهایی دیدم که داستان های دنباله دار مجله ی پسران و دختران را میخواندم، شاید از پرویز قاضی سعید یا دیگران، یادم نمانده نام قهرمانان آن روزهای مجله. انگار یادم هست که در کلاس درس نیز با یکی از هم شاگردی ها، داستانهای دنباله\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText10984925147830140261\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eدخترم نخست اولین جلد «هری پاتر» را خواند، سپس برای برادرانش قصه را باز نمود و آنها خواندند، هر روز در خانه صحبت از هری بود و جادو، با خود گفتم بخوانم و خواندم، دنیای خیال انگیز نویسنده را گسترده دیدم، داستانی که دنیای خیالی آفریده بود و آن را آهسته باز مینمود. خود را در آن روزهایی دیدم که داستان های دنباله دار مجله ی پسران و دختران را میخواندم، شاید از پرویز قاضی سعید یا دیگران، یادم نمانده نام قهرمانان آن روزهای مجله. انگار یادم هست که در کلاس درس نیز با یکی از هم شاگردی ها، داستانهای دنباله دار همان مجله را پی میگرفتیم، تا هفته ی بعدش لابد دل تو دلمان نبود. بعدها جلدهای دیگر دنیای خیال رولینگ را پیش از بچه ها میخواندم. هنوز هم از کار روزانه و خواندن مقالات و دانشنامه ها که خسته میشوم، به فانتزی روی میآورم \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"10984925147830140261\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/1084086883/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView 1 comment\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1420067723\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Lauren\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/26439378-lauren\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Lauren\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479624577p2/26439378.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1420067723?book_show_action=false\"\u003eOct 12, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Lauren\" class=\"user\" name=\"Lauren\" href=\"/user/show/26439378-lauren\"\u003eLauren\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9781408855898\" href=\"/book/show/21523103-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26439378-lauren?shelf=read-in-2015\"\u003eread-in-2015\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26439378-lauren?shelf=read-in-2016\"\u003eread-in-2016\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26439378-lauren?shelf=books-i-own\"\u003ebooks-i-own\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26439378-lauren?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26439378-lauren?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26439378-lauren?shelf=1900s-publication\"\u003e1900s-publication\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1420067723\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11990986468317199814\"\u003eThis series (because I’ve read the whole series) is and will always be one of my favourites!!!I loved everything about it and just the whole plot is amazing. Sometimes books never live up to their hype but with this book, I can actually understand why so many people like it. I can’t even explain my love for this series. I’ve watched the movies so many times and read the books only once which is probably why I'm reading it again. I do have to admit I was really late and read this book only last\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11990986468317199814\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThis series (because I’ve read the whole series) is and will always be one of my favourites!!!I loved everything about it and just the whole plot is amazing. Sometimes books never live up to their hype but with this book, I can actually understand why so many people like it. I can’t even explain my love for this series. I’ve watched the movies so many times and read the books only once which is probably why I'm reading it again. I do have to admit I was really late and read this book only last year. After reading the Cursed Child I just had to read this series again and so I did and I loved it even more!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI read this series around the end of last year but I have a perfectly good explanation for that. Oh and also I may have made the mistake of watching the movies many times before reading the books. I was quite young when I first wanted to read the series. I was maybe 10 years old or younger and because I was a stupid little child that knew nothing about the series I decided to read three of the books out of order. I didn’t realise I had to read them in order and I didn’t even know the order. So anyway it took me around 3 months to finish Goblet of Fire and one month to finish Half-Blood Prince. I mean come on I was young and didn't read as much as I do now. After that I never really cared about the series. Around two years ago I became one of those people that thought Harry Potter was overrated (I’m so sorry guys. I didn’t know why it was so popular) and didn’t think it was that great (I didn’t read that much at the time). Then I watched the movies and loved them and decided to order the first book online. It arrived and I was so excited and then… It was in some random language that I didn’t understand. I didn’t even know what language it was! That was when I gave up on the series until last year where I decided to read the series. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNow after all that unnecessary information on to the actual story. I read this two weeks ago and I can’t remember the small details to do a review so this is going to be a very brief review. Everyone’s probably read this book so I’m not going to say what it's about because that would be unnecessary. Everything about this book is wonderful and the magical world just blew me away. I’m so obsessed that sometimes my sister (who hasn’t read the books was but watched the movies) and I pretend to fight for like one minute and shout out spells at each other. Yeah, I’m really weird. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNow don’t get me wrong I love all the character (the good ones) but someone of the main characters aren't that bright \u003cb\u003e*cough*\u003c/b\u003e Harry \u003cb\u003e*cough*\u003c/b\u003e. To be honest I didn’t really think he was that dumb until my friend showed me this thing about why Harry Potter is not in Ravenclaw and it made me realise that he is really an idiot. I would tell you what the reasons are but they spoil the other books so I’m just going to say them when I read the other books. There is one situation where Harry tries to catch the letters in the air and not just pick one of the ground and hide it. They were everywhere so why the hell does he need to grab the ones flying. Yeah, he does manage to get one but he could have got one in a second. Hermione is my favourite character mainly because she’s so smart and without her none of it would have been possible. Harry was so stupid and don’t get me started on Ron. Hermione was amazing she was the one that was able to figure everything out. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis series will always be a series that I will never get sick of. I read this book so quickly. I flew through it and didn’t even realise it. Everything about is is just perfect and if you’re someone who doesn't read this is the best book to get you into it. Even though this is my second time reading it and I know everything that happens it still is just as good. Also, do not be deceived, this book is not for children only.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11990986468317199814\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1420067723'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_1420067723\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1420067723?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e77 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_1420067723\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1420067723\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=77\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=2\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1420067723\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_1420067723\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 1420067723, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1420067723' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1420067723' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 1420067723, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_3599177\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3599177\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"J.G. Keely\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/84023-j-g-keely\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"J.G. Keely\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1274333636p2/84023.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/3599177?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 15, 2007\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"J.G. Keely\" class=\"user\" name=\"J.G. Keely\" href=\"/user/show/84023-j-g-keely\"\u003eJ.G. Keely\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was ok\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fiction\"\u003econtemporary-fiction\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=novel\"\u003enovel\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=reviewed\"\u003ereviewed\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fantasy\"\u003econtemporary-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=uk-and-ireland\"\u003euk-and-ireland\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer3599177\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9881769962130527161\"\u003eFairly standard kid's fantasy fare from Rowling as she re-introduces the world to the classic British fairy tale, which had been mostly forgotten since Tolkien spliced it with the epic. She mines gold from this rich and storied tradition, but doesn't really fashion anything unique from it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWe can see the beginnings of Rowling's authorial failings (and a hint of her strengths as well). She adopts Rouald Dahl's 'awful family' trope, though it's clear that Rowling does not have the gift of bizarre c\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9881769962130527161\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eFairly standard kid's fantasy fare from Rowling as she re-introduces the world to the classic British fairy tale, which had been mostly forgotten since Tolkien spliced it with the epic. She mines gold from this rich and storied tradition, but doesn't really fashion anything unique from it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWe can see the beginnings of Rowling's authorial failings (and a hint of her strengths as well). She adopts Rouald Dahl's 'awful family' trope, though it's clear that Rowling does not have the gift of bizarre characterization or the knowledge of the darker parts of the human soul that made his books resonate.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eShe writes sympathetic characters, but not unusual ones. Overall her writing has relatively little character or style. Then again, mass success often requires leaving the more unusual elements behind. So she relies on standard character types, managing to keep them afloat through the patented perpetual plot of the airplane book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eShe also pulls from that old British tradition of 'children lost in fairyland', seen often in early fantasy (Dunsany, Eddison), which Lewis also made use of. She also has the vast, unknown underground of magic just beneath our world which keeps itself always mysterious and quiet, much favored by Gaiman and other Urban Fantasy authors (though Rowling's invented world is strained and piecemeal, moreso as the series goes on).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe strength of the book is that it combines the tradition of the 'child in fairyland' with another British standby: the boarding school bildungsroman. It's the same neat trick Mervyn Peake pulled in 'Gormenghast', though Rowling's version is tame in comparison. Her tale of the intellectual, emotional, and physical growth of the young, outcast everyman is rather predictable, except for some insight into angst in the fifth book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling's prose is quick and simple, but sometimes awkward and without music or joy. It is not the sort of deliberate simplicity Carroll achieved by expressing complex ideas in playful terms. It is rather the sign of an author whose unsophisticated voice prevents her language from vaulting higher.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSimplistic elegance is deceptively difficult to achieve, and so it's hard to blame Rowling too much when she falters. It's unfortunate that she didn't put a few failed books under her belt before finding success, as such early outings are often best winnowed chaff.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHer plotting--as ever--is scattered and convenient; though in a shorter book, it shows less. Her plot twists, as usual, disappoint; they are not built upon progression of events but upon reader expectation and emotional red herrings.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt's the beginning of an enjoyable series, but there's really no need to start any earlier than the third book, when Rowling finally finds her pace and begins to lean more heavily on that which she does well, which helps to hide her faults. Watch the movie if you need a primer.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://starsbeetlesandfools.blogspot.com/2012/06/suggested-readings-in-fantasy.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eMy Fantasy Book Suggestions\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9881769962130527161\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv Y Harry, que les puedo decir, siento un profundo amor por este personaje, un amor muy diferente al que siempre he sentido por los personajes masculinos de los libros. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/444217376\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Christina\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/14066678-christina\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Christina\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479179459p2/14066678.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/444217376?book_show_action=false\"\u003eOct 18, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Christina\" class=\"user\" name=\"Christina\" href=\"/user/show/14066678-christina\"\u003eChristina\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14066678-christina?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer444217376\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2627877286159868900\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e5 stars, always.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1476572436ra/20858675.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"Some say he died. Codswallop, in my opinion. Dunno if he had enough human left in him to die.\"\u003c/b\u003e \u0026lt;---This definitely sets the tone for the series...funny that as a kid I never realized that.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eGosh, I've missed this series. \u003cbr\u003eI'm not going to bother with a 'proper' review, because no review written by me could ever do this book (or this series for that matter) justice. I'm not going to bother with a description of the plot, because unless you've been living under a rock for the past\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText2627877286159868900\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e5 stars, always.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1476572436ra/20858675.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"Some say he died. Codswallop, in my opinion. Dunno if he had enough human left in him to die.\"\u003c/b\u003e \u0026lt;---This definitely sets the tone for the series...funny that as a kid I never realized that.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eGosh, I've missed this series. \u003cbr\u003eI'm not going to bother with a 'proper' review, because no review written by me could ever do this book (or this series for that matter) justice. I'm not going to bother with a description of the plot, because unless you've been living under a rock for the past almost 20 years, you know what Harry Potter is about. Instead, this is just a spot for me to put down my thoughts, feelings and history with this series.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/i\u003e was first released in the US on September 1, 1998 by Scholastic. I was 9 years old...the same age that my daughter (my oldest) is now. But I didn't read this that year. I actually read this out of order initially, and read this book only after reading and falling in love with \u003ci\u003eChamber of Secrets\u003c/i\u003e. So I was 11 the first time I ever picked up a Harry Potter book, the same age as Harry and company in this book. For me, it made it all the more magical and relatable to grow up alongside the characters and to be roughly the same age as they were as the books were released. I had already enjoyed reading, but Harry Potter is the first book series that I ever truly loved...that I could read over and over again, and never grow tired of it.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI still react with shock to the people who tell me they've \u003cu\u003eONLY\u003c/u\u003e watched these movies, never read the books (my husband included) and start ranting about all the amazing details they're missing out on...I'm almost as bad as a religious fanatic in that regard, trying to convert everyone into a Potterhead. I can't even watch the movies without thinking about everything from the books being left out.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1458697474ra/18519725.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow here I am, years later as an adult and with a family of my own, finally reading my illustrated copy of the first Harry Potter book. Which is \u003cb\u003eGORGEOUS!\u003c/b\u003e This edition is a \u003cu\u003eMUST\u003c/u\u003e for any true fan. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow that I'm older, I appreciate Rowling's writing that much more. It truly is magical. She manages to create a whole amazing world, with details galore and manages to introduce you into the world without it feeling like a huge info dump. Everything is so carefully explained, that it all feels completely legit. For me, she will always be the Queen, hands down.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003eFavorite Quotes:\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e*\u003cb\u003eIt does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e*\u003cb\u003eAfter all, to the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e*\u003cb\u003eIt takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"2627877286159868900\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n Seriously, his Hagrid voice is my life. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459479899ra/18616130.gif\" height=\"\" width=\"\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eGrowing up I always had a love/hate relationship with Harry as the main character, but this time around I just loved the lil guy. (tbh everything about this book made me emotional.)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459479899ra/18616131.gif\" height=\"\" width=\"\" Potter reread...\u003cb\u003eHARRY POTTER REREAD\u003c/b\u003e....already 2016 is looking awesome.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eReading with a few other Potter heads at \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/group/show/148164-buddies-books-and-baubles\"\u003eBuddies Books and Baubles\u003c/a\u003e. Let the magic commence. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThere are a bazzilion reviews for Harry Potter so I’ll make this short and sweet.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis is the story of a little boy who grew up thinking he was unremarkable and without any family that really cared for him.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452438420i/17694021._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"503\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eUntil he finds out that he is special and begins a magical journey that will change the course of his life forever.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452438420i/17694022._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"248\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eGoing to th\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText666527026801689651\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eHarry Potter reread...\u003cb\u003eHARRY POTTER REREAD\u003c/b\u003e....already 2016 is looking awesome.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eReading with a few other Potter heads at \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/group/show/148164-buddies-books-and-baubles\"\u003eBuddies Books and Baubles\u003c/a\u003e. Let the magic commence. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThere are a bazzilion reviews for Harry Potter so I’ll make this short and sweet.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis is the story of a little boy who grew up thinking he was unremarkable and without any family that really cared for him.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452438420i/17694021._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"503\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eUntil he finds out that he is special and begins a magical journey that will change the course of his life forever.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452438420i/17694022._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"248\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eGoing to the best and most magical school in any universe Hogwarts.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452438420i/17694023._SY540_.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"541\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNo matter how many times I read this I’m always transported into this great world all over again and get so lost in it. This book and series is really fantastic no matter how old you are. It is really amazing how much magic J.K. Rowling packed into this story. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOn this my 4th or 5th reread I found so many little things I didn’t see before. There always seems to be something knew I pick up every time. Like the dreams Harry has of a Quirrel’s turban talking to him telling him he is supposed to be in Slytherin. Albus Dumbledore liking 10 pin bowling and wanting wool socks more than anything else but people always give him books.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI get so nostalgic every single time I read this and I love Olivander’s wand shop, the beginning of the friendship between Harry, Ron and Hermione and how could we ever forget the crazy twin and all their hilarious antics. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo many wonderful things in this world that I’d say even if you aren’t an avid reader it is one series everyone should read.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"666527026801689651\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext BLOG: \u003ca href=\"http://melissa413readsalot.blogspot.com/2015/12/harry-potter-and-sorcerers-stone.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eMelissa Martin's Reading List\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eI'M GOING TO ADD MY BIG OLE SPOILER THING FOR THOSE THAT HAVEN'T READ THESE BOOKS YET. I'M ALSO GOING TO ADD A FEW PICTURES THAT ARE IN THE BOOK SO YOU CAN SEE HOW BEAUTIFUL IT IS AND RUN OUT AND BUY IT, IF YOU HAVEN'T ALREADY!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eLET US BEGIN!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1451248240ra/17520578.gif\" alt=\" \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1446646841i/16854883._SX540_.jpg\" alt=\" : \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003ePoor Harry's parents were killed by VOLDEMORT! Yep, I said it :-) So Dumbledore (the head honcho) and the gang decide to leave Harry with his mother's sister, Aunt Petunia and Uncle Vernon and their brat of a son, Dudley.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15521728429571722187\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eMY BLOG: \u003ca href=\"http://melissa413readsalot.blogspot.com/2015/12/harry-potter-and-sorcerers-stone.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eMelissa Martin's Reading List\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eI'M GOING TO ADD MY BIG OLE SPOILER THING FOR THOSE THAT HAVEN'T READ THESE BOOKS YET. I'M ALSO GOING TO ADD A FEW PICTURES THAT ARE IN THE BOOK SO YOU CAN SEE HOW BEAUTIFUL IT IS AND RUN OUT AND BUY IT, IF YOU HAVEN'T ALREADY!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eLET US BEGIN!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1451248240ra/17520578.gif\" alt=\" \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1446646841i/16854883._SX540_.jpg\" alt=\" : \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003ePoor Harry's parents were killed by VOLDEMORT! Yep, I said it :-) So Dumbledore (the head honcho) and the gang decide to leave Harry with his mother's sister, Aunt Petunia and Uncle Vernon and their brat of a son, Dudley. This was a huge mistake because they were so mean to him growing up. He had to live in a cupboard under the stairs and wear Dudley's hand-me-downs. They didn't get him gifts or do anything nice for him. :-( They didn't even tell him what really happened to his parents, what they were and what he was... until one day.. on his eleventh birthday he started getting all of these letters in the mail inviting him to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. But his stupid family tried to keep the letters from Harry, this didn't go over well and we get to meet sweet, wonderful Hagrid. :-)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHagrid is stunned that Harry doesn't know anything about anything and begins to fill him in, he also brings him a cake for his bday :-)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1451250040ra/17520660.gif\" alt=\" \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1451250040ra/17520661.gif\" alt=\" \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMoving on.. so Harry finds out about all the things he needs to find out about and Hagrid carts him off to the bank to get all of this money his parents left for him so he can buy supplies for school! I just loved in the movies and the books when they went shopping at Diagon Alley. I want to go there! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAfter Harry gets to school he gets into Gryffindor with his new friends, Ron, Hermione (my heroine), all of the Weasley's, and Neville. There are a lot of sweet people in their house. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHe has an arch nemesis named Malfoy that get into Slytherin, the house Voldemort was in at one time. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSoooooo.... I'm not going to tell every little thing about the book as most have read it and some that haven't just might take a little peek :-) \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eLet's sum this up to say that Harry gets on the Quidditch team (read to find out what that is), there are trolls with nasty snot, a secret the group are trying to figure out, great times spent with Hagrid, many magical moments and an appearance of sorts by someone that will not be named......\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm going to leave you with some pictures from the book, I had no idea that Jim Kay who is the illustrator is the same man who illustrated, \"A Monster Calls,\" by Patrick Ness and he also has a rescued greyhound like me :-) Yay! ...OH and there will be no captions to the pictures, you can figure out most yourself or just look at the pretty pictures, just know that there are many more pictures in the book and all of the pages have something cool on them! \u003cb\u003eI highly recommend this edition of the book!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451250040i/17520662._SY540_.jpg\" alt=\" : \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451250040i/17520663._SY540_.jpg\" alt=\" : \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451250040i/17520664._SY540_.jpg\" alt=\" : \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451250040i/17520665._SY540_.jpg\" alt=\" : \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI will say again to go out and buy this illustrated edition, it's so wonderful and I can't wait to get the rest of them in the illustrated editions!!!!!!!! Like yesterday!!!!!! Kudos to J.K. Rowling for writing the series and to Jim Kay for his wonderful illustrations! \u003cb\u003eProfessor McGonagall approves :-)\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1446841512ra/16910494.gif\" alt=\" \" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eI LOVED TAKING THIS TRIP BACK DOWN MEMORY LANE WITH THE GROUP AND THE MAGIC!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15521728429571722187\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return href=\"/review/list/1053760-shelby-trains-flying-monkeys?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer758289197\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer3560196239233209658\"\u003eThere is really no way to do this book justice. I felt years younger in spirit just from reading it. This is all.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://s926.photobucket.com/user/bookqueenshelby/media/Harry%20potter/tumblr_m0p24habBv1qfvjxco1_500_zps532ebacc.gif.html\" id=\"review_149066958\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/149066958\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1428960569p2/886144.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/149066958?book_show_action=false\"\u003eFeb 23, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" class=\"user\" name=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" href=\"/user/show/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow\"\u003eBrigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=5-star-books\"\u003e5-star-books\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=childrens\"\u003echildrens\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=middle-grade\"\u003emiddle-grade\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer149066958\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4702177603481629349\"\u003eSo, a bunch of my Goodreads friends are doing a Harry Potter re-read challenge! And since I haven't read these in like five years (and I've only read them once––*gasp!!*) I am joining in on the fun. :)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFinished re-reading this one yesterday, and I enjoyed it far more than the first two times I read it. (Some background: I read the first two books when I was 9 and then gave up, and then I didn't read the entire series until I was 18.) The last time I read this series, I went into it being a bit cy\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4702177603481629349\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eSo, a bunch of my Goodreads friends are doing a Harry Potter re-read challenge! And since I haven't read these in like five years (and I've only read them once––*gasp!!*) I am joining in on the fun. :)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFinished re-reading this one yesterday, and I enjoyed it far more than the first two times I read it. (Some background: I read the first two books when I was 9 and then gave up, and then I didn't read the entire series until I was 18.) The last time I read this series, I went into it being a bit cynical to be honest. People had been telling me to read them for years, and I resisted forever because ... I thought I was a cool ~non-conformist~? I don't really know.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut anyway, this time around I'm just letting myself enjoy these books like a normal person. And I really enjoyed my re-read of this book. It's a lot of fun, it's absorbing, it has terrific and original world-building, and it has a great cast of characters.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAlso, now that I've actually read the whole series, I was amazed at how many allusions there are to the following books. I know J.K. Rowling did a lot of careful planning, and it shows.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReally looking forward to re-reading the rest of the books!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e(Old review under the cut.)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--------\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[\u003cb\u003eOld review (2/28/11):\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOkay so, funny story. I started to read these books back in third grade, when they were first becoming like \"THE BIG THING\". I read the first two and a half, and then gave up for one reason or another. I got bored I guess? Eh, don't remember. And then I just never got around to reading them, and everyone was constantly talking about them and bugging me to read them like \"*POKE POKE* BRIGID READ HARRY POTTER!\" So I was like, \"Yeah … I'm not going to because I'm a nonconformist!\" And basically the whole thing just became really annoying ... because the more people told me to read them, the more I didn't want to. If that makes sense.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWell, finally my sisters gave into the whole craze and became obsessed just like everyone else. And so, with all my friends and two little sisters constantly nagging me, I caved. Plus, my sisters bought them all so they were already sitting there on my bookshelf.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI guess it's a bit hard to judge, since now I'm 18 and––ya know––not really a little kid anymore. Although yeah, I know the books get more mature, which is why I'll keep reading.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOver all, it was enjoyable. But I guess I see why, at age 9, I didn't feel compelled to keep reading. There were a few things that irked me ...\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ea) First of all, the whole story seemed to go by much too fast. I guess, you know, it's for kids and all. But still, quite a lot of things happened with no down-time in between. Events would just happen in two or three pages and then it'd be on to the next thing straightaway! Even the climax was only ... like ... ten pages long. And after that, it ended quite abruptly.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHowever, in Rowling's defense ... I understand that this was her first book, and so agents/publishers probably pressured her to cut out as much as possible. I'm trying to get my first book published at the moment, and so far quite a few agents have suggested that I cut about 70,000 words out of my manuscript ... So I know how it is. O_o\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eb) The writing. Well, for the most part it was all right. But ... so many dialogue tags with adverbs! One of my greatest pet peeves! (\"she exclaimed indignantly!\") Although, once again, it's a kids' book. So I guess I shouldn't expect the writing style to be mind-blowingly awesome. Also, I've been told five billion times that Rowling's writing style improves as the books progress, so … YAY!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ec) The characters are all very likable ... except Harry Potter himself. I don't know what it is, but I didn't feel much of an attachment to him. Maybe it was because everyone is always fawning over him? Like, wherever he goes everyone's like \"OOOH IT'S THE AWESOMETASTICAL HARRY POTTER!\" (Maybe I'm just jealous? Haha.) And he didn't have much of like an \"attitude\", at least not in this book. Eh ... I assume he'll develop more later on.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs for what I liked ... As I mentioned already, good characters. Also, it's a very creative story. Rowling's world-building is very detailed, which adds more to the suspension of disbelief and whatnot. So that's pretty cool. :) I can tell that she was setting up for a lot of future character relationships, plot-lines, etc. And it's good to see a series that has actually been planned out in advance––that's what a series is \u003ci\u003esupposed\u003c/i\u003e to be like. (So many authors seem to just pull sequels out of their butts these days.)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo yeah, I guess that is all my thoughts on book número uno. On to the next! \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"4702177603481629349\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review149066958\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link149066958\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=149066958\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_149066958'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_149066958\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/149066958?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e62 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_149066958\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_149066958\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_381003498\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/381003498\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Evgeny\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/9340136-evgeny\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Evgeny\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1349810697p2/9340136.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/381003498?book_show_action=false\"\u003eFeb 02, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Evgeny\" class=\"user\" name=\"Evgeny\" href=\"/user/show/9340136-evgeny\"\u003eEvgeny\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408810545\" href=\"/book/show/7955579-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9340136-evgeny?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9340136-evgeny?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer381003498\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer3195645845471906493\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eReview updated on 7/1/2016\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThere is nothing I say about this book or the series in general which has not been said before and probably better. I will still give a brief summary of the plot in case you lived under a rock - a rock in a \u003cb\u003every\u003c/b\u003e remote location. A young orphan living with his aunt's family which does not care much about him learns he came from a family of wizards. He also has an opportunity to go to a wizard school which he jumps at without a second thought. He makes some friends,\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452187898i/17658699.jpg\" width=\"260\" height=\"180\" alt=\"Wizards\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eenemie\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3195645845471906493\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eReview updated on 7/1/2016\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThere is nothing I say about this book or the series in general which has not been said before and probably better. I will still give a brief summary of the plot in case you lived under a rock - a rock in a \u003cb\u003every\u003c/b\u003e remote location. A young orphan living with his aunt's family which does not care much about him learns he came from a family of wizards. He also has an opportunity to go to a wizard school which he jumps at without a second thought. He makes some friends,\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452187898i/17658699.jpg\" width=\"260\" height=\"180\" alt=\"Wizards\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eenemies and learns some details about his parents' death.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMake no mistake here: this \u003ci\u003eis\u003c/i\u003e a children book. This is also a book which brought a lot of children to reading for which it gets major bonus points from me. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452187409i/17658632._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"260\" height=\"300\" alt=\"Grumpy Potter\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDo not think the series remain this way: the books become more and more mature as Harry Potter and his friends grow up.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs far as the story goes, it is highly entertaining and remains so throughout the whole series. This book in particular is notable for really showing a sense of wonder when we (and Harry) finally get to see the wizard's world. The movie based on this novel does an excellent job in this as well; succeeding at something almost every other ones based on fantasy books fail; it also nailed the casting. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI also really need to point out something else. It is not a secret anymore (was it ever?) what J.K. Rowling is a woman. Two of her major characters and countless number of minor ones are boys. She does write them as real life boys which takes talent and some experience which I suppose comes from her having a son. I do not even need to mention that her main female character grows up to be strong \u003cb\u003eand\u003c/b\u003e caring young woman.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis book is suitable for both children and adults alike. Do not be deceived by its seemingly childish beginning.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"3195645845471906493\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border         $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});\n        } else {\n          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});\n        }\n      });\n      $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {\n        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {\n          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {\n            var lessLink = e.next();\n            swapContent(lessLink);\n          }\n        });\n      });\n\n//]]\u003e\n\u003c/script\u003e  \u003cscript type=\"text/javascript\"\u003e\n  //\u003c![CDATA[\n href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/224259997\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Natalie Monroe\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6688207-natalie-monroe\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Natalie Monroe\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1339730817p2/6688207.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/224259997?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJan 04, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Natalie Monroe\" class=\"user\" name=\"Natalie Monroe\" href=\"/user/show/6688207-natalie-monroe\"\u003eNatalie Monroe\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=pants-are-snowmen-and-they-are-june\"\u003epants-are-snowmen-and-they-are-june\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=reread-for-the-nth-time\"\u003ereread-for-the-nth-time\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=fabulous-five-stars\"\u003efabulous-five-stars\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=pleasantly-surprised\"\u003epleasantly-surprised\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=fearless-protagonists\"\u003efearless-protagonists\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=kick-ass-heroines\"\u003ekick-ass-heroines\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6688207-natalie-monroe?shelf=laugh-out-loud-humor\"\u003elaugh-out-loud-humor\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer224259997\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13873966274137535461\"\u003eI used to hate Harry Potter.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1420108105ra/13173618.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow before you hoist your pitchforks and torches, allow me to explain.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWhen I was a wee child of six, my dad decided it'd be a good idea to introduce me to the series—starting from the Goblet of Fire. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBack then, I was a vivacious reader, but mainly of chapter books, like \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/series/40833-junie-b-jones\"\u003eJunie B. Jones\u003c/a\u003e or \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/series/57523-the-adventures-of-the-bailey-school-kids\"\u003eBailey School Kids\u003c/a\u003e. The thickest book I'd read was \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6310.Charlie_and_the_Chocolate_Factory__Charlie_Bucket___1_\" title=\"Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (Charlie Bucket, #1) by Roald Dahl\"\u003eCharlie and the Chocolate Factory\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1400058885ra/9629011.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo when my dad plunked this gigantic doorstopper of a book in front of me, I quickly lost interest\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText13873966274137535461\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI used to hate Harry Potter.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1420108105ra/13173618.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow before you hoist your pitchforks and torches, allow me to explain.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWhen I was a wee child of six, my dad decided it'd be a good idea to introduce me to the series—starting from the Goblet of Fire. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBack then, I was a vivacious reader, but mainly of chapter books, like \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/series/40833-junie-b-jones\"\u003eJunie B. Jones\u003c/a\u003e or \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/series/57523-the-adventures-of-the-bailey-school-kids\"\u003eBailey School Kids\u003c/a\u003e. The thickest book I'd read was \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6310.Charlie_and_the_Chocolate_Factory__Charlie_Bucket___1_\" title=\"Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (Charlie Bucket, #1) by Roald Dahl\"\u003eCharlie and the Chocolate Factory\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1400058885ra/9629011.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo when my dad plunked this gigantic doorstopper of a book in front of me, I quickly lost interest and deemed Harry Potter boring and overhyped. I carried this opinion through my teenage years, rolling my eyes at the people who'd pillaged bookstores at midnight and refusing my uncle's generous offer to purchase me the entire series because he knew I liked to read.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFast forward to 2009, when I was deep in the clutches of \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/41865.Twilight__Twilight___1_\" title=\"Twilight (Twilight, #1) by Stephenie Meyer\"\u003eTwilight\u003c/a\u003e and desperate for something to fill the power vacuum Breaking Dawn had left. Then I stumbled across Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone in my school library.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\"What the hell,\" I'd thought. \"There's nothing else to read anyway.\"\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'd settled on a cushy couch, flicked to the first page and laid eyes on this: \u003ci\u003e\"Mr and Mrs Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much.\"\u003c/i\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIt was all over for me. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI read past the tardy bell, begged the librarian to let me keep it, even though we weren't allowed to check out books that early on in the school year. I zoomed through it in class and snuck the Chamber of Secrets and the Prisoner of Azaban home under my coat. I even pleaded my mother to haul The Goblet of Fire, Order of the Phoenix, Half-Blood Prince, those thick, heavy hardbacks, home from \u003ci\u003eher\u003c/i\u003e school's library (my mom's a teacher), so I wouldn't be left Potter-less during the weekend. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHaving come across them long overdue, I knew major spoilers, including who would die in the end, yet it still broke my heart when I read The Deathly Hallows.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1420108105ra/13173619.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThere are no words to describe how much I love Harry Potter, and how much I want to smack my 14-year-old for obsessing over a controlling, douchebag vampire when I could have been laughing and swooning at Fred and George Weasley's antics.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1420108105i/13173620.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI am not part of the Potter generation. But I wish I had been.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1420108105ra/13173621.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"13873966274137535461\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/241902710\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Stepheny\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/7091879-stepheny\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Stepheny\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476841174p2/7091879.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/241902710?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 03, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Stepheny\" class=\"user\" name=\"Stepheny\" href=\"/user/show/7091879-stepheny\"\u003eStepheny\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=books-everyone-should-read\"\u003ebooks-everyone-should-read\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=favorite-series\"\u003efavorite-series\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=ya\"\u003eya\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=hands-down-favorites\"\u003ehands-down-favorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=coming-of-age\"\u003ecoming-of-age\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=like-a-meth-addiction\"\u003elike-a-meth-addiction\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=badd-ass-fantasy\"\u003ebadd-ass-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=mentioned-by-stephen-king\"\u003ementioned-by-stephen-king\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=classics\"\u003eclassics\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=reliving-my-childhood\"\u003ereliving-my-childhood\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer241902710\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5051681764108354210\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was in eighth grade when my mom brought me home a paperback copy of \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone\u003c/i\u003e. I immediately gave her the most outraged look possible and couldn’t believe that she would be handing me something as ridiculous as Harry Potter. “But Mom!” I said, “I read Stephen King. This book is for kids!” Well, if there is one thing my mom knows, it is her children. So she said back to me: “Stepheny, they are talking about \u003ci\u003e banning\u003c/i\u003e this book from the schools.” Well, that was all it\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5051681764108354210\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was in eighth grade when my mom brought me home a paperback copy of \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone\u003c/i\u003e. I immediately gave her the most outraged look possible and couldn’t believe that she would be handing me something as ridiculous as Harry Potter. “But Mom!” I said, “I read Stephen King. This book is for kids!” Well, if there is one thing my mom knows, it is her children. So she said back to me: “Stepheny, they are talking about \u003ci\u003e banning\u003c/i\u003e this book from the schools.” Well, that was all it took. She knew me well enough and knew my feelings on book-banning. I waited until she walked out of the room before cautiously picking the book up, not wanting to give her the satisfaction of knowing she hit the right button. I skimmed the back cover and had an internal conflict as to whether or not I was actually going to read Harry Potter. Sure, people were talking about this book everywhere, but come on…it’s a \u003cb\u003echildren’s book\u003c/b\u003e! After a few minutes of going back and forth inside my own head I decided I would at the very least give it a shot. I mean, why not, right? I told myself that if I didn’t like it I could put it down and move on with my life. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI finished that book that same day. I picked it up, became so immersed that I couldn’t put it down and it was over before I knew what had just happened. Later that evening, I asked my mom if she could pick me up the other 2 books of the series that were already out. When she gave me the next two I finished those and had to wait for a whole year before I could get my hands on the fourth one… I was hooked. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere is a reason that I encourage people to read this series. It is life-changing. For me anyway. I would re-read the first books before the new one was coming out, would wait in the endless lines at midnight to get my copy, and stay up the rest of the night reading until my eyes forced themselves shut against my insistence that they stay open. I am a part of the Harry Potter generation, even if I got a late start. I have continued the tradition of re-reading the series every year and I am telling you- it never gets old. In fact, it makes me feel young again. It takes me back to my young, carefree days when life was easy and made sense. I read this series because I love every word of it. The characters are unforgettable, the storyline is an adventure and the series itself is perfection. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis book has seen me through my worst days. It saw me through my awkward teenage years, my insecure post-high school years and the uncomfortable years where you are trying to define who you are and where you stand in the world. And when my father was first diagnosed with cancer, I turned to this book to help me out. It has never once let me down. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI tell people to read the first few books to get a feel for the story, but know they are definitely children’s books. (That, by no means, lowers the level of enjoyment.) But as the story progresses, the storyline matures, as do the characters. I see a piece of myself in nearly every character and I think that is what helps make Harry Potter such an incredible experience. Even if the situations are a little extreme, you can relate to the characters. The world is so real, you just \u003ci\u003eknow\u003c/i\u003e it actually exists and that JKR has been granted access-which is why she was able to write about it- DUH! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI am thankful I was able to convince my GR buddy, Delee, to pick these books up, and even more thrilled that she loved it. So far, every person I have persuaded has enjoyed the books, and that is an incredible feat- if not only for the reason that every person I have persuaded has had very different tastes in books. These books are truly something special. With as many times as I have read these books, this is the first time I have tried to write a review. (How do you even write a review for HP?!) \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI guess I can sum it up with this: I will continue to re-read these books until I am dead and hope to one day share it with the children I don’t have yet. This is more than just a book-it is a part of who I am. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"5051681764108354210\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review241902710\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n      \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer54563852\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4394321146682310790\"\u003eI primarily wanted to reread this book in honor of the Banned Books Week (this series is #1 on the \u003ci\u003eTop 100 Banned/Challenged Books: 2000-2009\u003c/i\u003e list). It also happened that I was on vacation in Orlando and, surely enough, a Universal Studios \u003ci\u003eHogwarts\u003c/i\u003e visit was a must. Oh, the nostalgia! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA lot has been said already about the series, so I won't repeat. I just feel very, very sad for the kids whose parents choose to ban these books from their houses and their lives. To take something so wondrous, ima\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4394321146682310790\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI primarily wanted to reread this book in honor of the Banned Books Week (this series is #1 on the \u003ci\u003eTop 100 Banned/Challenged Books: 2000-2009\u003c/i\u003e list). It also happened that I was on vacation in Orlando and, surely enough, a Universal Studios \u003ci\u003eHogwarts\u003c/i\u003e visit was a must. Oh, the nostalgia! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA lot has been said already about the series, so I won't repeat. I just feel very, very sad for the kids whose parents choose to ban these books from their houses and their lives. To take something so wondrous, imaginative, so magical from children is pretty much a crime in my eyes. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThese books have given me a lot pleasure over the years, but I have to praise them especially for their ability to turn the old me and my equally old husband into children who can still sigh in delight at seeing \u003ci\u003eHogwarts\u003c/i\u003e, the \u003ci\u003eSorting Hat\u003c/i\u003e, the \u003ci\u003eOlivander's\u003c/i\u003e (almost) come to life and smile from ear to ear just because we were drinking butterbeer at \u003ci\u003eThree Broomsticks\u003c/i\u003e (it's very tasty, BTW)!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9788478884452\" href=\"/book/show/1359361.Harry_Potter_y_La_Piedra_Filosofal\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4322616-josu?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4322616-josu?shelf=2015-abril\"\u003e2015-abril\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1248044876\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7576942307428288263\"\u003eEs una relectura, pero ¿y qué? El universo de Rowling es tan rico en detalles y está tan lleno de magia que es imposible no enamorarse. No importa cuántas veces lo lea, siempre habrá cosas que me sorprenderán. Leyendo la novela con perspectiva, sabiendo qué ocurrirá en libros venideros, te das cuenta de la cantidad de referencias y pistas que Rowling deja como si nada. \u003cb\u003ePERO ES QUE ESTÁ TODO PENSADO.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAhora ya en serio, siendo objetivo, \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter y la piedra filosofal\u003c/i\u003e es una novela llena de valo\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7576942307428288263\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eEs una relectura, pero ¿y qué? El universo de Rowling es tan rico en detalles y está tan lleno de magia que es imposible no enamorarse. No importa cuántas veces lo lea, siempre habrá cosas que me sorprenderán. Leyendo la novela con perspectiva, sabiendo qué ocurrirá en libros venideros, te das cuenta de la cantidad de referencias y pistas que Rowling deja como si nada. \u003cb\u003ePERO ES QUE ESTÁ TODO PENSADO.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAhora ya en serio, siendo objetivo, \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter y la piedra filosofal\u003c/i\u003e es una novela llena de valores, magia y con una historia que nos abre las puertas a un mundo perfectamente explicado y planteado. He de decir que todo lo que se nos presenta (tanto conflictos como magia, leyes o incluso personajes) se hace de un modo bastante plano, pero a la vez, lleno de detalles. Da la sensación de que conocemos el universo y a la gente de éste, pero realmente estamos viendo pequeñas características que se nota que van a ir evolucionando. Y eso es grande, Rowling. Es grande.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eGRACIAS.\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"7576942307428288263\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border
