\u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer339289282\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11570887100639038166\"\u003eIn my gradual return to books after my harrowing experience with Mockingjay, I've built myself up to Harry Potter:\u003cbr /\u003eFive stars to a book that is what it is and isn't what it's not. Make sense? This is a middle school children's book and when it's read as such it's great. I see people giving this one or two stars and I scratch my head in wonderment. Do they compare it to Shakespeare or Hemmingway? Do they read it as it was meant to be read or are they bringing snooty, intellectual baggage to the ta\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11570887100639038166\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIn my gradual return to books after my harrowing experience with Mockingjay, I've built myself up to Harry Potter:\u003cbr /\u003eFive stars to a book that is what it is and isn't what it's not. Make sense? This is a middle school children's book and when it's read as such it's great. I see people giving this one or two stars and I scratch my head in wonderment. Do they compare it to Shakespeare or Hemmingway? Do they read it as it was meant to be read or are they bringing snooty, intellectual baggage to the table. You are smart. We get it. You are all a bunch of geniuses—now try having some fun!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11570887100639038166\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1185968753?book_show_action=false\"\u003eOct 08, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Aj the Ravenous Reader\" class=\"user\" name=\"Aj the Ravenous Reader\" href=\"/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader\"\u003eAj the Ravenous Reader\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=wholesome-reads\"\u003ewholesome-reads\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1185968753\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer410814643123851842\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e \u003ci\u003e “It was agony to touch a person marked by something so good.” \u003c/i\u003e \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576920.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eTo give you an overview of the story…\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576921.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs if I was gonna do that. I wouldn’t want to be pelted with rotten tomatoes, mind you. Lol. ^^\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs for my review, I politely refer you to all other great five star reviews of this book and think of every little thing good you can think of, every beautiful word that comes to mind, every amazing feeling you remember, those are what I will say of this book, of the characters, of the writing and of e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText410814643123851842\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e \u003ci\u003e “It was agony to touch a person marked by something so good.” \u003c/i\u003e \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576920.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eTo give you an overview of the story…\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576921.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs if I was gonna do that. I wouldn’t want to be pelted with rotten tomatoes, mind you. Lol. ^^\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs for my review, I politely refer you to all other great five star reviews of this book and think of every little thing good you can think of, every beautiful word that comes to mind, every amazing feeling you remember, those are what I will say of this book, of the characters, of the writing and of everything about the book. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe only challenge I encountered reading this was this little voice speaking in perfect British accent that was manipulating my entire reading. That stubborn voice prolonged the entire process because it wanted to be heard and so many times that voice managed its way through my mouth making me read the words aloud in this foreign voice that’s definitely not my own. Lol. ^^\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI know I’m not making sense anymore so I’ll stop but before that let me just say that I loved all the characters (of course except the despicable ones) but that who made the strongest impression upon me is….surprise, surprise! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1423017066i/13576922.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThat quote above belongs to him. He amuses and surprises me all the time despite his little but hugely significant roles in the entire story. I was laughing out loud at his mention of eating a vomit flavored bean and then trying another only to taste the earwax flavored one. But except from his hilarity, everything he says is a precious gem. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e \u003ci\u003e “After all, to the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.” \u003c/i\u003e \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI know it sounds too much, but I was laughing and crying at the book’s perfect ending. Everything is just perfect! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThank you, Hayat for this reading challenge and thank you Isabelle for providing me the book. You guys are the best! \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"410814643123851842\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1185968753\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer137775795\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17425602962719569213\"\u003eWow! Watching the movie was one thing, but reading it is completely something else! I wish I didn't watch the movies first \u0026gt;__\u0026lt; Or should I say, I wished I read the books first!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy first impressions:\u003cbr /\u003e1) I didn't realize how humorous some parts of the book were! Albus Dumbledore, you're definitely off your rocker; but I LOVE IT!\u003cbr /\u003e2) The friendships, and interaction between all the characters are great. I love the love/hate relationship going on between Ron and Hermione.\u003cbr /\u003e3) Harry is a spunky kid\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17425602962719569213\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eWow! Watching the movie was one thing, but reading it is completely something else! I wish I didn't watch the movies first \u0026gt;__\u0026lt; Or should I say, I wished I read the books first!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy first impressions:\u003cbr /\u003e1) I didn't realize how humorous some parts of the book were! Albus Dumbledore, you're definitely off your rocker; but I LOVE IT!\u003cbr /\u003e2) The friendships, and interaction between all the characters are great. I love the love/hate relationship going on between Ron and Hermione.\u003cbr /\u003e3) Harry is a spunky kid isn't he? For a 11 year old he really knows how to hold his own. Well done sir!\u003cbr /\u003e4) Neville Longbottom. What can I say? He's the true hero, isn't he? :)\u003cbr /\u003e5) Love The Mirror of Erised chapter.\u003cbr /\u003e6) Quidditch is amazing. Can I be a Beater?\u003cbr /\u003e7) Excellent writing. Great setup for the rest of the books!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eCheck out my full review here: \u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://thereadables.tumblr.com/post/2604732660/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttp://thereadables.tumblr.com/post/2...\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"17425602962719569213\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; is the hardest review I've had to write all year!!!! Sometimes you read a book that's so magnificent, so completely perfect you literally don't have words to describe it and no matter how hard you try, no matter how hard you dig inside yourself, you can’t find the right ones. I adore the entire series and love the educational value and positive messages as well in the book, I could read it over and over again! my childhood was amazing I grew up watching harry potter’s movies as an adult I’m\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3939469441942866713\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThis is the hardest review I've had to write all year!!!! Sometimes you read a book that's so magnificent, so completely perfect you literally don't have words to describe it and no matter how hard you try, no matter how hard you dig inside yourself, you can’t find the right ones. I adore the entire series and love the educational value and positive messages as well in the book, I could read it over and over again! my childhood was amazing I grew up watching harry potter’s movies as an adult I’m still so amazed by this series it’s my first time reading JK Rowling’s books and I’m loving it ! I can’t wait to read the rest of the series ! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg href=\"/review/list/1713956-manny?shelf=well-i-think-its-funny\"\u003ewell-i-think-its-funny\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer113033849\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5515039270989259599\"\u003eOh look! A cute, funny children's book, just the right length, with a nicely constructed, self-contained plot and a good ending.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWell, obviously we want to turn it into a huge, bloated, ridiculously self-important seven-volume series. Nothing else would make sense. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n id=\"freeTextContainer18020644331807234897\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e¿Que puedo decir que no se haya dicho ya?\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHace rato que quería empezar la saga leyendo sus libros. Antes de hacer eso prefería conseguir los tomos en físico. No tengo plata, no aguante, me los descargué y la inicié. aventura.\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e \u003ci\u003eNo es bueno dejarse arrastrar por los sueños y olvidarse de vivir.\u003c/i\u003e \u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n for: \u003c/span\u003e\n           \u003cspan class=\"uitext reviewText\"\u003emagic world lovers\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=classics\"\u003eclassics\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=books-i-own\"\u003ebooks-i-own\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=all-time-favorites\"\u003eall-time-favorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer794900297\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7355088556086665287\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e \u003cblockquote\u003e“It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.”\u003c/blockquote\u003e \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIs there a person in the entire planet that has never in their lives read at least a Harry Potter novel? No, I don't think so. Is there a person who's never heard of Harry Potter? No, I don't think so, even my grandma knows of him. We all love us some Harry Potter. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt's a favorite of mine and I'm sure every bookworm who's out there can appreciate and understand the reason why.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was one of those little kids that run around dressed up like H\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7355088556086665287\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003cblockquote\u003e“It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.”\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIs there a person in the entire planet that has never in their lives read at least a Harry Potter novel? No, I don't think so. Is there a person who's never heard of Harry Potter? No, I don't think so, even my grandma knows of him. We all love us some Harry Potter. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt's a favorite of mine and I'm sure every bookworm who's out there can appreciate and understand the reason why.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was one of those little kids that run around dressed up like Harry. For the record, I really did. I would wear those round glasses and swish and flick my wand around and I took so pride in doing so.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt took me some time to read the books because I didn't use to be a bookworm, I only started appreciating the magic of books, like two years ago. I read this last year and after seeing the movie countless times I still didn't feel like reading something forcefully or something I knew what its story was going to be, although I did.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eJ.K. Rowling created a world that is so genuine, so detailed, so real. She took a word, magic, and she gave new meaning to it, creating spells, traditions to follow magic throughout this magnificent journey. She created these three real, passionate, and amazing characters that we all love and in a way we grew together. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis is my childhood. No, not the books. But I was fan of the movies ever since the first one and maybe I wasn't one of the lucky ones to read the book from the beginning I still have a word at saying that we were lucky to grow up into the Harry Potter generation.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis, as you all know, is the first novel in the series and it's an introduction mostly. Its size is not so big but trust me it's a wondrous book that makes every little kid's fantasy (and why not kid-grown ups) run wild. I love this and how juvenile it is. Harry, Ron, Hermione, they're all so cute and small, they're just little kids, chasing down the adventure.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWe all know who Harry and his sidekicks are. We all know about his lightning-shaped scar. We all know what he's been through when he was just a little boy.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo, I dare you, if you're my age, 19 that is, and you're a fan of the movies but have never given this book the chance it deserves, read the hell out of it. It's never to late.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThanks for reading my review. \u0026lt;3\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"7355088556086665287\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer896279189\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer941830610134089416\"\u003eHarry Potter has and always will have a special place in my heart, so my rating comes as no surprise. However, my rereading of the first book this time around was quite special because I read the recently published illustrated version. I must say that the illustrations very much enhanced the story and made it even more magical. They are unique because they don't look like what we see in the movies, but at the same time they were exactly as I would've pictured them to be. I imagine that any child\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText941830610134089416\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eHarry Potter has and always will have a special place in my heart, so my rating comes as no surprise. However, my rereading of the first book this time around was quite special because I read the recently published illustrated version. I must say that the illustrations very much enhanced the story and made it even more magical. They are unique because they don't look like what we see in the movies, but at the same time they were exactly as I would've pictured them to be. I imagine that any child who has a hard time imagining this fantasy world would only find help and guidance in this illustrated version. I know I loved it, and I can't wait till the second edition comes out. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"941830610134089416\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review896279189\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\"         \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer388323946\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7232487215300589784\"\u003eHarry Potter changed my life. If I hadn’t read Harry Potter when I did I would not be the same person today. What I am today, in a part is due to Harry. I cannot really say enough to make you understand how much Harry Potter means to me. \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review388323946\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link388323946\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=388323946\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_388323946'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_388323946\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/388323946?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e52 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_388323946\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_388323946\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=52\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=3\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=388323946\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_388323946\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 388323946, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); All my friends mock me because the only thing I wear at times are Hogwarts shirts.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText13643201860194329968\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI can relate to you!! My life is not the same after Harry Potter. All my friends mock me because the only thing I wear at times are Hogwarts shirts. Thank you sooo much for showing me I'm not the only one!! \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      May 28, 2015 06:52AM\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv id=\"comment_136497237\" class=\"brown_comment\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_photo\"\u003e\n    \t\u003ca alt=\"Elleana\" href=\"/user/show/44630254-elleana\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450540627p1/44630254.jpg\" alt=\"44630254\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_body\"\u003e\n    \u003ca style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/44630254-elleana\"\u003eElleana\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2096612002690178415\"\u003eI made a great friend with the Harry Potter books and where trying to make a Harry Potter book together.\u003c/span\u003e\n\n    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      Jul 14, 2015 07:38PM\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_388323946' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 388323946, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_129564160\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/129564160\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Mark Lawrence\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4508542-mark-lawrence\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Mark Lawrence\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442536170p2/4508542.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/129564160?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 11, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Mark Lawrence\" class=\"user\" name=\"Mark Lawrence\" href=\"/user/show/4508542-mark-lawrence\"\u003eMark Lawrence\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eliked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer129564160\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6711562669152037877\"\u003ePublishers have my sympathy. If I try to put myself in the place of an editor picking this manuscript from the pile I can say with some certainty that I would not have recognized it as the ticket to a multi-billion dollar prize. I would have thought to myself that it was a good fun read, revisiting the magic-school trope and doing a fine job for children in the 8 to 12 range. If I hadn't had anything better land on my desk I might have published it, but then again, like quite a number of\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6711562669152037877\" style=\"display:none\"\u003ePublishers have my sympathy. If I try to put myself in the place of an editor picking this manuscript from the pile I can say with some certainty that I would not have recognized it as the ticket to a multi-billion dollar prize. I would have thought to myself that it was a good fun read, revisiting the magic-school trope and doing a fine job for children in the 8 to 12 range. If I hadn't had anything better land on my desk I might have published it, but then again, like quite a number of publishers, I might have passed in favour of a book I liked better.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI read this maybe 15 years back so I could share in what was exciting my three kids at the time. And I've read it twice to my daughter, Celyn. We read the first 5 some years back, and now she's 12 we're going to read the whole lot. She's very disabled and can't read for herself (she can't hold the book or see the page for starters...) \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHaving just finished I've checked the shelves to discover we have two copies of book 1 and two copies of book 3, but none of book 2. So JKR will be getting some more of my money shortly!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTo the review... I liked the book. I have no idea why it has sold a gazzilion copies more than any other children's book or why so many adults are so taken with it. JKR writes solid enough prose, though her addiction to adverbs in dialogue tags irks me no end, he said testily. She writes a fun and inventive story, though the internal inconsistencies would have distressed me even as a child. Why do the finest wizards in the land leave a great treasure guarded only by a series of puzzles rather than actual defences? If in the final scenes the puzzle poem hadn't been left to give the solution to the potion test ... or the key hadn't been left in the same room as the door that wouldn't yield to magic ... would that not have been a better way to defend the treasure? Yes ... it was more fun this way, but ... dammit ... kids aren't stupid...\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut yes, funny and inventive magic, school dynamics of making friends and enemies, the hijinx, the evil baddie, the chosen one... it's all good. Celyn certainly enjoyed it. She's on team Hermionie.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe only other thing that really bothered me was the repeated insinuation, present even in the term itself, that 'muggles' are somehow lesser. That the random gift of magical ability somehow makes you better.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI remember that later on (and hinted at in this book) the idea of mud-bloods (wizards born of muggles) is offered up as a proxy for racism and we're invited to condemn Draco Malfoy for his views (rightly so). But all the time I read this I'm feeling the hypocrisy embodied in the whole idea of muggles, which, albeit voiced without open malice, is really the same damn thing. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI will report back on book 2 when we're done.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"6711562669152037877\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review129564160\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link129564160\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=129564160\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_129564160'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_129564160\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/129564160?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e54 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_129564160\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_129564160\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=54\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=3\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=129564160\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_129564160\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 129564160, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003e11 \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1695888397\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9805750198147440820\"\u003eEs la primera vez que leo Harry Potter (lo sé, verdad? Pero oye nunca es demasiado tarde para leer un libro) y me ha encantado. Hacía la mitad del libro hubieron algunas partes que me aburrieron un poco pero lo demás me gustó y mucho. Tengo ganas de seguir leyendo las aventuras de Harry por que creo que acabaré muy enamorada de esta saga. \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1151669054\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer8617942665549933936\"\u003eI am not going to review Harry Potter, that is just an impossible task. However, after reading many people's personal stories linked to Harry Potter I got inspired to share mine as well! It'll be a long and boring reminiscing....\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy childhood was not exposed to \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling\" title=\"J.K. Rowling\"\u003e J.K.Rowling\u003c/a\u003e. In fact, Harry Potter remained untouched until I was 12 years old.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was an avid \u003cs\u003einhaler\u003c/s\u003e reader of spooky books. Many children at that age were probably attending Hogwarts already (Harry Potter was booming back then) but I was\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText8617942665549933936\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI am not going to review Harry Potter, that is just an impossible task. However, after reading many people's personal stories linked to Harry Potter I got inspired to share mine as well! It'll be a long and boring reminiscing....\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy childhood was not exposed to \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling\" title=\"J.K. Rowling\"\u003e J.K.Rowling\u003c/a\u003e. In fact, Harry Potter remained untouched until I was 12 years old.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was an avid \u003cs\u003einhaler\u003c/s\u003e reader of spooky books. Many children at that age were probably attending Hogwarts already (Harry Potter was booming back then) but I was stuck in another planet where your worst nightmares can come to life. Other times, I'll be battling off angry ghosts from lighthouses, zapping aliens with laser guns, dodging dungeon trolls, wrestling off demonic doppelgangers, getting haunted by talking dummies and going back and forth from one dimension to the next. Sometimes, I was scouring places for clues to solve puzzling mysteries.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI suppose you can say that \u003cb\u003emy childhood was still just as adventurous minus witches \u0026amp; wizards \u0026amp; magical schools.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFinally, I was burnt out from all my usual, preferable book series. I have completed all the \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/138020.The_Secret_Path__Spooksville___1_\" title=\"The Secret Path (Spooksville, #1) by Christopher Pike\"\u003e Spooksville\u003c/a\u003e adventures \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/19954.Christopher_Pike\" title=\"Christopher Pike\"\u003e Christopher Pike\u003c/a\u003e had offered, I've read \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/18901.The_Book_of_Nightmares\" title=\"The Book of Nightmares by Galway Kinnell\"\u003e The Book of Nightmares\u003c/a\u003e by \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/3347573.John_Peel\" title=\"John Peel\"\u003e John Peel\u003c/a\u003e countless times already that I made myself sick of it, I was dead tired of \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/13730.R_L__Stine\" title=\"R.L. Stine\"\u003e R.L.Stine\u003c/a\u003e's repetitions in his \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/14883617.Goosebumps\" title=\"Goosebumps by Scholastic Inc.\"\u003e Goosebumps\u003c/a\u003e books, and I didn't own enough copies of \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/search/search?q= The Secret Five\" title=\" The Secret Five\"\u003e The Secret Five\u003c/a\u003e series by \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/10657.Enid_Blyton\" title=\"Enid Blyton\"\u003e Enid Blyton\u003c/a\u003e. I had \u003cb\u003enothing\u003c/b\u003e else to read aside from childish picture books.  \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThen come one day when my sister came home with a bulging plastic bag from Times bookstore. When we spilled out the content together, there were 4 books and \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling\"\u003e Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets\u003c/a\u003e was among them.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYou see, when I was first introduced to Harry Potter, I did not start with The Sorcerer's Stone as I should have but instead, the starter book for me was\u003ci\u003e The Chamber of Secrets\u003c/i\u003e (My sister was a bit of a noob at book buying. She didn't realize she bought the second book instead of the first!). I remembered thinking how \u003cb\u003eVERY ODD and UNIQUE\u003c/b\u003e this world of witchcraft \u0026amp; wizardry was. And believe me, I've read some strange stuffs before Harry Potter came into the picture.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI knew I had missed out on a few details from the first book but I've watched the movies and they were enough to provide me the information I needed to know.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHere's where the plot twist come to play - right after I was done with \u003ci\u003eThe Chamber of Secrets\u003c/i\u003e, I extinguished Harry Potter out of my mind. My sister and I did not want to own the rest of the books either. Plus, I simply wasn't that interested to continue reading and thought it was quite pointless to read the books when the movies were at my reach. (You are more than welcomed to kick the old me in the shins. I can't believe I was so unimaginative!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt was 4 years later, at 16, when I re-returned to this series. I was quite late to jump into bandwagon, I know but damn it, the last movie ended quite a while ago and I've rewatched and rewinded them all so many times than I can count. \u003ci\u003eI fucking missed Harry Potter. \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWell, I was still side-eyeing the books mistrustfully but one day, when I was feeling rebellious, I bought the entire box set (my old copy of \u003ci\u003eThe Chamber of Secrets\u003c/i\u003e was long lost) and here I am, doing my 5th reread of the series.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eStories are even more magical to read than to watch onscreen.\u003c/b\u003e That much I realized. I feel like kicking myself even as I write this for thinking, once, that the Harry Potter movies are better than the books. I didn't truly or fully apprecite the written words before but \u003cb\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling\" title=\"J.K. Rowling\"\u003e J.K.Rowling\u003c/a\u003e had given me a WAKE UP! call and I have her to thank for that.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis being my fifth reread, I was worried the analytical reader in me will shred the book apart and nitpick every single details but to my surprise, I did not. I still love every single moment as much as I had the first time around. I still found The Dursleys reaction to magic hilariously comical, Hermione's and Ron's banters are adorable and rip-roaringly funny at times (oh, they were so meant to be) and I enjoyed J.K.Rowling's ability to weave up an entire new bizarre world with its own set systems and good lord, her food description is absolutely fantastic. My mouth waters even at the thought of Chocolate Frogs, Pumpkin Juice, Butterbeer and every single meals the house elves at Hogwarts have to offer. I'd even try a taste at Bertie Bott's Every Flavour beans.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIn a nutshell, this entire series is utterly magical (Need I say more?) and I won't ever forget this anytime soon.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"8617942665549933936\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n full page stunning illustration..\u003cbr\u003eEven those few pictures without graphic or illustrations have some ink or potion stains and marks ..as If it's a used school book, which is perfect.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs a collector, I guess I'd give it 4 stars \"for the edition not the story of course\" , I still miss the Pottermore.com illustrations which was amazing even id=\"freeTextContainer3466932309622233599\"\u003eHow could I not give this book 5 stars? I would live in fear of being strung up the nearest Muggle tree! Thankfully, it was a great book and well deserving of high praise.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNot to mention Harry Potter gives way to this famous Office scene:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMichael Scott: We are going to choose team names. Dwight!\u003cbr /\u003eDwight Schrute: We will be called Gryffindor!\u003cbr /\u003eJim Halpert: Really? Not Slytherin?\u003cbr /\u003eDwight Schrute: Slytherin are the bad guys, Jim.\u003cbr /\u003eJim Halpert: I know. Okay, we will be Voldemort.\u003cbr /\u003eDwight Schrute: [fearfully:] H\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3466932309622233599\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eHow could I not give this book 5 stars? I would live in fear of being strung up the nearest Muggle tree! Thankfully, it was a great book and well deserving of high praise.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNot to mention Harry Potter gives way to this famous Office scene:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMichael Scott: We are going to choose team names. Dwight!\u003cbr /\u003eDwight Schrute: We will be called Gryffindor!\u003cbr /\u003eJim Halpert: Really? Not Slytherin?\u003cbr /\u003eDwight Schrute: Slytherin are the bad guys, Jim.\u003cbr /\u003eJim Halpert: I know. Okay, we will be Voldemort.\u003cbr /\u003eDwight Schrute: [fearfully:] He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named? I wouldn't do that.\u003cbr /\u003eJim Halpert: [starts chant, everyone joins in:] Voldemort! Voldemort! Voldemort! Voldemort! Voldemort!\u003cbr /\u003eDwight Schrute: [looks around, scared:] Okay, seriously, you really shouldn't be saying that.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNow that's funny. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=will-be-a-classic-in-100-years\"\u003ewill-be-a-classic-in-100-years\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=those-books-anyone-should-read-once\"\u003ethose-books-anyone-should-read-once\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=the-1st-book-in-a-series\"\u003ethe-1st-book-in-a-series\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=school-setting\"\u003eschool-setting\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1316706192\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5906462430203989606\"\u003eIt’s time for a little confession: I have survived \u003ci\u003eeighteen\u003c/i\u003e years without \u003ci\u003eever\u003c/i\u003e having read any Harry Potter book or having watched any Harry Potter movie. I remember seeing glimpses of the third or fourth movie in my childhood on a friend’s birthday, but that’s about everything which connected me with the world of Harry Potter. More recently, a friend of mine forced me to finally watch the movies, not understanding how I could still have had a relatively enjoyable childhood without the presence\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5906462430203989606\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt’s time for a little confession: I have survived \u003ci\u003eeighteen\u003c/i\u003e years without \u003ci\u003eever\u003c/i\u003e having read any Harry Potter book or having watched any Harry Potter movie. I remember seeing glimpses of the third or fourth movie in my childhood on a friend’s birthday, but that’s about everything which connected me with the world of Harry Potter. More recently, a friend of mine forced me to finally watch the movies, not understanding how I could still have had a relatively enjoyable childhood without the presence of Harry Potter in it. So here I am, having read the first book approximately ten years too late, and regretting to never have read it before.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe novel actually has a lot of flaws which I could start to criticize right now. But apart from the assumption that it would gain me some enemies, what would be the point of it? This book is \u003cb\u003emagical\u003c/b\u003e exactly the way it has been written. Even its flaws made me laugh or at least chuckle, and during every other page of the book, I wanted to be a part of Hogwarts. I always thought of the HP series as being set in a world designed for children, but now I understand how wrong my thinking was. Furthermore, I can’t stop comparing it to the Chronicles of Narnia, which are set in another magical world – yet the writing seems so much more childish. Rowling’s style addresses children, teens and adults alike, and that’s what I admire most about her writing.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI’m only 57 days older than the first book of the Harry Potter series as of its publication date, yet it has needed 6746 days before I finally entered the world of Hogwarts along with Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Hermione Granger, Neville Longbottom and all the other well-known characters connected with the series, and two more days before I finished the first year in Hogwarts. The only possible way for me to make good for avoiding Rowling’s book for such a long time is to read all the six following novels. Soon.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd to await the arrival of my own Hogwarts letter.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"5906462430203989606\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_1274690312\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1274690312\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button href=\"/user/show/349639-argona\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Argona\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476301474p2/349639.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/696504509?book_show_action=false\"\u003eFeb 01, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Argona\" class=\"user\" name=\"Argona\" href=\"/user/show/349639-argona\"\u003eArgona\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=childhood-memories\"\u003echildhood-memories\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=urban-fantasy\"\u003eurban-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=dragons\"\u003edragons\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=epic-fantasy\"\u003eepic-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=magic\"\u003emagic\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=humor\"\u003ehumor\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=mystery\"\u003emystery\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=reviewed\"\u003ereviewed\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=all-time-favorites\"\u003eall-time-favorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=favorite-romance\"\u003efavorite-romance\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=high-fantasy\"\u003ehigh-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=favorite-fantasy-series\"\u003efavorite-fantasy-series\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=david-the-amazing\"\u003edavid-the-amazing\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer696504509\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10992803881221043107\"\u003eFirst read 1997\u003cbr /\u003eMany many rereads\u003cbr /\u003eMost recent reread 2014\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDear Harry\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI have been meaning to write this for a long time now. This isn’t a review on your journey, this is simply my feelings and words I wish I could tell you. I still remember the first time I bought your first book. (I had to buy it again from another publication that actually continued with your books!) I had been without any interesting books to read for months and your book caught my attention since I had read about your popularity\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText10992803881221043107\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eFirst read 1997\u003cbr /\u003eMany many rereads\u003cbr /\u003eMost recent reread 2014\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDear Harry\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI have been meaning to write this for a long time now. This isn’t a review on your journey, this is simply my feelings and words I wish I could tell you. I still remember the first time I bought your first book. (I had to buy it again from another publication that actually continued with your books!) I had been without any interesting books to read for months and your book caught my attention since I had read about your popularity in Britain so I got all excited and bought the book immediately. People barely knew you where I lived and I can claim I was among the first who gave you a chance. At the time, your books weren’t found easily anyway and weren’t published all over the country. I read your book and I really liked it but I wasn’t really in love. I did look forward to your second book and I was disappointed to find out that there were no copies available where I lived and your third book wasn’t even out yet. I waited and waited and slowly word spread about you and the second copy appeared. I read it and...something changed. I was falling in love.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere was a girl in my class that I barely knew. I recommended you to her, she read it and something changed between us too. More than 10 years later, she is still one of my closest friends. Just like that, you helped to connect us.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI am not a genius but I found school days very boring. I was fine getting good grades without paying any real attention at the classroom and certain days were almost unbearable but then...you became a part of my life and I finally had you and your world to think about. I could think and fantasize about you, your journey, your future and I finally had a book to look forward to year after year. Time passed and my teenage years were spent with you. When I think back, you gave me some of my best memories from that time. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThen came a time that almost anyone that read books, knew about you. I stumbled upon a new site that had been created by kids in my country and I started to talk with one of the admins. She was both a Harry Potter fan and a Lord of the Rings fan and we clicked immediately! I will never forget how she kept calling me by mobile phone when my family moved into a new house and I didn't have access to phones or Internet. She would talk to me for hours and helped me to keep my sanity! She moved to Japan a few years ago and I have very little contact with her now, but I will always remember her and what she did for me.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYears later, as a university student, I met a pair of twin sisters. They were very very shy at the time, or should I say at first contact, and I didn’t know how to connect with them or whether I even wanted to. Then we realized we all love you, we started talking about you and then found other things we all liked... and today, they are my best friends, they always try to be there for me and I always try to be there for them. We have our differences but we also have our similarities and our love for you is one of them.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry, thank you for letting me into your world. Thank you for becoming a part of my world. Thank you for being there when I needed you. Thank you for giving me these fun and treasured memories. Thank you for helping me find people like me. Thank you for everything! I will always cherish you.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYou live forever in my mind and my heart.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYours sincerely\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr         \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1727905686\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer1120963373801124694\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e*2nd Reread: coming soon and this is the best time to re-read the whole series).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHogwarts: a love story!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212065._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd I wanted to meet my beloved characters, whom I've grown with for so long.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212066._SX540_.png\" Harry was always brave, honest and so kind (and he was the youngest Quidditch pla\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText1120963373801124694\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e*2nd Reread: August 24th 2016.\u003cbr\u003e*1st Reread: September 2013.\u003cbr\u003e*Read: Someday 2006.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI was so excited to enter Hogwarts this year again (Fall is coming soon and this is the best time to re-read the whole series).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHogwarts: a love story!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472583500i/20211527._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212064._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212065._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd I wanted to meet my beloved characters, whom I've grown with for so long.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212066._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry\u003c/b\u003e, the famous child, who didn't know anything about his family history or Hogwarts until he was 11 years old! Harry was always brave, honest and so kind (and he was the youngest Quidditch player for a century!).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eRon\u003c/b\u003e, the red-haired boy, the funniest best friend you can have ever! (and he was so good at playing Wizard's Chess!).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHermoine\u003c/b\u003e, the book nerd, the smartest girl you can imagine.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212067.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd \u003cb\u003eDraco Malfoy\u003c/b\u003e, I've always loved him (he was always misunderstood).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212068._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHagrid\u003c/b\u003e, he was always the kindest.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212069._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eProf. Dumbledore\u003c/b\u003e, the best wizard the history has known ever. He was wise but also so brave.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212070._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eProf. Snape\u003c/b\u003e, you won't know him well unless you complete the series!\u003cbr\u003e(He is my favorite character, \u003ci\u003ealways\u003c/i\u003e my fav!).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212071._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd we got to see \u003cb\u003eProf. Quirrell\u003c/b\u003e, the stuttering, most innocent professor you can meet in your life! \u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[Don't trust anyone looks so innocent, NEVER. \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eYou can't imagine the \u003cb\u003eplot twist\u003c/b\u003e in this book, it is so well-done. The first time I saw the movie, I was shocked! (Yeah, I watched the movies before reading the books, and the books are so much better than the movies, but it helped me a lot in imagining this magic world).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212073._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eLets leave the characters now, \u003cb\u003ewhat is this book particularly about?\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212072.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eThe Philosopher's/sorcerer's stone\u003c/b\u003e.\u003cbr\u003eWhat is this?\u003cbr\u003eWho owned this stone?\u003cbr\u003eWho protects it?\u003cbr\u003eWho want to steal it? and why?\u003cbr\u003eWhat will happen to the trio?\u003cbr\u003eWho is \"You-Know-Who\"?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI won't tell, for sure. GO. READ. THE. BOOK.! \u003cbr\u003eEven if you watched the movies, I am sure you still can enjoy the books so much. And you will know these characters better and better.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAnd finally, I NEED THIS TICKET IN MY LIFE!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212074._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eP.S.\u003c/b\u003e I have never written any reviews for HP books, because, you know, I always thought that was impossible for me. But, at least I tried this time!   \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1413790320?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 13, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Mangrii\" amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9788498387070\" href=\"/book/show/26228167-harry-potter-y-la-piedra-filosofal\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1413790320\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10022602092714008542\"\u003eDesde que me llego el viernes era inevitable que en cuanto que tuviera un mínimo de tiempo una relectura iba a caer, y ha sido más pronto que tarde, acompañándome en este domingo. La historia como en cada ocasión que la he leído, me atrapa, me hace soñar y revivir aquellos de los momentos más felices de toda mi infancia. La edición es simplemente un verdadero lujo para cualquier fan de la saga. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eUn volumen rocoso (que pesa lo suyo), con unas buenas tapas duras y de gran tamaño. Las ilustraciones\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText10022602092714008542\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eDesde que me llego el viernes era inevitable que en cuanto que tuviera un mínimo de tiempo una relectura iba a caer, y ha sido más pronto que tarde, acompañándome en este domingo. La historia como en cada ocasión que la he leído, me atrapa, me hace soñar y revivir aquellos de los momentos más felices de toda mi infancia. La edición es simplemente un verdadero lujo para cualquier fan de la saga. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eUn volumen rocoso (que pesa lo suyo), con unas buenas tapas duras y de gran tamaño. Las ilustraciones son una gozada, Jim Kay ha hecho un buen trabajo durante todo el volumen, y hay alguna como la de Malfoy a pagina completa que me maravilla y quiero enmarcar. Al principio no me encandilaba el texto a doble columna, pero he terminado acostumbrándome. Un lujo volver así a la infancia, la pena es que solo saldrá un volumen al año, pero las ganas de tener todos son enormes.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"10022602092714008542\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n around, yet here I am. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://i.imgur.com/Ugg7eZy\" title=\"\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e \u003cimg filling\u003cbr\u003eWith some interesting stuff,\u003cbr\u003eFor now they’re bare and full of air,\u003cbr\u003eDead flies and bits of fluff,\u003cbr\u003eSo teach us things worth style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e ETA 10/2016\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\"It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.”\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e~~ A.D. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eETA 11/2014\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI could never imagine loving a book as much the second time around, yet here I am. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://i.imgur.com/Ugg7eZy\" title=\"\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929056.gif\" alt=\"\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cp\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e“Hogwarts, Hogwarts, Hoggy Warty Hogwarts,\u003cbr\u003eTeach us something please,\u003cbr\u003eWhether we be old and bald\u003cbr\u003eOr young with scabby knees,\u003cbr\u003eOur heads could do with filling\u003cbr\u003eWith some interesting stuff,\u003cbr\u003eFor now they’re bare and full of air,\u003cbr\u003eDead flies and bits of fluff,\u003cbr\u003eSo teach us things worth knowing,\u003cbr\u003eBring back what we’ve forgot,\u003cbr\u003ejust do your best, we’ll do the rest,\u003cbr\u003eAnd learn until our brains all rot.”\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eOriginal Review\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWhen I review a book, basically I'm breaking it up into little pieces, placing the parts into neat little boxes, and ending my journey with that particular world. It's bittersweet at times because I want to share my journey with everyone, but in doing so, I get sucked back into the real world I was in before I read the book.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIn this case, I refuse to do that. I am keeping all the feelings this book gave me, all the \u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003emagic\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e, to myself. If you want some of your own, you'll have to go out and get it yourself. I'm not ready to let mine go. Not just yet.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eSo if you know how to get there,\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://i.imgur.com/52tMPY4\" title=\"\" \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer631404671\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17368943744395186136\"\u003e¡La de veces que yo he releído Harry Potter y me sigue gustando tanto como la primera vez! Ahora, el haber releído el libro en inglés, cosa que nunca había hecho, y en su versión ilustrada me tiene alucinando, de verdad. Cosas tan pequeñas como los acentos de los personajes y algunas palabras escritas en su versión británica y no americana me enamoraron \u0026lt;3. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSigo pensando que nunca es tarde para leer Harry Potter, o incluso para releerlo. Esta historia me trajo muchísimos recuerdos de la época\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17368943744395186136\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e¡La de veces que yo he releído Harry Potter y me sigue gustando tanto como la primera vez! Ahora, el haber releído el libro en inglés, cosa que nunca había hecho, y en su versión ilustrada me tiene alucinando, de verdad. Cosas tan pequeñas como los acentos de los personajes y algunas palabras escritas en su versión británica y no americana me enamoraron \u0026lt;3. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSigo pensando que nunca es tarde para leer Harry Potter, o incluso para releerlo. Esta historia me trajo muchísimos recuerdos de la época en la que me sabía el nombre de cada capítulo, de cada personaje y de cada punto y cada coma que aparecía en sus páginas... Recordé cómo esperábamos súper impacientes cada nuevo libro, cada película, porque queríamos saber más de las aventuras de Harry, queríamos volver a ese mundo mágico lejos de los Muggles, queríamos volver a Hogwarts. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReleyendo este libro entiendo por qué Harry logró crearse un espacio en mi corazón y por qué nunca se va a ir de allí tenga la edad que tenga.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003e Hogwarts will always be there to welcome you home \u003c/i\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"17368943744395186136\" href=\"#\" class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1491361474\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6734005276447247705\"\u003eAbsolutely fabulous!! I'm happy that I got to read an illustrated, non-altered version of Harry Potter year 1. It sucks they are only putting out one illustrated version per year. So it will be this fall until we see the Chamber of Secrets. :(\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eUPDATED: I've already read this, but just finished it a 2nd time reading it to my children; doing all the voices and everything! (Note: I finished the ILLUSTRATED VERSION for the 2nd time. I've read book 1 \u0026amp; the rest of the series too many times). THEY\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6734005276447247705\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eAbsolutely fabulous!! I'm happy that I got to read an illustrated, non-altered version of Harry Potter year 1. It sucks they are only putting out one illustrated version per year. So it will be this fall until we see the Chamber of Secrets. :(\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eUPDATED: I've already read this, but just finished it a 2nd time reading it to my children; doing all the voices and everything! (Note: I finished the ILLUSTRATED VERSION for the 2nd time. I've read book 1 \u0026amp; the rest of the series too many times). THEY LOVED IT! And now they are fixing to watch the first movie. I also found the illustrated version of book 2 \"The Chamber of Secrets\" (that was just released on 10/4/16). So after they finish the first movie, we will be starting book 2 together! My kids are officially little wizards now and in love with the magical world of Harry Potter! I'm bouncing off the walls with happiness and can't wait to start book 2 with them!\u003cbr /\u003e5 Stars....always!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"6734005276447247705\" href=\"#\"      Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=owned\"\u003eowned\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=multi-dimensional\"\u003emulti-dimensional\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed\"\u003ereviewed\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2010\"\u003e2010\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=highly-recommended\"\u003ehighly-recommended\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer93980748\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4411359534207677180\"\u003eI wasn't sure if I was going to write a review of these books, but I try to write a review of all of the books that I read, and it's been kind of nagging at me that I didn't write one for this. It's hard to write a review for a book that is so dang popular and well known. What is there to say that's new? I dunno. I think pretty much everything's been said, but still I wanted to write a review for this, and to talk about these books, even if I'm just rehashing everything that's already been done.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4411359534207677180\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI wasn't sure if I was going to write a review of these books, but I try to write a review of all of the books that I read, and it's been kind of nagging at me that I didn't write one for this. It's hard to write a review for a book that is so dang popular and well known. What is there to say that's new? I dunno. I think pretty much everything's been said, but still I wanted to write a review for this, and to talk about these books, even if I'm just rehashing everything that's already been done. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI remember when these first came out, I never really wanted to read them. I thought of them as \"kid's books\" and even though I read YA, my overly-critical half just kept saying that these weren't for me. I don't know if it was the cover, or the insta-popularity of the books or what, but I didn't read them. I avoided them like the plague. Until a friend of mine was reading the 5th book, and was so engrossed in it that he would do the \"...yes, yes, I'm paying attention...\" nod while his eyes remained glued to the page. And as a reader myself, I know that look. So I asked to borrow the book he was reading, and he refused. He told me that if I was going to read it, I'd have to READ it, starting with the first book. So the next day, he lent me the first and second books, both of which I finished in record time, and then I understood. And I never looked back. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere's something about these books that is just... magical. Yeah, yeah, cliche, I know. But it's true. Yes, they are about magic, but they are about so much more than that. They are about love, and friendship and loyalty and trust and betrayal and commitment and all the things that we aspire to have and to be as humans. They are about understanding and forgiveness and learning who we are when it really matters. And all of these things are buried in this shell of fun and adventure and mystery that makes them irresistible. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI decided to read these again in the original UK editions, because I know that the US editions were \"Americanized\", and I wanted to re-experience them in their true form. I dislike when things are changed from their original format, I hate abridgments and condensed versions etc. I want to experience the story how the author wrote it, how it was meant to be experienced without some guy in a suit somewhere trying to make it \"accessible\" to me. I like the feeling that I get of learning something of another culture through the words they use, and the meaning that they give the words. This is why they taught us reading comprehension in third grade, so that we can read and LEARN. Learning doesn't have to be boring and tedious, it can be fun if we allow it to be. But it seems that we've lost that ability. Sad. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnyway, I re-read the first book, now appropriately titled \"Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone\", and I was surprised at how emotional I felt reading it, especially after knowing where it all ends. It was like seeing friends that you've missed for years again, and while it makes you happy to see them, it's also sad because you know they'll have to go again too soon. That's how I felt, like I was seeing friends and that my time with them is short. That's kind of a silly way to feel, because they are forever, and I can visit anytime I want to, but I felt that way anyway. Especially meeting Ron again. He's my favorite character for an absolute reason, which is because he is so loyal and funny and true, and he gives his whole heart when he gives it at all. I wish that there were more people like Ron. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI can't wait to re-read the rest of the series and see if this feeling remains. I love discovering the hidden gems that Rowling has left for us to find, in mythology and history and legend and word-play and in life. Who wouldn't love these books? \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"4411359534207677180\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review93980748\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv \u003ca title=\"Jonathan Ashleigh\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jonathan Ashleigh\" href=\"/user/show/33737465-jonathan-ashleigh\"\u003eJonathan Ashleigh\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was ok\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1074664321\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6169529823574205229\"\u003eThis book was given to me by an english chick in a hostel in Central America. It was supposed to make me want to read the rest of the catalogue; it did not. The worst part of this book is how stupid that stupid wizard game is. How do they not realize they should just save their energy until the end when the one ball that wins the game comes into play? It is infuriating to me that people play this game on quads across the country, a game that is intended to be played while flying on broomsticks.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6169529823574205229\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThis book was given to me by an english chick in a hostel in Central America. It was supposed to make me want to read the rest of the catalogue; it did not. The worst part of this book is how stupid that stupid wizard game is. How do they not realize they should just save their energy until the end when the one ball that wins the game comes into play? It is infuriating to me that people play this game on quads across the country, a game that is intended to be played while flying on broomsticks. Why do some children's books make some people think they are big readers because they are able to focus on children's literature. For my time, I will pick up \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/4273.Roald_Dahl\" title=\"Roald Dahl\"\u003eRoald Dahl\u003c/a\u003e any day of the week over this series.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"6169529823574205229\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/973715653?book_show_action=false\"\u003eApr p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar        Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5301777-elesia?shelf=love-love-loved\"\u003elove-love-loved\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca
