\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_594958962\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/594958962\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Vane J.\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/19590155-vane-j\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Vane J.\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468102148p2/19590155.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/594958962?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 22, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Vane J.\" class=\"user\" name=\"Vane J.\" href=\"/user/show/19590155-vane-j\"\u003eVane J.\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=amazing-characters\"\u003eamazing-characters\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=2011\"\u003e2011\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=speshul-snowflake\"\u003espeshul-snowflake\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer594958962\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4117128937159025094\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eEdit (December 5, 2015):\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFirst re-read I've ever done in my life. I must say, this book isn't quite the best thing in the world. It has many tropes I \u003ci\u003ereally\u003c/i\u003e hate (speshul snowflake, villain that only wants to take over the world for no reason, etc), but there's something \u003ci\u003emagical\u003c/i\u003e about it and all those aspects for some reason make me smile.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIt's amusing how innocent everything was when it all started. It could fool you into thinking this is just some kid's adventure when really is a journey that wi\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4117128937159025094\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eEdit (December 5, 2015):\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFirst re-read I've ever done in my life. I must say, this book isn't quite the best thing in the world. It has many tropes I \u003ci\u003ereally\u003c/i\u003e hate (speshul snowflake, villain that only wants to take over the world for no reason, etc), but there's something \u003ci\u003emagical\u003c/i\u003e about it and all those aspects for some reason make me smile.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIt's amusing how innocent everything was when it all started. It could fool you into thinking this is just some kid's adventure when really is a journey that will eat our hearts. \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e is not my favourite series ever, or the one that has affected me the most (that place is saved for \u003ci\u003eThe Monstrumologist\u003c/i\u003e by Rick Yancey), but certainly it's one of the best and it kind of made my childhood (I grew up with the movies, actually, not with the books, but I was, in any case, attached to the story since a kid). J.K., I'm sorry for saying you're not a goddess in my \u003ci\u003eThe Cuckoo's Calling\u003c/i\u003e review.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e______________________\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eThere's no way to properly review this thing, so I'm just gonna tell you how I met the Harry Potter series...\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380222758ra/675051.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThere was a little girl named Vanessa who always wanted to do the contrary to what people wanted her to do. If she had a chore to do, she would do it as long as they let her alone. If mom or dad or one of her brothers or her sister or anyone in her family told her to do it, she would immediately refuse, because she takes no orders. She's her own boss.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs she was like that, then if something was popular, she would not do/read/watch/whatever it. Well, there was this particular \u003cb\u003elittle\u003c/b\u003e series that everyone had read. It had movies and everyone loved them.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDo you know what she did? She promised herself she would \u003ci\u003enever\u003c/i\u003e read them. She had already watched the movies (the ones that were out) and she rather liked them, but she would \u003ci\u003enot\u003c/i\u003e touch the books, because doing so would mean she was just like everyone else, and she was special (yeah, I was that arrogant).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eSome years later.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOctober 15th, 2011.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIt was a gray day and it was her brother's birthday. Mother wanted to gift his son something that he would enjoy, but not videogames or stuff like that. She wanted something with more educational value - say, a book.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMother knew Vanessa's brother liked the HP movies (up until the sixth one), and as there was a book fair at his school (which was mine too), and the books upon which the movies were based were there. She bought the first and gave it to his son for his birthday.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSome of her mother's friend had also given Vanessa's brother several of the other boks in the series. It seemed as if they had planned the whole thing.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOf course Vanessa thought there was a hidden purpose there. She thought her mother had bought the books so she wouldn't resist on picking them (I told you I was arrogant, didn't I?).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eShe was wrong. That was not her mother's purpose, but in the end, Vanessa couldn't resist the pull. She wanted and didn't want to read the books.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWanted them for some reasons:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e· She had always been intrigued by them.\u003cbr\u003e· She was the reader in the house. She couldn't stand the fact that her brother (who hated - and still hates - reading) was going to read more books than her (don't even tell me).\u003cbr\u003e· A \"friend\" of hers was bragging she had read the HP books in less than one week and she wanted to prove her she could do the same.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDidn't want them for some reasons:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e· Reading them would mean she was a common girl (I was an insufferable 13-year-old girl - don't blame me).\u003cbr\u003e· She would break her promise if she read them.\u003cbr\u003e· If she read them, she would do what everyone else wanted her to do, and as you know, she hates being told what to do.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAfter a long time of deep philosophizing (aka one day), she decided she would read them. What could be the worst thing to happen?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIt turns out she loved the first book. Her reaction upon starting it was something like this:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1384792919ra/6963846.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAfter that, she wanted the next ones. She borrowed the books from his brother and read them all up to the 5th one (those were the ones we had) in one week. She felt sorry for not doing it any sooner.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eYeah, I was and still am like that. I'm really glad I decided to read the books. They all have amazing plots, fantastic character development, writing that improves over the books, great story and world building, etc. What else can I need?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1430411241i/14710917.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"4117128937159025094\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/771541660\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Kathe L\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/25921490-kathe-l\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Kathe L\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1421550107p2/25921490.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/771541660?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 12, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Kathe L\" class=\"user\" name=\"Kathe L\" href=\"/user/show/25921490-kathe-l\"\u003eKathe L\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25921490-kathe-l?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25921490-kathe-l?shelf=read-more-than-once\"\u003eread-more-than-once\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25921490-kathe-l?shelf=5-stars\"\u003e5-stars\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25921490-kathe-l?shelf=read-2015\"\u003eread-2015\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer771541660\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer1564133102567308804\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"There are all kinds of courage,\" said Dumbledore, smiling.\"It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.\"\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576920.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI love this book, with all my heart. That's why this review is so hard to write. Who has never heard about \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter,\u003c/i\u003e the guy who lived? I always say that the \u003ci\u003eThe book thief\u003c/i\u003e was the first book I have ever read, but then, there's this one. That I read sooo long ago, that I didn't remember a single thing about it. I know \u003cs\u003eall\u003c/s\u003e almost\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText1564133102567308804\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"There are all kinds of courage,\" said Dumbledore, smiling.\"It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.\"\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576920.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI love this book, with all my heart. That's why this review is so hard to write. Who has never heard about \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter,\u003c/i\u003e the guy who lived? I always say that the \u003ci\u003eThe book thief\u003c/i\u003e was the first book I have ever read, but then, there's this one. That I read sooo long ago, that I didn't remember a single thing about it. I know \u003cs\u003eall\u003c/s\u003e almost all lines by head because I've watched the movie thousands of times, but there's \u003cb\u003enothing\u003c/b\u003e like reading the book. It's like myself talking to my brother after I finished it:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe:\u003c/b\u003e Gu, (his name is Gustavo - when we went to the USA, nobody understood his name. Is that an unusual name?) did you know that after Ron plays chess, there was another test? A potion one? \u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy brother:\u003c/b\u003e REALLY? Why wouldn't they show that at the movie? I bet it was amazing, potions and all. Hermione solve it, right? Imagine if I guessed it correctly like her? \u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe:\u003c/b\u003e Don't know, Gus. Would you read the book, then? There are thousands of things you will only know about HP if you read it\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy brother:\u003c/b\u003e Nah, I hate reading. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy point is:\u003c/b\u003e like myself before I reread this, my brother and other people who never read this book and only watched the movie will never know the things that also happened. LIKE HOW MANY TIMES NEVILLE IS PRESENT ON THE SCENES! How Hermione is way geekier, Ginny is SO young, the way Hagrid speaks. And still, there are things that never seizes to amaze me about these books: \u003cb\u003efriendship, loyalty, love, magic.\u003c/b\u003e They are present in every page of this, every scene, every line. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe way Hermione becomes their friend was always one of the things I liked the most. She's so different from Harry and Ron, and still, she fits. She learns, she takes risks, she goes with Ron and Harry in their adventures because she is brave, in her own way. She has a heart of gold, like my mom used to say, just like Harry. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.\"\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434134341ra/15178418.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI have to talk about Harry, as well. He is just... oh my. He is this eleven year old kid who lived with his mean aunt and uncle for his entire existence to discover that he is , actually, a \u003cb\u003ewizard.\u003c/b\u003e So he goes to this school, finds out is famous and that his parents were killed for one of the best bad wizards out there. He doesn't know how to do magic, it's his first time making friends, in an entire new school in a total different environment, and still, he does good. Because he's kind, courageous, strong-minded, smart. He's an excellent friend, an excellent student. (unless when he's not sneaking around lol but still, he does it for the greater good). Harry Potter is not only one of these books you love, it speaks to you. It makes you care about people who are not real, and still, you love them. You have all the dvds, all the books. You watched every movie in the movie theater as soon as they were released. It was a tradition, something you waited the whole year for. \u003cb\u003eAnd no, you didn't cry like a baby in the last one.\u003c/b\u003e Not in Leville's speech, because how has he grown!. Not in Snape's scene, not when Harry \"dies.\" And you definitely didn't cry when the movie ended. It's just... it's a love for a series that will never die, you know? \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434134402ra/15178425.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI loved every aspect of this. I loved how the movie was as faithful as possible, loved the authors playing these characters so well, loved how different and important each one of them is. Snape, Dumbledore, Hermione, Ron, Neville Longbottom, George and Fred, Harry, of course. I just can't wait to read the next one and be mesmerized all over again.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"After all, to the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.\"\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"1564133102567308804\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));;              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer515990587\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5899302369964533300\"\u003eIt's impossible not to date myself through this review, but I first read Harry Potter when I was young enough to wish for a Hogwarts letter of my own. I'm now rereading the exact same hardcovers that I bought as they were released, mostly because my mother is a saint and mailed them all to me in San Francisco:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1465015742i/19303416.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm rereading this book while drinking a glass of wine (HA!!), and on this pass I really think it's the optimal children's book. It opens an entire world while still following a compact, in\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5899302369964533300\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt's impossible not to date myself through this review, but I first read Harry Potter when I was young enough to wish for a Hogwarts letter of my own. I'm now rereading the exact same hardcovers that I bought as they were released, mostly because my mother is a saint and mailed them all to me in San Francisco:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1465015742i/19303416.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm rereading this book while drinking a glass of wine (HA!!), and on this pass I really think it's the optimal children's book. It opens an entire world while still following a compact, interesting plot, and it makes me laugh on every single page. It's amazing that the Dumbledore who says, at the first feast, \"Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!\" can be the same person as the Dumbledore of the rest of the series, but somehow that is believable and wonderful. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e5/5 this book made me cry happy tears but maybe it was the alcohol\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"5899302369964533300\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer73108717\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15356904741898629585\"\u003eRather than write a review of this book, I will instead share memories I have about the series.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Making fun of my high school girlfriend for reading the books, borrowing this one from her, sitting in a chair in my parents' office and reading the first few pages, and apologizing for ever making fun of her. I was hooked.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Working at a bookstore when Order of the Phoenix was released and dressing up like Harry Potter. I danced around in the middle of the mall with a copy of the book to remind everyon\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15356904741898629585\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eRather than write a review of this book, I will instead share memories I have about the series.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Making fun of my high school girlfriend for reading the books, borrowing this one from her, sitting in a chair in my parents' office and reading the first few pages, and apologizing for ever making fun of her. I was hooked.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Working at a bookstore when Order of the Phoenix was released and dressing up like Harry Potter. I danced around in the middle of the mall with a copy of the book to remind everyone that it was finally out, and also to embarrass myself.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Visiting Universal Studios as an adult and riding all the Harry Potter rides, drinking butterbeer, and taking a picture outside the Hogwarts Express\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Receiving a Gryffindor scarf as a Christmas gift from my grandparents-in-law\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eObviously, this book and series are amazing and giving it anything less than five stars is ridiculous. \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12338570422743232187\"\u003eI have been richly rewarded for waiting all these years to read this - what an indulgence to be able to read the new illustrated version for my first Potter book. If you are a fan and haven't perused the Jim Kay illustrated volume yet, you really must. It's a masterpiece. I hope they do all the volumes, but I'm not waiting any longer to read the rest of them! href=\"/review/list/5242679-brooke?shelf=2016-reads\"\u003e2016-reads\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer428416920\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13079767656184460896\"\u003eObviously a re-read for me.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLoved reading this book for the second time and having the illustrated version be the edition to experience it all again. Rowling is such a master storyteller. Not many writers have achieved creating such beloved characters. The illustrations were beautiful and that close to ending scene with Dumbledore is perfection. So much love and detail was put into these unique characters. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHagrid, I will always love you. \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n href=\"/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=2016machalo\"\u003e2016machalo\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1160974248\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12217224735672003065\"\u003eAs always, this story feels like coming home.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA noteworthy development: This is the first time I've cried reading book one. I'm always prepared to cry while reading five and seven, but this was unexpected to say the least, especially given the countless number of times I've read this book. The Mirror of Erised scene just really hit me this time around. And I really appreciate Chris Columbus and Steve Kloves for making such a faithful film adaptation. This book remains pure magic.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380352348ra/705811.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eupdate: HAHA I ju\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText12217224735672003065\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eAs always, this story feels like coming home.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA noteworthy development: This is the first time I've cried reading book one. I'm always prepared to cry while reading five and seven, but this was unexpected to say the least, especially given the countless number of times I've read this book. The Mirror of Erised scene just really hit me this time around. And I really appreciate Chris Columbus and Steve Kloves for making such a faithful film adaptation. This book remains pure magic.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380352348ra/705811.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eupdate: HAHA I just finished this only to have Doc pick it up. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e1/6/16\u003cbr\u003eHe's only 8 pages in but he already hates the Dursleys more than he already did from watching the films (and lemme tell you, he despised them to begin with). He especially detests Uncle Vernon. He also says he never got the vibe from the films of how utterly paranoid they are regarding magic and the Potters.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e1/13/16\u003cbr\u003eHe still loves the zoo boa constrictor's \"Thankssss, amigo.\"\u003cbr\u003eAlso, \"YER A WIZARD, HARRY.\"\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e1/21/16\u003cbr\u003eHe really gets a kick out of the way Hagrid speaks, he says it sounds like he's from Appalachia -- coming off reading Spencer's Mountain, it seems to be a good grounding point. And he picked up on Fantastic Beasts in the list of course books, and liked that I have the little copy of that one downstairs too :) Oh and he says he must not have paid much attention to the movie before, because the twin cores thing between Harry's and Voldy's wands really got his attention. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAlso, George's line: \"We'll send you a Hogwarts toilet seat!\" to which I had to respond \"\u003ci\u003eGeorge!\u003c/i\u003e -- Only joking, Mum.\" And then he just stared at me with the face of Who-even-are-you.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI am LOVING this.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e3/1/16\u003cbr\u003eHe finished it a few days ago (maybe it's been a week now?) and is on to book two. This edition has a sneak peek of the next book in the back, and he started reading that the other night before stopping and saying \"Hang on, the second book's downstairs. Why am I reading this when I can just go get the book??\" ROFL.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"12217224735672003065\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_533291954\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/533291954\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Nikoleta\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/13362307-nikoleta\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Nikoleta\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466461770p2/13362307.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/533291954?book_show_action=false\"\u003eFeb 12, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Nikoleta\" class=\"user\" name=\"Nikoleta\" href=\"/user/show/13362307-nikoleta\"\u003eNikoleta\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9789602743485\" href=\"/book/show/4593339\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13362307-nikoleta?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer533291954\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5289337959859267787\"\u003eΤον Χαρι τον διάβασα στα 15, τον διάβασα στα 20 κ τον ξαναδιαβάζω κ τώρα, όλη την εφταλογια! Αυτά τα βιβλία έχουν την ικανότητα να σε συνδέσουν με την ιστορία τους, σε κάθε ηλικία, σε όποιο μέρος του κόσμου κ να ζεις. Ποιος -ανεξάρτητα από το ποιος είναι- δεν ονειρεύτηκε έστω κ στιγμιαία, διαβάζοντας αυτή την σειρά, ότι είναι μαθητής στο Χογκουαρτς; Ποιος δεν σκέφτηκε \u0026quot;φτου είμαι Μαγκλ\u0026quot;; Τα βιβλία ωριμάζουν μαζί με τον Χαρι κ τους φίλους του, αν το πρώτο σας φανεί παιδικό μην απορήσετε γιατί ο\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5289337959859267787\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eΤον Χαρι τον διάβασα στα 15, τον διάβασα στα 20 κ τον ξαναδιαβάζω κ τώρα, όλη την εφταλογια! Αυτά τα βιβλία έχουν την ικανότητα να σε συνδέσουν με την ιστορία τους, σε κάθε ηλικία, σε όποιο μέρος του κόσμου κ να ζεις. Ποιος -ανεξάρτητα από το ποιος είναι- δεν ονειρεύτηκε έστω κ στιγμιαία, διαβάζοντας αυτή την σειρά, ότι είναι μαθητής στο Χογκουαρτς; Ποιος δεν σκέφτηκε \"φτου είμαι Μαγκλ\"; Τα βιβλία ωριμάζουν μαζί με τον Χαρι κ τους φίλους του, αν το πρώτο σας φανεί παιδικό μην απορήσετε γιατί ο Χαρι είναι μόνο 11 χρονών, αλλά αξίζει το κόπο. Στη πορεία εξελίσσονται σε βιβλία για σκληροπυρηνικούς αναγνώστες! Δεν είναι τυχαίο ότι οοοσοι διαβάζουν τη συγκεκριμένη σειρά πάσχουν από χαριποτερομανια!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"5289337959859267787\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review533291954\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right I don't know why it took me so long to start this series but I'm so glad I finally did. href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1454172046\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Melanie\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3030788-melanie\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Melanie\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474399332p2/3030788.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1454172046?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 15, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Melanie\" class=\"user\" name=\"Melanie\" href=\"/user/show/3030788-melanie\"\u003eMelanie\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=read-in-2015\"\u003eread-in-2015\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=witches\"\u003ewitches\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=buddy-reads\"\u003ebuddy-reads\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=middle-grade\"\u003emiddle-grade\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1454172046\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer14170127663113257197\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e “It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.” \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449418721i/17283305._SY540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI've sat at my desk for over an hour and I still, after all these years, do not think I can review this book properly. All I can say is that \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e feels like home, and every page of this book feels like magic; and not the magic that has to do with wizards or Hogwarts, but magic that has to do with love that is all encompassing. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis book was published nearly twenty years ago, but when I opened this book to the first page it felt lik\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText14170127663113257197\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e “It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.” \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449418721i/17283305._SY540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI've sat at my desk for over an hour and I still, after all these years, do not think I can review this book properly. All I can say is that \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e feels like home, and every page of this book feels like magic; and not the magic that has to do with wizards or Hogwarts, but magic that has to do with love that is all encompassing. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis book was published nearly twenty years ago, but when I opened this book to the first page it felt like not a day had passed. I really don't have any amount of words that I can string together to tell you how this book makes me feel. J.K. Rowling will always set the bar for how a series \u003ci\u003eshould\u003c/i\u003e be written, because \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e is written with love, and it makes all the difference. \u003cb\u003eAlways.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1449029406ra/17225575.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIf you'd like to participate in #HARRYXMASTOYOU here is the official \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/harryxmastoyou\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTwitter\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BjealyQA-OI\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eYouTube Video\u003c/a\u003e for more information! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eExtra Harry Potter things that make me happy and probably will make you happy as well: \u003cbr\u003e1.) \u003ca href=\"http://www.buzzfeed.com/andyneuenschwander/these-adorable-harry-potter-comics-imagine-james-and-lily-as#.xue9RPjL3\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eJames And Lily Comics\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e2.) \u003ca href=\"http://www.buzzfeed.com/eleanorbate/pleaseneveraskmethatoneagain#.iiXWMNzlqm\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eNew Things J.K. Rowling Taught Us About Harry Potter In 2015\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e3.) \u003ca href=\"http://ohwitchplease.ca/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eA fortnightly podcast about the Harry Potter world\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://meltotheany.wordpress.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eBlog\u003c/a\u003e | \u003ca href=\"https://www.twitter.com/meltotheany\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTwitter\u003c/a\u003e | \u003ca href=\"http://meltotheany.tumblr.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTumblr\u003c/a\u003e | \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/meltotheany/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eInstagram\u003c/a\u003e | \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4RbHEg_fH6CewJrh_0xJ9g\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eYoutube\u003c/a\u003e | \u003ca href=\"http://www.twitch.tv/meltotheany/profile\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTwitch\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"14170127663113257197\" href=\"#\"     var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');\n      var $copy;\n      if ($ratingGraph.length \u003e 0) {\n          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();\n          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');\n          $copy.find('script').remove();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);\n      }\n  //]]\u003e\n  \u003c/script\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv id=\"bookReviews\"\u003e\n  \n\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section firstReview\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1012980854\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1012980854\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Eric Boot\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/33117741-eric-boot\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Eric Boot\"   \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1012980854?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 16, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Eric Boot\" class=\"user\" name=\"Eric Boot\" href=\"/user/show/33117741-eric-boot\"\u003eEric Boot\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was        Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=books-i-own\"\u003ebooks-i-own\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=favs-of-all-times\"\u003efavs-of-all-times\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=5-stars-totally-freaking-out\"\u003e5-stars-totally-freaking-out\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1012980854\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9391483479367696138\"\u003eI realize many people have said this and many people can express this way better than I can, but I'll try. I don't know how many times I've read the books so far in my life (I guess around the 5 times) but every time I start reading this series again I realize why this is my favourite series ever (and I'm 99.9% sure it will be never surpassed). I have tried to explain this to others, but I never quite manage to tell why I love these books so much. And I don't know what the Nobel Prize comitee is\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9391483479367696138\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI realize many people have said this and many people can express this way better than I can, but I'll try. I don't know how many times I've read the books so far in my life (I guess around the 5 times) but every time I start reading this series again I realize why this is my favourite series ever (and I'm 99.9% sure it will be never surpassed). I have tried to explain this to others, but I never quite manage to tell why I love these books so much. And I don't know what the Nobel Prize comitee is thinking but if there is one person who changed the world by books it's J.K. Rowling. There are many other really, really good books, but if I try to compare them to Harry Potter it mostly goes sth like this:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBooks I like:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e1. Harry Potter\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e2. The other books \u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003e(Including Percy Jackson, Throne of Glass and The Mortal Instruments) \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e(This is so hard :/ I can't do this)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cu\u003ewhen reading 'normal' books, it often goes as follows:\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI read one hour, then I go on Goodreads/YouTube/I watch the news/whatever for some time (like an hour), I pick up the book again etc. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cu\u003ewhen I'm reading Harry Potter things go more like this:\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI read for 3 hours, then I'm like oh I need to check the news, I watch the news for 5 minutes and I'm like \u003ci\u003ebut what am I actually doing? This is nonsense I'D RATHER BE READING\u003c/i\u003e \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd that makes that I can read 5 pretty big books in just one week and feel like I should have read more. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd at the same time it makes me ache because I know I've only got two books left. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAHHHHHHHHHH\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003e(time for another reread)\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9391483479367696138\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return id=\"freeTextContainer7863886633790031531\"\u003eОБИЧАМ тази книга! Реших, че това е най – подходящото изречение, с което да започна. Съжалявам, че не гледах с добро око на поредицата и толкова дълго я пренебрегвах, но „по – добре късно, отколкото никога”. Романът ме спечели в абсолютно всички категории: персонажи, стил, сюжет, действие...\u003cbr /\u003eЦялото ревю тук -\u0026gt; \u003ca target=\"_blank\" \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1684589439' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/1684589439/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView 2 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1684589439' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 1684589439, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_226968334\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/226968334\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Olivia McCloskey\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6767471-olivia-mccloskey\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Olivia McCloskey\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1455329655p2/6767471.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/226968334?book_show_action=false\"\u003eSep 12, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Olivia McCloskey\" class=\"user\" name=\"Olivia McCloskey\" href=\"/user/show/6767471-olivia-mccloskey\"\u003eOlivia McCloskey\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=all-time-favorites\"\u003eall-time-favorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=recommended\"\u003erecommended\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=adventure\"\u003eadventure\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=all-time-favorite-series\"\u003eall-time-favorite-series\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=get-it-right-away\"\u003eget-it-right-away\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=boarding-school\"\u003eboarding-school\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer226968334\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer8428290460398215643\"\u003e\"Happiness can be found in the darkest of times, if only one remembers to turn on the light.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSince 1997, the Harry Potter series has enchanted readers, both young and old. Legendary British author, J.K. Rowling's debut novel has gained international acclaim since its initial publication, winning a total of seven awards. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone is the thrilling first installment of the series where all of the magic began. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe novel begins at the small, quiet house on Number Four Pri\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText8428290460398215643\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\"Happiness can be found in the darkest of times, if only one remembers to turn on the light.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSince 1997, the Harry Potter series has enchanted readers, both young and old. Legendary British author, J.K. Rowling's debut novel has gained international acclaim since its initial publication, winning a total of seven awards. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone is the thrilling first installment of the series where all of the magic began. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe novel begins at the small, quiet house on Number Four Privet Drive, Little Whinging, Surrey where the book's eleven year-old protagonist, Harry Potter, lives in the cupboard under the stairs. He was orphaned at a young age after his parents were killed in a tragic accident and was sent to live with the Dursleys: Aunt Petunia, Uncle Vernon, and their son, Dudley. His only living relatives treat him poorly, making Harry's childhood miserable.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry's unhappy demeanor is replaced by one of elation when he receives a letter inviting him to attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, the finest school for witches and wizards in all of Britain. As the novel unfolds, Harry begins his first year at Hogwarts where he is introduced to the wizarding world, befriends other students, and comes face-to-face with adversity. The twists and turns, mounting suspense, and thrilling perils that Harry encounters render this book life-changning and unforgettable.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling has a rare talent for creating believable, realistic characters that gradually change as the story progresses. These characters, as some people would say, possess a certain amount of depth. Their unique personalities and traits distinguish them from the characters in similar novels. Harry embodies all of the characteristics of a true hero: courage, tenacity, and an inclination to protect others. Harry is willing to sacrifice everything, including his own life, to ensure the safety of others. Rowling accurately captures his desire to protect those he loves, whatever the cost.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI must admit, Rowling's imagination is extraordinary. Her original vision of a young boy sporting a lighting scar who attended boarding school was transformed into a seven book series teeming with the unimaginable. Rowling's creative prowess enabled her to establish an entirely new world filled with realistic people, magical creatures, and thrilling enchantments. The wizarding world was crafted so thoroughly that it is flawless. No minor detail of this alternate world was excluded, allowing readers to fully immerse themselves in the book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs the plot unfolded, readers received a glimpse of the growing complexity of the series. Rowling introduced specific details throughout the novel which the majority of readers overlook. These seemingly insignificant details, however, have a large impact upon later events within the book. My predictions of the events to come were quite far from the actual events that transpired. The shocking conclusion left me stunned and begging my mother to drive me to Barnes and Noble to purchase the second book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWhile Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone falls under the \"Fantasy\" genre, Rowling discretely incorporated many mythological and historical references into the novel, especially those pertaining to the works of Ancient Rome. First and foremost among these allusions is Hagrid's three-headed dog, Fluffy. The concept of such a creature is taken from Greek Mythology; according to legend, Cerberus, a three-headed dog, ferociously guarded the entrance to the Underworld. The only means of subduing Cerberus (and Fluffy, consequently) is the playing of a lyre. Additionally, the Hogwarts motto, \"Draco Dormiens Nunquam Titillandus,\" is Latin for \"Never tickle a sleeping dragon.\" Rowling relies heavily on her knowledge of Latin to create incantations and character names throughout the series.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI am most impressed not with the books themselves, but with the author whose rags-to-riches life story has inspired countless people worldwide. J.K. Rowling was born Joanne Kathleen Rowling into a poor family living in Gloucestershire, England. She was accepted at the University of Exeter, where she studied Classics. She was devastated when her mother died shortly after her graduation, having suffered from multiple sclerosis. Several years later, Rowling married Jorge Arantes and gave birth to their daughter, Jessica. The unhappy couple separated 13 months after their marriage. Homeless, penniless, and caring for a newborn, Rowling struggled with depression and contemplated suicide. We almost lost the brilliant, talented mind who is solely responsible for the series that has now become a worldwide phenomenon. Her rags to riches story inspires millions of people in similar situations. Despite her challenges, Rowling's perseverance and determination brought the world of Harry Potter to life.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOverall, this series is the most memorable from my childhood. I was originally introduced to the series in third grade and immediately fell in love with the realistic characters, suspenseful plot, and flawless writing style. I was the diehard fan who watched each movie a dozen times at the same movie theater, eventually coming to know the employees at the concessions stand on a first name basis. For Halloween last year, in fact, I dressed up in an old pair of robes, pulled on a wig, and drew a scar on my forehead. And to this day, I find myself reciting quotes from the series. I was crushed after the release of the final book, feeling that part of my childhood had ended with the series. Looking back, I have never once regretted the time I have spent reading and rereading the series, committing it to memory. The Harry Potter series has served as more than a way to pass the time; it has helped to shape the person I am today.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"8428290460398215643\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review226968334\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_451290584\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/451290584\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Christopher\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/14386596-christopher\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Christopher\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1402231159p2/14386596.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/451290584?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 20, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Christopher\" class=\"user\" name=\"Christopher\" href=\"/user/show/14386596-christopher\"\u003eChristopher\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=fiction\"\u003efiction\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=kindle-unlimited\"\u003ekindle-unlimited\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=magic\"\u003emagic\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=adventure\"\u003eadventure\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=buddy-read\"\u003ebuddy-read\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer451290584\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15558883151130064846\"\u003eThere's a decent chance you won't like this book. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLet's be honest here. If you're reading my reviews and haven't read this series, you're probably an adult, which means two things. One is that you have lived through this series releasing 7 novels, 8 movies, and becoming a cultural phenomenon. If you're here, you felt that societal pressure to read this, or one of your friends won't shut up until you do (probably). There is little chance the hype can withstand reality. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd that is partly because.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15558883151130064846\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThere's a decent chance you won't like this book. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLet's be honest here. If you're reading my reviews and haven't read this series, you're probably an adult, which means two things. One is that you have lived through this series releasing 7 novels, 8 movies, and becoming a cultural phenomenon. If you're here, you felt that societal pressure to read this, or one of your friends won't shut up until you do (probably). There is little chance the hype can withstand reality. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd that is partly because... you aren't eleven years old. This book is written for children. Yes, the books get darker and more mature (and much better) later on, but this one is for middle school aged kids.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis is my first time rereading book 1 in at least 6 years. This book commits sins I would never forgive if they occurred in a different book. The main characters are dumb, the authority figures should all be fired for child endangerment, and in order for some events to make any sense, one has to create their own head-canon. Typically at such points, I stop, remind myself that this is a children's book, and get a glass of Maker's 46.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut forgive them I do. Rowling creates a fantastic world, characters, and story over these seven books that makes it all worth it. If I were reading this for the first time today, I honestly do not know if I would DNF this due to the above sins or simply for it targeting a much different audience than adult me. But I do know that having read the rest of the series, it didn't even cross my mind not to finish this reread, despite seeing all of the problems. The writing is designed so the target audience ages with Harry, so while we never get adult novels, we do get much \"better\" writing in later books. If you read this book or even the first two and the writing is much of what turned you off, I encourage you to keep going for another couple of books.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs a final note, my rating for this book is for the series. I can't honestly rate this book by itself at this point.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15558883151130064846\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review451290584\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_451290584'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_451290584\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/451290584?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e32 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_451290584\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_451290584\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=32\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=451290584\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_451290584\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 451290584, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003e9 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/451290584?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=5\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_451290584' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/451290584/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView all 9 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_451290584' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 451290584, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1536987673\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1536987673\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4748843-tracey-ya-book-addict\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454928266p2/4748843.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1536987673?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMar 13, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" href=\"/user/show/4748843-tracey-ya-book-addict\"\u003eTracey (YA Book Addict)\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          added it\n\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855652\" href=\"/book/show/22841994-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1536987673\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9929834086164815645\"\u003eI first picked up The Philosopher's Stone about seven years ago. I'd gone from reading true crime and biographies, to having just finished the Twilight saga, when the Harry Potter series was recommended to me. From memory I think I read the first two chapters and then put it down. It felt really young and I felt it just wasn't for me. So I moved on. After starting my IG account I was constantly bombarded with people telling me how amazing the series was and how I had to read it. I'm not even\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9929834086164815645\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI first picked up The Philosopher's Stone about seven years ago. I'd gone from reading true crime and biographies, to having just finished the Twilight saga, when the Harry Potter series was recommended to me. From memory I think I read the first two chapters and then put it down. It felt really young and I felt it just wasn't for me. So I moved on. After starting my IG account I was constantly bombarded with people telling me how amazing the series was and how I had to read it. I'm not even sure why I decided to give it another try, but I did. And it just goes to show that even if a book is not meant for you when you first pick it up, it doesn't mean that at another time it won't be something that you love. Because this book... This book was brilliant! It was enchanting and captivating and magical. I was completely engrossed from the very first page. I absolutely adored the friendship between Harry and Ron, and the dynamic was completed once Hermione was accepted into the little group. And Hermione, boy she was awesome! She had me grinning from ear to ear. I'm so intrigued by Snape, and I can't wait to peel back all his layers to see what he has hidden. And then there's the gentle giant that is Hagrid. My heart is so full of love for him. My favourite character so far! I can't tell you how incredibly happy I am to have given this series a second chance. I can now officially say I'm well on my way to being a Potterhead! \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9929834086164815645\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1536987673\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463769552p2/2018505.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/624662206?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 22, 2013\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Thomas\" class=\"user\" name=\"Thomas\" href=\"/user/show/2018505-thomas\"\u003eThomas\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=own-physical\"\u003eown-physical\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer624662206\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12268770511559683188\"\u003eBecause everyone on the planet excluding me and maybe some of the Kardashians have read this series, I'll skip the plot summary and go for a less formal review. I can see why so many people adore \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e. While Rowling does not introduce anything particularly groundbreaking in terms of fantasy or plot or characterization, she does abide by the hero's quest with great precision. Harry is the underdog from the start and you can't help but cheer him on as he overcomes obstacles with the help o\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText12268770511559683188\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eBecause everyone on the planet excluding me and maybe some of the Kardashians have read this series, I'll skip the plot summary and go for a less formal review. I can see why so many people adore \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e. While Rowling does not introduce anything particularly groundbreaking in terms of fantasy or plot or characterization, she does abide by the hero's quest with great precision. Harry is the underdog from the start and you can't help but cheer him on as he overcomes obstacles with the help of his friends and his mentor. Each of the characters has a distinct personality, and Rowling's simple writing style leaves room for brevity and enough imagery to pull you into the setting. Story-wise, she includes all of the necessary elements: foreshadowing, conflicts that escalate to the climax, a pretty satisfying plot twist, etc.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'll probably read one other book in between each installment of this series. I'm looking forward to seeing the characters mature and the plot become darker as many others have said it will!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"12268770511559683188\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1593414832\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Melisa\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/40816186-melisa\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Melisa\"   \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1593414832?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMay 21, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Melisa\" class=\"user\" name=\"Melisa\" href=\"/user/show/40816186-melisa\"\u003eMelisa\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40816186-melisa?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40816186-melisa?shelf=rereads\"\u003erereads\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1593414832\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer1182614133666897362\"\u003eRereading this magical book with these beautiful illustrations was such a new experience. Generally I had so much fun rereading this because I discovered so many little details I hadn't noticed the first time. But this new excitement of a page turner was amazing. I was so excited to see if there was going to be an illustration on the next page and how it would look like. Highly recommend. 10 out of 10 \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr I WANT IT!!!\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://photobucket.com/images/hogwarts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949739.gif\" alt=\"hogwarts photo: Hogwarts hogwarts2-1.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAfter two years of ESL my english teacher decided to assign me a book to read, and every day for a couple of hours she would stay with me and I'd have to read, circle all the words I didn't know and so much more... the book assigned was \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.\u003c/b\u003e After reading that book I started hating Harry Potter so much that I didn't want to see another book of his... \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eafter a couple of months the first movie was out and the school brought us to movie theater to watch it and I actually fell in love with the movie! So I've watched almost all the movies and then at a certain point I stopped and I promised myself that I wouldn't watch the last three movies, not until I would have read the series...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://photobucket.com/images/stupid\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949740.gif\" alt=\"stupid photo: with stupid stupid.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWell after 14 years I've finally had \u003ci\u003ethe courage to start this Saga \u003c/i\u003eand I'm so ashamed that I've waited so long... This book is adorable, perfect, I loved it!!! And I've already started the second one!!! Have to make up for all the years I've lost! D: But I've chosen to read it in my language, italian ;)... It's funny how a bad memory can influence you. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930348ra/12949830.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003eStupid Me!!! I almost risked never reading this wonderful saga...\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e... ... ... HARRY POTTER \u0026lt; 3 \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3 ... ... ...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eEven though I knew exactly what was going to happen and who the bad guy was, I was still surprised! Rowling has a way of capturing you completely! She has bewitched me completely!!!!!!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418296490ra/12736351.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe after reading Harry Potter! \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e-----\u003cbr\u003eDopo quattordici anni sono finalmente riuscita a trovare il \"coraggio\" per iniziare questa saga. Eh si, coraggio. Dopo il trauma subito da piccola avevo paura di riprendere questo testo. Ogni volta che pensavo alla saga di Harry Potter mi rivedevo piccola, seduta accanto alla mia professoressa d'inglese che mi invitava a leggere e cerchiare tutte le parole che non comprendevo (che erano tantissime, considerando che ero appena uscita da ESL - classe per alunni stranieri nelle scuole americane - da pochissimo). E quindi successivamente non ho mai più voluto saperne di HARRY POTTER! Dannazione!!!! ... quanto mi pento di non aver trovato il coraggio prima... per fortuna Harry Potter è in grado di stupire non solo i bambini!!!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://photobucket.com/images/harry%20potter\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929987ra/12949765.gif\" alt=\"harry potter photo: glee tumblr_les06aCN1W1qahz0j.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDopo un paio di mesi dalla lettura del testo la scuola ci portò a vedere il nuovo film di Harry Potter al cinema, ma che dire... il film mi rapì completamente. Non vi era nessuno che mi osservava, solo io ed Harry. Ed iniziai a vedere anche i film successivi. Ma poi dopo il quarto mi imposi di fermarmi. \u003cb\u003eDovevo leggere la Saga di Harry Potter!\u003c/b\u003e ... beh dopo tanti anni eccomi qui!!! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930453ra/12949854.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e Harry forgive me!!! But I'm all yours now... ready to fly to Hogwarts with you!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eQuesto libro è dolcissimo!!! Harry, Ron, Hermione... ohhh can't wait to see how the love between the two grows!!! \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930782ra/12949933.gif\" width=\"300\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u0026lt;3 Una vera e propria fiaba \u003c/b\u003eche non stanca mai, che ti tiene incollata alle pagine! Un testo davvero unico, con protagonisti straordinari... e sto solo all'inizio! Non vedo l'ora di continuare... beh in realtà già sto leggendo il secondo! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930570ra/12949874.gif\" width=\"250\" height=\"170\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eMisteri, magia, amici, nemici, incanti, scope volanti, pozioni, intrighi, lotte,\u003c/i\u003e, tanti ingredienti squisiti che non possono non suscitare una forte emozione. Amore. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e STUPENDO!!!\u003cbr\u003eI need more!!!!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg
