class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1242475028\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1242475028\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Steve\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Steve\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1242475028?book_show_action=false\"\u003eApr 06, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Steve\" class=\"user\" name=\"Steve\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\"\u003eSteve\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015\"\u003eread-in-2015\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=rmfao-2015-genre-challenge\"\u003ermfao-2015-genre-challenge\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya\"\u003eya\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1242475028\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10457043252093554053\"\u003eOk, so this was my first time reading this book (don't judge me). While I wasn't quite as enamored with it as the thousands of adoring fans (the ones who have read them over and over and over) have been, this wasn't a bad read. I did have to keep reminding myself that this was a children's book, and I'm WAY past the target age! My son and daughter-in-law, along with the RMFAO group, have been after me to read these books. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm actually looking forward to reading the rest of the books, just to see\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText10457043252093554053\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eOk, so this was my first time reading this book (don't judge me). While I wasn't quite as enamored with it as the thousands of adoring fans (the ones who have read them over and over and over) have been, this wasn't a bad read. I did have to keep reminding myself that this was a children's book, and I'm WAY past the target age! My son and daughter-in-law, along with the RMFAO group, have been after me to read these books. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm actually looking forward to reading the rest of the books, just to see how the books, and the characters, grow up. I haven't seen the movies, but I don't live under a rock either, and I know that each book progressively ages with the characters, turning from children's books with child-like problems, to books with adult issues and adult responses from the characters. I'm really hoping that things in the next books aren't so easy for Harry, Ron, and Hermione to solve. That's probably my biggest complaint, and why it \"only\" got four stars from me: everything was too easy, that the mysteries were laid out too simply and were easily solved. They were clever, and again, I had to keep reminding myself that it wasn't written with me in mind.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis first book was entertaining, as I've said, but it wasn't a five-star read (I'm going to be in trouble for that statement, I think!). It reminded me of a mash-up between the old Hardy Boys/Nancy Drew books (kids solving crimes with skills well beyond their age or abilities) and Scooby-Doo. Yes, Scooby-Doo! Especially at the end when the real bad guy was revealed (it wasn't who they thought it was), and the bad guy's reaction was, \"Darn you, meddling kids!\" (or something very similar). :D\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOn to the next book!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"10457043252093554053\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1242475028\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1242475028\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1242475028\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n         \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1505654224\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13288558266498748957\"\u003eI started reading this for the Nth time 3 days before the death of Alan Rickman, who played Snape in the adaptations- in my opinion the best thing about them. It was sad, heartbreaking really, to think of his character just beginning his journey again for me through this reading, while the man who played him so excellently had just passed away. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI love the adventure and magic of these books, but I especially love the journey we take with Snape's character. He is everything. So hard to love, but I\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText13288558266498748957\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI started reading this for the Nth time 3 days before the death of Alan Rickman, who played Snape in the adaptations- in my opinion the best thing about them. It was sad, heartbreaking really, to think of his character just beginning his journey again for me through this reading, while the man who played him so excellently had just passed away. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI love the adventure and magic of these books, but I especially love the journey we take with Snape's character. He is everything. So hard to love, but I love him for it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI adore these books. That is all.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"13288558266498748957\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n Every time I read this book, it delights me all over again. There's nothing like it, accept no substitutes. Rowling has given the world a tremendous gift.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eJanuary 2016: Read the kids the illustrated edition aloud. They loved it. Boy had read it before, of course, but it was Baby Girl's first time, and she was hooked. The one drawback to reading it aloud is bawling through Hagrid giving Harry the album of pictures of his parents, and through Neville getting 10 points for Gr\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText655435461340763629\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eReread, September 2012. Every time I read this book, it delights me all over again. There's nothing like it, accept no substitutes. Rowling has given the world a tremendous gift.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eJanuary 2016: Read the kids the illustrated edition aloud. They loved it. Boy had read it before, of course, but it was Baby Girl's first time, and she was hooked. The one drawback to reading it aloud is bawling through Hagrid giving Harry the album of pictures of his parents, and through Neville getting 10 points for Gryffindor. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca  \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408810545\" href=\"/book/show/7955579-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n             \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1269177142\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12792904350102546292\"\u003e[re-read August 2015] I won't write a full review, since pretty much everyone knows how this book goes! I'm just amazed by the amount of foreshadowing! JK Rowling must have exactly known how the story would evolve. I don't mind that this book is short, when I think of OOTP for example, I find the beginning (before they go to Hogwarts) too long and often boring... \u003c/span\u003e\n\n   \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7929992520691540406\"\u003eSo this is the first time I read Harry Potter (yeah I know WHY???) and now I can officially say it is AMAZING! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'd love to describe how this book made me feel but I just can't find a word to do it so let's say...you know that feeling when you didn't know a part of your heart was missing until you feel like something starts to fill it? Well, it was kind of like that (*starts crying*).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnyway, I recommend it to everyone who hasn't read it yet. I can asure you it's never too late to start reading Ha\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7929992520691540406\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eSo this is the first time I read Harry Potter (yeah I know WHY???) and now I can officially say it is AMAZING! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'd love to describe how this book made me feel but I just can't find a word to do it so let's say...you know that feeling when you didn't know a part of your heart was missing until you feel like something starts to fill it? Well, it was kind of like that (*starts crying*).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnyway, I recommend it to everyone who hasn't read it yet. I can asure you it's never too late to start reading Harry Potter.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"7929992520691540406\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_9681448\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/9681448\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Mariel\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/647547-mariel\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Mariel\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451321467p2/647547.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/9681448?book_show_action=false\"\u003eNov 29, 2010\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Mariel\" class=\"user\" name=\"Mariel\" href=\"/user/show/647547-mariel\"\u003eMariel\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\u003cspan class=\"uitext greyText\"\u003eRecommends it for: \u003c/span\u003e\n           \u003cspan class=\"uitext reviewText\"\u003eHarry is the one I'll marry\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003eRecommended to Mariel by: \u003c/span\u003e\n      Potter you rotter\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer9681448\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11141258349907648675\"\u003eI'm not the usual Harry Potter fan, I don't think. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTo the well organized mind death is but the next great adventure.\" - Albus Dumbledore I don't wanna die! Who cares? My favorite Dumbledore is Aberforth. Y'know, the one who performed an experimental charm on goats and got sent to appear before the ministry for it. Albus isn't even sure he can read, for that matter. I'm more Aberforth on the wisdom scale, fo' sho'. (I once asked JK Rowling what the charm was. She said my guess was as good as hers\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11141258349907648675\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI'm not the usual Harry Potter fan, I don't think. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTo the well organized mind death is but the next great adventure.\" - Albus Dumbledore I don't wanna die! Who cares? My favorite Dumbledore is Aberforth. Y'know, the one who performed an experimental charm on goats and got sent to appear before the ministry for it. Albus isn't even sure he can read, for that matter. I'm more Aberforth on the wisdom scale, fo' sho'. (I once asked JK Rowling what the charm was. She said my guess was as good as hers. She also laughed evilly. I have my answer.) Wake up and smell the flowers? Huh? The goats are eating all the flowers and they sure smell experimental pretty. It wasn't as fun after Order of the Phoenix and the bitching commenced. Yeah, there were problems. But I'm not organized, I don't wanna die, and I never really cared how it ended as much as I cared about focusing on the cool little stuff.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI got into the series after Prisoner of Azkaban came out and before Goblet of Fire. (So it wasn't the movies or that Daniel Radcliffe was -then- Elijah Wood before he was uglier.) What made me want to read them? The Dursleys. I thought they sounded wonderfully delicious (they are hilarious. I love it when Vernon tells everyone that Harry attends \"St. Brutus' Center for Incurably Criminal Boys\". His Japanese golfer joke. When playing trivia games with friends I'd piss myself with excitement if I got a muggle question. \"Vernon's drill company is called Grunnings! Yes! I'm more amazing than all of you put together!\" Wonder why no one plays reindeer games with me anymore...) I love muggles.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI loved the stupid shit. No, not the mythology references. Yaaay she read Shakespeare. My Uncle Remus did too. Not even that she listened to The Smiths and The Beatles while coming up with the series (I do love that). I loved the Aberforth goat stuff. I loved the names of Lockhart's books (Gadding with Ghouls, Year with the Yeti, etc.) and the little humor stuff she slips in. I can still quote asshole-y things that Draco Malfoy taunted them with (Potter stinks!) and can't remember the basic plot twists. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was a card carrying Potterite (laminated!). Sigh. I do miss wondering what was going to happen next. I miss having that place to retreat to in my mind. I'd go on my favorite Harry forum and have fun making up theories (I was right about EVERYYTHING *coughs*). I'm jealous of JK Rowling for having that place in her mind. Yeah, I've got my own stories. But I don't think I have as much fun with mine (probably because I'm not a sadistic murderer like she is). \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI liked the books better before they grew up. Rowling couldn't write a love story for anything. I hated it whenever Ron was mad at Harry. My favorite Buffy seasons to watch when depressed are the first three because the core group are still together. I love the togetherness. (Aberforth was eventually important in the last book. That almost ruined it.)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eP.s. In case I didn't look dorky enough... I used to get into rabid debates about the English to American changes with the transatlantic fans. They were all like: \"Americans are so dumb that you don't understand what Philosopher means.\" I delivered eighteen shots to their stomach with my comebacks about Lee not being black in their versions, JK Rowlings name being JK in the first place (it doesn't mean Just Kidding. The publishers thought boys wouldn't read a female author), and their effing ugly covers (English kids lose so often. No Edward Gorey for Joan Aiken's books!). I did know that jumper meant sweater. It's not just a Hayden Christensen vehicle.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11141258349907648675\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/10827825-sharon?shelf=reviewed-2015\"\u003ereviewed-2015\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer855877673\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4405854637513303948\"\u003eI found the idea of this series of books wonderful. When they were released there were not a lot of children's books that were set in the world of magic. I think for me the greatest thing about this book is, it teaches children and adults alike that, you can achieve anything you wish even when you think that it is impossible. I also think the theme of friendship is important, people can be friends whether you agree with everything about them or not, Hermione is a great example of that throughout\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4405854637513303948\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI found the idea of this series of books wonderful. When they were released there were not a lot of children's books that were set in the world of magic. I think for me the greatest thing about this book is, it teaches children and adults alike that, you can achieve anything you wish even when you think that it is impossible. I also think the theme of friendship is important, people can be friends whether you agree with everything about them or not, Hermione is a great example of that throughout the book, she is more of a straight-laced student but she befriends Ron and Harry. She tells them it is to keep them out of trouble, but I believe deep down she is actually happy that she has found people that like a bit of adventure, it is something new to her. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOne aspect of the story that there has been a lot of discussion about is, why Harry was left with the Dursley's after the death of his parents. Although it is clear that Harry is not treated very well at all, I think this was the best place for Harry to grow up. Although he cannot understand why they do not like him because of his magical ability, they teach Harry a very valuable lesson...kindness, when he comes across all different kinds of people at Hogwarts, he is more prone to showing kindness to them after the way he has been treated by the Dursley's. They also have taught him how to stand up for himself when he is taunted by Draco Malfoy.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling has the ability to create a world that every reader of these books wishes to enter and never leave. With owls that deliver the mail, a magical school where anything is possible and lets not forget the moving pictures, Hogwarts is a place that will live in the hearts of fans for years to come. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAll and all a great start to what looks like a fantastic series. If you are a fan of all things magical and have not delved into the world of Harry Potter yet, I would highly recommend you give this series a chance.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1425021125\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Cris\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/33748885-cris\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Cris\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1407423719p2/33748885.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1425021125?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 06, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Cris\" class=\"user\" name=\"Cris\" href=\"/user/show/33748885-cris\"\u003eCris\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9781408845646\" href=\"/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1425021125\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer14137093330714833453\"\u003eEs muy difícil escribir una reseña sobre una saga que me ha acompañado en tantos momentos diferentes de mi vida. Todavía recuerdo cuando mis padres me regalaron ‘Harry Potter y el prisionero de Azkaban’ y aluciné en colores con el mundo que me encontré entre sus páginas. Tendría 11 o 12 años y creo que fue perfecto cruzarme con esta historia por aquel entonces. Inmediatamente me enteré de que lo que acababa de leer era la tercera entrega de una serie y fui corriendo a hacerme con los dos\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText14137093330714833453\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eEs muy difícil escribir una reseña sobre una saga que me ha acompañado en tantos momentos diferentes de mi vida. Todavía recuerdo cuando mis padres me regalaron ‘Harry Potter y el prisionero de Azkaban’ y aluciné en colores con el mundo que me encontré entre sus páginas. Tendría 11 o 12 años y creo que fue perfecto cruzarme con esta historia por aquel entonces. Inmediatamente me enteré de que lo que acababa de leer era la tercera entrega de una serie y fui corriendo a hacerme con los dos anteriores, que leí en cuestión de días. Entiendo perfectamente que supusiera el acercamiento a la literatura para miles de niños que no habían mostrado antes ningún interés por los libros. Aunque en mi caso yo ya era una lectora regular, no consigo recordar ningún otro libro o saga que me hubiera tenido leyendo tantas horas seguidas y en un estado tal de ensimismamiento.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReseña completa y mi versión de la portada en \u003ca target=\"_blank\"   \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/363148348?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 03, 2014\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Maureen\" class=\"user\" name=\"Maureen\" href=\"/user/show/10762033-maureen\"\u003eMaureen\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was     \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer363148348\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12044817297830355884\"\u003eI LOVE Harry Potter, fantastic start to the series.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReread December 2014 for #HarryXmasToYou\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere are SO MANY foreshadowing things I never noticed before! Like the centaurs talking about the innocent being the first to die? And just so many things just mentioned that come up later, the dragon in Gringotts, Dittany, Sirius Black, Etc.\u003cbr /\u003eThere's also a lot of things I've forgotten weren't in the movie, which is crazy! But so good. I love it just as much IF NOT EVEN MORE.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1321888040\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2114516190580936150\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e \u003cb\u003e \u003ci\u003e“You haven't got a letter on yours,\" George observed. \"I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.”\u003c/i\u003e \u003c/b\u003e \u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stellarscrutinyblog.wordpress.com/2015/11/08/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-harry-potter-1-by-j-k-rowling/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eOriginally posted on Stellar Scrutiny Book Blog.\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eWell, it turns out all those Muggles were right…\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429979195ra/14655508.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI didn’t enjoy reading until a few years ago. Having suffered through so many years of school required reading, I couldn’t look at a book without thinking of essays! Not to mention my distaste for writing at the time. All that changed ho\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText2114516190580936150\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003e“You haven't got a letter on yours,\" George observed. \"I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.”\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stellarscrutinyblog.wordpress.com/2015/11/08/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-harry-potter-1-by-j-k-rowling/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eOriginally posted on Stellar Scrutiny Book Blog.\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eWell, it turns out all those Muggles were right…\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429979195ra/14655508.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI didn’t enjoy reading until a few years ago. Having suffered through so many years of school required reading, I couldn’t look at a book without thinking of essays! Not to mention my distaste for writing at the time. All that changed however, with one book that was so magnificent, it must have been a gift from God! It completely altered my view of books. What was this holy novel, you might be asking? …It wasn’t Harry Potter. It was The Hunger Games. As my eyes were opened to the Young Adult genre, my love of reading began. Shortly after reading The Hunger Games, I made a deal with my friend, who passionately loved the Harry Potter books and had been trying to get me to read them for quite some time. If she read the first Hunger Games book, I’d read the first Harry Potter book. Flash forward a few months, and wouldn’t you know it, my friend read the whole trilogy! Did I breeze through all seven Harry Potter books in a week? HAHAHAHAHA, NO.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eYou want to know the best part? That was 3 years ago…\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444407231ra/16497076.gif\" alt=\"description\" width=\"400\" height=\"175\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI had been hearing about Harry Potter since I knew how to read, but really disliked the concept of it. \u003ci\u003eIt's just about some stupid boy who goes to a school for wizards! Also, I've heard it rips off Lord of the Rings, so I'm going to stay as far away from it as possible....\u003c/i\u003eSee, the funny thing about this is, I actually knew nothing about Harry Potter. Nothing. Zip. Nada. I hadn't even seen more than 5 minutes of the movies! *gasps* After having a hundred or so people threatening me to read it, out of fear for my life, I complied. I certainly am glad I did. It was incredible! Absolutely stupendous!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eThe Characters\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003e\"So light a fire!\" Harry choked. \u003cbr\u003e\"Yes...of course...but there's no wood!\"\u003cbr\u003e\"HAVE YOU GONE MAD!\" Ron bellowed. \"ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eUndoubtedly, my favorite part of this beautiful book was its beautiful characters. Harry, Hermione, Ron, Fred, George...I love them all! Ironically, Harry was my least favorite of the trio. Not that I didn't like him, but he just didn't have as distinct of a personality as Hermione and Ron. However, I still admired his loyalty and selflessness. I'm really excited to see how his character develops throughout the series.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHermione.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIs it bad if I see a lot of myself in Hermione? Haha. I can be the occasional smart-alec who gets all up in your business...so, naturally, I love Hermione Granger. She wasn't a Mary Sue! She was intelligent, loyal, and feisty! There really should be more heroines like her. I also have brown hair, brown eyes, and am Muggle-born...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWe're practically the same person.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1447190765ra/16967495.gif\" alt=\"description\" width=\"400\" height=\"170\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eRon.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHe was pretty great too. Having four siblings (two of which, are twins), I can relate to him. Ron and Hermione's bickering was positively priceless, and he had more than a few memorable remarks. He was the comedy relief of the whole book, and it wouldn't be the same without him.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMalfoy.\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI was really hoping this little git would get devoured by Fluffy.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eOther characters.\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHagrid, was hilarious, and is it strange if I am particularly fond of Hedwig? Dumbledore didn't really have that much screen time, so I don't really know what to think of him...yet. My favorite, or should I say favorites, are definitely Gred and Froge. *wink* I swear, I was cracking up over every dialogue they had. As a matter of fact, I loved all the Weasleys.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003e\n    \u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cbr\u003e“Now, you two – this year, you behave yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've – you've blown up a toilet or –\"\u003cbr\u003e\"Blown up a toilet? We've never blown up a toilet.\"\u003cbr\u003e\"Great idea though, thanks, Mum.”\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n  \u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eThe World Building\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI finally see why everyone admires J.K. Rowling. Hogwarts and the wizard world she creates is whimsically ingenious. Honestly, why can't Quidditch be a real sport? It's fantastic! I want to ride a broom stick and hit flying balls into peoples' faces! All flavor jelly beans? How awesome is that? Apparently, you can buy them from Amazon...including earwax flavor (Eww, wasn't licorice bad enough?). I'm not kidding, look it up! Rowling did a marvelous job of luring me into Potter's world. The only aspect of the universe that puzzles me, is where exactly is Hogwarts? Is it in a different universe from our reality? If so, how are Harry and Ron (I started a wee bit on Chamber of Secrets...as soon as I finished this one) able to fly a car there?!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eWhat I Loved\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe protagonist and side characters.\u003c/b\u003e Lovely, lovely, lovely characters. Rowling did a spectacular job of creating such a hilarious and realistic cast.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe plot was highly entertaining.\u003c/b\u003e Though a little short, Harry and his friends' adventure was incredibly entertaining and I am especially curious about what other secrets Hogwarts holds...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eRowling's writing was pleasant and engaging.\u003c/b\u003e A little simple, yes, but short and sweet. What else should I expect from a Middle Grade novel?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe plot twist in the end.\u003c/b\u003e I'm not going to lie, I felt quite childish that I didn't see it coming. It was so obvious, yet I was too busy laughing over Harry swallowing Quidditch balls to notice what was right in front of me.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe villains.\u003c/b\u003e *claps* Well done, Rowling. Well done.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eWhat I Didn't Love\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e⚜ The pacing.\u003c/b\u003e A short novel? Understandable. An abrupt ending? Inexcusable.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003e\n    \u003cu\u003eFinal Thoughts\u003c/u\u003e\n  \u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI hope all you Muggles are happy now!  I finally did it!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1447191144ra/16967517.gif\" alt=\"description\" width=\"400\" height=\"160\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHarry Potter was so wonderful!  I really should've read it all those years ago.  The characters were exceptional, story incredible, writing amiable...honestly, what else can I say, other than it truly was a magical book.  I'll absolutely be finishing this series. :)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"2114516190580936150\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n DIDN'T I READ THIS WHEN I WAS YOUNGER. THIS IS EPIC. FUCKING EPIC. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e_____________________________________________________________\u003cbr /\u003eGuys my little sister just came put to me with this book in her hand and asked if I wanted to BR with her. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eShe looked so happy when I said yes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/1785262635?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=5\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1785262635' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"brown_comment\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_photo\"\u003e\n    \t\u003ca alt=\"kazzexual\" href=\"/user/show/54010598-kazzexual\"\u003e\u003cimg \u0026lt;3\u003c/span\u003e\n\n    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      20 hours, 52 min ago\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv   \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv id=\"review_274070323\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/274070323\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Alejandro\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/665584-alejandro\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Alejandro\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1328672389p2/665584.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/274070323?book_show_action=false\"\u003eSep 12, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Alejandro\" class=\"user\" name=\"Alejandro\" href=\"/user/show/665584-alejandro\"\u003eAlejandro\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780590353403\" href=\"/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=magic\"\u003emagic\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=novel\"\u003enovel\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer274070323\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer3946822242601174458\"\u003eIt was interesting how I ended reading finally the books of Harry Potter. I'd heard some comment here and there even before of the first film from some acquaintances and I had the general knowledge that it was becoming a phenomenon, but still I didn't feel compelled to read the books. I've been reader all my life but I don't know, I was kinda undecided about it. Then, the films came out, and I started to watch them, and still I wasn't eager to read the books, since I thought, hey, I am watching\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3946822242601174458\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt was interesting how I ended reading finally the books of Harry Potter. I'd heard some comment here and there even before of the first film from some acquaintances and I had the general knowledge that it was becoming a phenomenon, but still I didn't feel compelled to read the books. I've been reader all my life but I don't know, I was kinda undecided about it. Then, the films came out, and I started to watch them, and still I wasn't eager to read the books, since I thought, hey, I am watching the films, so what may I am losing about the story (oh boy! how wrong I was!). I had some good surprises because I wasn't reading the books like in the third movie. When I watched the fourth film, \u003ci\u003eGoblet of Fire\u003c/i\u003e, I was commenting it with a friend that he was reading the books on Spanish and he told me enough stuff that was in the fourth book \u003cb\u003eBUT\u003c/b\u003e it was missed on the fourth film that I decided then to read the books. Oddly enough while my friend was been reading the books on Spanish, he had an edition on English of the first book, this one, and since by then I already was reading on English, he lent me the book. Usually I am quite reluctant to borrow books or that people lent me books. I had some bad experiences borrowing books and while I am dependable and careful about stuff that it's not mine, still I don't want to have books, etc... that are not mine under my care. Still, my friend insisted and he told me that he was glad that somebody read the book since he bought it in an impulse thinking that he would read it but he aborted the mission and he prefer to read on Spanish. Since I wasn't SO convinced to read the books, I ended accepting the offer of that he lent me the book. I started to reading it... \u003cb\u003eOH MY GOODNESS!!!\u003c/b\u003e Right in the first pages, when Hagrid mentioned \u003cb\u003eWHO\u003c/b\u003e lent him out the flying motorcycle!!! \u003cb\u003eOH MY GOODNESS!!!\u003c/b\u003e Keep on mind that I already watched 4 films by then, so reading the identity of the real owner of the motorcycle, mentioned in so casual way and right in the beginning of the saga! \u003cb\u003eOH MY GOODNESS!!!\u003c/b\u003e Then, I knew that J.K. Rowling was a wicked genius!!! And this first book kept me surprising me even when I was already reading the fifth book, since certain character that appears in the first book, then I said \"Oh, boy, what a boring chapter, why did J.K. bothered to create such unimportant character?\" and I was starting to read the fifth book and... \"Mmh... where I heard about this character before...where?...mmmh...OH MY GOODNESS!!! NO!!! IT CAN'T BE!!!\". By then, I had returned the borrowed book but I had bought my own copy for the collection and I consulted it and POW! Yes, it was the same character!!! Right in the first book!!! So, re-confirmed like for the umpteenth time... J.K. Rowling is a wicked genius!!! I enjoyed a lot reading the first book. J.K. Rowling has a very interesting style of writing. Also, the first book is very good combining the magical world with the normal things that people has to do when kids are beginning school. Going to buy the school supplies. Having to deal different kind of teachers. Some good, some strict, some both. The forming of friendships with schoolmates. Indeed a wonderful and magical book. Highly recommended.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"3946822242601174458\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n            \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1414788363\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4470524636662414586\"\u003eI absolutely adore this new edition of Harry Potter and I hope that they will make illustrated versions of all of the books (although they might get quite big...) \u003cbr /\u003eGetting to experience this story once again, after not having read the book for a long time and this time with beautiful illustrations to complement the story was a truly magnificent experience. J.K. Rowling is the queen!!\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter is and will always be one of my all time favorite series \u0026lt;3 \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1012980854\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Eric Boot\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/33117741-eric-boot\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Eric Boot\"   \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1012980854?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 16, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Eric Boot\" class=\"user\" name=\"Eric Boot\" href=\"/user/show/33117741-eric-boot\"\u003eEric Boot\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747532743\" href=\"/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=books-i-own\"\u003ebooks-i-own\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=favs-of-all-times\"\u003efavs-of-all-times\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=re-read\"\u003ere-read\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=review\"\u003ereview\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=5-stars-totally-freaking-out\"\u003e5-stars-totally-freaking-out\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1012980854\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer16768722353136493419\"\u003eI realize many people have said this and many people can express this way better than I can, but I'll try. I don't know how many times I've read the books so far in my life (I guess around the 5 times) but every time I start reading this series again I realize why this is my favourite series ever (and I'm 99.9% sure it will be never surpassed). I have tried to explain this to others, but I never quite manage to tell why I love these books so much. And I don't know what the Nobel Prize comitee is\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText16768722353136493419\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI realize many people have said this and many people can express this way better than I can, but I'll try. I don't know how many times I've read the books so far in my life (I guess around the 5 times) but every time I start reading this series again I realize why this is my favourite series ever (and I'm 99.9% sure it will be never surpassed). I have tried to explain this to others, but I never quite manage to tell why I love these books so much. And I don't know what the Nobel Prize comitee is thinking but if there is one person who changed the world by books it's J.K. Rowling. There are many other really, really good books, but if I try to compare them to Harry Potter it mostly goes sth like this:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBooks I like:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e1. Harry Potter\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e2. The other books \u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003e(Including Percy Jackson, Throne of Glass and The Mortal Instruments) \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e(This is so hard :/ I can't do this)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cu\u003ewhen reading 'normal' books, it often goes as follows:\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI read one hour, then I go on Goodreads/YouTube/I watch the news/whatever for some time (like an hour), I pick up the book again etc. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cu\u003ewhen I'm reading Harry Potter things go more like this:\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI read for 3 hours, then I'm like oh I need to check the news, I watch the news for 5 minutes and I'm like \u003ci\u003ebut what am I actually doing? This is nonsense I'D RATHER BE READING\u003c/i\u003e \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd that makes that I can read 5 pretty big books in just one week and feel like I should have read more. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd at the same time it makes me ache because I know I've only got two books left. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAHHHHHHHHHH\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003e(time for another reread)\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"16768722353136493419\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=recommended\"\u003erecommended\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=adventure\"\u003eadventure\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=all-time-favorite-series\"\u003eall-time-favorite-series\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=get-it-right-away\"\u003eget-it-right-away\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=boarding-school\"\u003eboarding-school\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer226968334\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17126119034109119247\"\u003e\"Happiness can be found in the darkest of times, if only one remembers to turn on the light.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSince 1997, the Harry Potter series has enchanted readers, both young and old. Legendary British author, J.K. Rowling's debut novel has gained international acclaim since its initial publication, winning a total of seven awards. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone is the thrilling first installment of the series where all of the magic began. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe novel begins at the small, quiet house on Number Four Pri\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17126119034109119247\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\"Happiness can be found in the darkest of times, if only one remembers to turn on the light.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSince 1997, the Harry Potter series has enchanted readers, both young and old. Legendary British author, J.K. Rowling's debut novel has gained international acclaim since its initial publication, winning a total of seven awards. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone is the thrilling first installment of the series where all of the magic began. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe novel begins at the small, quiet house on Number Four Privet Drive, Little Whinging, Surrey where the book's eleven year-old protagonist, Harry Potter, lives in the cupboard under the stairs. He was orphaned at a young age after his parents were killed in a tragic accident and was sent to live with the Dursleys: Aunt Petunia, Uncle Vernon, and their son, Dudley. His only living relatives treat him poorly, making Harry's childhood miserable.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry's unhappy demeanor is replaced by one of elation when he receives a letter inviting him to attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, the finest school for witches and wizards in all of Britain. As the novel unfolds, Harry begins his first year at Hogwarts where he is introduced to the wizarding world, befriends other students, and comes face-to-face with adversity. The twists and turns, mounting suspense, and thrilling perils that Harry encounters render this book life-changning and unforgettable.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling has a rare talent for creating believable, realistic characters that gradually change as the story progresses. These characters, as some people would say, possess a certain amount of depth. Their unique personalities and traits distinguish them from the characters in similar novels. Harry embodies all of the characteristics of a true hero: courage, tenacity, and an inclination to protect others. Harry is willing to sacrifice everything, including his own life, to ensure the safety of others. Rowling accurately captures his desire to protect those he loves, whatever the cost.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI must admit, Rowling's imagination is extraordinary. Her original vision of a young boy sporting a lighting scar who attended boarding school was transformed into a seven book series teeming with the unimaginable. Rowling's creative prowess enabled her to establish an entirely new world filled with realistic people, magical creatures, and thrilling enchantments. The wizarding world was crafted so thoroughly that it is flawless. No minor detail of this alternate world was excluded, allowing readers to fully immerse themselves in the book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs the plot unfolded, readers received a glimpse of the growing complexity of the series. Rowling introduced specific details throughout the novel which the majority of readers overlook. These seemingly insignificant details, however, have a large impact upon later events within the book. My predictions of the events to come were quite far from the actual events that transpired. The shocking conclusion left me stunned and begging my mother to drive me to Barnes and Noble to purchase the second book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWhile Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone falls under the \"Fantasy\" genre, Rowling discretely incorporated many mythological and historical references into the novel, especially those pertaining to the works of Ancient Rome. First and foremost among these allusions is Hagrid's three-headed dog, Fluffy. The concept of such a creature is taken from Greek Mythology; according to legend, Cerberus, a three-headed dog, ferociously guarded the entrance to the Underworld. The only means of subduing Cerberus (and Fluffy, consequently) is the playing of a lyre. Additionally, the Hogwarts motto, \"Draco Dormiens Nunquam Titillandus,\" is Latin for \"Never tickle a sleeping dragon.\" Rowling relies heavily on her knowledge of Latin to create incantations and character names throughout the series.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI am most impressed not with the books themselves, but with the author whose rags-to-riches life story has inspired countless people worldwide. J.K. Rowling was born Joanne Kathleen Rowling into a poor family living in Gloucestershire, England. She was accepted at the University of Exeter, where she studied Classics. She was devastated when her mother died shortly after her graduation, having suffered from multiple sclerosis. Several years later, Rowling married Jorge Arantes and gave birth to their daughter, Jessica. The unhappy couple separated 13 months after their marriage. Homeless, penniless, and caring for a newborn, Rowling struggled with depression and contemplated suicide. We almost lost the brilliant, talented mind who is solely responsible for the series that has now become a worldwide phenomenon. Her rags to riches story inspires millions of people in similar situations. Despite her challenges, Rowling's perseverance and determination brought the world of Harry Potter to life.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOverall, this series is the most memorable from my childhood. I was originally introduced to the series in third grade and immediately fell in love with the realistic characters, suspenseful plot, and flawless writing style. I was the diehard fan who watched each movie a dozen times at the same movie theater, eventually coming to know the employees at the concessions stand on a first name basis. For Halloween last year, in fact, I dressed up in an old pair of robes, pulled on a wig, and drew a scar on my forehead. And to this day, I find myself reciting quotes from the series. I was crushed after the release of the final book, feeling that part of my childhood had ended with the series. Looking back, I have never once regretted the time I have spent reading and rereading the series, committing it to memory. The Harry Potter series has served as more than a way to pass the time; it has helped to shape the person I am today.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"17126119034109119247\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review226968334\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_226968334'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_226968334\" rel=\"nofollow\" class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_451290584\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/451290584\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Christopher\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/14386596-christopher\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Christopher\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1402231159p2/14386596.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/451290584?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 20, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Christopher\" class=\"user\" name=\"Christopher\" href=\"/user/show/14386596-christopher\"\u003eChristopher\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=fiction\"\u003efiction\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=kindle-unlimited\"\u003ekindle-unlimited\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=magic\"\u003emagic\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=adventure\"\u003eadventure\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=buddy-read\"\u003ebuddy-read\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14386596-christopher?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer451290584\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer8408723338119760618\"\u003eThere's a decent chance you won't like this book. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLet's be honest here. If you're reading my reviews and haven't read this series, you're probably an adult, which means two things. One is that you have lived through this series releasing 7 novels, 8 movies, and becoming a cultural phenomenon. If you're here, you felt that societal pressure to read this, or one of your friends won't shut up until you do (probably). There is little chance the hype can withstand reality. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd that is partly because.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText8408723338119760618\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThere's a decent chance you won't like this book. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLet's be honest here. If you're reading my reviews and haven't read this series, you're probably an adult, which means two things. One is that you have lived through this series releasing 7 novels, 8 movies, and becoming a cultural phenomenon. If you're here, you felt that societal pressure to read this, or one of your friends won't shut up until you do (probably). There is little chance the hype can withstand reality. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd that is partly because... you aren't eleven years old. This book is written for children. Yes, the books get darker and more mature (and much better) later on, but this one is for middle school aged kids.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis is my first time rereading book 1 in at least 6 years. This book commits sins I would never forgive if they occurred in a different book. The main characters are dumb, the authority figures should all be fired for child endangerment, and in order for some events to make any sense, one has to create their own head-canon. Typically at such points, I stop, remind myself that this is a children's book, and get a glass of Maker's 46.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut forgive them I do. Rowling creates a fantastic world, characters, and story over these seven books that makes it all worth it. If I were reading this for the first time today, I honestly do not know if I would DNF this due to the above sins or simply for it targeting a much different audience than adult me. But I do know that having read the rest of the series, it didn't even cross my mind not to finish this reread, despite seeing all of the problems. The writing is designed so the target audience ages with Harry, so while we never get adult novels, we do get much \"better\" writing in later books. If you read this book or even the first two and the writing is much of what turned you off, I encourage you to keep going for another couple of books.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs a final note, my rating for this book is for the series. I can't honestly rate this book by itself at this point.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"8408723338119760618\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review451290584\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_451290584'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_451290584\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/451290584?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e32 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_451290584\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_451290584\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=32\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=451290584\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_451290584\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 451290584, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003e9 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/451290584?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=5\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_451290584' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/451290584/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView all 9 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_451290584' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 451290584, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1536987673\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1536987673\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4748843-tracey-ya-book-addict\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454928266p2/4748843.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1536987673?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMar 13, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Tracey (YA Book Addict)\" href=\"/user/show/4748843-tracey-ya-book-addict\"\u003eTracey (YA Book Addict)\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          added it\n\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855652\" href=\"/book/show/22841994-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1536987673\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17909526225844684672\"\u003eI first picked up The Philosopher's Stone about seven years ago. I'd gone from reading true crime and biographies, to having just finished the Twilight saga, when the Harry Potter series was recommended to me. From memory I think I read the first two chapters and then put it down. It felt really young and I felt it just wasn't for me. So I moved on. After starting my IG account I was constantly bombarded with people telling me how amazing the series was and how I had to read it. I'm not even\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17909526225844684672\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI first picked up The Philosopher's Stone about seven years ago. I'd gone from reading true crime and biographies, to having just finished the Twilight saga, when the Harry Potter series was recommended to me. From memory I think I read the first two chapters and then put it down. It felt really young and I felt it just wasn't for me. So I moved on. After starting my IG account I was constantly bombarded with people telling me how amazing the series was and how I had to read it. I'm not even sure why I decided to give it another try, but I did. And it just goes to show that even if a book is not meant for you when you first pick it up, it doesn't mean that at another time it won't be something that you love. Because this book... This book was brilliant! It was enchanting and captivating and magical. I was completely engrossed from the very first page. I absolutely adored the friendship between Harry and Ron, and the dynamic was completed once Hermione was accepted into the little group. And Hermione, boy she was awesome! She had me grinning from ear to ear. I'm so intrigued by Snape, and I can't wait to peel back all his layers to see what he has hidden. And then there's the gentle giant that is Hagrid. My heart is so full of love for him. My favourite character so far! I can't tell you how incredibly happy I am to have given this series a second chance. I can now officially say I'm well on my way to being a Potterhead! \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"17909526225844684672\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border  \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/624662206?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 22, 2013\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Thomas\" class=\"user\" name=\"Thomas\" href=\"/user/show/2018505-thomas\"\u003eThomas\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=own-physical\"\u003eown-physical\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer624662206\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15305433346202603990\"\u003eBecause everyone on the planet excluding me and maybe some of the Kardashians have read this series, I'll skip the plot summary and go for a less formal review. I can see why so many people adore \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e. While Rowling does not introduce anything particularly groundbreaking in terms of fantasy or plot or characterization, she does abide by the hero's quest with great precision. Harry is the underdog from the start and you can't help but cheer him on as he overcomes obstacles with the help o\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15305433346202603990\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eBecause everyone on the planet excluding me and maybe some of the Kardashians have read this series, I'll skip the plot summary and go for a less formal review. I can see why so many people adore \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e. While Rowling does not introduce anything particularly groundbreaking in terms of fantasy or plot or characterization, she does abide by the hero's quest with great precision. Harry is the underdog from the start and you can't help but cheer him on as he overcomes obstacles with the help of his friends and his mentor. Each of the characters has a distinct personality, and Rowling's simple writing style leaves room for brevity and enough imagery to pull you into the setting. Story-wise, she includes all of the necessary elements: foreshadowing, conflicts that escalate to the climax, a pretty satisfying plot twist, etc.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'll probably read one other book in between each installment of this series. I'm looking forward to seeing the characters mature and the plot become darker as many others have said it will!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15305433346202603990\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));;        \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40816186-melisa?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40816186-melisa?shelf=rereads\"\u003erereads\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1593414832\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10299407915573078558\"\u003eRereading this magical book with these beautiful illustrations was such a new experience. Generally I had so much fun rereading this because I discovered so many little details I hadn't noticed the first time. But this new excitement of a page turner was amazing. I was so excited to see if there was going to be an illustration on the next page and how it would look like. Highly recommend. 10 out of 10 \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr
