LETTER FOR HOGWARTS?! I WANT IT!!!\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://photobucket.com/images/hogwarts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949739.gif\" alt=\"hogwarts photo: Hogwarts hogwarts2-1.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAfter two years of ESL my english teacher decided to assign me a book to read, and every day for a couple of hours she would stay with me and I'd have to read, circle all the words I didn't know and so much more... the book assigned was \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.\u003c/b\u003e After reading that book I started hating Harry Potter so much that I didn't want to see another book of his... \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eafter a couple of months the first movie was out and the sch\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText8480378708516559320\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e NOW WHERE IS MY LETTER FOR HOGWARTS?! I WANT IT!!!\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://photobucket.com/images/hogwarts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949739.gif\" alt=\"hogwarts photo: Hogwarts hogwarts2-1.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAfter two years of ESL my english teacher decided to assign me a book to read, and every day for a couple of hours she would stay with me and I'd have to read, circle all the words I didn't know and so much more... the book assigned was \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.\u003c/b\u003e After reading that book I started hating Harry Potter so much that I didn't want to see another book of his... \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eafter a couple of months the first movie was out and the school brought us to movie theater to watch it and I actually fell in love with the movie! So I've watched almost all the movies and then at a certain point I stopped and I promised myself that I wouldn't watch the last three movies, not until I would have read the series...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://photobucket.com/images/stupid\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949740.gif\" alt=\"stupid photo: with stupid stupid.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWell after 14 years I've finally had \u003ci\u003ethe courage to start this Saga \u003c/i\u003eand I'm so ashamed that I've waited so long... This book is adorable, perfect, I loved it!!! And I've already started the second one!!! Have to make up for all the years I've lost! D: But I've chosen to read it in my language, italian ;)... It's funny how a bad memory can influence you. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930348ra/12949830.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003eStupid Me!!! I almost risked never reading this wonderful saga...\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e... ... ... HARRY POTTER \u0026lt; 3 \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3 ... ... ...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eEven though I knew exactly what was going to happen and who the bad guy was, I was still surprised! Rowling has a way of capturing you completely! She has bewitched me completely!!!!!!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418296490ra/12736351.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMe after reading Harry Potter! \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e-----\u003cbr\u003eDopo quattordici anni sono finalmente riuscita a trovare il \"coraggio\" per iniziare questa saga. Eh si, coraggio. Dopo il trauma subito da piccola avevo paura di riprendere questo testo. Ogni volta che pensavo alla saga di Harry Potter mi rivedevo piccola, seduta accanto alla mia professoressa d'inglese che mi invitava a leggere e cerchiare tutte le parole che non comprendevo (che erano tantissime, considerando che ero appena uscita da ESL - classe per alunni stranieri nelle scuole americane - da pochissimo). E quindi successivamente non ho mai più voluto saperne di HARRY POTTER! Dannazione!!!! ... quanto mi pento di non aver trovato il coraggio prima... per fortuna Harry Potter è in grado di stupire non solo i bambini!!!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://photobucket.com/images/harry%20potter\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929987ra/12949765.gif\" alt=\"harry potter photo: glee tumblr_les06aCN1W1qahz0j.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDopo un paio di mesi dalla lettura del testo la scuola ci portò a vedere il nuovo film di Harry Potter al cinema, ma che dire... il film mi rapì completamente. Non vi era nessuno che mi osservava, solo io ed Harry. Ed iniziai a vedere anche i film successivi. Ma poi dopo il quarto mi imposi di fermarmi. \u003cb\u003eDovevo leggere la Saga di Harry Potter!\u003c/b\u003e ... beh dopo tanti anni eccomi qui!!! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930453ra/12949854.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e Harry forgive me!!! But I'm all yours now... ready to fly to Hogwarts with you!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eQuesto libro è dolcissimo!!! Harry, Ron, Hermione... ohhh can't wait to see how the love between the two grows!!! \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3 \u0026lt;3\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930782ra/12949933.gif\" width=\"300\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u0026lt;3 Una vera e propria fiaba \u003c/b\u003eche non stanca mai, che ti tiene incollata alle pagine! Un testo davvero unico, con protagonisti straordinari... e sto solo all'inizio! Non vedo l'ora di continuare... beh in realtà già sto leggendo il secondo! \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930570ra/12949874.gif\" width=\"250\" height=\"170\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eMisteri, magia, amici, nemici, incanti, scope volanti, pozioni, intrighi, lotte,\u003c/i\u003e, tanti ingredienti squisiti che non possono non suscitare una forte emozione. Amore. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e STUPENDO!!!\u003cbr\u003eI need more!!!!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1242475028\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Steve\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Steve\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1242475028?book_show_action=false\"\u003eApr 06, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Steve\" class=\"user\" name=\"Steve\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\"\u003eSteve\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015\"\u003eread-in-2015\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=rmfao-2015-genre-challenge\"\u003ermfao-2015-genre-challenge\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya\"\u003eya\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1242475028\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer137097988280161360\"\u003eOk, so this was my first time reading this book (don't judge me). While I wasn't quite as enamored with it as the thousands of adoring fans (the ones who have read them over and over and over) have been, this wasn't a bad read. I did have to keep reminding myself that this was a children's book, and I'm WAY past the target age! My son and daughter-in-law, along with the RMFAO group, have been after me to read these books. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm actually looking forward to reading the rest of the books, just to see\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText137097988280161360\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eOk, so this was my first time reading this book (don't judge me). While I wasn't quite as enamored with it as the thousands of adoring fans (the ones who have read them over and over and over) have been, this wasn't a bad read. I did have to keep reminding myself that this was a children's book, and I'm WAY past the target age! My son and daughter-in-law, along with the RMFAO group, have been after me to read these books. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm actually looking forward to reading the rest of the books, just to see how the books, and the characters, grow up. I haven't seen the movies, but I don't live under a rock either, and I know that each book progressively ages with the characters, turning from children's books with child-like problems, to books with adult issues and adult responses from the characters. I'm really hoping that things in the next books aren't so easy for Harry, Ron, and Hermione to solve. That's probably my biggest complaint, and why it \"only\" got four stars from me: everything was too easy, that the mysteries were laid out too simply and were easily solved. They were clever, and again, I had to keep reminding myself that it wasn't written with me in mind.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis first book was entertaining, as I've said, but it wasn't a five-star read (I'm going to be in trouble for that statement, I think!). It reminded me of a mash-up between the old Hardy Boys/Nancy Drew books (kids solving crimes with skills well beyond their age or abilities) and Scooby-Doo. Yes, Scooby-Doo! Especially at the end when the real bad guy was revealed (it wasn't who they thought it was), and the bad guy's reaction was, \"Darn you, meddling kids!\" (or something very similar). :D\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOn to the next book!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"137097988280161360\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n     Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed\"\u003ereviewed\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\"         \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1505654224\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer3244241858743736342\"\u003eI started reading this for the Nth time 3 days before the death of Alan Rickman, who played Snape in the adaptations- in my opinion the best thing about them. It was sad, heartbreaking really, to think of his character just beginning his journey again for me through this reading, while the man who played him so excellently had just passed away. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI love the adventure and magic of these books, but I especially love the journey we take with Snape's character. He is everything. So hard to love, but I\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3244241858743736342\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI started reading this for the Nth time 3 days before the death of Alan Rickman, who played Snape in the adaptations- in my opinion the best thing about them. It was sad, heartbreaking really, to think of his character just beginning his journey again for me through this reading, while the man who played him so excellently had just passed away. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI love the adventure and magic of these books, but I especially love the journey we take with Snape's character. He is everything. So hard to love, but I love him for it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI adore these books. That is all.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"3244241858743736342\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n Every time I read this book, it delights me all over again. There's nothing like it, accept no substitutes. Rowling has given the world a tremendous gift.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eJanuary 2016: Read the kids the illustrated edition aloud. They loved it. Boy had read it before, of course, but it was Baby Girl's first time, and she was hooked. Rowling has given the world a tremendous gift.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eJanuary 2016: Read the kids the illustrated edition aloud. They loved it. Boy had read it before, of course, but it was Baby Girl's first time, and she was hooked.             \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1269177142\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13095028708468452362\"\u003e[re-read August 2015] I won't write a full review, since pretty much everyone knows how this book goes! I'm just amazed by the amount of foreshadowing! JK Rowling must have exactly known how the story would evolve. I don't mind that this book is short, when I think of OOTP for example, I find the beginning (before they go to Hogwarts) too long and often boring... \u003c/span\u003e\n\n id=\"freeTextContainer11354897426683151158\"\u003eFirst read: this first edition hardcover is from october 2000, so I guess around that time..?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSecond read: buddyreread I'm really happy I still like my favorite character, Hagrid, as much, and I'm really happy the book was this good second t\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11354897426683151158\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eFirst read: this first edition hardcover is from october 2000, so I guess around that time..?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSecond read: buddyreread in June/July 2016, with good AND bookish friend \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/2778699-rowie\"\u003eRowie\u003c/a\u003e, how perfect is that :D.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt was a great experience to reread this book for the first time. I loved meeting all the characters again while I already knew them, and I love going back to places I already love. I'm really happy I still like my favorite character, Hagrid, as much, and I'm really happy the book was this good second time around as well. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI had some issues with   \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer18135951695531446005\"\u003eSo this is the first time I read Harry Potter (yeah I know WHY???) and now I can officially say it is AMAZING! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'd love to describe how this book made me feel but I just can't find a word to do it so let's say...you know that feeling when you didn't know a part of your heart was missing until you feel like something starts to fill it? Well, it was kind of like that (*starts crying*).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnyway, I recommend it to everyone who hasn't read it yet. I can asure you it's never too late to start reading Ha\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText18135951695531446005\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eSo this is the first time I read Harry Potter (yeah I know WHY???) and now I can officially say it is AMAZING! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'd love to describe how this book made me feel but I just can't find a word to do it so let's say...you know that feeling when you didn't know a part of your heart was missing until you feel like something starts to fill it? Well, it was kind of like that (*starts crying*).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnyway, I recommend it to everyone who hasn't read it yet. I can asure you it's never too late to start reading Harry Potter.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"18135951695531446005\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return id=\"freeTextContainer5420236368039783491\"\u003e\u0026lt;3\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1187751055\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1187751055\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1187751055\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1187751055'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_1187751055\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1187751055?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e30 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_1187751055\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1187751055\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=30\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1187751055\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_1187751055\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 1187751055, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003ecomment\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/1187751055?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=5\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1187751055' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1187751055' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 1187751055, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_9681448\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/9681448\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Mariel\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/647547-mariel\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Mariel\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451321467p2/647547.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/9681448?book_show_action=false\"\u003eNov 29, 2010\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Mariel\" class=\"user\" name=\"Mariel\" href=\"/user/show/647547-mariel\"\u003eMariel\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\u003cspan class=\"uitext greyText\"\u003eRecommends it for: \u003c/span\u003e\n           \u003cspan class=\"uitext reviewText\"\u003eHarry is the one I'll marry\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003eRecommended to Mariel by: \u003c/span\u003e\n      Potter you rotter\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer9681448\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6846662836700301342\"\u003eI'm not the usual Harry Potter fan, I don't think. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTo the well organized mind death is but the next great adventure.\" - Albus Dumbledore I don't wanna die! Who cares? My favorite Dumbledore is Aberforth. Y'know, the one who performed an experimental charm on goats and got sent to appear before the ministry for it. Albus isn't even sure he can read, for that matter. I'm more Aberforth on the wisdom scale, fo' sho'. (I once asked JK Rowling what the charm was. She said my guess was as good as hers\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6846662836700301342\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI'm not the usual Harry Potter fan, I don't think. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTo the well organized mind death is but the next great adventure.\" - Albus Dumbledore I don't wanna die! Who cares? My favorite Dumbledore is Aberforth. Y'know, the one who performed an experimental charm on goats and got sent to appear before the ministry for it. Albus isn't even sure he can read, for that matter. I'm more Aberforth on the wisdom scale, fo' sho'. (I once asked JK Rowling what the charm was. She said my guess was as good as hers. She also laughed evilly. I have my answer.) Wake up and smell the flowers? Huh? The goats are eating all the flowers and they sure smell experimental pretty. It wasn't as fun after Order of the Phoenix and the bitching commenced. Yeah, there were problems. But I'm not organized, I don't wanna die, and I never really cared how it ended as much as I cared about focusing on the cool little stuff.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI got into the series after Prisoner of Azkaban came out and before Goblet of Fire. (So it wasn't the movies or that Daniel Radcliffe was -then- Elijah Wood before he was uglier.) What made me want to read them? The Dursleys. I thought they sounded wonderfully delicious (they are hilarious. I love it when Vernon tells everyone that Harry attends \"St. Brutus' Center for Incurably Criminal Boys\". His Japanese golfer joke. When playing trivia games with friends I'd piss myself with excitement if I got a muggle question. \"Vernon's drill company is called Grunnings! Yes! I'm more amazing than all of you put together!\" Wonder why no one plays reindeer games with me anymore...) I love muggles.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI loved the stupid shit. No, not the mythology references. Yaaay she read Shakespeare. My Uncle Remus did too. Not even that she listened to The Smiths and The Beatles while coming up with the series (I do love that). I loved the Aberforth goat stuff. I loved the names of Lockhart's books (Gadding with Ghouls, Year with the Yeti, etc.) and the little humor stuff she slips in. I can still quote asshole-y things that Draco Malfoy taunted them with (Potter stinks!) and can't remember the basic plot twists. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was a card carrying Potterite (laminated!). Sigh. I do miss wondering what was going to happen next. I miss having that place to retreat to in my mind. I'd go on my favorite Harry forum and have fun making up theories (I was right about EVERYYTHING *coughs*). I'm jealous of JK Rowling for having that place in her mind. Yeah, I've got my own stories. But I don't think I have as much fun with mine (probably because I'm not a sadistic murderer like she is). \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI liked the books better before they grew up. Rowling couldn't write a love story for anything. I hated it whenever Ron was mad at Harry. My favorite Buffy seasons to watch when depressed are the first three because the core group are still together. I love the togetherness. (Aberforth was eventually important in the last book. That almost ruined it.)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eP.s. In case I didn't look dorky enough... I used to get into rabid debates about the English to American changes with the transatlantic fans. They were all like: \"Americans are so dumb that you don't understand what Philosopher means.\" I delivered eighteen shots to their stomach with my comebacks about Lee not being black in their versions, JK Rowlings name being JK in the first place (it doesn't mean Just Kidding. The publishers thought boys wouldn't read a female author), and their effing ugly covers (English kids lose so often. No Edward Gorey for Joan Aiken's books!). I did know that jumper meant sweater. It's not just a Hayden Christensen vehicle.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"6846662836700301342\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review9681448\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_9681448'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_9681448\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/9681448?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e29 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_9681448\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_9681448\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_9681448\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 9681448, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003e3 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/9681448?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=5\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_9681448' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/9681448/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView all 3 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 9681448, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_855877673\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/855877673\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Sharon\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/10827825-sharon\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Sharon\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1462601237p2/10827825.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/855877673?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 14, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Sharon\" class=\"user\" name=\"Sharon\" href=\"/user/show/10827825-sharon\"\u003eSharon\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855652\" href=\"/book/show/22841994-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/10827825-sharon?shelf=reviewed-2015\"\u003ereviewed-2015\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer855877673\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4260102339599215381\"\u003eI found the idea of this series of books wonderful. When they were released there were not a lot of children's books that were set in the world of magic. I think for me the greatest thing about this book is, it teaches children and adults alike that, you can achieve anything you wish even when you think that it is impossible. I also think the theme of friendship is important, people can be friends whether you agree with everything about them or not, Hermione is a great example of that throughout\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4260102339599215381\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI found the idea of this series of books wonderful. When they were released there were not a lot of children's books that were set in the world of magic. I think for me the greatest thing about this book is, it teaches children and adults alike that, you can achieve anything you wish even when you think that it is impossible. I also think the theme of friendship is important, people can be friends whether you agree with everything about them or not, Hermione is a great example of that throughout the book, she is more of a straight-laced student but she befriends Ron and Harry. She tells them it is to keep them out of trouble, but I believe deep down she is actually happy that she has found people that like a bit of adventure, it is something new to her. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOne aspect of the story that there has been a lot of discussion about is, why Harry was left with the Dursley's after the death of his parents. Although it is clear that Harry is not treated very well at all, I think this was the best place for Harry to grow up. Although he cannot understand why they do not like him because of his magical ability, they teach Harry a very valuable lesson...kindness, when he comes across all different kinds of people at Hogwarts, he is more prone to showing kindness to them after the way he has been treated by the Dursley's. They also have taught him how to stand up for himself when he is taunted by Draco Malfoy.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling has the ability to create a world that every reader of these books wishes to enter and never leave. With owls that deliver the mail, a magical school where anything is possible and lets not forget the moving pictures, Hogwarts is a place that will live in the hearts of fans for years to come. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAll and all a great start to what looks like a fantastic series. If you are a fan of all things magical and have not delved into the world of Harry Potter yet, I would highly recommend you give this series a chance.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"4260102339599215381\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review855877673\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_855877673'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_855877673\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/855877673?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e29 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9781408845646\" href=\"/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1425021125\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7494137726759143513\"\u003eEs muy difícil escribir una reseña sobre una saga que me ha acompañado en tantos momentos diferentes de mi vida. Todavía recuerdo cuando mis padres me regalaron ‘Harry Potter y el prisionero de Azkaban’ y aluciné en colores con el mundo que me encontré entre sus páginas. Tendría 11 o 12 años y creo que fue perfecto cruzarme con esta historia por aquel entonces. Inmediatamente me enteré de que lo que acababa de leer era la tercera entrega de una serie y fui corriendo a hacerme con los dos\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7494137726759143513\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eEs muy difícil escribir una reseña sobre una saga que me ha acompañado en tantos momentos diferentes de mi vida. Todavía recuerdo cuando mis padres me regalaron ‘Harry Potter y el prisionero de Azkaban’ y aluciné en colores con el mundo que me encontré entre sus páginas. Tendría 11 o 12 años y creo que fue perfecto cruzarme con esta historia por aquel entonces. Inmediatamente me enteré de que lo que acababa de leer era la tercera entrega de una serie y fui corriendo a hacerme con los dos anteriores, que leí en cuestión de días. Entiendo perfectamente que supusiera el acercamiento a la literatura para miles de niños que no habían mostrado antes ningún interés por los libros. Aunque en mi caso yo ya era una lectora regular, no consigo recordar ningún otro libro o saga que me hubiera tenido leyendo tantas horas seguidas y en un estado tal de ensimismamiento.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReseña completa y mi versión de la portada en \u003ca target=\"_blank\"     \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer363148348\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7257334211295540388\"\u003eI LOVE Harry Potter, fantastic start to the series.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReread December 2014 for #HarryXmasToYou\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere are SO MANY foreshadowing things I never noticed before! Like the centaurs talking about the innocent being the first to die? And just so many things just mentioned that come up later, the dragon in Gringotts, Dittany, Sirius Black, Etc.\u003cbr /\u003eThere's also a lot of things I've forgotten weren't in the movie, which is crazy! But so good. I love it just as much IF NOT EVEN MORE.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"✞Ƙєℓℓу✧Sтєℓℓαя Scяυтιηу✞\" class=\"user\" name=\"✞Ƙєℓℓу✧Sтєℓℓαя Scяυтιηу✞\" href=\"/user/show/24407332-s-sc\"\u003e✞Ƙєℓℓу✧Sтєℓℓαя amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar href=\"/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=all-time-favorites\"\u003eall-time-favorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=way-better-than-i-thought\"\u003eway-better-than-i-thought\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=i-regret-not-reading-this-sooner\"\u003ei-regret-not-reading-this-sooner\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=all-the-right-books-challenge\"\u003eall-the-right-books-challenge\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=young-adult\"\u003eyoung-adult\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1321888040\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer14736090222449240584\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e \u003cb\u003e \u003ci\u003e“You haven't got a letter on yours,\" George observed. \"I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.”\u003c/i\u003e \u003c/b\u003e \u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stellarscrutinyblog.wordpress.com/2015/11/08/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-harry-potter-1-by-j-k-rowling/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eOriginally posted on Stellar Scrutiny Book Blog.\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eWell, it turns out all those Muggles were right…\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429979195ra/14655508.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI didn’t enjoy reading until a few years ago. Having suffered through so many years of school required reading, I couldn’t look at a book without thinking of essays! Not to mention my distaste for writing at the time. All that changed ho\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText14736090222449240584\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003e“You haven't got a letter on yours,\" George observed. \"I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.”\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stellarscrutinyblog.wordpress.com/2015/11/08/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-harry-potter-1-by-j-k-rowling/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eOriginally posted on Stellar Scrutiny Book Blog.\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eWell, it turns out all those Muggles were right…\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429979195ra/14655508.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI didn’t enjoy reading until a few years ago. Having suffered through so many years of school required reading, I couldn’t look at a book without thinking of essays! Not to mention my distaste for writing at the time. All that changed however, with one book that was so magnificent, it must have been a gift from God! It completely altered my view of books. What was this holy novel, you might be asking? …It wasn’t Harry Potter. It was The Hunger Games. As my eyes were opened to the Young Adult genre, my love of reading began. Shortly after reading The Hunger Games, I made a deal with my friend, who passionately loved the Harry Potter books and had been trying to get me to read them for quite some time. If she read the first Hunger Games book, I’d read the first Harry Potter book. Flash forward a few months, and wouldn’t you know it, my friend read the whole trilogy! Did I breeze through all seven Harry Potter books in a week? HAHAHAHAHA, NO.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eYou want to know the best part? That was 3 years ago…\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444407231ra/16497076.gif\" alt=\"description\" width=\"400\" height=\"175\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI had been hearing about Harry Potter since I knew how to read, but really disliked the concept of it. \u003ci\u003eIt's just about some stupid boy who goes to a school for wizards! Also, I've heard it rips off Lord of the Rings, so I'm going to stay as far away from it as possible....\u003c/i\u003eSee, the funny thing about this is, I actually knew nothing about Harry Potter. Nothing. Zip. Nada. I hadn't even seen more than 5 minutes of the movies! *gasps* After having a hundred or so people threatening me to read it, out of fear for my life, I complied. I certainly am glad I did. It was incredible! Absolutely stupendous!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eThe Characters\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003e\"So light a fire!\" Harry choked. \u003cbr\u003e\"Yes...of course...but there's no wood!\"\u003cbr\u003e\"HAVE YOU GONE MAD!\" Ron bellowed. \"ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eUndoubtedly, my favorite part of this beautiful book was its beautiful characters. Harry, Hermione, Ron, Fred, George...I love them all! Ironically, Harry was my least favorite of the trio. Not that I didn't like him, but he just didn't have as distinct of a personality as Hermione and Ron. However, I still admired his loyalty and selflessness. I'm really excited to see how his character develops throughout the series.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eHermione.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIs it bad if I see a lot of myself in Hermione? Haha. I can be the occasional smart-alec who gets all up in your business...so, naturally, I love Hermione Granger. She wasn't a Mary Sue! She was intelligent, loyal, and feisty! There really should be more heroines like her. I also have brown hair, brown eyes, and am Muggle-born...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWe're practically the same person.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1447190765ra/16967495.gif\" alt=\"description\" width=\"400\" height=\"170\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eRon.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHe was pretty great too. Having four siblings (two of which, are twins), I can relate to him. Ron and Hermione's bickering was positively priceless, and he had more than a few memorable remarks. He was the comedy relief of the whole book, and it wouldn't be the same without him.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eMalfoy.\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI was really hoping this little git would get devoured by Fluffy.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eOther characters.\u003c/b\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHagrid, was hilarious, and is it strange if I am particularly fond of Hedwig? Dumbledore didn't really have that much screen time, so I don't really know what to think of him...yet. My favorite, or should I say favorites, are definitely Gred and Froge. *wink* I swear, I was cracking up over every dialogue they had. As a matter of fact, I loved all the Weasleys.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003e\n    \u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cbr\u003e“Now, you two – this year, you behave yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've – you've blown up a toilet or –\"\u003cbr\u003e\"Blown up a toilet? We've never blown up a toilet.\"\u003cbr\u003e\"Great idea though, thanks, Mum.”\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n  \u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eThe World Building\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI finally see why everyone admires J.K. Rowling. Hogwarts and the wizard world she creates is whimsically ingenious. Honestly, why can't Quidditch be a real sport? It's fantastic! I want to ride a broom stick and hit flying balls into peoples' faces! All flavor jelly beans? How awesome is that? Apparently, you can buy them from Amazon...including earwax flavor (Eww, wasn't licorice bad enough?). I'm not kidding, look it up! Rowling did a marvelous job of luring me into Potter's world. The only aspect of the universe that puzzles me, is where exactly is Hogwarts? Is it in a different universe from our reality? If so, how are Harry and Ron (I started a wee bit on Chamber of Secrets...as soon as I finished this one) able to fly a car there?!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eWhat I Loved\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe protagonist and side characters.\u003c/b\u003e Lovely, lovely, lovely characters. Rowling did a spectacular job of creating such a hilarious and realistic cast.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe plot was highly entertaining.\u003c/b\u003e Though a little short, Harry and his friends' adventure was incredibly entertaining and I am especially curious about what other secrets Hogwarts holds...\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eRowling's writing was pleasant and engaging.\u003c/b\u003e A little simple, yes, but short and sweet. What else should I expect from a Middle Grade novel?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe plot twist in the end.\u003c/b\u003e I'm not going to lie, I felt quite childish that I didn't see it coming. It was so obvious, yet I was too busy laughing over Harry swallowing Quidditch balls to notice what was right in front of me.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e⚜ \u003cb\u003eThe villains.\u003c/b\u003e *claps* Well done, Rowling. Well done.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cu\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003e\n    \u003ci\u003eWhat I Didn't Love\u003c/i\u003e\n  \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/u\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e⚜ The pacing.\u003c/b\u003e A short novel? Understandable. An abrupt ending? Inexcusable.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003e\n    \u003cu\u003eFinal Thoughts\u003c/u\u003e\n  \u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI hope all you Muggles are happy now!  I finally did it!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1447191144ra/16967517.gif\" alt=\"description\" width=\"400\" height=\"160\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHarry Potter was so wonderful!  I really should've read it all those years ago.  The characters were exceptional, story incredible, writing amiable...honestly, what else can I say, other than it truly was a magical book.  I'll absolutely be finishing this series. :)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"14736090222449240584\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1321888040\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" THIS IS EPIC. FUCKING EPIC. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e_____________________________________________________________\u003cbr /\u003eGuys my little sister just came put to me with this book in her hand and asked if I wanted to BR with her. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eShe looked so happy when I said yes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv   \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_274070323\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/274070323\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Alejandro\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/665584-alejandro\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Alejandro\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1328672389p2/665584.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/274070323?book_show_action=false\"\u003eSep 12, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Alejandro\" class=\"user\" name=\"Alejandro\" href=\"/user/show/665584-alejandro\"\u003eAlejandro\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780590353403\" href=\"/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=magic\"\u003emagic\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=novel\"\u003enovel\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer274070323\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer186578383974218479\"\u003eIt was interesting how I ended reading finally the books of Harry Potter. I'd heard some comment here and there even before of the first film from some acquaintances and I had the general knowledge that it was becoming a phenomenon, but still I didn't feel compelled to read the books. I've been reader all my life but I don't know, I was kinda undecided about it. Then, the films came out, and I started to watch them, and still I wasn't eager to read the books, since I thought, hey, I am watching\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText186578383974218479\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt was interesting how I ended reading finally the books of Harry Potter. I'd heard some comment here and there even before of the first film from some acquaintances and I had the general knowledge that it was becoming a phenomenon, but still I didn't feel compelled to read the books. I've been reader all my life but I don't know, I was kinda undecided about it. Then, the films came out, and I started to watch them, and still I wasn't eager to read the books, since I thought, hey, I am watching the films, so what may I am losing about the story (oh boy! how wrong I was!). I had some good surprises because I wasn't reading the books like in the third movie. When I watched the fourth film, \u003ci\u003eGoblet of Fire\u003c/i\u003e, I was commenting it with a friend that he was reading the books on Spanish and he told me enough stuff that was in the fourth book \u003cb\u003eBUT\u003c/b\u003e it was missed on the fourth film that I decided then to read the books. Oddly enough while my friend was been reading the books on Spanish, he had an edition on English of the first book, this one, and since by then I already was reading on English, he lent me the book. Usually I am quite reluctant to borrow books or that people lent me books. I had some bad experiences borrowing books and while I am dependable and careful about stuff that it's not mine, still I don't want to have books, etc... that are not mine under my care. Still, my friend insisted and he told me that he was glad that somebody read the book since he bought it in an impulse thinking that he would read it but he aborted the mission and he prefer to read on Spanish. Since I wasn't SO convinced to read the books, I ended accepting the offer of that he lent me the book. I started to reading it... \u003cb\u003eOH MY GOODNESS!!!\u003c/b\u003e Right in the first pages, when Hagrid mentioned \u003cb\u003eWHO\u003c/b\u003e lent him out the flying motorcycle!!! \u003cb\u003eOH MY GOODNESS!!!\u003c/b\u003e Keep on mind that I already watched 4 films by then, so reading the identity of the real owner of the motorcycle, mentioned in so casual way and right in the beginning of the saga! \u003cb\u003eOH MY GOODNESS!!!\u003c/b\u003e Then, I knew that J.K. Rowling was a wicked genius!!! And this first book kept me surprising me even when I was already reading the fifth book, since certain character that appears in the first book, then I said \"Oh, boy, what a boring chapter, why did J.K. bothered to create such unimportant character?\" and I was starting to read the fifth book and... \"Mmh... where I heard about this character before...where?...mmmh...OH MY GOODNESS!!! NO!!! IT CAN'T BE!!!\". By then, I had returned the borrowed book but I had bought my own copy for the collection and I consulted it and POW! Yes, it was the same character!!! Right in the first book!!! So, re-confirmed like for the umpteenth time... J.K. Rowling is a wicked genius!!! I enjoyed a lot reading the first book. J.K. Rowling has a very interesting style of writing. Also, the first book is very good combining the magical world with the normal things that people has to do when kids are beginning school. Going to buy the school supplies. Having to deal different kind of teachers. Some good, some strict, some both. The forming of friendships with schoolmates. Indeed a wonderful and magical book. Highly recommended.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"186578383974218479\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n            \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1414788363\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5621447798058727872\"\u003eI absolutely adore this new edition of Harry Potter and I hope that they will make illustrated versions of all of the books (although they might get quite big...) \u003cbr /\u003eGetting to experience this story once again, after not having read the book for a long time and this time with beautiful illustrations to complement the story was a truly magnificent experience. J.K. Rowling is the queen!!\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter is and will always be one of my all time favorite series \u0026lt;3 \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer191845382\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer14573242452337598853\"\u003eThis won't be a proper review, just review here\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e-----\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe first time I had heard of Harry Potter was when my brother brought home the movie for 'Sorcerer's Stone' ... he wasn't a reader but the movie had appealed to him. It looked interesting to me to so we had a movie night and watched it together. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMichael (my brother) didn't think much of the movie himself... I think he ga\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText14573242452337598853\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThis won't be a proper review, just me reminiscing and some fangirling via gifs... you have been warned ;-P\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eBuddyread of the first three with \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/30679152-melissa\"\u003eMelissa\u003c/a\u003e :)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/914602602\"\u003eMelissa's review here\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e-----\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe first time I had heard of Harry Potter was when my brother brought home the movie for 'Sorcerer's Stone' ... he wasn't a reader but the movie had appealed to him. It looked interesting to me to so we had a movie night and watched it together. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMichael (my brother) didn't think much of the movie himself... I think he gave it to me afterwards and said nothing else about it. As for me, the movie didn't blow me away, at first. It did get me curious enough to pick up the first book. I remember falling love with everything about it, finishing the book quicker than I had finished one before and immediately hungry for the next one.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAt the time, I didn't know popular the series was... I just knew I loved it and had to read them as quickly as possible. By the time I discovered these beautiful books, the first four were already out and OoTP was released not long after... needless to say, I caught on quickly as to how big the fandom was. \u003cbr\u003eI loved the it all though, it felt like a big family :) I loved to hear people swap theories while waiting in line, and soak the whole atmosphere as we all eagerly waited for the bookstore to open (ours never had midnight release parties but they did open extra early).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis is part of my book family :) \u0026lt;3\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1451795196ra/17605525.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1451795196ra/17605526.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg data-src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451795196r/17605528.gif\" style=\";display:none;\" data-error=\"[image error]\" onerror=\"$j(this).loadHostedImage();\" \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=feminine\"\u003efeminine\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=ce20\"\u003ece20\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=2016\"\u003e2016\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bookshelf\"\u003ebookshelf\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer134292138\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12658698963123474506\"\u003e[First read: December 2001. 3 stars. \u003cbr /\u003eSecond read: 18th January, 2016. 3 stars.]\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRead as part of the \u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge\u003c/a\u003e based on the BBC's Big Read poll.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis was my first read of Harry Potter since 2001. I'm fairly certain I only read it because of the film, which makes me feel neither better or worse for it. \u003ci\u003eand The Philosopher's Stone\u003c/i\u003e is a relatively quick read with either very good, wonderful writing or some of the worst writing imaginable. Thankfully, most of the time it wa\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText12658698963123474506\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e[First read: December 2001. 3 stars. \u003cbr /\u003eSecond read: 18th January, 2016. 3 stars.]\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRead as part of the \u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge\u003c/a\u003e based on the BBC's Big Read poll.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis was my first read of Harry Potter since 2001. I'm fairly certain I only read it because of the film, which makes me feel neither better or worse for it. \u003ci\u003eand The Philosopher's Stone\u003c/i\u003e is a relatively quick read with either very good, wonderful writing or some of the worst writing imaginable. Thankfully, most of the time it was simple children's story writing, which made me feel at home with the book right away.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'll say that the world was rather more lacklustre than I ever really remembered it being. It's quite a small world, really, in this first book and there's not an awful lot of world-building, but such a short book I think that's fair enough. The plot felt a little badly-stitched together in some places, as if they'd be written separately and then threaded together later. There were a few eye-roll moments, and some really ridiculous moments, but there were also some lovely moments, great characters I'd forgotten about and overall a nice flow to how it all panned out.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe thing I'm most looking forward to is the development of Hermione. I don't really like Harry all that much, and Ron is just one of those \"oh, you're here\" characters to me, and my favourite Luna won't be turning up for another four books or so, although I didn't remember that Hermione had been purposefully described as \u003cb\u003eBossy\u003c/b\u003e and I'm so excited to see how she changes in the books. Honestly, she was always my favourite.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm glad I'm re-reading the series. I'm so glad I'm not going to become obsessed: I'm so glad I'm not going to remove it from my heart altogether, too. It's taken a while, and I needn't have been scared to do this, but that's what happens with \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e, I suppose.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"12658698963123474506\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n   Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2348494-spider-the-doof-warrior?shelf=i-love-this-book\"\u003ei-love-this-book\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer57105614\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6355634265616560496\"\u003eFirst of all, this book ought to be the Philosopher's stone, dang it. We Americans are NOT STUPID.\u003cbr /\u003eSecond of all,this is the book that started it all. It's classic! I first read it in college and I enjoyed it so much, the funny candy names, the characters, the reader is taken along with Harry on a magical adventure they will never forget.\u003cbr /\u003eI have read this book, this series many times. The enjoyment of it usually doesn't wane. There's maybe a few minor inconsistencies, but all and all it's just too\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6355634265616560496\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eFirst of all, this book ought to be the Philosopher's stone, dang it. We Americans are NOT STUPID.\u003cbr /\u003eSecond of all,this is the book that started it all. It's classic! I first read it in college and I enjoyed it so much, the funny candy names, the characters, the reader is taken along with Harry on a magical adventure they will never forget.\u003cbr /\u003eI have read this book, this series many times. The enjoyment of it usually doesn't wane. There's maybe a few minor inconsistencies, but all and all it's just too enjoyable. It's earl grey tea. It's eating a delicious sundae. It's sprawling in your bed on a weekend just enjoying a good book that doesn't nag you, but it entertains you. It's a great book and you can see why JK Rowling went from being a struggling single mother to a kajillionaire because she is just that good.\u003cbr /\u003eNot perfect, no writer is, but great enough.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt's still very good. But dang it, I hate that Hagrid got everyone in trouble! \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"6355634265616560496\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return href=\"/review/list/13798293-kristie?shelf=audible\"\u003eaudible\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer438377188\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer18124006641072739996\"\u003eJust finished my third reading of this book, which is saying something for someone who doesn't typically re-read anything. The first time I read this book was the paperback and I bought the rest of the series as they were published. Last time, I listened to the audio and loved Jim Dale's narration, so I just listened to it again. I may actually re-read the paper book at some point too. It is just such a fun story and I have grown to love the characters. I plan to re-read the rest of the series\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText18124006641072739996\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eJust finished my third reading of this book, which is saying something for someone who doesn't typically re-read anything. The first time I read this book was the paperback and I bought the rest of the series as they were published. Last time, I listened to the audio and loved Jim Dale's narration, so I just listened to it again. I may actually re-read the paper book at some point too. It is just such a fun story and I have grown to love the characters. I plan to re-read the rest of the series this time around. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOriginal review: Such a classic. Love the story. I listened to the audio narrated by Jim Dale and he did an amazing job. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"18124006641072739996\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7644592674023933711\"\u003eTodavía no puedo creer una cosa: lo abandoné por un tiempo porque se me estaba haciendo aburrido/lento y cuando lo retomé me di cuenta de \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1223225201\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer18292611277914835583\"\u003eWell, this book was released when I was only 3 years old, and the final one came out when I was 7. Obviously, I was unable to read them then. I wasn't interested in the movies until last year (2014) when I watched them all when I was sick! I never had interest in the books until watching the movie, but I always assumed I would read them at some point. I AM SO GLAD I FINALLY STARTED READING THEM. I LOVE THESE BOOKS SO MUCH. I also can't believe I deprived myself of the amazingness that is Harry\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText18292611277914835583\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eWell, this book was released when I was only 3 years old, and the final one came out when I was 7. Obviously, I was unable to read them then. I wasn't interested in the movies until last year (2014) when I watched them all when I was sick! I never had interest in the books until watching the movie, but I always assumed I would read them at some point. I AM SO GLAD I FINALLY STARTED READING THEM. I LOVE THESE BOOKS SO MUCH. I also can't believe I deprived myself of the amazingness that is Harry Potter for so many years. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"18292611277914835583\" href=\"#\"            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer14299358753935026946\"\u003eThis is where it all began, where we were introduced to Harry Potter, Rowling's magical world, a series of exciting adventures and the excellent characters and environments she has given to English literature. It set the standard for contemporary fantasy. Rowling make full use of classic literary and mythological references, freeing herself from the confines of the merely topical, while giving it all a daring sense of newness. This series will live forever.\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr href=\"/book/show/22841994-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/48647071-alexxy?shelf=2016-reads\"\u003e2016-reads\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1533467998\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer51145799742296308\"\u003eThe number of times I've read this book has gotten out of hand and yet, I can never get tired of reading Harry Potter.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAlthough I believe I should mark this as my first time reading the books in English; all the previous times has been the translated version. It's like a whole other world! Almost as if I'm reading the book for the first time!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1533467998\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv
