class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_33809924\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/33809924\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"asdewi\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1302781-asdewi\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"asdewi\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1348393946p2/1302781.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/33809924?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJan 24, 2013\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"asdewi\" class=\"user\" name=\"asdewi\" href=\"/user/show/1302781-asdewi\"\u003easdewi\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747532743\" href=\"/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=children-story\"\u003echildren-story\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=5-bintang\"\u003e5-bintang\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=well-written\"\u003ewell-written\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=i-own\"\u003ei-own\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer33809924\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15761276931299037260\"\u003eWow...nggak kerasa sudah 15 tahun sejak saya kenalan sama Harry Potter dan terpesona pada dunia buatan Madame Rowling ini. Saya tahu kalo saya mestinya bikin review, tapi sebelum itu, rasanya pengen nostalgia saat pertama kenalan sama bocah dengan luka berbentuk petir ini.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSaya pertama ketemu Harry Potter di Bras Basah, sekitar akhir 1997. Saat itu saya sedang asyik memilih-milih buku bekas ketika shopkeeper-nya menawari saya buku ini. Dia berpromosi kalo ini buku bagus banget dan sayang banget k\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15761276931299037260\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eWow...nggak kerasa sudah 15 tahun sejak saya kenalan sama Harry Potter dan terpesona pada dunia buatan Madame Rowling ini. Saya tahu kalo saya mestinya bikin review, tapi sebelum itu, rasanya pengen nostalgia saat pertama kenalan sama bocah dengan luka berbentuk petir ini.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSaya pertama ketemu Harry Potter di Bras Basah, sekitar akhir 1997. Saat itu saya sedang asyik memilih-milih buku bekas ketika shopkeeper-nya menawari saya buku ini. Dia berpromosi kalo ini buku bagus banget dan sayang banget kalo ampe gak saya beli. Dia juga bilang kalo Harry Potter ini lagi happening banget di Inggris sana.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWaktu itu saya kenal internet cuma sebatas email dan chatting doang, gak pernah browsing. Saya pun bukan tipe yang langganan majalah ato koran, jadi saya benar-benar gak tahu kalo ada buku berjudul Harry Potter yang lagi booming. Saya malah curiga kalo buku ini adalah buku jelek yang gak laku. Ya logikanya aja, kalo emang tuh buku buagus banget kok udah ada yang jual second-nya di Bras Basah? Dan kalo emang laris buanget, kenapa juga si shopkeeper maksa-maksa saya buat beli? Tebakan saya sih ini buku gak laku dan si shopkeeper mo nepu saya (Oh...how stupid I was).\u003cbr /\u003eAkhirnya buku Harry Potter 1 itu saya beli juga karena sang shopkeeper menjamin saya boleh tukar dengan buku lain kalo nggak puas. Dan begitulah awalnya saya kenal sama Harry Potter.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRasanya saya gak perlu menulis sinopsis buku ini ato bahkan memberi tahu buku ini termasuk dalam genre apa. I mean, seriously? Sudah 15 tahun lebih sejak demam Harry Potter melanda dunia, it's been all over the news. Kalo bahkan ampe detik ini Anda nggak tahu garis besar cerita Harry Potter, berarti Anda emang gak berminat sama buku ini. Then why bothers now? ;)\u003cbr /\u003eJadi lebih baik saya membahas apa yang saya rasakan sewaktu membaca kembali buku ini setelah 15 tahun berlalu.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYang \u003cb\u003epertama\u003c/b\u003e saya rasa sih \"aura\"nya yang beda. Sewaktu pertama baca Harry Potter dulu, teman-teman saya gak ada yang ngeh sama buku ini (yah sebenernya ampe sekarang temen saya yang baca buku ini juga sedikit sih :| ). Jadi saya heboh sendiri, bahas buku ini sendirian (dan dapat tatapan loe-ngomong-apa-sih dari teman-teman) bahkan fangirling pun sendirian \u003ci\u003e#kasian\u003c/i\u003e. Sekarang ini, berkat GR dan BBI, saya jadi kenal banyak orang yang juga ngefans sama Harry Potter bahkan ampe baca bareng. Jelas vibe-nya beda banget. Dan itu menyenangkan. Horeeeee....saya masuk golongan mainstream \u003ci\u003e#hehe\u003c/i\u003e.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYang \u003cb\u003ekedua\u003c/b\u003e, saya mengubah pandangan saya tentang Harry di buku pertama. Awal baca dulu, saya beranggapan Harry ini kepo banget. \u003ci\u003e\"Kenapa sih pusing banget sama kemungkinan Sorcerer Stone dicuri sama Voldemort? Kenapa gak kirim Hedwig aja ke Dumbledore sih buat warning?\"\u003c/i\u003e-- itu adalah pertanyaan saya dulu.\u003cbr /\u003eSekarang saya ngerti kenapa.\u003cbr /\u003eSeperti yang dibilang Harry, Dumbledore tahu bahwa Harry butuh untuk mencoba melawan karena pertarungan dengan Voldemort itu personal untuk Harry. Gimana pun, Voldemort lah yang membunuh orangtua Harry. Dan Harry sadar kalo Voldemort bisa kembali menyerang dia.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTapi terutama, karena Harry sadar bahwa kembalinya Voldemort dapat membuat dia kehilangan dunia sihir.\u003cbr /\u003eHe was nothing in the muggle world. Gak punya siapa pun dan apa pun. Lalu dia menemukan semuanya di dunia sihir : sahabat, kebahagiaan dan terutama : penerimaan. Penerimaan yang tak pernah dia dapatkan sebelumnya. \u003cbr /\u003eGak heran kalo Harry berkeras mempertahankannya. I'd do the same if I were him. I'd fight the nastiest wizard if I have to in order not to let something most precious being taken from me. So I could understand Harry's determination to fight Voldemort even when he's still a kid.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eKetiga\u003c/b\u003e, ternyata saya sudah suka Ron dari buku ke 1 X).\u003cbr /\u003eJangan salah, dari trio itu Ron memang favorit saya kok. Saya suka Ron karena kalimatnya yang witty dan rada sarkastis, belum lagi sindirannya yang tajam. Tapi kualitas itu baru keliatan di buku kedua (ato malah ketiga?). Yang pasti bukan di buku pertama.\u003cbr /\u003eDulu saya gak ngerti apa yang bikin saya bersimpati sama Ron sejak awal. Sekarang saya tahu. Karena Ron orang pertama yang \"menerima\" Harry. Dia gak meremehkan Harry seperti yang dilakukan Malfoy, tapi dia juga gak memujanya secara berlebihan. Dia menganggap Harry sama normalnya dengan dia, and that's enough.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eKeempat\u003c/b\u003e, saya makin kagum dengan persahabatan Ron dan Hermione. They're true bestfriends.\u003cbr /\u003eTanpa ragu Ron dan Hermione menemani Harry untuk melawan Voldemort walopun mereka tahu resikonya. I mean, saya ngerti kesetiaan Ron dan Hermione pada Harry di buku ke-7. They've come a long way. Tapi di buku 1? Saat mereka baru kenal 1 tahun kurang serta belum ngeh seberapa parah kondisinya kalo Voldemort kembali berkuasa? That's great.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eKelima\u003c/b\u003e, perubahan karakter Neville kerasa banget ya. Neville yang penakut dan gak berani membela dirinya sungguh berbeda dengan Neville di buku ke-7. I forgot how awkward, clumsy and shy Neville was. But let's talk about him on the later book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eKeenam\u003c/b\u003e, wow...penerjemah Harry Potter ini keren sekali ya.\u003cbr /\u003eSaya sudah pernah sih baca versi Inggris dan terjemahan buku ini (untuk reread yang ini, saya baca versi Inggrisnya lagi), dan dari dulu memang saya tahu penerjemahnya emang canggih. Tapi baru sekarang saya benar-benar ngeh..\u003cbr /\u003eMirror of Erised diterjemahkan Cermin Tarsah. Erised yang merupakan anagram dari desire, diterjemahkan jadi tarsah yang anagram dari hasrat. Wow! Dan setelah saya googling, saya dapat info kalo sebenarnya ide Tarsah ini baru kepikir belakangan, menjelang bukunya turun cetak. Karena sang penerjemah berkeras mesti ada padanan yang tepat untuk \"erised\". Dan iya, beliau emang bener karena erised dan tarsah adalah padanan yang cocok.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eKetujuh\u003c/b\u003e, hmm....saya tetap gak ngerti kenapa Professor Quirrell gak bisa menyentuh Harry hanya di bagian akhir buku ini? Waktu awal cerita, Harry bertemu Prof. Quirrell di Diagon Alley dan saat itu mereka sudah berjabat tangan. Kok saat itu tangan si Quirrell gak melepuh ya? Padahal sudah jelas kalo Voldemort telah \"nebeng\" di tubuh Quirrell saat itu.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eKedelapan\u003c/b\u003e, saya makin kagum deh sama JK Rowling.\u003cbr /\u003eOke...saya tahu kalo JKR emang banyak menggunakan bantuan mitos, legenda ato apalah itu dalam ceritanya. So it's not really original. Tapi toh emang gak ada formula yang benar-benar baru. Yang penting sih gimana Rowling bisa meramu bahan yang ada. And she's really good at it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTapi yang sebenarnya keren dari Rowling adalah : dia benar-benar paham karakter pembacanya.\u003cbr /\u003eI guess in some points of our life, even if it's just for one time, we ever felt like Harry, who's a misfit and wishing to go to some place new where we could start everything from the scratch or becoming a different people. But not everyone could do that. Apparently Harry is one of those lucky people.\u003cbr /\u003eReading Harry's journey gave me happiness. Happiness that comes from knowing that at least there's one person in this world who could fulfill his dreams. It also gave me some hopes that in the end everything will be fine for me too. If this boy whose life was much more miserable than me finally found what he always wanted, how could I not? :)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDan Rowling juga dengan cerdasnya memilih setting di Inggris, suatu tempat yang masih bisa terjangkau dan karenanya masih terasa \"dekat\". Bukannya tempat jauh antah berantah seperti di Middle Earth sana, atau dunia magic namun tak terjangkau seperti Abarat. Terlibatnya kaum manusia non sihir (aka muggle) juga tempat-tempat di Inggris seperti stasiun King's Cross membuat cerita ini makin terasa dekat di hati, membuat kita (oke...sebenernya sih saya) berani berharap bahwa suatu saat nanti saya juga bisa dapat..ehem...surat saya sendiri. \u003cbr /\u003eSeorang teman saya bahkan sampe mencoba menekan pilar di tempat yang semestinya jadi peron 9 3/4 waktu dia lagi ada di King's Cross dan waktu salah seorang petugas di sana melihat kelakuan teman saya, si petugas bilang : \"You're not the first person who tried looking for that platform.\" Bhahak....ternyata banyak yang bermimpi ke Hogwarts eh? ;)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDan alasan kenapa saya kasih 5 bintang walopun saya mengakui kalo cerita di buku ini masih kalah spekta dibanding buku-buku berikutnya?\u003cbr /\u003eKarena ini adalah buku pertama. The one that started it all. Buku ini juga yang bikin saya kenal dan jadi langganan (sampe sekarang) sama sebuah toko di Bras Basah itu. It's always nice to find a new friend because of one certain book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLastly, just wanna say this : for you all who feel like you don't fit in, who wished for a magical school, or secret garden or magical cupboard that could open secret passage to magical land and still secretly keeping those wish alive : keep on wishing. Keep on hoping. Who knows, maybe your \"letter\" is on its way now :)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15761276931299037260\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border  \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\u003cspan class=\"uitext greyText\"\u003eRecommends it for: \u003c/span\u003e\n           \u003cspan class=\"uitext reviewText\"\u003eSean \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003eRecommended to Kristin by: \u003c/span\u003e\n      The World\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText href=\"/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=me-like\"\u003eme-like\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer846812430\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12448354067514152622\"\u003eI've honestly read this book so many times I find it kind of boring. {\u003ci\u003eShe did not say that!\u003c/i\u003e} I think I need to start skipping this when I do my re-reads for awhile because I have this \u003cb\u003ememorized\u003c/b\u003e. *Please be aware that for many of my formative years in middle school and high school I only had access to books 1-4 as J.K. was still \u003cs\u003etormenting her audience\u003c/s\u003e working on finishing her series. So I have read this particular book no less than 100 times - no hyperbole in that statement I swear.*\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis is my r\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText12448354067514152622\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI've honestly read this book so many times I find it kind of boring. {\u003ci\u003eShe did not say that!\u003c/i\u003e} I think I need to start skipping this when I do my re-reads for awhile because I have this \u003cb\u003ememorized\u003c/b\u003e. *Please be aware that for many of my formative years in middle school and high school I only had access to books 1-4 as J.K. was still \u003cs\u003etormenting her audience\u003c/s\u003e working on finishing her series. So I have read this particular book no less than 100 times - no hyperbole in that statement I swear.*\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis is my review of the illustrated version which I found to be an absolute gem and a \u003cb\u003emust own\u003c/b\u003e for all Harry Potter fanatics, such as myself. Before I share some photos of my favorite illustrations here are some thoughts about the overall book: \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis may be one of those things that is more of a \u003ci\u003ecollectors item\u003c/i\u003e versus an essential book for reading. It was fun and offered me a whole different experience to reading the book in general, but I'm not so sure I would be so quick to pick it up again for \u003ci\u003epure reading purposes\u003c/i\u003e. It is very large and heavy. It is awkward to hold and can be difficult to read if you do your reading in bed (guilty). Like I mentioned, it enhances the reading experience but not completely essential to enjoying the book. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow, I don't have kids and the last picture book I read was Berenstein Bears. I did personally find the images to be on the darker side and more wacky and whimsical instead of soft and child-like (whatever that means). I feel like these illustrations may appeal to more adults than kids but I don't read to kids before bed or even know what kids like. I don't even have the faintest idea who Jim Kay illustrates for so take that tidbit with a grain of salt. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHere are some of my favorite illustrations so enjoy!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile%20Uploads/e71826a9-1add-4b29-aaa5-74a4b3a93ec0_zpszheuhqk3.jpg.html\" target=\"_blank\" I really just posted all of these for Sean so I hope he enjoys them!\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/582889789\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Angela\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4255477-angela\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Angela\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1398251387p2/4255477.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/582889789?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMar 16, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Angela\" class=\"user\" name=\"Angela\" href=\"/user/show/4255477-angela\"\u003eAngela\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Kindle Edition \" href=\"/book/show/13570308-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=ya\"\u003eya\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read\"\u003e2013-read\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read-sequels\"\u003e2013-read-sequels\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=middle-grade\"\u003emiddle-grade\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=kindle\"\u003ekindle\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=buddy-read-cory\"\u003ebuddy-read-cory\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2016-read\"\u003e2016-read\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer582889789\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9209097822129950840\"\u003eI've read this book a few of dozen times over the years. I've tried, each time, to figure out how to put into words my feelings on it. I fail every time. But here I am, trying once again. I'm going to try and speak of just this book in this review - so (beyond these few statements) I won't touch on how incredibly built the series is. Each book is builds on the ones before it, widening and strengthening the world. There are foreshadowings and moments peppered throughout the series that sometimes\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9209097822129950840\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI've read this book a few of dozen times over the years. I've tried, each time, to figure out how to put into words my feelings on it. I fail every time. But here I am, trying once again. I'm going to try and speak of just this book in this review - so (beyond these few statements) I won't touch on how incredibly built the series is. Each book is builds on the ones before it, widening and strengthening the world. There are foreshadowings and moments peppered throughout the series that sometimes don't come into play for many books to come. As Harry grows and becomes more mature, so too do these books. It's something that's almost impossible to realize here, in the first one, and that I still appreciate each and every time I pick up this series.\u003cbr /\u003eWhen I first picked up Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone I had no idea the impact it would have on my life. It was just a story, about a boy that finds out he's a wizard and has to fight the forces of evil. That's what I thought when I started it that first time. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eVery quickly I was drawn into the world of magic that J.K. Rowling penned, surrounded by witches and wizards, magic, and muggles. When I try to examine my feelings for this (and all future books), I run into the problem of not being able to quantify what makes it so special. \u003cbr /\u003eThe story is a classic; boy finds out he's special, learns about world, fights evil, wins. The world is intricate and fun, with a lot of cleverness - plays on words, simple ciphers, and logic puzzles made me smile - while still being straightforward. The characters, though varied and three-dimensional, are fairly standard.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd yet, this all combines into this wonderful, fantastical world that pulls me in and makes me wonder what's hiding behind that brick wall over there, or what I might be missing out of the corner of my eye.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI remember, distinctly, the feeling of sorrow that I had upon finishing this first book and realizing I was already too old to get a letter to Hogwarts. The world is so enchanting that I can't help but want to be a part of it. It's all about the feeling that it evokes in me. It makes me feel like there's magic in the world, and it's not necessarily the turn-a-mouse-into-a-snuff-box type of magic, or the type where the chess pieces actually fight each other (though, how awesome would that be?). It's the type where friendship is stronger than anything that gets thrown at it. Where people, kids, can fight against injustice and wrong - and win. It lets you know that life isn't always fair, and that you might have to battle against things that are scary and horrible, but the happiness at the end is always worth it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd I suppose that's what keeps me coming back, time and time again, to re-read, revisit, and relive this story. It makes me feel a part of something amazing.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd that is definitely magical.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReview also available at \u003ca href=\"http://thebookeaters.net/2016/03/09/review-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eThe Book Eaters\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter holds a forever-place in my heart. His story is one of my favorites ever. This re-read just reinforced that thought. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9209097822129950840\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review582889789\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_44834361\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/44834361\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Gabrielle\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1163731-gabrielle\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Gabrielle\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1213826226p2/1163731.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/44834361?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJan 30, 2009\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Gabrielle\" class=\"user\" name=\"Gabrielle\" href=\"/user/show/1163731-gabrielle\"\u003eGabrielle\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003edid not like it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer44834361\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer8188024269711021837\"\u003ePathetic. Really pathetic.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter is more of a Mary-Sue than Eragon. More than Nancy Drew. More than the worst of fanfiction I've seen.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHe's rich, popular and famous for absolutely nothing of his own doing. He destroys the power of the big bad guy before he's a year old. He has the whole angsty past down pat. He instantly becomes the best at flying without ever having done it before, wasting all the older and more experienced flyers. And get this - he fries bad guys when they touch his skin\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText8188024269711021837\" style=\"display:none\"\u003ePathetic. Really pathetic.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter is more of a Mary-Sue than Eragon. More than Nancy Drew. More than the worst of fanfiction I've seen.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHe's rich, popular and famous for absolutely nothing of his own doing. He destroys the power of the big bad guy before he's a year old. He has the whole angsty past down pat. He instantly becomes the best at flying without ever having done it before, wasting all the older and more experienced flyers. And get this - he fries bad guys when they touch his skin because the power of his mother's love is so amazing that it protects him.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI mean, gosh, the only Sueish habit we aren't subjected to is multipage rants on his appearance each morning. Or the devoted unicorn of unusual powers, of course, but I'm expecting him to show up in the very next book. After all, she has to keep some plot devices for the next one, doesn't she? Can't put all her brilliant twists out at once...\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*heavy sarcasm*\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDon't even get me started on the plot. Epic failure. 'Nuff said.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry wasn't any excuse for a hero. He did nothing, he just sat around and things happened to him. End of story. His fame was inherited, his fortune was inherited, he lived with his relations and allowed them to bully him, and couldn't even manage to read his own mail. His wonderful skills were not worked at and studied for years but picked up instantly, and he bet the bad guys by electrocuting them with his infamous zapper skin.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI could go on for hours. The thing that really gets to me is that \u003ci\u003ethis\u003c/i\u003e is the great literature of our age? What hope is there for any decent writers if all kids want to read is this utter garbage? What hope is there for the world if kids are growing up thinking this is good literature?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis is a dangerous book. It made me consider both suicide and mass homicide, and it is definitely not suitable for children.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"8188024269711021837\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; BECAUSE IT STARTED ALL OF IT. And it's\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText862386997564451374\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt's a \"Mary Sue\" BECAUSE IT STARTED ALL OF IT. And also Harry knows that he inherited all the fame. It's actually a main point in the story. And it's not like other real people haven't inherited fame.I respect that it is your opinion and that I have no right to bash your opinion. \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1699038161\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer810964657619581868\"\u003eNo os pasa que siempre llega un momento en el año en el que decís: \u003ci\u003euf, qué ganas de releer Harry Potter.\u003c/i\u003e Entonces te sientes mal porque tienes un montón de libros por leer en casa y los de HP ya los has leído mil millones de veces, pero aún así lo haces igualmente.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eY bueno, poco tengo yo qué decir de esta maravilla de libro y de saga. Leer la edición ilustrada ha sido una gozada, las ilustraciones son preciosas y representan muy bien el espíritu del libro. He disfrutado de esta historia tanto como cada vez que la leo. La magia de Hogwarts, supongo.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTampoco me quiero alargar porque no voy a decir nada de este libro que no se haya dicho ya. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer431944347\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11432602050386966228\"\u003eThis might just be the very first book I've ever read in English. I was in high school at the time. I remember desperately trying to find out the meaning of the word \"tantrum\". Hahaha! The good old days. I need to find the time to reread this series, and its last book. I've never had the strength to finish reading the last one. It launched the year I had my son. It felt too much reading it. I didn't want it to end. That was nine years ago. I think it's high time I read it.\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr id=\"review_1673271894\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1673271894\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Τζο\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/9830594\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Τζο\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1446458238p2/9830594.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1673271894?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 20, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Τζο\" class=\"user\" name=\"Τζο\" href=\"/user/show/9830594\"\u003eΤζο\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eliked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9789602743485\" href=\"/book/show/4593339\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1673271894\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2874775949567743101\"\u003eΔεν είχα ποτέ την διάθεση να διαβάσω Χάρι Πότερ για πολλούς λόγους. Ένας απο αυτους είναι οτι δεν μου αρέσει ιδιαίτερα η φαντασία σα είδος λογοτεχνίας. Δεύτερο και κυρίοτερο είχα βαρεθεί να ακουώ για τον κόσμο του Πότερ. Σε όποια βιβλιοφιλική σελίδα έχω κάνει λάικ στο facebook κάθε δεύτερο άρθρο του είχε σα θέμα του τον Χάρι Πότερ. Κάθε τι που έβγαινε απο το στόμα της J.K Rowling ήταν ιερό,ε, νυσάφι. Αλλά έλα που έπεσα σε λογοτεχνικό τέλμα και τίποτα δεν μου έκανε και ανοίγοντας το Kindle ήρθα\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText2874775949567743101\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eΔεν είχα ποτέ την διάθεση να διαβάσω Χάρι Πότερ για πολλούς λόγους. Ένας απο αυτους είναι οτι δεν μου αρέσει ιδιαίτερα η φαντασία σα είδος λογοτεχνίας. Δεύτερο και κυρίοτερο είχα βαρεθεί να ακουώ για τον κόσμο του Πότερ. Σε όποια βιβλιοφιλική σελίδα έχω κάνει λάικ στο facebook κάθε δεύτερο άρθρο του είχε σα θέμα του τον Χάρι Πότερ. Κάθε τι που έβγαινε απο το στόμα της J.K Rowling ήταν ιερό,ε, νυσάφι. Αλλά έλα που έπεσα σε λογοτεχνικό τέλμα και τίποτα δεν μου έκανε και ανοίγοντας το Kindle ήρθα μούρη με μούρη με την Φιλοσοφική λίθο and it was good. Δεν ξέρω τι να πω για αυτό το βιβλίο και τι θα θεωρηθεί σπόιλερ μιας και τα βιβλία είναι πασίγνωστα και οι ταινίες έχουν χιλιοπεχτεί παρόλα αυτά θα προσπαθήσω να είμαι διακριτκή και να μην προδώσω πολλά απο την πλοκή.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eΤο βιβλίο ξεκινάει αμέσως μετά την επίθεση του Βόλτερμορτ, του πιο ισχυρόυ μαύρου μάγου, στους Πότερς. Η επίθεση είχε αποτέλεσμα τον θάνατο της Λίλη και του Τζέιμς, της μητέρας και του πατέρα του μικρού Χάρι. Ο μόνος που επέζησε ήταν ο μικρός του γιός. Κανείς δεν ξέρει γιατί έζησε ο Χάρι αλλά όλοι θα τον ξέρουν πια σα το αγόρι που έπεζησε και το σημάδι με το σχήμα κεραυνού θα προδίδει πάντα την καταγωγή του. Μέτα την επίθεση ο Βολτερμόρτ εξαφανίζεται αφήνοντας πίσω του ένα ορφανό το οποίο χρειάζεται ένα σπίτι μακριά απο την μαγεία και οι μόνοι που μπορούν να του προσφέρουν ένα σπιτικό ήταν η Ντάρσλι, οι θείοι του Χάρι, ένα μάτσο αντιπαθητικοί άνθρωποι. Έντεκα χρόνια αργότερα ένας τριχωτός γίγαντας εισβάλει στην ζωη του Χάρι για να τον ενημερώσει πως ήρθε η ώρα του να φοιτησει στο Χόγκουαρτς, την μεγαλύτερη σχολή μαγείας. Και κάπως έτσι ξεκινάει ο πρώτος μας χρόνος στην σχολή μαγείας.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eΜου άρεσε και δεν το περίμενα. Θα πρέπει όμως να αναφέρω πως ο λόγος που μου άρεσε ήταν το πόσο \"ελαφρύ\" ήταν και λάτρεψα την παιδικότητα που ήταν εμφανής σε όλο το βιβλίο. Με έβγαλε απο ένα άσχημο αναγνωστικό τέλμα! Πάντως γνωστοί μου που το έχουν διαβάσει μου έχουν πει οτι δεν είναι απο τα καλύτερα της σειράς!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eΕπειδή δεν είμαι παιδί η αναγνώση του βιβλίου μέσα απο τα τριαντάχρονα μάτια μου ήταν πολύ διαφορετική απο αυτή που ίσως θα ήθελε η J.K Rowling. Τα πρώτα έντεκα χρόνια του Χάρι ήταν γεμάτα κακοποιήση που με έκανε να τρίζω τα δόντια μου. Παραμελημένος και παραχωνιασμένος κάτω απο μια σκάλα το μικρό και κοκαλιάρικο αγόρι ζει χωρίς κανένα συναισθηματικό ερέθισμα. Στην πραγματική ζωή πολύ πιθανόν το αγόρι να είχε εμφανίσει πολύ άσχημα στοιχεία στον χαρακτήρα του. Αλλά όχι ο Πότερ. Ο Χάρυ ήταν ένα ευγενικό παιδί, τρυφερό με τους φίλους του και επιθετικός εκέι που χρειαζόταν. Ήταν καλός με μια έμφυτη διάθεση για περιπέτεια αλλά όχι και πολυ έξυπνος. Ο Ρον, ο φίλος του, ήταν ένας πολύ ενδιαφέρον χαρακτήρας. Λίγο ουδέτερος αλλά με καυστικό χιούμορ και την ανάγκη να διακριθεί ανάμεσα στα μεγαλύτερα αδέρφια του, είναι εξαιρετική παρεά για τον μοναχικό Πότερ. Και φυσικά η Ερμιόνη, η πειθαρχημένη. Η διαβαστερή. Η γλυκιά παρουσία που τους μαζεύει τα χαλινάρια αλλά και που είναι πάντα δίπλα τους. Θα ήθελες να τους είχες φίλους σου. Αλλά πιο γλυκούλης απο όλους ήταν ο Νέβιλ. Αχ, το αγόρι μου. Το φοβισμένο, ατσούμπαλο αγόρι. Ταυτίστικα μαζί του! Και δεν θα μπορούσε να λέιπει ο κακός της υπόθεσης. Ο Βόλτερμορτ. Δεν ξέρουμε πολλά για αυτός εκτός ότι μισεί τον Χάρι και ότι είναι πολύ δυνατός. Οι μάγοι τον τρέμουν.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eΜου άρεσε το σχολείο και ο τρόπος που το έχει περιγράψει η συγγραφέας. Τα διάφορα μαγικά στοιχεία που μας έδινε κάθε λίγο και λιγάκι ήταν πολυ διασκεδαστικά!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eΜπορώ να καταλάβω γιατί τον αγαπούν τον Χάρι. Αν ήμουν παιδί όταν το ξεκινούσα και μεγάλωνα μαζί με τους χαρακτήρες θα ένιωθα το δέσιμο που νιώθουν όλοι. Αλλα όμως δεν είμαι παιδί. Σίγουρα θα τα διαβάσω όλα!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"2874775949567743101\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1673271894\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" href=\"/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin\"\u003eMike (the Paladin)\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=ya-fantasy\"\u003eya-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer72481690\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7195723816018549309\"\u003eI read this years ago...my kids were still young.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDid it bother anyone else that the publishers assumed Americans were too ignorant to know what the \"philosopher's stone\" was?\u003cbr /\u003eyeah, me to.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWell anyway, I've read and listened to this (these) and gone back to them several times since. Even though my children are grown I still enjoy this series of books. As originally written the series (considering the time between publication of each volume) actually grew with the first generation of kids who read t\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7195723816018549309\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI read this years ago...my kids were still young.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDid it bother anyone else that the publishers assumed Americans were too ignorant to know what the \"philosopher's stone\" was?\u003cbr /\u003eyeah, me to.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWell anyway, I've read and listened to this (these) and gone back to them several times since. Even though my children are grown I still enjoy this series of books. As originally written the series (considering the time between publication of each volume) actually grew with the first generation of kids who read them. They do get gradually darker as they go on, but (originally) the children who'd started were growing to. So, they actually matured with the story. (My only caveat is that parents should be sure their children are mature enough now to move to each volume. Now a ten year old could conceivably buy the set and read them one after the other, so, parents need to be proactive and be sure their \"youths\" are ready, mature enough for each book.)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm amazed at how much I still \"feel\" I know these characters and care about them even though they are fictional in a fantasy world. It's an accomplishment that's seen in the best of novels. Congratulations Ms.Rowling. While they have their flaws these are wonderful books. I had started to give them 4 stars, I give very few 5 star ratings. BUT upon consideration, I realized I'd read them several times and still enjoyed them greatly. These are wonderfully written novels. I rate it 5 stars.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis novel opens the story of Harry Potter, the boy who lived. We get to meet Harry, his aunt, uncle and cousin. We are introduced to the \"wizarding world\" and we go to Hogworts. And of course, we meet Ron and Hermione. I'd say if you're not charmed by this book and don't find yourself caring about Harry and his friends...maybe you should check for Grinch blood??? \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review72481690\"\u003e\n class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_72481690' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_72481690' style='display: \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1525039890\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1525039890\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Alexandra\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/51939827-alexandra\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Alexandra\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454442287p2/51939827.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1525039890?book_show_action=false\"\u003eApr 20, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Alexandra\" class=\"user\" name=\"Alexandra\" href=\"/user/show/51939827-alexandra\"\u003eAlexandra\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1525039890\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9886690540601277945\"\u003eHarry Potter changed my life. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI don't say this lightly.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was very young when I started reading these, I was 9. The librarian at the elementary I was attending pulled me aside and gave me this book to take home to read, her own personal copy, because at the time Harry Potter hadn't been read and approved for the library yet. She may have broke some rules at the time, but I'll bet she doesn't know that breaking that rule made me who I am today.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis story is magical. Literally. I re-read this serie\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9886690540601277945\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eHarry Potter changed my life. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI don't say this lightly.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was very young when I started reading these, I was 9. The librarian at the elementary I was attending pulled me aside and gave me this book to take home to read, her own personal copy, because at the time Harry Potter hadn't been read and approved for the library yet. She may have broke some rules at the time, but I'll bet she doesn't know that breaking that rule made me who I am today.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis story is magical. Literally. I re-read this series every year. Every September. Sometimes twice a year if I feel the need. No matter how old I get, when I pick up these books I feel like a kid again. You don't have to be a kid to love Harry Potter, you don't have to like fantasy to like Harry Potter, you don't even have to be a big reader to love Harry Potter. All you have to do is open your mind (and your heart :').) \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ePlease pick up one of these books if you haven't yet. I don't care if you're 6 or 60, they will enlighten you to a whole new world. They will make you feel happiness, sadness, anger, all of the feelings, all of the time. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI LOVE YOU J.K. ROWLING. I mean that. haha. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9886690540601277945\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1525039890\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1525039890\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1525039890\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1525039890'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_1525039890\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1525039890?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e34 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_1525039890\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1525039890\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=34\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=6\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1525039890\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_1525039890\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 1525039890, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer893976136\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5232756205906473913\"\u003eI simply adored this book \u0026lt;3. It was such a fast and funny read! Also, it brought childhood memories back, because I saw the first Harry Potter movie when I was 10 years old, and I was so nostalgic remembering it all \u0026lt;3.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm not used to read books after I watched the movies, but it'll be that way with my Harry Potter books, because I'm a huge fan of the movies and I've already saw them all. The good thing is that I don't really remember anything at all, haha (just the \"big\" parts. Oh, and a\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5232756205906473913\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI simply adored this book \u0026lt;3. It was such a fast and funny read! Also, it brought childhood memories back, because I saw the first Harry Potter movie when I was 10 years old, and I was so nostalgic remembering it all \u0026lt;3.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI'm not used to read books after I watched the movies, but it'll be that way with my Harry Potter books, because I'm a huge fan of the movies and I've already saw them all. The good thing is that I don't really remember anything at all, haha (just the \"big\" parts. Oh, and also the deaths *cries*). \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSooo, I loved this book and I'm impressed by that! I mean, I knew I was going to like it! But it was so much more. Since the first page it had me hooked. J.K. Rowling has such a fluid writing style! I never got bored and I was gasping in some parts even when I knew what was going to happen!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eCan't wait to read the next books :). \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"/book/show/15868.Harry_Potter_y_la_piedra_filosofal\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1383087640\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer16954025526727929477\"\u003eAunque parezca raro leer el primer libro de una saga que ha impactado y encantado a tantos lectores de todas las edades, después de que hace un buen rato todas sus entregas han sido llevadas a la pantalla grande, con bastante éxito por cierto, quise comprobar por mi misma cual es la \"magia\" de Harry Potter, y aquí estoy terminando \"...la piedra filosofal\". \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDebido a que esta primera entrega estaba dirigida principalmente a un público infantil, pensé que me iba a aburrir y lo iba a abandonar, pero\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText16954025526727929477\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eAunque parezca raro leer el primer libro de una saga que ha impactado y encantado a tantos lectores de todas las edades, después de que hace un buen rato todas sus entregas han sido llevadas a la pantalla grande, con bastante éxito por cierto, quise comprobar por mi misma cual es la \"magia\" de Harry Potter, y aquí estoy terminando \"...la piedra filosofal\". \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDebido a que esta primera entrega estaba dirigida principalmente a un público infantil, pensé que me iba a aburrir y lo iba a abandonar, pero sorprendentemente me encontré con un libro fabuloso, emocionante y emotivo, con muy buenos diálogos y entrañables personajes. Sinceramente creo que la película no le hace justicia. Muy bueno.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"16954025526727929477\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n     var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');\n      var $copy;\n      if ($ratingGraph.length \u003e 0) {\n          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();\n firstReview\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_14146679\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/14146679\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Chris\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/858949-chris\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Chris\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1208350750p2/858949.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/14146679?book_show_action=false\"\u003eFeb 09, 2008\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Chris\" class=\"user\" name=\"Chris\" href=\"/user/show/858949-chris\"\u003eChris\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780590353427\" href=\"/book/show/121121.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/858949-chris?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/858949-chris?shelf=harry-potter\"\u003eharry-potter\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer14146679\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15627168335751404131\"\u003e\u003ci\u003eSince pretty much everyone I know has read these books, I figure reviewing them is pretty pointless. But with the new book coming out in a couple of weeks, I have to go through them beginning to end. To make the reviews more entertaining, I will be doing them in a variety of unexpected formats. For this review, I will be writing as someone incapable of suspending his disbelief.\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis book was terrible! I mean, this author is obviously on drugs or insane or something like that, and why she has been\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15627168335751404131\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003eSince pretty much everyone I know has read these books, I figure reviewing them is pretty pointless. But with the new book coming out in a couple of weeks, I have to go through them beginning to end. To make the reviews more entertaining, I will be doing them in a variety of unexpected formats. For this review, I will be writing as someone incapable of suspending his disbelief.\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis book was terrible! I mean, this author is obviously on drugs or insane or something like that, and why she has been allowed to publish such patent nonsense is beyond me. What is even more horrifying is that so many people, adults and children, are supporting this madwoman. I mean, even some of my friends and family, people I respect have come under her spell!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHer spell. Ha! As though such things as spells and magic really exist. I know she and her hoard of followers believe so, but we, the right-thinking, rational people of the world know better, don't we?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe beginning was okay, and I had high hopes for it. I thought it might be an interesting story about this family, the Dursleys, who seem to be people after my own heart. Sensible, no-nonsense folk, these, who know what's real and what isn't. But within ten pages, I knew something wasn't right. Think about this - some crazy old man in robes shows up with a tiny device that can put out streetlights from a distance? A cat changes into a woman? Outrageous! And then the flying motorcycle, and nonsensical ravings about magicians and dark lords and curses, and that's where it all started to go downhill.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI forced myself to slog through this mess of nonsense, though by the time I got to chapter five, I had pretty much given up. Nothing this book describes could possibly take place in the real world, and it is almost criminal that she should get this kind of fame and attention. She is a font of nonsense and mayhem, poisoning the minds of everyone her work touches. If you haven't read these books, I recommend that you stay away from them. If you have, then I beg you to come to your senses and embrace the real world. Give up this madness and join us over here in the world where truth is truth and Harry Potter is meaningless vapor.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15627168335751404131\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review14146679\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_51957271\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/51957271\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Meg\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1009267-meg\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Meg\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1206746236p2/1009267.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/51957271?book_show_action=false\"\u003eFeb 01, 2010\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Meg\" class=\"user\" name=\"Meg\" href=\"/user/show/1009267-meg\"\u003eMeg\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003eRecommended to Meg by: \u003c/span\u003e\n      ummm... the entire human race?\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1009267-meg?shelf=read-with-kids\"\u003eread-with-kids\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer51957271\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5435271619601185295\"\u003eLEAH'S RATING (age 4): 5 STARS\u003cbr /\u003eRAEF'S RATING (age 6): 4 STARS\u003cbr /\u003eMEG'S RATING (age--none of your business): 5 STARS\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLEAH'S REVIEW:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI liked the book and I liked the movie. It was exciting when they destroyed the troll.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLEAH'S FAVORITE QUOTE:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"Welcome!\" (Dumbledore) said. \"Welcome to a new year at Hogwarts! Before we begin our banquet, I would like to say a few words. And here they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak! Thank you.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRAEF'S REVIEW:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThey should have figured out the answers faster and had better\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5435271619601185295\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eLEAH'S RATING (age 4): 5 STARS\u003cbr /\u003eRAEF'S RATING (age 6): 4 STARS\u003cbr /\u003eMEG'S RATING (age--none of your business): 5 STARS\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLEAH'S REVIEW:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI liked the book and I liked the movie. It was exciting when they destroyed the troll.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLEAH'S FAVORITE QUOTE:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"Welcome!\" (Dumbledore) said. \"Welcome to a new year at Hogwarts! Before we begin our banquet, I would like to say a few words. And here they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak! Thank you.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRAEF'S REVIEW:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThey should have figured out the answers faster and had better questions. The part I liked was the part when they were trying to get the Sorcerer's Stone at the end. The ending was a surprise.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRAEF'S FAVORITE QUOTE:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"And what if I wave my wand and nothing happens?\"\u003cbr /\u003e\"Throw it away and punch him on the nose,\" Ron suggested.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMEG'S REVIEW:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI get it! I finally get Harry Potter! I know it's not exactly rocket science, but I didn't fully understand the obsessive fascination with this series until I read the first book to my kids. They were absolutely RIVETED the entire time. Every magical enchantment was rewarded with an \"ooohhh\" and \"ahhh,\" every one of Ron's jokes met with hysterical laughter, and I could actually watch my son and daughter grow stronger with each impossible obstacle or horrific monster Harry overcame. In one early scene, Leah literally started crying when Harry thought he would be thrown out of school and sent back to the Dursley's. Now THAT is a sure sign of someone who is LIVING a book, not reading it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo that's why my kids loved it. Here's why *I* loved it: Harry is strong. He stands up for what is right regardless of who stands against him (friend, enemy, authority figure, incorporeal undead wizard of darkness, etc.), which makes him a powerful hero for my 4- and 6-year-old. He's brave, self-sacrificing, and honorable. I think Harry proves his own character, and addresses the book's central theme itself, in a scene he shares with Malfoy near the beginning of his time at Hogwarts. In this particular scene, Malfoy gives a snotty little spiel on how he can introduce Harry to the best wizarding families and help him stay away from the \"wrong sort.\" Harry then refuses to shake Malfoy's hand and responds, \"I think I can tell who the wrong sort are for myself, thanks.\" And isn't that the essence of growing up? Moving away from simply doing what others tell us to do and learning to discern right and wrong for ourselves? Then, as soon as we know what's right, we can work on growing strong enough to stand up for it regardless of who stands against us. Harry is brilliant! Almost as brilliant as his author, who's created a story that is both wonderful and wonderfully told. Bravo!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMEG'S FAVORITE QUOTES (and, of course, Dumbledore says most of them):\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eScars can come in handy.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry wished he had about eight more eyes. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe very dust and silence seemed to tingle with some secret magic.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFrom that moment on, Hermione Granger became their friend. There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOne can never have enough socks.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eDeath is but the next great adventure.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHumans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe truth... is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTo have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever. It is in your very skin.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere are all kinds of courage. It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"5435271619601185295\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/51957271?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=7\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_51957271' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/51957271/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView 2 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_51957271' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 51957271, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1324845572\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1324845572\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Donna\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6217162-donna\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Donna\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1430955688p2/6217162.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1324845572?book_show_action=false\"\u003eNov 04, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Donna\" class=\"user\" name=\"Donna\" href=\"/user/show/6217162-donna\"\u003eDonna\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6217162-donna?shelf=favorite-books\"\u003efavorite-books\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6217162-donna?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6217162-donna?shelf=coming-of-age\"\u003ecoming-of-age\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1324845572\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer16995230059219793391\"\u003eWhat can I say about this book that hasn't already been said? I can only tell you my experience in reading it for the very first time in the form of the illustrated version. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI had such a great time reading this book. I had only watched a handful of the films prior to picking it up and had forgotten many of the scenes, so this story had some surprises for me. But just as wonderful in the surprise department were the amazing illustrations which never intruded upon the story and only enhanced it. O\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText16995230059219793391\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eWhat can I say about this book that hasn't already been said? I can only tell you my experience in reading it for the very first time in the form of the illustrated version. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI had such a great time reading this book. I had only watched a handful of the films prior to picking it up and had forgotten many of the scenes, so this story had some surprises for me. But just as wonderful in the surprise department were the amazing illustrations which never intruded upon the story and only enhanced it. Other than viewing some of them online, I purposefully didn't peek ahead in the book, but waited until the illustrations were revealed as the story unfolded, never knowing what I'd find as I turned each page. Would there be this scene or that one next? And from which perspective would I get to view something--from above, from below, or from straight on? Which character would I get to see next? How much color or detail would there be? How much emotion would be conveyed? Not every page had an official illustration on it, but every page had a little something extra included that made it a treat to look at, whether the page looked marbled or had mysterious looking splotches on it. But even when there were full color illustrations on a page, I was able to use my imagination just as well as if there hadn't been any at all. Mr. Kay really did this book credit. I'm very happy for him since he was so worried that he wouldn't. \u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.telegraph.co.uk/books/what-to-read/harry-potter-illustrated-jim-kay/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/books/what...\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut getting back to the story, which I haven't even talked about yet, what I liked best about it were the growing bonds between the characters, the slippery lines between good and evil, the many forms in which bravery appeared, the hope and optimism stirring in the hearts and minds of the characters, even when all seemed lost, and finally, the magic woven within this book which had nothing to do with the spells cast. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI don't know why I waited so long to begin this series, but in a way I'm glad I did, just so I could kick off reading it with this very special edition. I wish I could wait to read all the books in this form, but no way! I'm sure I'll have read the entire series before the next illustrated book comes out. Then I guess I'll just have to read them again in the illustrated form. I will have no problem at all doing that. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"16995230059219793391\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1324845572\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1564446067\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15714505282440127492\"\u003eTabii ki güzeldi, sonuçta bu Harry Potter. Filmlerini toplasanız 100 defa izlemişimdir, ama içimde okumaya dair o his yoktu. Sonra bir gün bir gif gördüm, kitaptan bir kısım ve o kısmın filme yansıyışı vardı. Kitaptan verilen kısımda, Dumbledore sakince, \u0026quot;Harry, Ateş Kadehi'ne adını sen mi attın?\u0026quot; diye sordu. diyordu. \u0026quot;SAKİNCE.\u0026quot; Filmdeki sahnedeyse Dumbledore o sahnede koşup fırlayarak geliyor, Harry'e bağırarak soruyordu. Ben de sonra kitapta ne kadar farklı kısımlar olabileceğini düşündüm, çok\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15714505282440127492\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eTabii ki güzeldi, sonuçta bu Harry Potter. Filmlerini toplasanız 100 defa izlemişimdir, ama içimde okumaya dair o his yoktu. Sonra bir gün bir gif gördüm, kitaptan bir kısım ve o kısmın filme yansıyışı vardı. Kitaptan verilen kısımda, Dumbledore sakince, \"Harry, Ateş Kadehi'ne adını sen mi attın?\" diye sordu. diyordu. \"SAKİNCE.\" Filmdeki sahnedeyse Dumbledore o sahnede koşup fırlayarak geliyor, Harry'e bağırarak soruyordu. Ben de sonra kitapta ne kadar farklı kısımlar olabileceğini düşündüm, çok sevdiğim o dünyanın daha fazlasını görebilirim dedim. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eTabii ki önceden de biliyordum bunu, ilk defa kitap uyarlaması izlemiyordum. Kitaplarını deli gibi okuduğum, uyarlamalarını izlediğim şeyler vardı. Ama diyorum ya, içimden gelmiyordu. Ama o gifi görünce \"artık okumalıyım\" dedim. (Gifi aşağı ekliyorum :D ) \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eVe okudum, sevdim. Bazı kısımlar farklı çıkınca mutlu oldum ve filme ne kadar güzel uyarladıklarını fark ettim. Cidden, bir kitabın uyarlaması bu kadar güzel olabilir :) Hagrid'in Harry'i sevdiğini biliyordum, ama BU KADAR sevdiğini bilmiyordum. :) Sondaki hediyesi falan çok güzeldi. Yasak Orman sahnesinde Neville'in olması... Sevdim yani.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eKitabın çeviri ya da edisyonundaki bazı şeyleri sevmedim. Sonuçta bu bir çocuk kitabı, değil mi? Çocuk kitabı olmasa bile \"Mr.\" ve \"Miss\" diye bırakılması inanılmaz sinirimi bozdu. \"Bay\" ve \"Bayan\" kelimelerinin suyu mu çıkmıştı? Bir de \"ilk kere\" lafı çok acayibime gitti. Harry bunu ilk kere görüyordu. Garip... Bir tane daha vardı okurken garip bulduğum ama unutuverdim :)) \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457634368i/18382898.jpg\" width=\"350px\" height=\"350px\" alt=\"\" feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1564446067\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca
