\u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n                  \u003cem\u003e\n                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,\n                    \u003ca href=\"#\" onclick=\"Effect.toggle(\u0026#39;reviewTextContainer5226952\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003eclick here.\u003c/a\u003e\n                  \u003c/em\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer5226952\" class=\"readable\"\n                    style=\"display:none\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12882373197980115530\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRead~November 1, 2001\u003cbr /\u003eHardcover\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI fought the Harry Potter phenom for so long that when I finally did succumb to it, I was blown away at why I resisted for so freaking long!!!!\u003cbr /\u003eWHAT a great series! But as I am very Type-A, I am going to review each book individually as they all have interesting aspects to them.\u003cbr /\u003eThis is the first book in the series. You meet Harry. You learn a tiny bit about who he is and why he is with his Aunt and Uncle at the very beginning of the book. You learn quickly to DESPISE\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText12882373197980115530\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRead~November 1, 2001\u003cbr /\u003eHardcover\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI fought the Harry Potter phenom for so long that when I finally did succumb to it, I was blown away at why I resisted for so freaking long!!!!\u003cbr /\u003eWHAT a great series! But as I am very Type-A, I am going to review each book individually as they all have interesting aspects to them.\u003cbr /\u003eThis is the first book in the series. You meet Harry. You learn a tiny bit about who he is and why he is with his Aunt and Uncle at the very beginning of the book. You learn quickly to DESPISE his Aunt and Uncle and lovely cousin Dudley. ICK!\u003cbr /\u003eAnd then you go to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. What an awesome place. I know that there has to be other people other than myself that wish that this was a real place and that we could all go there. Ghosts, pictures that move from one frame to another and 3-headed dogs named Fluffy!\u003cbr /\u003eYou also learn about Voldemort, who is the reason Harry has to live with the Dursley's in the first place. Voldemort killed Harry's parents, and tried to kill Harry, but the spell backfired! So Voldemort is wandering around out in the world just biding his time when he can come back and finish Harry off !!\u003cbr /\u003eThere is so much going on in this book, that I feel you have to read it more than once to get it all. \u003cbr /\u003eFantastic read!!!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~\u003cbr /\u003eI have reread this book so many times; I think this is my 6th reread of it [possibly more] and I never kept track. I will be doing so from this point forward! :-)\u003cbr /\u003eReread September 18, 2016\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI still love this book so very much. I love how you discover everything right along with Harry. It is always such a joy to reread this book. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"12882373197980115530\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review5226952\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1103990679\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1103990679\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Caitlyn\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6322902-caitlyn\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Caitlyn\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1415759502p2/6322902.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1103990679?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 27, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Caitlyn\" class=\"user\" name=\"Caitlyn\" href=\"/user/show/6322902-caitlyn\"\u003eCaitlyn\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6322902-caitlyn?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6322902-caitlyn?shelf=ya-reads\"\u003eya-reads\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6322902-caitlyn?shelf=my-childhood\"\u003emy-childhood\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1103990679\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6729152423760063123\"\u003eI do an annual re-reading of this series around winter time. December is the ideal time to start because Harry Potter has always seemed like a \u003ci\u003ewinter\u003c/i\u003e type series to me. I don't know why or how I started this tradition but I always attempt to follow it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis is the first year I'll be writing a review for my rereading because I realized I never did a proper one for the books. I think the reason is that I don't think I can find the words to describe just how much I love and adore this series. J.K.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6729152423760063123\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI do an annual re-reading of this series around winter time. December is the ideal time to start because Harry Potter has always seemed like a \u003ci\u003ewinter\u003c/i\u003e type series to me. I don't know why or how I started this tradition but I always attempt to follow it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis is the first year I'll be writing a review for my rereading because I realized I never did a proper one for the books. I think the reason is that I don't think I can find the words to describe just how much I love and adore this series. J.K. Rowling created a world that I can sink into, that I can immerse myself into at any point in my life. I grew up with Harry, I remember reading GoF when I was 14, knowing that I couldn't have done what Harry did even though we were the same age. I remember realizing I was 18, that eighteen year olds didn't attend Hogwarts anymore. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs Harry grew, I grew. I grew as a person, I grew as a fan of this series. I went from standing in line to see GoF with my mom when I was 9 to repurchasing the entire set so that I would have copies in my first apartment. It's always a relief to remember that Harry, Ron, and Hermione have, and never will, change. They have stayed constant during my life. It may sound so cliche but Hogwarts, and these series, will always be there. They are one of my childhood homes that I can visit again and again with just a flip of the cover. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"6729152423760063123\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/175635-trevor?shelf=children-s-literature\"\u003echildren-s-literature\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer18447489\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11808929665270316414\"\u003eIt wasn't called this at all - but for some reason the title changed in the US and there is no original title versions of this on this site, which is also strange. How terribly odd. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnyway, I read this to the kids - in fact, the first four books to them - just before the tidal wave of popularity. We had just finished reading all the books of Dahl and were looking for something else to be getting on with - and there was this article in the paper saying that the Fundamentalist Christians wanted th\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11808929665270316414\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt wasn't called this at all - but for some reason the title changed in the US and there is no original title versions of this on this site, which is also strange. How terribly odd. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnyway, I read this to the kids - in fact, the first four books to them - just before the tidal wave of popularity. We had just finished reading all the books of Dahl and were looking for something else to be getting on with - and there was this article in the paper saying that the Fundamentalist Christians wanted this book banned.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWell, let's face it, there is no higher recommendation for a book and I remain grateful to the Christian community for pointing me in the right direction with this one.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAfter the forth book my youngest daughter started reading them to me - there are few joys in life that are surpassed by books or daughters, mixing them together was always going to be a highlight, and how could it not be?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThese books got better as they went on - the last one was particularly good.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11808929665270316414\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1665558808\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Tanu Gill\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/11326705-tanu-gill\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Tanu Gill\"   \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1665558808?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJun 13, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Tanu Gill\" class=\"user\" name=\"Tanu Gill\" href=\"/user/show/11326705-tanu-gill\"\u003eTanu Gill\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1665558808\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13529075832189379548\"\u003eThere are no words I can think to write that can even come near to doing this book justice. This is a series that can only be savoured, like a top-dollar meal in a restaurant. There is only one way to appreciate it, and that is to just inhale every word of it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI had kept this on my mental shelf as a series that I would read one day, just not sure about the timeline. It got hurried along, but I don't regret it for even a single moment. I've enjoyed the movies, but they are, quite easily, dried-out\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText13529075832189379548\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThere are no words I can think to write that can even come near to doing this book justice. This is a series that can only be savoured, like a top-dollar meal in a restaurant. There is only one way to appreciate it, and that is to just inhale every word of it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI had kept this on my mental shelf as a series that I would read one day, just not sure about the timeline. It got hurried along, but I don't regret it for even a single moment. I've enjoyed the movies, but they are, quite easily, dried-out versions of the real deal that is the actual books. I'm just in Hogwarts-heaven right now and lovin' it!;-) \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"13529075832189379548\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return id=\"freeTextContainer16374305188685903740\"\u003eHaving just read this for the first time, I definitely missed the boat. My taste in books now skews a little darker. At the same time, I'm glad I finally read it and though I don't think it was the best book of all time or anything, I can definitely understand the hype. I'm sure I'll eventually read all the books, in which case I'll understand the fandom and probably be a super fan myself.\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1116433719\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Maxwell\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1381728-maxwell\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Maxwell\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474578952p2/1381728.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1116433719?book_show_action=false\"\u003eNov 27, 2014\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Maxwell\" class=\"user\" name=\"Maxwell\" href=\"/user/show/1381728-maxwell\"\u003eMaxwell\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582889\" href=\"/book/show/17372039-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=i-own-it\"\u003ei-own-it\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=2014\"\u003e2014\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1116433719\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6154398902309817155\"\u003e\u003ci\u003eReread November 2014\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eObviously this isn't my first time reading \u003ci\u003eSorcerer's Stone\u003c/i\u003e; I think this is the 3rd reading for me. And as every time before, I loved it immensely. I really am just reminded of how incredible J.K. Rowling is at crafting a story, a whole world, and setting up the rest of the series, while still writing a smart, entertaining children's book. Because in reality, this first book is very young feeling, but it's never dumbed down. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSince most people have read this or know the plot,\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6154398902309817155\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003eReread November 2014\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eObviously this isn't my first time reading \u003ci\u003eSorcerer's Stone\u003c/i\u003e; I think this is the 3rd reading for me. And as every time before, I loved it immensely. I really am just reminded of how incredible J.K. Rowling is at crafting a story, a whole world, and setting up the rest of the series, while still writing a smart, entertaining children's book. Because in reality, this first book is very young feeling, but it's never dumbed down. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSince most people have read this or know the plot, I thought I would instead share some fun thoughts I had or noticed upon rereading this book:\u003cbr /\u003e-What do you think the sorting hat said to Hermione, Ron, or any of the other characters when they tried it on?\u003cbr /\u003e-Dumbledore's Chocolate Frog card mentions his defeat of Grindewald, a fact that doesn't come to be important until book 6 or 7!\u003cbr /\u003e-The Weasley twins are hilarious as always, and they know the secret passages already (probably thanks to the Marauder's Map) that shows up in book 3.\u003cbr /\u003e-I wonder why Hermione wasn't in Ravenclaw. (I'm sure there is some sort of answer for this one, I had just never thought of it before).\u003cbr /\u003e-I want Mrs. Weasley to knit me a sweater.\u003cbr /\u003e-The Mirror of Erised's inscription backwards says, \"I show not your face but your heart's desire.\"\u003cbr /\u003e-In the book, when Harry first finds the Mirror of Erised, he sees a reflection of his mom, dad, and the rest of his family. But in the film it only shows Lily and James. That would've been cool to see in the film.\u003cbr /\u003e-Apparently, chess is the only thing that Hermione ever lost at (p.217). If she is so smart, don't you think she'd be really good at the strategy of chess?\u003cbr /\u003e-After seeing Quirrell/Voldemort in the Forbidden Forest, Harry starts to have nightmares about the face dripping unicorn blood. I wonder if this is Voldemort already using Occlumancy on Harry?\u003cbr /\u003e-In the film, the protections that Harry, Ron, and Hermione have to get through to find the Sorcerer's Stone leave out the troll (placed by Quirrel) and the potions challenge (Snape's). Would've been fun to see Hermione tackle that one.\u003cbr /\u003e-Voldemort's face on the back of Quirrell's head is described as pale with red, slit eyes like a snake (like movie Voldemort). Why isn't that how they portrayed him in the first film?!\u003cbr /\u003e-Also, Neville's best exam grade was in Herbology. Aww. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOverall, I just thought it was remarkable to note how many things Rowling references already! It makes me even more excited to jump right into \u003ci\u003eChamber of Secrets\u003c/i\u003e next!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"6154398902309817155\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n id=\"review_1107093480\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1107093480\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"ᴄᴀᴍ\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/36976651\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"ᴄᴀᴍ\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1465107032p2/36976651.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1107093480?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJul 25, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"ᴄᴀᴍ\" class=\"user\" name=\"ᴄᴀᴍ\" href=\"/user/show/36976651\"\u003eᴄᴀᴍ\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9788478886548\" href=\"/book/show/15868.Harry_Potter_y_la_piedra_filosofal\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/36976651?shelf=2015\"\u003e2015\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/36976651?shelf=on-my-shelf\"\u003eon-my-shelf\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1107093480\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10217406788762968081\"\u003eOh shit !! Porfin comencé esta saga, era hora !! Pensé que esta lectura no me iba a sorprender tanto y a gustar tanto ya que había visto la película, pero todo lo contrario. A medida que iba leyendo el libro parecía que no había visto al película. El hecho de que hace un montón que no la veía de nuevo ayudo un montón también. Ademas de que obviamente un montón de escenas no están en la película, o le cambiaron cosas pequeñas (porque las películas de hp son bastante fieles, i think).\u003cbr\u003eEn cuanto a p\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText10217406788762968081\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eOh shit !! Porfin comencé esta saga, era hora !! Pensé que esta lectura no me iba a sorprender tanto y a gustar tanto ya que había visto la película, pero todo lo contrario. A medida que iba leyendo el libro parecía que no había visto al película. El hecho de que hace un montón que no la veía de nuevo ayudo un montón también. Ademas de que obviamente un montón de escenas no están en la película, o le cambiaron cosas pequeñas (porque las películas de hp son bastante fieles, i think).\u003cbr\u003eEn cuanto a personajes, Harry es uno que a pesar que no haya amado, me encanta esa personalidad de todo a la mierda, yo lo hago igual. Y pensar que es super chico igual ajaja. Hermione es bastante infumable a veces, pero se nota que como amiga es excelente, amo sus ironías y su sentido del humor, me encanta !! Ron es otro personaje que me gusta muchísimo, es como un gran amigo fiel. Hagrid es como un padre con mentalidad de niño ajajaj, me encanta, su personalidad, su sentido del humor, sus bromas, lo fiel que es, etc. Draco es el típico niño malvado, que de vez en cuando se manda de las suyas, pero al final de todo, termina perdiendo!! Toma Draco, por gilipollas. \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1428046105ra/14354784.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eLe di 5 estrellas porque en este libro se introduce todo lo que es el mundo mágico de Hogwarts y de todo este mundo. Es increíble la imaginación de esta mujer! Cada cosa que hay en este mundo es increíble (a no ser los muggles, los muggles son mierda). Me sorprendí MUCHO en el final, porque sinceramente yo creía \u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[que Gryffindor ganaba el trofeo de las casas, y estaba terminando el libro y todo declaraba que ganaba Slytherin y como como whaaat? y cuando gano Gryffindor al final fue como YO SABIA BITCHES!! TOMEN GILES \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e. \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1428046105ra/14354785.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003eLa parte final, en la que Ron, Hermione y Harry van en busca de la piedra filosofal, es super intensa y emocionante. Voldemort, hate u.\u003cbr\u003eEn fin, imposible no amar esta perfección de libro, espero seguir con el resto pronto !! \u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/[\"br\"]\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"10217406788762968081\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr read the same book in French at the end of 2015, but I wanted to read the whole series in English to discover JK Rowling's real writing. I'm not disappointed at all, I'm still in love with this book ! I'm gonna discover the next books now, because I haven't read them before.\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter will always be a wonderful series, even after all these years that have gone         $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});\n        } else {\n          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});\n        }\n      });\n      $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {\n        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {\n          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {\n            var lessLink = e.next();\n            swapContent(lessLink);\n          }\n        });\n      });\n\n//]]\u003e\n\u003c/script\u003e  \u003cscript type=\"text/javascript\"\u003e\n  //\u003c![CDATA[\n      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');\n      var $copy;\n      if ($ratingGraph.length \u003e 0) {\n          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();\n class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9786068620732\" href=\"/review/list/6663086-simona?shelf=wizards\"\u003ewizards\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1464250692\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer430898815793069526\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631057._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eRating: 5+/5\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA venit în sfârșit momentul când pot face și eu o recenzie pentru una dintre seriile mele preferate: \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e. Primul volum al acestei serii scrise de \u003cb\u003eJ.K. Rowling\u003c/b\u003ese numește \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter și Piatra Filosofală\u003c/b\u003eși a apărut recent la \u003cb\u003eEditura Arthur\u003c/b\u003esub o nouă traducere care îi aparține lui \u003cb\u003eFlorin Bican\u003c/b\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNu am mai citit cap-coadă \u003cb\u003eseria Harry Potter\u003c/b\u003e în \u003cb\u003etraducerea veche a Ioanei Iepureanu\u003c/b\u003e de câțiva ani buni, dar aceea este traducerea cu care eu am crescut și care m-a atras, în ciuda păreri\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText430898815793069526\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631057._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eRating: 5+/5\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eA venit în sfârșit momentul când pot face și eu o recenzie pentru una dintre seriile mele preferate: \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e. Primul volum al acestei serii scrise de \u003cb\u003eJ.K. Rowling\u003c/b\u003e se numește \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter și Piatra Filosofală\u003c/b\u003e și a apărut recent la \u003cb\u003eEditura Arthur\u003c/b\u003e sub o nouă traducere care îi aparține lui \u003cb\u003eFlorin Bican\u003c/b\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNu am mai citit cap-coadă \u003cb\u003eseria Harry Potter\u003c/b\u003e în \u003cb\u003etraducerea veche a Ioanei Iepureanu\u003c/b\u003e de câțiva ani buni, dar aceea este traducerea cu care eu am crescut și care m-a atras, în ciuda părerilor negative. Ajunsă acum la o vârstă, și trecută prin mai multe cărți, pot spune într-adevăr că traducerea unor nume proprii dintr-o limbă în alta, fără a se face referire la numele originale, nu este un lucru bun întrucât se pierde din farmecul creat de autor.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eFlorin Bican\u003c/b\u003e revine cu o traducere mult mai bună din punctul acesta de vedere, numele proprii sunt la fel ca cele din engleză (\u003cb\u003eMalfoy \u003c/b\u003eși nu \u003cb\u003eReacredință\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eQuidditch\u003c/b\u003e și nu \u003cb\u003eVâjhaț\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eGryffindor \u003c/b\u003eși nu \u003cb\u003eCercetași\u003c/b\u003e, etc.).\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAm auzit o serie de \u003cb\u003ediscuții\u003c/b\u003e despre cum \u003cb\u003etraducerea de la Egmont\u003c/b\u003e nu era una corectă cu privire la ce am menționat mai sus, dar și deoarece existau pasaje din cartea originală care nu au fost traduse în întregime. Eu nu am apucat să citesc seria \u003cb\u003eHP în limba engleză\u003c/b\u003e (este în proces acest amănunt), așa că nu pot spune cu certitudine acest lucru, dar adevărul este că am avut senzația că traducerea veche era un pic cam simplistă, ca și când lipsea ceva pe alocuri.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631058._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eNoua traducere\u003c/b\u003e de la \u003cb\u003eeditura Arthur\u003c/b\u003e este \u003cb\u003eîncântătoare\u003c/b\u003e, și pot spune că după ce am făcut o \u003cb\u003ecomparație cu ediția de la Egmont\u003c/b\u003e, această nouă ediție este mult mai recomandată fiind una completă și corectă, sensul ideilor din engleză nepierzându-și originalitatea.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eÎntâlnim și aici o serie de traduceri de care sunt sigură că sunteți curioși: \u003cb\u003eSalcia Plesnitoare\u003c/b\u003e (nope, Severus Plesneală nu mai există, în cazul în care vă întrebați; Severus Snape a rămas și în traducere - \u003cb\u003eWhomping Willow\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eSalcia Bătăușă\u003c/b\u003e în traducerea veche), \u003cb\u003eMageamii \u003c/b\u003e(\u003cb\u003eMuggles\u003c/b\u003e, sau \u003cb\u003eÎncuiați \u003c/b\u003edupă traducerea veche), \u003cb\u003eNick-Cel-Decapitat-Un-Pic\u003c/b\u003e (\u003cb\u003eNearly Headless Nick\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eNick Aproape-Făr-de-Cap\u003c/b\u003e în traducerea veche), \u003cb\u003eBaronul-Băi-de-Sânge\u003c/b\u003e (\u003cb\u003eBloody Baron\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eBaronul Sângeros\u003c/b\u003e în traducerea veche), \u003cb\u003eNimbus Două Mii\u003c/b\u003e (\u003cb\u003eNimbus Two Thousand\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003eNimbus 2000\u003c/b\u003e în traducerea veche), \u003cb\u003eTrântorul\u003c/b\u003e (\u003cb\u003eScabbers\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003ePungașul\u003c/b\u003e în traducerea veche), etc.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAceasta a fost o selecție de denumiri care mie mi-au sărit în atenție mai mult. Unele dintre ele îmi plac cum sună și în noua traducere, multe îmi plac și în traducerea veche. Cu toate că majoritatea numelor proprii nu au fost traduse, am observat și mici excepții.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631059._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eRevenind la \u003cb\u003epovestea cărții\u003c/b\u003e, pentru că nu am apucat să vă zic nimic încă! Această \u003cb\u003eprimă carte a seriei\u003c/b\u003e este una \u003cb\u003eabsolut magică\u003c/b\u003e. \u003cb\u003eLumea Harry Potter\u003c/b\u003e este una dintre lumile care m-a fascinat în copilărie, cărtile și filmele fiind prietenele mele care mă amuzau și mă linișteau de fiecare dată.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003ePovestea băiatului\u003c/b\u003e care a reușit să supraviețuiască atacului celui mai mare vrăjitor întunecat va dăinui probabil încă multă vreme de acum în colo. L-am urmărit cu drag pe \u003cb\u003eHarry\u003c/b\u003e în primul lui an în care se înscrie la \u003cb\u003eșcoala de magie Hogwarts\u003c/b\u003e, acolo unde au fost și părinții săi pe care nu a apucat să îi cunoască.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eVrăjile\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003efantomele\u003c/b\u003e plutitoare din \u003cb\u003ecastelul Hogwarts\u003c/b\u003e, bucuria rezolvării de \u003cb\u003emistere\u003c/b\u003e a lui \u003cb\u003eHarry\u003c/b\u003e alături de prietenii săi \u003cb\u003eRon \u003c/b\u003eși \u003cb\u003eHermioane\u003c/b\u003e, m-au făcut să îndrăgesc fiecare capitol al acestei cărți, și să mă bucur de un univers unde \u003cb\u003efantasticul\u003c/b\u003e abia își deschide aripile, urmând ca următoarele cărți să mă dea pe spate din ce în ce mai mult.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631060._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDacă nu ați citit această carte (serie) până acum, eu cred că aveți acum ocazia să vă apucați de o călătorie fantastică de care vă veți aminti multă vreme! Ca să fiți și mai atrași de această carte, la început veți găsi și o \u003cb\u003ehartă interesantă\u003c/b\u003e a locurilor de care veți auzi în \u003cb\u003elumea magică Harry Potter\u003c/b\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631061._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eCa aspect\u003c/b\u003e, \u003cb\u003enoua ediție\u003c/b\u003e este parțial mulțumitoare. Îmi place foarte mult că are o \u003cb\u003ecopertă cartonată\u003c/b\u003e care are aproape același aspect ca și \u003cb\u003esupracoperta\u003c/b\u003e (aceasta din urmă având în plus un titlu lucios auriu), \u003cb\u003ecalitatea paginilor\u003c/b\u003e este ok, \u003cb\u003escrisul\u003c/b\u003e este potrivit ca mărime, avem parte și de o \u003cb\u003eharta minunată\u003c/b\u003e la începutul cărții, însă \u003cb\u003eimaginea de pe copertă\u003c/b\u003e mi-aș fi dorit să fie în întregime ca cea originală. Există numeroase ediții pentru coperta primului volum, și cred că se putea lucra mai mult la acest detaliu care uneori este cel mai atractiv pentru mulți cititori.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631062._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631063._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631064._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631065._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631066._SY540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cb\u003eCitate:\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\"Tocmai ridicase bagheta, când ușa compartimentului se deschise din nou. Băiatul cu broasca se întoarse, de astă dată însoțit de o fată. Fata purta deja mantia de la Hogwarts.\u003cbr\u003e- A văzut cineva o broască? A pierdut-o Neville.\u003cbr\u003eVorbea pe un ton autoritat. Avea o claie de păr șaten, iar dinții din față îi erau cam mari.\u003cbr\u003e- Deja i-am spus că nu i-am văzut broasca, o informă Ron, dar fata nu părea să asculte ce zice.\u003cbr\u003eSe uita la bagheta din mâna lui.\u003cbr\u003e- A, făceai o vrajă? Ia să vedem.\u003cbr\u003eFata se așeză pe banchetă. Ron părea luat prin surprindere.\u003cbr\u003e- Ăăă. Bine.\u003cbr\u003eÎși drese glasul.\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMargarete, margarină, raze aurii de soare,\u003cbr\u003eȘobolanul ăsta gras, să fie galben la culoare.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAgită bagheta, dar nu se întâmplă nimic. Trântorul rămase cenușiu și adormit.\" (p.123-124)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\"Era deosebit de greu. Harry și Seamus roteau bagheta și șfichiuiau aerul cu ea din răsputeri, dar pana pe care li se ceruse s-o trimită în slăvi rămânea în fața lor nemișcată. Seamus își pierduse răbdarea în asemenea măsură, încât îi dădu bietei pene un ghiont ajutător cu bagheta și-i dădu foc. Harry trebui să stingă cu pălăria flăcările izbucnite ca urmare a acestei manevre.\u003cbr\u003eNici Ron, la masa alăturată, nu părea să aibă mai mult noroc.\u003cbr\u003e- Wingardium Leviosa! striga el cât îl ținea gura, rotindu-și brațele lungi de parcă era o moară de vânt.\u003cbr\u003e- Nu pronunți corect, o auzi Harry pe Hermione repezindu-l. Se spune Wing-gar-dium Levi-o-sa, pronunță frumos silava «gar» - cu «a» lung.\u003cbr\u003e- De ce n-o pronunți tu, dacă ești așa deșteaptă? mârâi Ron.\u003cbr\u003eHermione își suflecă mânecile robei, șfichiui aerul cu bagheta și zise:\u003cbr\u003e- Wingardium Leviosa!\u003cbr\u003ePana decolă de pe pupitru și începu să graviteze pe deasupra lor, la o înălțime apreciabilă.\u003cbr\u003e- Bravo, excelent! aplaudă profesorul Flitwick. Atenție, toată lumea! Domnișoara Granger a reușit!\u003cbr\u003eLa sfârșitul orei, Ron era un pachet de nervi.\" (p.197)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\"- Uitați-vă colo, spuse Hagrid. Vedeți ceva care strălucește pe pământ? Ceva argintiu? Ăla-i sânge de unicorn. În Pădure e un unicorn pe care l-a rănit ceva, nu se știe ce. Da' rău de tot... E a doua oară săptămâna asta când se întâmplă așa ceva. Miercurea trecută am găsit un unicorn mort. De data asta, o să încercăm să găsim bietu' animal rănit. S-ar putea să trebuiască să-l omorâm, ca să nu se mai chinuie.\u003cbr\u003e- Și ce se întâmplă dacă, înainte să găsim noi unicornul, ne găsește fiara care l-a rănit? întrebă Malfoy, incapabil să-și ascundă frica din glas.\u003cbr\u003e- Nimic din pădurea asta nu vă poate face vreun rău atâta vreme cât sunteți cu mine sau Fang, spuse Hagrid. Și să nu vă abateți de la potecă. Gata - acu' ne-mpărțim în două echipe și urmăm poteca în direcții opuse. E sânge peste tot - tre' să se fi târât de colo-colo cel puțin noaptea trecută.\u003cbr\u003e- Îl vreau pe Fang, se repez Malfoy, privind la colții lungi ai câinelui.\u003cbr\u003e- N-ai decât, da' te previn, e un fricos, spuse Hagrid. Io, Harry și Hermione o s-o luăm într-o parte și Malfoy, Neville și Fang - în cealaltă. Și cine găsește unicornu', lansează în sus scântei verzi. Ne-am înțeles? Scoateți-vă baghetele și exersați puțin chiar acum. Așa... Iar dacă cineva are probleme, lansați scântei roșii și-o să venim toți să vă găsim. Fiți cu băgare de seamă. Să mergem!\" (p.283-284)\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"430898815793069526\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1276761791\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1276761791\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"♥♡¢σσкιє♥♡ (Krystle) \" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/5076023-krystle\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"♥♡¢σσкιє♥♡ (Krystle) \" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470623118p2/5076023.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1276761791?book_show_action=false\"\u003eApr 05, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"♥♡¢σσкιє♥♡ (Krystle) \" class=\"user\" name=\"♥♡¢σσкιє♥♡ (Krystle) \" href=\"/user/show/5076023-krystle\"\u003e♥♡¢σσкιє♥♡ (Krystle) \u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1276761791\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17130526581168886389\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e \u003ci\u003eYou can read this review and more on my blog:\u003c/i\u003e \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cdiv\u003e \u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/\" title=\"Kookie Krysp Reads\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1435883476i/15384366.png\" alt=\"Kookie Krysp Reads\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e \u003c/div\u003eThis was my first time reading this book. I have never even watched the movies, and somehow I was lucky enough to avoid any spoilers. I got to enjoy the story like it was meant to be enjoyed so I know more than a few of you Potter fans wish you were me right now and got to fall in love with this series for the first time.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWhat can I say?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668858.gif\" alt=\"world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape\" width=\"500\" height=\"190\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhile reading this, I felt simultaneously transported back in time and into another world.The world was filled\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17130526581168886389\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003eYou can read this review and more on my blog:\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cdiv\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/\" title=\"Kookie Krysp Reads\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n    \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1435883476i/15384366.png\" alt=\"Kookie Krysp Reads\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003eThis was my first time reading this book. I have never even watched the movies, and somehow I was lucky enough to avoid any spoilers. I got to enjoy the story like it was meant to be enjoyed so I know more than a few of you Potter fans wish you were me right now and got to fall in love with this series for the first time.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWhat can I say?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668858.gif\" alt=\"world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape\" width=\"500\" height=\"190\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhile reading this, I felt simultaneously transported back in time and into another world.The world was filled with magic and mythical creatures and the time was when I was eleven years old and filled with imagination and wonder. I've read my fair share of children's books, but I've never read one that so perfectly captured the feeling of how wonderful and freeing it is to be a child.\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/xYjjO.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668859.gif\" alt=\"xYjjO\" width=\"500\" height=\"214\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eI loved the moments when Harry, Ron, and Hermoine got to play, eat sweets, and find mischief like normal kids just as much as I liked the moments when they were learning magic and fighting monsters. Even the most mundane activities were written in such a wistful and intriguing way that I was afraid to miss a single word. Usually if I my eyes glaze over I just keep reading until I get caught up but that was impossible to do with this book. I was scared that if I looked away for even a moment I might miss something.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/giphy.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668860.gif\" alt=\"giphy\" width=\"500\" height=\"202\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhen the story began, I hated the Dursleys with such a passion. A group of more miserable and hateful people has never been found. After a while, I had to remind myself to chill out because things were going to get better for Harry eventually. And that's the only way I made it though those first chapters without throwing my book across the room.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_inline_myy3ue9qRV1rguask.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668861.gif\" alt=\"tumblr_inline_myy3ue9qRV1rguask\" width=\"500\" height=\"190\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBut something happened when Harry met Ron's mom for the first time. I was so relieved when she was sweet and motherly towards him that I realized why the Dursleys had to be so terrible. There are plenty of mean and horrible people Harry has to deal with, but those bad people make the friends Harry meets seem all the more wonderful.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Trio-3-harry-ron-and-hermione-26030628-500-207_large.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668862.gif\" alt=\"Trio-3-harry-ron-and-hermione-26030628-500-207_large\" width=\"500\" height=\"207\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAfter I realized how necessary the villains were to the story, I started to enjoy them more. When Harry and the gang got in trouble, instead of just feeling dread and worrying about them, I also looked forward to seeing how they were going to get out of their current scrape.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/125f9c80-016c-0133-f461-0e18518aac2f.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668863.gif\" alt=\"125f9c80-016c-0133-f461-0e18518aac2f\" width=\"499\" height=\"201\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThere was a chemistry between all the characters in this book that was such a pleasure. Harry is an innocent and heroic little boy who is lucky to have a loyal and brave friend like Ron, and Hermione is the smart, mother hen. She worries about them both, tells them when their ideas are stupid, and then goes along to keep them out of trouble. And Dumbledore is insanely funny it only took two scenes for me to fall in love with him and wish he was my crazy great-uncle. \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_mqz0icMkiR1syf0pdo1_500.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668864.gif\" alt=\"tumblr_mqz0icMkiR1syf0pdo1_500\" width=\"500\" height=\"250\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eI honestly can't think of a thing I didn't love about this book. I even loved the names! (Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington is the best name in the history of names, and I will never refer to him as “Headless Nick”.)\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_inline_ne06i4BIwd1s8wp3s.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668865.gif\" alt=\"tumblr_inline_ne06i4BIwd1s8wp3s\" width=\"245\" height=\"180\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEverything was so well thought out and planned, and there were more than a few surprising moments that I never saw coming.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/giphy-1.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668866.gif\" alt=\"giphy (1)\" width=\"489\" height=\"198\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eI am so glad that I waited as long as I did to read this. I have always liked to read, but when I was a kid, I didn't love it the way I do now. I finally know why everyone loves this book so much. It's not because it is the greatest piece of literature that has ever been written, It's because this book shows how joyful and fun reading can be. Reading doesn't have to be intimidated and hard to be good. The best books--the books that stick with you and make you smile when you think about them--are the ones that challenge you, teach you something useful, and entertain the heck out of you.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_mmma0qjTvP1s5po2no1_500.gif\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n    \u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668867.gif\" alt=\"tumblr_mmma0qjTvP1s5po2no1_500\" width=\"480\" height=\"270\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis book did all that and more.\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis is the first book I have every read that I can honestly recommend everyone read.\u003cbr\u003e \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eI'm not even sure how to do the parental guidance on this one. I recommend the parent read it first and then decide if their child can handle it. At the very least, the parent will have some fun.\u003c/em\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://kookiekrysp.com/review-40/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eThis review was originally posted on Kookie Krysp Reads\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"17130526581168886389\" href=\"#\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1606685969\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Rachel Nicole Wagner\" class=\"left \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1606685969?book_show_action=false\"\u003eOct 07, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Rachel Nicole Wagner\" class=\"user\" name=\"Rachel Nicole Wagner\" href=\"/user/show/25652076-rachel-nicole-wagner\"\u003eRachel Nicole Wagner\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582889\" href=\"/book/show/17372039-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25652076-rachel-nicole-wagner?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1606685969\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer16563229331654394992\"\u003e**5/5 Stars but I wish I could give it about 9 3/4 out of 5! hehe. It's so wonderful! \u003cbr /\u003e I gotta be honest, I missed the Harry Potter train whenever I was a wee tyke. I had never seen the movies or read the books until last year whenever my grandmom gave me and my sister the whole movie collection and told us we had to watch them because they're, \"simply amazing,\" as she said. :) So, last year, me and my sister sat down and watched all of the movies, in order. I was absolutely amazed at how great\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText16563229331654394992\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e**5/5 Stars but I wish I could give it about 9 3/4 out of 5! hehe. It's so wonderful! \u003cbr /\u003e I gotta be honest, I missed the Harry Potter train whenever I was a wee tyke. I had never seen the movies or read the books until last year whenever my grandmom gave me and my sister the whole movie collection and told us we had to watch them because they're, \"simply amazing,\" as she said. :) So, last year, me and my sister sat down and watched all of the movies, in order. I was absolutely amazed at how great the storyline really is, how wonderful all of the characters are and ultimately, how MAGICAL it really is. This past summer, my family and I went on our annual trip to Anaheim, California. We always go to Disneyland, Huntington Beach, and Universal Studios. I was really excited to hear that Universal Studios had a new \"Diagon Alley,\" area that was supposed to be as \"magical\" as the Harry Potter movies. Let's just say, I was in absolute wonder. We spent almost our entire day in Diagon Alley, we only had time to ride two other rides in the whole park before closing time because we stayed there that late. I was amazed by how magical it all was. The shops, the food, the wands, the tricks, the staff, the rides, everything was completely and utterly themed for Harry Potter and I honestly felt like I was in Diagon Alley and Hogsmead. It was INCREDIBLE. So, while we were there, I decided that I HAD TO read the books. I wanted more of this wizarding world, I wanted to know more about the characters and everything that surrounds this world. So, we came home, I got on e-bay, found a brand new set of the special edition books that have spines make the castle and I bought them! As soon as they came in, I couldn't wait to start reading them. Becuase of school (I'm triple majoring in Nursing, English and Business) and because of the time I have to work (preceptorship hours for my BSN in Nursing) I haven't had near as much time to read. It's been difficult but I finally got caught up enough in school and finished the books that I was reading over this summer where I could start this book. \u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone! The first book in the Wizarding World of Harry Potter books. I must say that I was not disappointed at all. In fact, I'm even more in love with the world of Harry Potter and these characters that the INCREDIBLE J.K. Rowling has created. It's such a lovely book that explores being different, outcasted, standing up for what's right, being afraid and brave at the same time, and never losing your curiosity. It's such an amazing book. I'm so excited that I've finally got to start reading these lovely books and I can't wait to continue on! :) \u003cbr /\u003e5/5 Stars but I wish I could give it about 9 3/4 out of 5! hehe. It's so wonderful! \u003cbr /\u003eThank you, J.K. Rowling, for writing these books and creating this world. I believe you're never too old to discover the magic in this world and become a part of it. This is just excellent! :) \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003exo, \u003cbr /\u003eRachel \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"16563229331654394992\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1606685969\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1606685969\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1606685969\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1606685969'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_1606685969\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1606685969?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e19 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_1606685969\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1606685969\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=19\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1606685969\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_1606685969\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 1606685969, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); return false;\"\u003e2 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/1606685969?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=8\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1606685969' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/1606685969/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView 2 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1606685969' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 1606685969, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1457011560\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1457011560\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Lily\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1899725-lily\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Lily\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451003929p2/1899725.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1457011560?book_show_action=false\"\u003eDec 19, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Lily\" class=\"user\" name=\"Lily\" href=\"/user/show/1899725-lily\"\u003eLily\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          added it\n\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Audiobook 9781907545016\" href=\"/book/show/8040193-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1899725-lily?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1899725-lily?shelf=2015\"\u003e2015\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1899725-lily?shelf=audiobooks\"\u003eaudiobooks\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1457011560\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer18359149202169207461\"\u003eI can't rate Harry Potter any more than I can rate hot chocolate or weekends or the feeling of being nuzzled by a puppy. But I can say that the experience of reading this book now, when I'm older than Lily and James were when they had their son, was very different from the experience of reading it for the first time when I was younger than Harry. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBefore I had ever seriously said goodbye to anyone, I thought that the first chapter was comical. Now, it's a struggle not to cry alongside Hagrid, McG\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText18359149202169207461\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI can't rate Harry Potter any more than I can rate hot chocolate or weekends or the feeling of being nuzzled by a puppy. But I can say that the experience of reading this book now, when I'm older than Lily and James were when they had their son, was very different from the experience of reading it for the first time when I was younger than Harry. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBefore I had ever seriously said goodbye to anyone, I thought that the first chapter was comical. Now, it's a struggle not to cry alongside Hagrid, McGonagall, and Dumbledore. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI used to immerse myself in the wizarding world without thinking too much about it. Now, I'm fascinated by how JKR's writing choices make that immersion possible. Magical cultures, histories, and economies are hinted at in a way that resembles how we usually interact with their real-life counterparts, rather than being explained through info-dumps that forcefully remind us that we're being introduced to a fictional world.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI used to look up to Harry, thinking of him as a practically grown-up hero. Now, I'm struck by his social astuteness and his lack of pretension - I loved seeing him figure out how to share with Ron without making Ron feel embarrassed, as well as his matter-of-fact acceptance of Quirrell's speech impediment. I was also surprised at how manipulative he is under certain circumstances - he would indeed have done well in Slytherin. Mostly, I just wish I could hug him and Hedwig and the others, and protect them from the terrible things in the not-too-distant future. And yet, I think their willingness to confront the future is part of what makes them so lovable. In some ways, I still look up to them. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFinally, this reading experience created a bridge to the version of myself that opened the book over 15 years ago. In the time since then, we've been inundated with other people's (mostly filmmakers') ideas of what Harry's world looks and sounds like. It took a bit of conscious effort, but by displacing those images I rediscovered the world that my own imagination once created - part of it modeled after people and places in my own life at the time, part of it purely invented and then seemingly forgotten, but just waiting to be brought back to life.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"18359149202169207461\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1457011560\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1457011560\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1457011560\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1457011560'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_1457011560\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1457011560?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e20 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_1457011560\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1457011560\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=20\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1457011560\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_1457011560\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 1457011560, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); I know I read like this series like a manic; and was\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9900038869916586225\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003eSeemita wrote: \"Aww.. it feels good to revisit the Potter World through your lovely review, Lily! I've lately become more appreciative...\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI know what you mean,\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6951499448504839018\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003eCecily wrote: \"Lily wrote: \"At one point in life, I wasn't too fond of re-reading books. I've lately become more appreciative...\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI know what you mean, and I'm still wary. With a big pile of books I know I want ...\"\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt's definitely tricky! And I honestly still don't re-read very much. Most of the other re-reads that I've done this year have been of books that I finished reading for the first time and then decided to re-read right away.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/407336608?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJan 27, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Erin ☕ *Proud Book Hoarder*\" class=\"user\" name=\"Erin ☕ *Proud Book Hoarder*\" href=\"/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder\"\u003eErin ☕ *Proud Book Hoarder*\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780439362139\"      Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=a-own-book-form\"\u003ea-own-book-form\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=s-king-recommends\"\u003es-king-recommends\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=4-star\"\u003e4-star\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=movie-seen\"\u003emovie-seen\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=reviewed\"\u003ereviewed\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer407336608\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer1503736620179541251\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e“It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.”\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e3.5 stars\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI’m sure this thick book became even more legendary than the author ever dreamed it would.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling uses cookie cutter characters to create a fascinating world of magic, wizardry, and the great divide between good and evil which has always captivated all age groups and which always will. The world building is one reason the novels – and then movies – became so famous. Getting that invite to Hogwarts must be such fun - I’m sure many no\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText1503736620179541251\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e“It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.”\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e3.5 stars\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI’m sure this thick book became even more legendary than the author ever dreamed it would.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling uses cookie cutter characters to create a fascinating world of magic, wizardry, and the great divide between good and evil which has always captivated all age groups and which always will. The world building is one reason the novels – and then movies – became so famous. Getting that invite to Hogwarts must be such fun - I’m sure many normals in this world fantasize it happening to them at that age.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry Potter is likeable, but simple. His friends are the same. The villain promises to be a fascinating one but he’s not really uncovered yet save for whispers of legends and foreshadowing. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe book was especially enjoyable at the beginning, where Harry is unfortunate in his demented average family. There’s humor that works, sometimes, pushing the story along. The real excitement starts when Harry steps foot onto Hogwarts ground, meeting the bizarre blend of professors, other students, potions, classes, and challenges.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI know the movie was rated poorly by some in comparison to the book. To me it’s almost word for word, including dialogue. Some of it, such as emotion, worked better in page form. I do have to prefer some of the movie though, especially when playing Quidditch, because the effects made it more interesting. I think Rowling drug it out too long in book form, and because of this dragging on I grew a little bored at times.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOverall a cute and quirky, simple novel that opens a door to a world that skyrocketed. I’m hoping I enjoy the later novels more, just like I did with the movies.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"1503736620179541251\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca href=\"/review/list/46731504-irshad?shelf=audio-booked\"\u003eaudio-booked\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1571682018\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer3451289349636288973\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone by J.K Rowling - 5/5 stars\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI wished that I had read this book when I was younger. It really is amazing. The plot development and the characters in this book were so good! I just can't get enough of it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIn this tale of the Philosopher's Stone, Harry discover that he is a wizard. He lives with muggles and is treated rather poorly even though his muggle family know that he is a wizard. \u003cbr /\u003eOn his eleventh birthday, Harry receives a letter from \u003ci\u003eHogwarts,\u003c/i\u003e the schoo\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText3451289349636288973\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone by J.K Rowling - 5/5 stars\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI wished that I had read this book when I was younger. It really is amazing. The plot development and the characters in this book were so good! I just can't get enough of it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIn this tale of the Philosopher's Stone, Harry discover that he is a wizard. He lives with muggles and is treated rather poorly even though his muggle family know that he is a wizard. \u003cbr /\u003eOn his eleventh birthday, Harry receives a letter from \u003ci\u003eHogwarts,\u003c/i\u003e the school for wizards and witches. He eventually attends Hogwarts and meets his friends, Ron and Hermoine. The friendship between these three will definitely be one of my favorites easily, I can already tell. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI loved the entire book and breezed through it. It left my mind amazed and bewildered. I have watched the films countless of times and now I SEE THE MISSING PORTIONS that are so relevant to the plot. The book makes everything much more clear and I loved the casting of spells and the sorting hat where Harry was sorted into Gryffindor! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWill definitely be reading this series throughout this year and I can't wait. Planning to listen to the auidobooks for a new experience as well. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"3451289349636288973\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border
