stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer141449726\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10078560795913177104\"\u003eI am short on words, so I'll keep it simple. I started Harry Potter late, and I kept telling myself \u003ci\u003ebetter late than never\u003c/i\u003e. Yes, that does work to an extent. And then I think of my younger version, reading all the crap our school teachers used to give us. And then I think how much fun would have been to read Harry Potter at that age. Why didn't anyone tell me about the book back then? Why didn't my parents buy it for my birthday? Or Christmas? \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOf course I blame my parents. Parents are responsibl\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText10078560795913177104\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI am short on words, so I'll keep it simple. I started Harry Potter late, and I kept telling myself \u003ci\u003ebetter late than never\u003c/i\u003e. Yes, that does work to an extent. And then I think of my younger version, reading all the crap our school teachers used to give us. And then I think how much fun would have been to read Harry Potter at that age. Why didn't anyone tell me about the book back then? Why didn't my parents buy it for my birthday? Or Christmas? \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOf course I blame my parents. Parents are responsible for everything. Well, almost everything. So mum, if you're reading this, shame on you! You took away from me the privilege of growing up with Harry Potter. That is a crime! A crime I say!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBut seriously you guys, Harry Potter is epic! I can’t wait to get my hands on \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling\"\u003eHarry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"10078560795913177104\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return  \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19126246-kaitlin?shelf=my-sff-faves\"\u003emy-sff-faves\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1469903020\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer13552676377351581927\"\u003eNaturally this was a phenomenal because it's Harry Potter and I have always loved these books since I first read them, but this edition is the brand new illustrated edition and I have to say that Jim Kay was BY FAR a wonderful choice to illustrate these because he's represented the wonder, quirk and magic of the world and characters beautifully! I had so many pages within this that I adored, the colour palette is beautiful and has such a great vibe, and the style is free, flowing and fabulous.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eTh\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText13552676377351581927\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eNaturally this was a phenomenal because it's Harry Potter and I have always loved these books since I first read them, but this edition is the brand new illustrated edition and I have to say that Jim Kay was BY FAR a wonderful choice to illustrate these because he's represented the wonder, quirk and magic of the world and characters beautifully! I had so many pages within this that I adored, the colour palette is beautiful and has such a great vibe, and the style is free, flowing and fabulous.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe story was like coming home to friends of course, and I am so excited to keep reading the next few soon!! 5*s of course (although Harry Potter defies all rating systems)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1574108822\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer14029602036786352840\"\u003eTá liberado chorar de saudade?\u003cbr /\u003eHá tanto tempo que eu não mergulhava nessa história que foi quase como se eu tivesse lendo pela primeira vez novamente. Quase. Ver os personagens tão novos e tão corajosos, me impressionar com os perigos que eles já se colocavam... \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eO mais legal de reler o livro foi que eu estava com muitos detalhes do filme na cabeça, então várias coisas eu não lembrava que havia acontecido. Como eu disse, foi quase como ler pela primeira vez. Nostalgia total.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u0026lt;3 Muito amor!\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext href=\"/review/show/1686871365?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJul 11, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Lavinia Călina\" class=\"user\" name=\"Lavinia Călina\" href=\"/user/show/19770568-lavinia-c-lina\"\u003eLavinia Călina\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1686871365\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17700481285718605466\"\u003eI read it late, but still I can see how this book became so popular. It has everything a child needs: adventure, mystery, magic and it's well written. Maybe when I'll have time I'll read the rest of the books in the series.\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1373239436' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1373239436' comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_539250222\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/539250222\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1356324709p2/11375137.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/539250222?book_show_action=false\"\u003eFeb 17, 2013\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" href=\"/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury\"\u003eCait (Paper Fury)\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=middle-grade\"\u003emiddle-grade\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=magical-fantasy\"\u003emagical-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=5-star\"\u003e5-star\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=read-2013\"\u003eread-2013\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer539250222\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7457913009706399703\"\u003eThe hype of Harry Potter passed me by when I was small, so it’s only now (at age nineteen) that I borrowed the famed (and very tattered) novel from the library and immersed myself in the world of Hogwarts. It was strictly for “research”, okay? I can’t call myself a children’s author and yet have skipped the most impacting and controversial children’s novel of all time. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo first of all, I loved it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI’m not fan of the “classics” style, but the clean prose of Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Ston\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7457913009706399703\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThe hype of Harry Potter passed me by when I was small, so it’s only now (at age nineteen) that I borrowed the famed (and very tattered) novel from the library and immersed myself in the world of Hogwarts. It was strictly for “research”, okay? I can’t call myself a children’s author and yet have skipped the most impacting and controversial children’s novel of all time. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo first of all, I loved it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI’m not fan of the “classics” style, but the clean prose of Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone, the quirky description and the subtle humour could very well convert me. It’s written in omnipresent narrative, again, not my “thing” – with POV everywhere and by anyone. Once Harry turned eleven, we delved more into his viewing of the world, but at the beginning, we see out of everyone’ eyes. Even that cat’s. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe character? Oh, the characters! My personal taste requires a book to be well written and have gripping characters. (Everything else is open for negotiation.) I loved Hagrid! And Dumbledore. And Snape (urgh). And Harry! Ron and the Weasley twins were instant favourites of course (the latter’s antics keeping me smiling the whole way through). But, I’ll go right ahead and say that Hermoine is my utter favourite. I loved her from the beginning and every aspect of her character was so well written, not to mention hilariously brought across. Ron and Harry’s understandable disgust of her is epic. The only character I said, “Meh”, at was Voldemort. He had so much hype around him from chapter one that I didn’t think he could possibly be that scary. He wasn’t. Any villain who doesn’t kill his victims straight away is going to end up defeated – probably by a preteen and his little gang of snivelly nosed adventure-seekers. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBeing over ten years old, the style of children’s books as changed since Harry Potter first hit the shelves. Does that affect this novel? No! It stands in a classy light of it’s own. It can’t be accused of being “cliché”, because it started everything! It’s well written and well plotted and I think my only complaint is Harry having to spend his summer holidays back with the Dursely family. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs to the controversial aspect? Witchcraft? Wizardry? Is JK Rowling promoting children to immerse themselves in the occult? Should we be scared of this book and ban and burn it? Well, apart from my personal conviction that a book should never be burned, I can’t see much difference to reading about dragons and fairies, to frolicking through Harry’s adventures in Hogwarts. JK Rowling presents a side for evil and a side for good. It can be argued, how is magic ever good? And it can also be argued, is there such a thing as magic? (Or fairies, for that matter! And I still believe in them!) Harry Potter is a fairy tale. Take it or leave it at that. If I had a small child (which I don’t, being…well, a teen and all) I would probably not let them read Harry Potter until they were ten or so. Then we could discuss it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt is an epic classic, still standing after decades, and still inspiring children to imagine, have adventures, and write. Or find their letter to Hogwarts. That option might outweigh the others. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"7457913009706399703\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review539250222\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_539250222' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/539250222/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView all 3 comments\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_539250222' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 539250222, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_83629646\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/83629646\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Elisa \" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3112505-elisa\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Elisa \" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452314605p2/3112505.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/83629646?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMar 15, 2014\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Elisa \" class=\"user\" name=\"Elisa \" href=\"/user/show/3112505-elisa\"\u003eElisa \u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780590353403\" href=\"/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3112505-elisa?shelf=kids-fiction\"\u003ekids-fiction\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3112505-elisa?shelf=seven-greatest-books-ever\"\u003eseven-greatest-books-ever\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer83629646\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9530948086888677516\"\u003eI highly doubted that I would ever write a review for any of the Harry Potter books. Instead, I created a shelf called \"seven greatest books ever\" and threw them all in there, hoping that would be enough to display my immense love for them. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAfter seeing Part 1 of the Deathly Hallows movie, I decided that I would kick start the re-reading process before the release of Part 2, so I picked up \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling\"\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/a\u003e for probably the 15th time, and began to read. I realized part way th\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9530948086888677516\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI highly doubted that I would ever write a review for any of the Harry Potter books. Instead, I created a shelf called \"seven greatest books ever\" and threw them all in there, hoping that would be enough to display my immense love for them. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAfter seeing Part 1 of the Deathly Hallows movie, I decided that I would kick start the re-reading process before the release of Part 2, so I picked up \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling\"\u003eHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone\u003c/a\u003e for probably the 15th time, and began to read. I realized part way through, that even if I didn't want to review it for its literary merit, I still had much to say about the book solely regarding how it makes me \u003ci\u003efeel\u003c/i\u003e.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAt twenty three years of age, the book is still everything that it was for me when I was only twelve. I remember seeing it in a book order (remember those?) in the sixth grade and putting a star next to it to take home to my mom. My mom, not wanting to buy me a book I'd never read, denied me my request, adding that it looked pretty silly anyway (the joke was on her though, she came to love them too). Anyway, the next year, my cool uncle (don't we all have one?) decided \u003ci\u003ehe\u003c/i\u003e was going to buy them for my cousin and \u003ci\u003eshe\u003c/i\u003e was going to have to let me borrow them. So I began the Harry Potter books, and suddenly being twelve- awkward and unpopular, wasn't quite so lonely as it had always been. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI dreamed myself right into Harry Potter's world; not in a dangerous, psychotic way, but in a starry eyed, childlike way. Harry, Ron, and Hermione were better friends to me than anyone I met throughout my junior high and high school years, which in a way is a bit sad, but I have no regrets.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis was the first time that I've read Sorcerer's Stone since Deathly Hallows came out, and it inevitably made for a far more emotional experience than the first time around. What was once just good, innocent, fun can't exactly be viewed as such when you've seen the big picture. I literally burst into tears at the end of the chapter in which Harry and Ron finally take Hermione as their friend. Oh, what the heck? I'll go ahead and post the paragraph, in case anyone else is wanting to ride the high of that emotional wave:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003eBut from that moment on, Hermione Granger became their friend. There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAh! Knowing what they were in store for- years of utter devotion to one another made this moment so much bigger now than it had seemed at first. Either way though, it's a very moving moment. I love this book. I will always love this book. And I full intend to disown any future children of mine who can't appreciate it with me (I haven't decided as to whether or not that's a joke yet).\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9530948086888677516\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_body\"\u003e\n    \u003ca style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/3112505-elisa\"\u003eElisa \u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9955155725752045969\"\u003eHaha good plan!\u003c/span\u003e\n\n    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      Jan 14, 2016 07:32PM\n itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1951251\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Namratha\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/114559-namratha\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Namratha\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1406702134p2/114559.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left href=\"/user/show/114559-namratha\"\u003eNamratha\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747532743\" href=\"/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=mystery\"\u003emystery\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=journey-within\"\u003ejourney-within\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=classics\"\u003eclassics\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=adventure\"\u003eadventure\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=childrens-fantasy\"\u003echildrens-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=ya-lit\"\u003eya-lit\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=tween-time\"\u003etween-time\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=books-i-love\"\u003ebooks-i-love\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=pottermania\"\u003epottermania\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=epic-fantasy\"\u003eepic-fantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=children-s\"\u003echildren-s\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1951251\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15799495979121441769\"\u003eI was expecting my return trip to Hogwarts to be something of a dampener. I had finished the series and after all, how many \u003ci\u003emore\u003c/i\u003e surprises could the first book reveal? The magic must have faded over time and the characters must surely have achieved the status of house-guests who had overstayed their welcome. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ePredictably enough, I was wrong. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReturning to the first book in what I can now proudly say is my most favourite series \u003cb\u003eEVER\u003c/b\u003e was nothing short of magical. It was enchanting to see how the com\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15799495979121441769\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI was expecting my return trip to Hogwarts to be something of a dampener. I had finished the series and after all, how many \u003ci\u003emore\u003c/i\u003e surprises could the first book reveal? The magic must have faded over time and the characters must surely have achieved the status of house-guests who had overstayed their welcome. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ePredictably enough, I was wrong. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eReturning to the first book in what I can now proudly say is my most favourite series \u003cb\u003eEVER\u003c/b\u003e was nothing short of magical. It was enchanting to see how the complex and multifaceted characters of the later books started off as nervous, unsure \u003ci\u003eickle-firsties\u003c/i\u003e. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt was a time for firsts: \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ea) Ill-treated, neglected 11-year old orphan \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e discovers that he is a wizard - an actual, honest-to-goodness, wand-swishing wizard.\u003cbr /\u003eb) There is a magical school called Hogwarts for young witches and wizards like him and at Hogwarts, Harry Potter is a legend and so much more than a small boy who lives in a cupboard under the stairs.\u003cbr /\u003eb) He discovers that he had brave parents who loved him dearly and lost their lives to the most powerful dark wizard in existence in a misguided attempt to save their tiny son.\u003cbr /\u003ec) It will be the first time that he will meet his soon-to-be best friends \u003cb\u003eRon Weasley\u003c/b\u003e and \u003cb\u003eHermione Granger\u003c/b\u003e, not knowing that it would be the start of many unforeseen and memorable adventures for the trio.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFor me, the charm lay in reacquainting myself with my favourite cast of characters: the great and twinkly-eyed Headmaster \u003cb\u003eAlbus Dumbledore\u003c/b\u003e, stern \u003cb\u003eProf. McGonagall\u003c/b\u003e with a staunchly hidden soft-center, quivering \u003cb\u003eNeville Longbottom\u003c/b\u003e who is brave enough to stand up to his friends, nasty \u003cb\u003eDraco Malfoy\u003c/b\u003e, lovable \u003cb\u003eHagrid\u003c/b\u003e, the irrepressible \u003cb\u003eFred\u003c/b\u003e and \u003cb\u003eGeorge\u003c/b\u003e and of course, delightfully detestable \u003cb\u003eSeverus Snape\u003c/b\u003e. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI also liked the fact that \u003cb\u003e\n  \u003cu\u003eJ.K.Rowling\u003c/u\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e carved out a story that was a blend of fantasy and realism. She refused to patronize her young readers. She spoke about death in a manner that doesn't usually finds it's way into a children's book. With minimal sugar-coating, she created a world that was rife with pain, loss and love.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIn this book, Harry Potter faces his vile enemy for the very first time with nerve and bravery. He gets his first opportunity to prove that he is more than just a legendary kid with a mysterious past.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe book sets an adequate pace, lays the foundation for future awesomeness and needless to say....the rest is history.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15799495979121441769\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1951251\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was  \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover \" href=\"/book/show/28550610-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer207250302965778441\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443470366ra/16363719.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"296\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm just going to be honest here: \u003cb\u003eIt is impossible for me to write an unbiased review of Harry Potter.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI \u003ci\u003eknow\u003c/i\u003e Harry Potter has it's flaws, I \u003ci\u003eknow\u003c/i\u003e J.K. Rowling makes mistakes. But Harry Potter is one of those series where you could give me a list naming all its faults, .... and I honestly couldn't care less.\u003cbr\u003eI grew up with Harry, and it will always be my favourite book series. No matter if I'm happy or sad, I will always pick it up again eventually. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo, now that you've been warned, let's review thi\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText207250302965778441\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443470366ra/16363719.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"296\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm just going to be honest here: \u003cb\u003eIt is impossible for me to write an unbiased review of Harry Potter.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI \u003ci\u003eknow\u003c/i\u003e Harry Potter has it's flaws, I \u003ci\u003eknow\u003c/i\u003e J.K. Rowling makes mistakes. But Harry Potter is one of those series where you could give me a list naming all its faults, .... and I honestly couldn't care less.\u003cbr\u003eI grew up with Harry, and it will always be my favourite book series. No matter if I'm happy or sad, I will always pick it up again eventually. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSo, now that you've been warned, let's review this book (or, rather: this edition)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003cu\u003eThe Story\u003c/u\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI don't really need to go into much detail, I think everyone knows what the first book is about: Harry's first year at Hogwarts and his first encounter with Voldemort and magic. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eI love Rowling's writing\u003c/b\u003e and the pace of the plot. There really is not a single dull page in this one.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e\n  \u003cu\u003eThe Edition\u003c/u\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI wanted to re-read Philosopher's Stone for a while now, but with all the TBR books in my shelf, I never really allowed myself to. \u003cbr\u003eSo I was more than happy when I got this beautiful book for christmas. \u003cbr\u003eI don't need to tell you that the illustration in this are \u003cb\u003eamazing\u003c/b\u003e, because if you took one look at the cover you know that \u003cb\u003eJim Kay can draw\u003c/b\u003e. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow, what might be more interesting: Is it worth buying?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429128776ra/14534361.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"172\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFor every Potterhead: YES DEFINITELY\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFor everyone that just liked Harry Potter: Mhh, if you own a copy of the normal edition, it might not be necessary to buy this one, because the text inside is exactly the same, the only bonus are the illustrations. Even if you don't already own a copy, I don't know if it would be wise to buy this, because this book really is \u003cb\u003ehuge\u003c/b\u003e. Alas, hard to transport. No taking this book to work or school to read during break. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eBut:\u003c/b\u003e If you don't plan to bring it with you wherever you go, why not? \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFor me, this book is definitely worth the money and if I ever were to have kids, this is the book I'm going to read them. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_1534014764\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1534014764\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button comment\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/review/show/1534014764?book_show_action=false\u0026amp;from_review_page=8\"\u003esee review\u003c/a\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1534014764' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/1534014764/comments?reverse=true\"\u003eView 1 comment\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1534014764' style='display: \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_140374900\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/140374900\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4793251-aja-the-narcoleptic-ninja\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1444962167p2/4793251.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/140374900?book_show_action=false\"\u003eAug 31, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja\" class=\"user\" name=\"Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja\" href=\"/user/show/4793251-aja-the-narcoleptic-ninja\"\u003eAja: The Narcoleptic Ninja\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer140374900\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9146830968725882947\"\u003eThis is the book that made me love reading. When I was younger I used to hate reading. I couldn't do it and I had no interest in learning it, but I could memorize. So in kindergarten reading groups that was exactly what I did. I memorized. I memorized the reading group books and passed through them all without ever learning how to read. It was my first grade teacher that figured me out and spent four weeks teaching me to read. I owe a lot to that woman. Still, I didn't really like to do it. It\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9146830968725882947\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThis is the book that made me love reading. When I was younger I used to hate reading. I couldn't do it and I had no interest in learning it, but I could memorize. So in kindergarten reading groups that was exactly what I did. I memorized. I memorized the reading group books and passed through them all without ever learning how to read. It was my first grade teacher that figured me out and spent four weeks teaching me to read. I owe a lot to that woman. Still, I didn't really like to do it. It wasn't until second or third grade my mom brought this home and handed it to me and told me to give it a shot. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eChapter one I handed it back and said I didn't like it, she handed it back and told me to try again. Rinse and repeat for a few chapters until something amazing happened. I didn't want to give the book back. I didn't want to put it down to go eat dinner and I certainly didn't want to put it down and go to bed. I stayed up until I was falling asleep on the pages and then I took it to school and started my bad habit of reading in class. Then I read through lunch and recess and silent reading time until I finished this book. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI devoured all the others when I could get my hands on them but between Harry Potter books I didn't know what to do with myself. So my parents did a little digging around and found me another book I liked and then another and another until I became the family bookworm. I started borrowing books from my older sister, I started reading books to my younger brother, I read just about everything and anything I could find and I loved every minute of it. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt's really hard to rate a book that I grew up on, but if any book deserves five stars, it's this one because it helped turn me into the person I am. The series itself got me through a lot of hard times and I love going back to it and re-reading it because it feels like coming home. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9146830968725882947\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review140374900\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link140374900\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\"   Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/43792706-andrea-manzanilla?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1392591047\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11777397880502899488\"\u003e4.25/5\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYa se, no hay ninguna excusa para el hecho de que no había leído Harry Potter hasta ahora, aunque en mi defensa cuando se publico estaba en el vientre de mi madre, pero bueno mejor tarde que nunca. ¿No?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNo creí que me fuera a apegar con los personajes y la historia desde el principio aunque a lo mejor influyo el hecho de que ya había visto las películas anteriormente, lo bueno es que no recuerdo nada de las películas así que puedo leerlo con nuevos ojos. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEl mundo en este primer libro esta m\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11777397880502899488\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e4.25/5\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYa se, no hay ninguna excusa para el hecho de que no había leído Harry Potter hasta ahora, aunque en mi defensa cuando se publico estaba en el vientre de mi madre, pero bueno mejor tarde que nunca. ¿No?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNo creí que me fuera a apegar con los personajes y la historia desde el principio aunque a lo mejor influyo el hecho de que ya había visto las películas anteriormente, lo bueno es que no recuerdo nada de las películas así que puedo leerlo con nuevos ojos. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEl mundo en este primer libro esta muy bien construido al igual que los personajes para tener tan pocas paginas. Obviamente mis personajes favoritos fueron Harry, Ron y Hermonie, pero los gemelos Weasley sin duda también están entre mis favoritos. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling tiene una imaginación que va mas allá de mi comprensión y una pluma fluida que te atrapa sin dejarte respirar, en el buen sentido. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNo se que mas puedo decir que ya no se haya dicho acerca de este maravilloso libro, así que hasta aquí mi reseña. Si no lo han leído no sigan mi ejemplo y léanlo lo mas rápido posible. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11777397880502899488\" href=\"#\" \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1306715706\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer16548360392928543058\"\u003ePilastro dell'infanzia.\u003cbr /\u003eQuello che sono diventato adesso - manco fossi un astrofisico o un calciatore che deve spalare i soldi davanti a casa per entrare - è anche grazie alla lettura di \"Harry Potter\", vero e proprio compagno di viaggio della mia infanzia, non sempre felice e solare.\u003cbr /\u003eLa storia è chiaramente acerba e narrata con un piglio molto fanciullesco, ma il tutto è felicemente controbilanciato dall'impareggiabile atmosfera di Hogwarts e dagli innumerevoli personaggi iconici e riusciti, trio\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText16548360392928543058\" style=\"display:none\"\u003ePilastro dell'infanzia.\u003cbr /\u003eQuello che sono diventato adesso - manco fossi un astrofisico o un calciatore che deve spalare i soldi davanti a casa per entrare - è anche grazie alla lettura di \"Harry Potter\", vero e proprio compagno di viaggio della mia infanzia, non sempre felice e solare.\u003cbr /\u003eLa storia è chiaramente acerba e narrata con un piglio molto fanciullesco, ma il tutto è felicemente controbilanciato dall'impareggiabile atmosfera di Hogwarts e dagli innumerevoli personaggi iconici e riusciti, trio principale compreso.\u003cbr /\u003eIndimenticabile, tra i tanti passaggi memorabili, la tesissima discesa verso la pietra filosofale nei sotterranei di Hogwarts.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"16548360392928543058\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return   Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11337920-megha-patel?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1615776967\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer12671362478806256345\"\u003eWhy have I not read Harry Potter before now, it’s totally amazing! From the first page till the last one I was hooked. I always thought I wouldn’t enjoy a book about a wizard boy who is 11…but damn I was so wrong! Harry, Ron, and Hermoine are probably the best characters ever. They are smart, loyal, brave, funny, and so much more; you can’t help but love them. Honestly, I can’t wait till I get started with the rest of the series.\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext href=\"/review/list/31254457-sara-kamjou?shelf=%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%AA%D8%B2%DB%8C\"\u003eفانتزی\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1402024919\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2244585443396155277\"\u003eدقیقا نمیدانم این چندمین بار هست که هری پاتر خوانی را از سر گرفتهام. حسابش حسابی از دستم در رفته! من معمولا در مورد کتابهایی که خیلی زیاد دوستشان داشته باشم زیاد حرف نمیزنم.\u003cbr /\u003eفقط همینقدر بگویم که هنوز هری پاتر بهترین کتاب زندگیم هست و خواهد بود و هنوز عاشقانه خواندمش و هنوز مطمئنم با اینکه خط به خطش رو حفظ بودم باز هم بارها خواهم خواندش!\u003cbr /\u003eامتیاز من به هری پاتر تو عدد و ستارهها جا نمیشود...\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText2244585443396155277\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eدقیقا نمی‌دانم این چندمین بار هست که هری پاتر خوانی را از سر گرفته‌ام. حسابش حسابی از دستم در رفته! من معمولا در مورد کتاب‌هایی که خیلی زیاد دوستشان داشته باشم زیاد حرف نمی‌زنم.\u003cbr /\u003eفقط همین‌قدر بگویم که هنوز هری پاتر بهترین کتاب زندگیم هست و خواهد بود و هنوز عاشقانه خواندمش و هنوز مطمئنم با اینکه خط به خطش رو حفظ بودم باز هم بارها خواهم خواندش!\u003cbr /\u003eامتیاز من به هری پاتر تو عدد و ستاره‌ها جا نمی‌شود...\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"2244585443396155277\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_54881998\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/54881998\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Liz\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2191574-liz\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Liz\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1249122143p2/2191574.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/54881998?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMay 27, 2010\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Liz\" class=\"user\" name=\"Liz\" href=\"/user/show/2191574-liz\"\u003eLiz\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003edid not like it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781551923963\" href=\"/book/show/742576.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n          \u003cdiv\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003eRecommended to Liz by: \u003c/span\u003e\n      Just about everyone I know. They were all brainwashed.\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2191574-liz?shelf=2009\"\u003e2009\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer54881998\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9822252944981548622\"\u003eIt is a bewildered girl who writes this. \u003ci\u003eAfter all,\u003c/i\u003e her mind reasons, \u003ci\u003eisn’t this THE children’s series? The best thing to have hit the bookstores since Narnia? There must be something tragically wrong with me. Surely my mind has twisted this into something other than what’s really there. Right?\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eUnfortunately, I don’t think so. You see, I’ve realised something. I might only have just finished book one (yeah, I’m just a little behind the times), but I’ve realised something. Harry Potter is a Mary S\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9822252944981548622\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt is a bewildered girl who writes this. \u003ci\u003eAfter all,\u003c/i\u003e her mind reasons, \u003ci\u003eisn’t this THE children’s series? The best thing to have hit the bookstores since Narnia? There must be something tragically wrong with me. Surely my mind has twisted this into something other than what’s really there. Right?\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eUnfortunately, I don’t think so. You see, I’ve realised something. I might only have just finished book one (yeah, I’m just a little behind the times), but I’ve realised something. Harry Potter is a Mary Sue, Gary Stu, Marty Stu, whatever you want to call him. Let me say it again.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHARRY POTTER IS A SUE.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNo wonder it was boring and bothering me so much. I can hear you future readers (at present I have exactly none) demanding to know why, just why, I think he is a Sue, and how dare I? Those of you who haven’t fainted, that is.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*puts on mafia boss accent* You wanna know why? Let me count the ways. If you could just keep track on your fingers–oh, it looks like you’ll need your toes as well–that would be really helpful.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRight. Here we go.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e1. He’s hated by all the nasty (some of them ridiculously evil) people.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e2. And liked by all the good ones.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e3. He has a cool scar, black hair, and green eyes. Like, yeah. He looks cool. This is the reason I stay away from the black hair/green eyes combo in my own writing: it’s really something that gets doled out by most authors to their specialest favouritest characters. And boy, is Harry Potter special or what?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e4. He’s famous. Not only that, but everyone bows to him in the street. I think we just discovered Buddha’s successor.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e5. He’s rich. Insanely rich. What are the odds?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e6. He got into the best school for magic around. Without even applying.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e7. He’s a Gryffindor, the most fantabulous house in the school.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e8. He’s fantastic at broomsticking even though he’s never had any practice whatsoever.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e9. Immediately, instead of getting punished for breaking the rules, he gets put on the Quidditch team even though it’s unheard of for someone so young to be there. And this is after the teacher sees one single display of catching a Remembrall. Ever heard of beginners’ luck? Adrenaline-fuelled ability, perhaps? Heightened senses? With all this, she still decides that Harry should be in the Quidditch team.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e10. Continuing the theme of complete and utter Sueness: FREE BROOMSTICK! Not only that, it’s the latest in broomstick technology.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e11. He got given his broomstick by a teacher. I will leave you to guess the phrase that applies here. Starts with ‘t’ and ends with ‘eacher’s pet’. Wow. You got it. Tell me, have you applied for Mensa yet?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e12. He then impresses everybody on the Quidditch team with his special specialness to such an extent that he’s likened to the greatest Quidditch player in a hundred years (who was also definitely older than Harry when he played Quidditch).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e13. Invisible cloak. He’s got all this, and then to add to it, he gets an invisible cloak.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e14. He’s smart.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e15. He’s brave.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e16. He’s good at magic. These last three combined are a Sueness Overload in themselves.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e17. And yet, even with all these qualities, he’s so generous and brave, is purported to have such good judgement, etc., that you feel as if the urge to like him is being shoved down your throat, stirred until properly combined, and left to set for three hours.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e18. This is the part that made me almost throw up: Hermione, for no good reason, throws her arms around Harry and tells him how great he is, and that she’s basically not worth half of what he is. Just stuff some more Sueness down our throats, why don’t you, J?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e19. Harry just escaped major Sue-ity again because Neville Longbottom’s final points are the ones that win Gryffindor the House Cup/Trophy/thing. Still, Ron and Hermione win a generic fifty points each. Harry, of course, has to get sixty. Minor Sue-ness.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e20. Yeah, he loses Gryffindor a massive 150 points, but he gets it all back, doesn’t he? Being treated like an outcast doesn’t really seem to have made an impression on him at all.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e21. Instead of being punished for heading into the third-floor corridor, he is rewarded. Now, make no mistake, I do see that there are times when we should break the rules for the right reasons. But surely, to maintain order, shouldn’t the ‘perpetrators’ be punished on the surface of things? Surely Harry should be given grunt work or detention or something, right? Wrong.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e22. The way he was saved from the evil Lord Voldemort is by nothing other than Pure Love. *cue sparkles*\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e23. Dumbledore turns out to have given Harry the cloak. Surely, having been a teacher for many years, he would recognise what mischief kids get up to, and would really NOT want a boy whose friends include the brother of Fred and George Weasley to have access to an invisible cloak. Or, if it comes to that, any kid at all. T-E-A-C-H-E-R-S-P-E-T.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI wouldn’t care if HP only displayed a couple of these characteristics, but he’s got the whole lot! The thing that really drives me up the wall is that surely this should be the ultimate guide for what not to do when writing a book, and yet… and yet… it’s a bestseller. It’s not sour grapes that keep me writing this post. It’s sheer confuzzled amazement.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe writing style is boring and forgettable. No description to speak of, no real thoughts. There are some allusions to historical figures and terms, and so on, but they aren’t presented in an interesting way. And couldn’t we have at least met Nicholas Flamel?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe morals in Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone are negligible at best. It’s just me, me, me propaganda in disguise—one lying, sneaking, and even ‘immobilising’ episode after another. And that’s from the so-called ‘good’ characters.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eCliché after cliché abounds in this book. It’s there in Dumbledore’s white beard. It’s there in Harry’s surprisingly quick Quidditch triumph. It’s there in Professor Quirrel’s turban. And most of all, it’s there in Draco Malfoy, a character so flat he could’ve been made out of paper and then run over with a steamroller and his original shape would have been slightly rounder.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAdded to which, the plot is so unoriginal. Can anyone say ‘Cinderella’? Orphaned child mysteriously left with a mean, boring family who doesn’t want him and treats him terribly. Discovers that he really belongs to a world beyond his wildest dreams. And that he’s very, very rich. Almost immediately, he’s at home there. Sure, he has his enemies, but who doesn’t? And they get dealt with anyway. Added to which, it turns out that his parents are super-cool.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIf that’s original, then I’m Neville Longbottom’s true love. Turns out everybody who keeps calling this original is Neville's honeybunchkins.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI had to struggle to finish this book. Really struggle. I had it out from the library for nine weeks because I kept putting it down for ten days or so, then realizing I should probably finish it to see if it got better. I’d pick it up and realise that I’d forgotten what had happened before, meaning I had to go back to the beginning and start all over again. This, as you may well imagine, drove me nuts.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEventually, with the help of SparkNotes, I managed to figure it out and I’ve just taken book 2 out of the library. I’m wondering if it gets any better. After all, J.K. Rowling’s run out of Cinderella storyline. Considering how much people love this series (to me at this point in time, they are inexplicably popular), I’m not going to end with a pessimistic “I don’t think so”. I might go with something more like this:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt’s got to, right? Right???\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--------\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Disclaimer: As I am not at this point in time a Harry Potter fan, I’ve probably gotten a couple of things wrong, although I’ve checked and double-checked to the best of my ability. (If you see any errors, please comment and let me know.) However, even if a few things are a bit off, there are still about twenty points on this list. Surely that’s enough to merit consideration anyway.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9822252944981548622\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review54881998\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link54881998\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=54881998\u0026amp;resource_type=Review\u0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone\"\u003eflag\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\n      \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_54881998'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_54881998\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/54881998?resource_type=Review\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"likesCount\"\u003e18 likes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_action_review_54881998\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_54881998\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false\u0026amp;format=json\u0026amp;lc=18\u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=9\u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=54881998\u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review\"\u003eLike\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca id=\"commentLink_54881998\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(\u0026#39;review\u0026#39;, 54881998, true, \u0026#39;\u0026#39;); The main character could've been anyone, after all it was her choice,\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11438584070495303099\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThe way I see it, the author has created an entire world and all of its people. The main character could've been anyone, after all it was her choice, she just decided to show what happened to one of the most interesting characters and let the story play out from there. Though I will respect the opinion that you and others have, I personally loved this book and the rest in its series\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11438584070495303099\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      Dec 19, 2015 03:09PM\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv id=\"comment_153459110\" class=\"brown_comment\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_photo\"\u003e\n    \t\u003ca alt=\"Caroline\" href=\"/user/show/46128636-caroline\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461764960p1/46128636.jpg\" alt=\"46128636\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"xhr_comment_body\"\u003e\n    \u003ca style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/46128636-caroline\"\u003eCaroline\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11892727041608641283\"\u003ewow what a review\u003c/span\u003e\n\n    \u003cbr/\u003e\n\n    \u003cspan class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\"\u003e\n      Jun 26, 2016 11:00AM\n    \u003c/span\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_54881998' style='display: none'\u003e\n\u003ctextarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 54881998, true, '')\"\u003eWrite a comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_968087717\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/968087717\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Çavlan\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/31501360-avlan\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Çavlan\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475752664p2/31501360.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/968087717?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMay 04, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Çavlan\" class=\"user\" name=\"Çavlan\" href=\"/user/show/31501360-avlan\"\u003eÇavlan\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747573609\" href=\"/book/show/4255.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer968087717\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15185019419747763579\"\u003eSon okuyuşumun üzerinden beş yıldan uzun zaman geçmiş olduğunu fark edince, seriyi -herhalde 80. kez- baştan okumaya karar verdim. Okumaların arasına birkaç yıl, serinin kitaplarının arasına da farklı birkaç kitap aldığınız takdirde Harry Potter'ları ölene dek tekrar tekrar okuyabilir ve aynı keyfi alabilirsiniz gibi bir teorim var :) Bu vesileyle daha önce \u003ca href=\"http://kedilervekitaplar.blogspot.com.tr/search/label/Harry%20Potter\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ebloğumdan\u003c/a\u003e paylaştığım Harry Potter yazılarını da ekliyorum buraya: \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYedi kitaplık serinin birincisi olan Felsefe Taşı, büyücülük dünyasına bi\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15185019419747763579\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eSon okuyuşumun üzerinden beş yıldan uzun zaman geçmiş olduğunu fark edince, seriyi -herhalde 80. kez- baştan okumaya karar verdim. Okumaların arasına birkaç yıl, serinin kitaplarının arasına da farklı birkaç kitap aldığınız takdirde Harry Potter'ları ölene dek tekrar tekrar okuyabilir ve aynı keyfi alabilirsiniz gibi bir teorim var :) Bu vesileyle daha önce \u003ca href=\"http://kedilervekitaplar.blogspot.com.tr/search/label/Harry%20Potter\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ebloğumdan\u003c/a\u003e paylaştığım Harry Potter yazılarını da ekliyorum buraya: \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eYedi kitaplık serinin birincisi olan Felsefe Taşı, büyücülük dünyasına bir giriş niteliğinde, çok eğlenceli bir giriş hem de. Bildiğimiz dünya, sihirle dolu bir dünya daha saklamaktadır. Büyüyle ilgisi olmayan, bizim gibi sıradan insanlar (yani 'Muggle'lar) olur da bir şekilde haberdar olursa sihrin varlığından, derhal Sihir Bakanlığı'ndaki yetkin kişilerin büyüleriyle bildikleri unutturulur, böylece sihirden uzak insanlarla büyücüler, birbirlerine karışmadan, yanyana yaşar gider. İkisi de büyücü olan anne ve babasını da öldüren karanlık büyücünün, kimsenin nedenini bilmediği şekilde üzerinde işlemeyen öldürücü lanetinden kurtulan 1 yaşındaki Harry Potter, ona bakması için teyzesinin evine bırakılır. Bu arada kendisine saldıran kötü büyücünün yaptığı büyü geri tepmiş, güçlerinin çoğunu elinden almıştır, artık Voldemort ölü mü, sağ mı belli değildir, ondan adını söyleyemeyecek kadar çok korkan büyücü dünyası (ondan bahsederken Kim-Olduğunu-Bilirsin-Sen derler) rahatlamış, eski refahlarına, barış içindeki düzenlerine kavuşmuştur. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOn yıl geçer, Harry'nin teyzesi, teyzesinin kocası ve yeğeniyle birlikte geçirdiği on korkunç yıl. Dursley'ler Harry'e öyle kötü davranırlar ki, Harry merdiven altındaki dolapta yaşar, yeğeni Dudley'nin artıklarını yer ve giyer, evde akrabalarından herhangi bir sevgi görmediği gibi, sürekli azar yer, okulda da hiç arkadaşı yoktur, çünkü kimse kabadayı Dudley ile papaz olmayı göze alamaz. Bunlara rağmen Harry (filmlerdekinin aksine) ezik büzük, sünepe bir tip olmamıştır; gayet muzip, güçlü karakterli ve zeki bir çocuktur, etrafındakileri de bolca \"idare eder\". Son derece sıkıcı Muggle'lar olan teyzesi ve eniştesi büyü dünyasından nefret ettikleri -ve deli gibi korktukları- için, Harry'e kökenlerini, anne babasının ne olduğunu, nasıl öldüğünü anlatmamışlardır bile -Harry büyünün b'sinden habersizdir. Bu nedenlerle bir gün kapıda saçı sakalına karışmış bir dev belirdiğinde ve Harry'e bir büyücü olduğunu, üstelik bir bebekken farkına varmadan da olsa Voldemort'un güçlerini yok ettiği için büyücüler dünyasında çok ünlü bir büyücü olduğunu, bundan sonra Hogwarts Cadılık ve Büyücülük Okulu'na gideceğini söylediğinde, Harry'ciğin şaşkınlığını tahmin edersiniz. Felsefe Taşı da, Harry'nin arkadaşlarla ve düşmanlarla, üç başlı köpekler ve trollerle, uçan süpürgeler ve ejderhalarla dolu geçen okuldaki ilk yılını anlatır.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eKitap dostluk, cesaret ve sadakat kavramlarını işliyor ancak öyle kör göze parmak şeklinde süslü methiyeler, aşırı övgüler yok, küçük hadiseler üzerinden incelikli biçimde işleniyor her türlü öğe. Bu ilk kitap özellikle çocuk kitabı olarak tanımlanabilecek olmasına rağmen metnin mesaj kaygılı olmaması, yazarın da okuyucusunu küçük görmemesi, verdiği mesajları çok şık biçimde zekice vermesi çok hoşuma gitmişti ilk okuduğumda.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eRowling'in basit, dolaysız bir anlatım dili var; gösterişe, dramatize etmeye yer olmuyor metinlerinde. Üstelik tarzını genel olarak çok nüktedan buluyorum, bazı bölümler son derece ince, çok da komik esprilerle dolu. Felsefe Taşı'nın dili çocuksu sayılabilir, en azından serinin üçüncü kitabı ve ardından gelenler kadar \"yaşsız\" olmadığı kesin, ancak bu kitabın büyüsünü azaltmıyor. Ayrıca dili inanılmaz akıcı, kurgusu da okuyucuyu esir alıcı olduğu için, çocukça olsa da olmasa da kendinizi kaptırıyor ve bir oturuşta yiyip yutuyorsunuz.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBüyü dünyasında geçmesine rağmen, altmetinlerde bolca gerçek hayattan kesitlere rastlamak mümkün. Harry Potter serisi her şeyden önce ırkçılık ve ayrımcılık üzerine zaten. Rowling Felsefe Taşı'nın hemen her bölümüne, sonraki kitaplarda olacaklar için ipuçları serpiştirmiş. Hiçbir devamlılık hatası yok, yazar detaylara olağanüstü önem vermiş. Bu kitabı bitirince bir HP bağımlısına dönüşmeyeceksiniz büyük ihtimalle, ama başlarken duyduğunuz küçümseme hisleri yok olmuş olacak ve daha fazlasını merak edeceksiniz. İkinci kitap da aynı şekilde sürükleyici olduğu için, o da bir gecede bitecek ve üçüncü kitabın ortalarında bir yerde, çoktan bir bağımlı olmuş olacaksınız. Artık daha fazla zaman yitirmeyin, kendinizi Harry Potter'ın olağanüstü dünyasından yoksun bırakmayın :)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15185019419747763579\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review968087717\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1761984337\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1761984337\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Faroukh Naseem\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/47239298-faroukh-naseem\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Faroukh Naseem\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454492940p2/47239298.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1761984337?book_show_action=false\"\u003eSep 18, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Faroukh Naseem\" class=\"user\" name=\"Faroukh Naseem\" href=\"/user/show/47239298-faroukh-naseem\"\u003eFaroukh Naseem\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003ereally liked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747532743\" href=\"/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1761984337\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9665388691942857290\"\u003eI'm not even sure if it's a good idea to 'review' Harry Potter. *hides in the corner*\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI did not expect this, 10 pages in I realized I was reading with a fake British accent and dramatizing the dialogues in my mind! #theguywiththebookreview presents Harry Potter and the Philosophers stone.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe only reason I've started this series is because of my sister Sumaiyya @sumaiyya.books Thank you very much!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWriting: Early on in the book I was captivated by the writing style but midway through the book I real\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9665388691942857290\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI'm not even sure if it's a good idea to 'review' Harry Potter. *hides in the corner*\u003cbr /\u003e‎\u003cbr /\u003eI did not expect this, 10 pages in I realized I was ‎reading with a fake British accent and dramatizing the dialogues in my mind!‎ #theguywiththebookreview presents Harry Potter and the Philosophers stone.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe only reason I've started this series is because of my sister Sumaiyya @sumaiyya.books Thank you very much!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWriting: Early on in the book I was captivated by the writing style‎ but midway through the book I realized although the writing is unique, the tale had taken over and you get engrossed so much in the story that you don't really care about the writing (The previous time this happened with me was A Thousand Splendid Suns by Khaled Hosseini)\u003cbr /\u003e‎\u003cbr /\u003eStory: What surprised me most was although I'm far from my teenage days, I related to a lot of things 'said' between the lines. Friendship, Loyalty, Judgmental attitude, everything is somehow squeezed into it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe HP world: I've always felt that some of the best books are those which don't describe a lot and manage to tickle your imaginary bones. Yes, a lot of things have been minutely described, the look of the characters, some of the Hogwarts rooms, but there is a lot left out which somehow you piece together yourself, like Jenga, you know there are some missing pieces and you can picture the tower in its entirety if you want to!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eCharacters: Even Hedwig seemed to have a personality of its own! And can we have some more Draco please? I loved the trio (I think they are called the golden trio?) Hermoine was so cute but I would stay so far away from such girls in school (because, you know, I so want to be Slytherin!) I couldn't help but relate a few of my school friends to Ron. Harry's character was a bit calm and I expect him to come out of his cave in the next book. The faculty was so intriguing, and now I know why Snape is so talked about. And shoutout to the Big Friendly Giant, Hagrid!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003ePace: I didn't really care about it. I'm not even sure if the book was fast or slow. It was well put together and something or the other was constantly happening. Ace.\u003cbr /\u003e‎\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9665388691942857290\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n
