  \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer948008261\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer11623020451366466064\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e*Primera vez leído desde el 25 de May. hasta el 1 de Jun. del 2014*\u003cbr /\u003e*Segunda vez leído/Releído desde el 18 de Ene. hasta el 20 de Ene. del 2015*\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e \u003ci\u003e“Oh, podrás pensar que no soy bonito,\u003cbr /\u003epero no juzques por lo que ves.\u003cbr /\u003eMe comeré a mí mismo si puedes encontrar\u003cbr /\u003eun sombrero más inteligente que yo.\u003cbr /\u003ePuedes tener bombines negros,\u003cbr /\u003esombreros altos y elegantes.\u003cbr /\u003ePero yo soy el Sombrero Seleccionador de Hogwarts\u003cbr /\u003ey puedo superar a todos.\u003cbr /\u003eNo hay nada escondido en tu cabeza\u003cbr /\u003eque el Sombrero Seleccionador no pueda ver.\u003cbr /\u003eAsí qu\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText11623020451366466064\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e*Primera vez leído desde el 25 de May. hasta el 1 de Jun. del 2014*\u003cbr /\u003e*Segunda vez leído/Releído desde el 18 de Ene. hasta el 20 de Ene. del 2015*\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003e“Oh, podrás pensar que no soy bonito,\u003cbr /\u003epero no juzques por lo que ves.\u003cbr /\u003eMe comeré a mí mismo si puedes encontrar\u003cbr /\u003eun sombrero más inteligente que yo.\u003cbr /\u003ePuedes tener bombines negros,\u003cbr /\u003esombreros altos y elegantes.\u003cbr /\u003ePero yo soy el Sombrero Seleccionador de Hogwarts\u003cbr /\u003ey puedo superar a todos.\u003cbr /\u003eNo hay nada escondido en tu cabeza\u003cbr /\u003eque el Sombrero Seleccionador no pueda ver.\u003cbr /\u003eAsí que pruébate y te diré\u003cbr /\u003edónde debes estar.\u003cbr /\u003ePuedes pertenecer a Gryffindor,\u003cbr /\u003edonde habitan los valientes.\u003cbr /\u003eSu osadía, temple y caballerosidad\u003cbr /\u003eponen aparte a los de Gryffindor.\u003cbr /\u003ePuedes pertenecer a Hufflepuff,\u003cbr /\u003edonde son justos y leales.\u003cbr /\u003eEsos perseverantes Hufflepuff\u003cbr /\u003ede verdad no temen el trabajo pesado.\u003cbr /\u003eO tal vez a la antigua sabiduría de Ravenclaw,\u003cbr /\u003eSi tienes una mente dispuesta,\u003cbr /\u003eporque los de inteligencia y erudición\u003cbr /\u003esiempre encontrarán allí a sus semejantes.\u003cbr /\u003eO tal vez en Slytherin\u003cbr /\u003eharás tus verdaderos amigos.\u003cbr /\u003eEsa gente astuta utiliza cualquier medio\u003cbr /\u003epara lograr sus fines\u003cbr /\u003e¡Así que pruébame! ¡No tengas miedo!\u003cbr /\u003e¡Y no recibirás una bofetada!\u003cbr /\u003eÉstas en buenas manos (aunque yo no las tenga).\u003cbr /\u003ePorque soy el Sombrero Pensante.”\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEs hora de confesarme: \u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter no es mi libro de la infancia como todo el mundo (no me burlo ni nada) a decir verdad, ni tengo libro de infancia. También, ¿Saben cuándo supe que las películas de HP eran adaptadas en los libros? \u003cu\u003eEn la última película\u003c/u\u003e, y no me avergüenzo de decirlo, hasta me alegro de leerlo mucho años después de que se han publicado los libros y las películas igual.\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLa primera vez que leí Harry Potter fue el año pasado en ePub/inglés, además fue mi primer libro en inglés que leí -\u003ci\u003eGracias Carmen\u003c/i\u003e- y fue bastante fácil y sencillo leerlo, pero ahora que lo releo -me prometí que lo iba a releer iniciando el año- \u003cb\u003elo amé.\u003c/b\u003e Solamente para aclarar, lo he releído en español/físico.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eAmé demasiado este libro.\u003c/b\u003e Aunque ha sido el primero de esta saga -y espero que en los demás mejore-, no me pudo gustar menos. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e¡Por fin pude entender todas las dudas que tenía mientras veía las películas! Todas las aventuras que tiene Harry son increíbles, el trama solamente me hizo continuar hasta acabar el libro además de que tenía sus partes cómicas y conocí más a fondo todos los detalles: los personajes, Howgarts, el trama, el misterio, todo.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e¡Gracias J.K. por haber creado este mundo!\u003c/b\u003e Lo digo muy tarde pero da igual, he amado demasiado este libro.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNo espero para continuar con \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/357545.Harry_Potter_y_la_c_mara_secreta__Harry_Potter___2_\" title=\"Harry Potter y la cámara secreta (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling\"\u003eHarry Potter y la cámara secreta\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003eGracias Yas, y Cande por leerlo conmigo. Son las mejores.\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"11623020451366466064\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review948008261\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link948008261\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" \u003cspan class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_948008261'\u003e\u003ca id=\"like_count_review_948008261\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1744060873\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Frances\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/17651062-frances\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Frances\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466778265p2/17651062.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1744060873?book_show_action=false\"\u003eSep 15, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Frances\" class=\"user\" name=\"Frances\" href=\"/user/show/17651062-frances\"\u003eFrances\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/17651062-frances?shelf=women-authors\"\u003ewomen-authors\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/17651062-frances?shelf=wish-list\"\u003ewish-list\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1744060873\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer10936107112400238140\"\u003eI am 18 yrs late to this party and to make a review on this book in 2016 is probably silly. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis was published few years after I was born and gotten its hype in the early 2000s, well based on where I'm from, Philippines. My cousins were so utterly obsessed on the films (apparently they're not into books, only me and my uncle loves to read) and they would watch HP films over and over again. I lost count on how many times they've watched it in our family room, every time they'd get. Back then I th\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText10936107112400238140\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eI am 18 yrs late to this party and to make a review on this book in 2016 is probably silly. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis was published few years after I was born and gotten its hype in the early 2000s, well based on where I'm from, Philippines. My cousins were so utterly obsessed on the films (apparently they're not into books, only me and my uncle loves to read) and they would watch HP films over and over again. I lost count on how many times they've watched it in our family room, every time they'd get. Back then I think they're crazy. The wizard world just did not interest me. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was into something only grown-ups were allowed to read. But I still did since I was fff excited to grow-up only to find out \u003ci\u003eadulting\u003c/i\u003e is never fun at all. Also, what I was reading back then were works of \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/9068.Sidney_Sheldon\" title=\"Sidney Sheldon\"\u003eSidney Sheldon\u003c/a\u003e, and all those other crime-mystery novels I could easily get off of our shelf.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThen there came the \u003ci\u003eregret.\u003c/i\u003e *cringe*\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNot reading HP when I should have, years ago, was my choice. I guess the hype was to blame since everyone was talking about HP left and right and since I was a rebel, I did not gave-in. I also did not watched the films although we have all the CDs back home. I didn't know what I was getting myself into but what I now know was, although I've missed so much on enjoying this magical series when I was younger, I could still catch-up on it and experience it all, and feel like I'm a kid again. As cliche as it may sound, it never is too late for Hogwarts.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI may have lost those years, but Harry Potter will always be there to bring me to a world where good triumphs evil, where friendship is true and gold, where everything is possible, and where \u003cb\u003e\n  \u003ci\u003eMagic\u003c/i\u003e\n\u003c/b\u003e does exists.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_421014699\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/421014699\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Arielle Walker\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Arielle Walker\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452561487p2/6762949.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/421014699?book_show_action=false\"\u003eMay 30, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Arielle Walker\" class=\"user\" name=\"Arielle Walker\" href=\"/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker\"\u003eArielle Walker\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=fantasy-unusual\"\u003efantasy-unusual\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=children\"\u003echildren\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer421014699\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5886381497420297151\"\u003eThis is less a review, and more a sort of miniature memoir of my Harry Potter experience. Gushy emotions and etc follow, so feel free to skip this review with no more than my recommendation that if you have not read this series you should do so immediately.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEvery so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books -\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5886381497420297151\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThis is less a review, and more a sort of miniature memoir of my Harry Potter experience. Gushy emotions and etc follow, so feel free to skip this review with no more than my recommendation that if you have not read this series you should do so immediately.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEvery so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books - in order - over the course of around two days (I've read them so often that I can devour them in almost a single go now) followed by as many of the films as I can fit into the time I have left, before I'm forced back into reality. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI am one of the Harry Potter generation. I was four when this first book was published, fourteen when the series concluded, and around the same age as the characters in the films when they eventually came out. I still remember my mother insisting that I was too young to read this (at the age of 5) and hiding it under the sofa cushions so I could read in secret anyway.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt's a series that I grew up with, and as such, cannot comment on its literary merits without bias. All I know is that these books are a comfort, and feel almost like family. They may not technically be the best books I have ever read, but for a reading experience they are truly unparalleled.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e30 Day Book Challenge, Day 3: Favourite series.\u003c/b\u003e (It has to be, there is no other series of books I've read this many times, and will read again another hundred. I can (and sometimes do) read the entire series in three days or less now, as I am so familiar with the words I can simply slip through them for the comfort of the story...)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"5886381497420297151\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review421014699\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link421014699\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" \u003cdiv\u003e\u003cspan class=\"uitext greyText\"\u003eRecommends it for: \u003c/span\u003e\n           \u003cspan class=\"uitext reviewText\"\u003eanyone\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/325918-patrick-henderson?shelf=crack\"\u003ecrack\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer5362406\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer5768231245346544065\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOh go to hell. These things are like crack.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo I just finished the 7th one and I have no intention of re-reading them, though I do have fond memories of them. My most recent encounter with Harry Potter was on an airplane a couple of days ago. This humongous 16 year old kid from North Dakota was sitting next to me reading the 5th book. He smelled like cereal and farts and was audibly mouth-breathing for the whole flight. I tried to engage him in conversation periodically to get his little whistle\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText5768231245346544065\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOh go to hell. These things are like crack.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo I just finished the 7th one and I have no intention of re-reading them, though I do have fond memories of them. My most recent encounter with Harry Potter was on an airplane a couple of days ago. This humongous 16 year old kid from North Dakota was sitting next to me reading the 5th book. He smelled like cereal and farts and was audibly mouth-breathing for the whole flight. I tried to engage him in conversation periodically to get his little whistle to quiet down for a few minutes at a time. We chatted about the little bastards at Hogrwarts and it kind of got me misty...not for the books, but for how terrible high school was even though I didn't realize it at the time. And this kid clearly didn't either. He just wanted to read his book and make it home. I wanted to tell him that in 10 years he wouldn't even remember what his goddamn school looked like. Instead I tried to convince him that what he heard about Dumbledore dying in the 6th one wasn't true. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eStay strong, brother. \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1412603374\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Zahra Rhm\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/45575013-zahra-rhm\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Zahra Rhm\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445019293p2/45575013.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1412603374?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJul 18, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Zahra Rhm\" class=\"user\" name=\"Zahra Rhm\" href=\"/user/show/45575013-zahra-rhm\"\u003eZahra Rhm\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/45575013-zahra-rhm?shelf=fantasy\"\u003efantasy\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/45575013-zahra-rhm?shelf=make-you-laugh\"\u003emake-you-laugh\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1412603374\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2751269257091759027\"\u003eوقتی شروع کردم به خوندن کتاب های هری پاتر، تا کتاب چهارم ترجمه شده بود و تو کتابخونه موجود بود.\u003cbr /\u003eکتاب اول سری هری پاتر، اولین کتاب بیش از 200 صفحه ای بود که خوندم. خواهرم بابت اینکه کارمو راحت کنه سه فصل اولش رو برام تعریف کرد و من تقریبا 50 صفحه ی اولش رو نخوندم. با این که برام حجیم بود اما جذبش شدم و با سرعت کند اون زمانم خوندمش و ازش لذت بردم.\u003cbr /\u003eیادمه فصلی که هری و دوستاش برای تنبیه به جنگل ممنوعه رفته بودن رو، یه شب داشتم می خوندم. چون ترسیدم، نتونستم تنها تو اتاق بشینم و بخونم. رفتم توی هال، پیش\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText2751269257091759027\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eوقتی شروع کردم به خوندن کتاب های هری پاتر، تا کتاب چهارم ترجمه شده بود و تو کتابخونه موجود بود.\u003cbr /\u003eکتاب اول سری هری پاتر، اولین کتاب بیش از 200 صفحه ای بود که خوندم. خواهرم بابت اینکه کارمو راحت کنه سه فصل اولش رو برام تعریف کرد و من تقریبا 50 صفحه ی اولش رو نخوندم. با این که برام حجیم بود اما جذبش شدم و با سرعت کند اون زمانم خوندمش و ازش لذت بردم.\u003cbr /\u003eیادمه فصلی که هری و دوستاش برای تنبیه به جنگل ممنوعه رفته بودن رو، یه شب داشتم می خوندم. چون ترسیدم، نتونستم تنها تو اتاق بشینم و بخونم. رفتم توی هال، پیش بقیه ادامه ی کتاب رو خوندم. بعدها که مجدد کتاب رو خوندم، دیدم هیچ موردی نداشته. من از روی بچگی می ترسیدم. حتی الان یادم نیست چه نکته ای باعث شده بود بترسم.\u003cbr /\u003eبا این که من از هری کم سن تر بودم گاهی از رفتارهای احمقانه ش حرص می خوردم.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"2751269257091759027\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408812846\" stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1247772957\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2543098110567187352\"\u003e5 stars for all the feels \u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr href=\"/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=reread\"\u003ereread\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=reviewed\"\u003ereviewed\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=harry-freaking-potter\"\u003eharry-freaking-potter\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer413207969\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17949925774248634171\"\u003eEDIT 9/18/13: Rereading (again) with Litchick and Tandie and a while bunch of other lovelies starting November 18. JOIN US!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI must have reread this series about 5 times, but I still remember the way it felt to experience it for the first time. I was introduced to the world of Harry Potter at the age of eight when I watched the first Harry Potter movie. I was enthralled. When I turned nine, I noticed that many of my classmates were carrying around these huge books, so I decided to pick up Harry Po\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17949925774248634171\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eEDIT 9/18/13: Rereading (again) with Litchick and Tandie and a while bunch of other lovelies starting November 18. JOIN US!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI must have reread this series about 5 times, but I still remember the way it felt to experience it for the first time. I was introduced to the world of Harry Potter at the age of eight when I watched the first Harry Potter movie. I was enthralled. When I turned nine, I noticed that many of my classmates were carrying around these huge books, so I decided to pick up Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. I can honestly say it changed my life. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBefore HP I did like to read, but it wasn't really all that big of a deal to me. When I finished the first Harry Potter book, it was like a spell was cast on me (hehe). I went out and got the rest of the books immediately and I flew through each one. When there were no more HP books to read, I went into a sort of withdrawal, counting down the days until the next installment became available. I went and watched all the movies on opening weekend. I was utterly obsessed. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe thing that I am most grateful for is the love of reading that was instilled in me as a result of JK Rowling's books. Once I got a taste of the excitement of reading, I couldn't stop. And that, my friends, is why reading is now my favorite thing to do. That is why I began to write my own stories, plays, and poems, and am currently working on a novel that I hope to publish one day. I owe all this to JK Rowling. I can't thank her enough for what her books have done for me. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe story of Harry Potter, an eleven-year-old boy horribly abused and neglected by his \"family,\" if you can even call the Dursleys a family, was one that saddened me when I first read of it. It still saddens me to this day. Still, as a little kid, whenever I went through some hard times, I always told myself that Harry had it worse than me and he endured. I aspired to be like Harry. If he could deal with the Dursleys, then I could deal with whatever life threw at me. Harry Potter is the kind of kid I would love to have as a friend. He's brave, humble, and loyal. I find myself forgetting that he's a fictional character as I read, but at the same time wishing with all my heart that I could meet someone like him. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd then we have Ron. Ron was hilarious, what with his dry humor and sarcasm that never came across as bitter or like he was trying too hard. While I noticed that he was self-conscious about his family's financial situation, he wasn't all \"woe is me\" about it. He was a good and loyal friend to Harry.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs for Hermione, I adored her. I found myself connecting with her on such a personal level. I could relate to almost everything she went through. I also happen to have a mane of bushy brown hair, brown eyes, buck teeth (before I got braces), and a love of books and libraries. I too am a huge goody-two-shoes that many people would consider smart. But most of all, I have a habit of shooting my hand up in the air every time a teacher asks a question. Snape would probably despise me. Hermione was practical, smart, responsible, and a great friend. Her amazing cleverness and skill in magic is even more commendable because of the fact that she's Muggle-born. She'd had no prior experience with magic of any kind before coming to Hogwarts, and still she came out top of her class in her first year. Take that, Draco! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSpeaking of Draco, allow me to rant about the obnoxious git. He was the most contemptible, pompous, jealous, spoiled little brat I've ever encountered in a book. He seemed to have absolutely nothing better to do than follow Harry and his friends around and ruin their lives in any way possible. Ugh. Someone needs to hit this kid. Still, there's a part of me that feels bad for Draco too. I think all of his hatred for Harry and his friends is really jealousy. Think about it this way. Harry had great friends, Draco has dumb, mean cronies. Harry is famous, Draco doesn't get any attention. Harry's great at quidditch, Draco's not really good at anything (though he does excel in douchebaggery). While the bad still outweighs the good, we have to remember that he's just a lonely, jealous kid that needs to lash out at someone.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eNow lets talk about one of my favorite characters: Severus Snape. I love him. Is that so wrong? I adore that man. My opinion of him has never changed. Sure, I knew he was a jerk in all the books and I got so angry at him at those times. At the same time, though, I was thoroughly amused by his sarcastic, caustic wit. You have to admit, he's funny, mysterious, complex, and even sexy, in his own weird way. As I continued with the series, I grew stronger feelings for him. Stronger annoyance at his bouts of meanness, stronger understanding of why he did what he did, and finally, in the last book, a stronger love and respect of his character. The first time I read Sorcerer's Stone, I was so confused! Did he hate Harry or didn't he? Was he trying to kill Harry or save him? This is what I love most about Snape. The inner machinations of his mind are an enigma (if you know where that line is from, go buy yourself an ice cream). \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThen we have Hagrid: the sweetest, cutest giant of them all. I love his adorable accent, his love of deadly animals, and how much of a great father figure he is for Harry, Ron, and Hermione. I think his ludicrous belief that deadly creatures are actually harmless stems from his own personal experience. At first Hagrid seems threatening and hostile because of his size and wild appearance, when really he is a huge sweetheart. In this way, he feels he can relate to the dangerous creatures that he loves. Except the majority of these creatures don't turn out to be sweethearts like Hagrid.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAs for the Dursleys, I cannot deal with them. I despise these people. Can't stand them for the life of me. Somehow, I almost find myself hating them more than I hate Voldemort, especially Petunia. God damn it woman, this kid is your BLOOD relative. He is your sister's son, and you treat him like a prisoner. You wouldn't even treat strangers that way! As much as I despised this family, I found them funny as well, particularly Vernon's angry explosions. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAnd last, but most certainly not least, there is Albus Dumbledore. I love him for his cute craziness, as well as his wisdom. I've never seen a better combination of the two. He is a wonderful father figure for Harry. Still, the mystery surrounding him frustrates me. What did he see in the Mirror of Erised, dammit?! The world will never know.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAll in all, this series remains my favorite of all time. Thank you, JK Rowling, for all you've done for me and for millions of other people all over the world.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"17949925774248634171\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n        \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1657325017\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer6959298909327962444\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.\"\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eVery true, isn't it?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy words while reading: stunning, terrific... (\u003ci\u003ecan't stop myself from praising this book\u003c/i\u003e)\u003cbr /\u003eOne of the best books ever! My emotions are still in the influence of this book's ending. What a great book and the ending it was!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eSETTINGS \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- Hogwart School of Witchcraft and Wizardry\u003cbr /\u003eOne of the finest school for wizards and witches to learn magic. I liked it very much. It is very well written.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMAJOR CHARACTERS\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e, \u003ci\u003eof course!\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eBio\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText6959298909327962444\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\"Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.\"\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eVery true, isn't it?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eMy words while reading: stunning, terrific... (\u003ci\u003ecan't stop myself from praising this book\u003c/i\u003e)\u003cbr /\u003eOne of the best books ever! My emotions are still in the influence of this book's ending. What a great book and the ending it was!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eSETTINGS \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- Hogwart School of Witchcraft and Wizardry\u003cbr /\u003eOne of the finest school for wizards and witches to learn magic. I liked it very much. It is very well written.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMAJOR CHARACTERS\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/b\u003e, \u003ci\u003eof course!\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eBio \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- An orphan child. He lives with his uncle and aunt (\u003ci\u003eI didn't like them as they were so rude with Harry\u003c/i\u003e), who don't tell him he is a WIZARD! Even though they knew it.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy Feelings\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- A very appealing and effective character. I liked him very much.\u003cbr /\u003eOne thing I didn't like about him: \u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[ I was expecting some more magic from him but he didn't do more then once or twice, as much as I remember.  \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eRon\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eBio\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- One of Harry's best friends.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy Feelings\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- A good one. I also liked him almost as much as I liked Harry. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eHermione\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBio\u003cbr /\u003e--- Also one of Harry's best friends. She has a very brilliant mind. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy Feelings\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- Actually, I didn't get any feelings while reading her. I don't know why? Although she is very well written. But I liked her dialogues with Ron. That's sort of...HUMOROUS.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eVoldemort\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eBio\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- A bad wizard. Main antagonist of this series, I assume and the killer of Harry's parents. He also tried to kill Harry but couldn't and He vanishes after that and nobody knows where he is?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eMy Feelings\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e--- He seems a powerful antagonist I will ever read. he didn't appear much. This book just gives us the introduction of his existence. But I am sure I will enjoy reading him in the next books.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAlbus Dumbledore(Headmaster of Hogwarts) and Hagrid(Keeper of Hogwarts). Both of them seem nice persons to me.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eOVERVIEW\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eHarry finds out he is a wizard when Hagrid gives him the letter from Hogwarts for admission. Harry's life changes completely while studying in Hogwarts when they(\u003ci\u003eHarry, Ron and Hermione\u003c/i\u003e) run across the forbidden section of the 3rd floor of Hogwarts. \u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[ There is a stone named Sorcerer's Stone which can extend your life and transform any material into gold. This stone is hidden in that section of the 3rd floor and a dog(who is very big in size and have three heads), and many enchantments are guarding it. \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cu\u003eA very big spoiler\u003c/u\u003e: \u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[ Voldemort is after this stone because he becomes too week after killing trying to kill harry. If he gets the Stone he will become powerful, again. \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eTHINGS I LIKED\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEverything! from beginning to ending except for one minor thing (\u003ci\u003esee next section\u003c/i\u003e).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eQuidditch\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI liked this sport a lot. When I came to know about it I thought \"Author will skip this and announce the winner\" BUT author wrote this sport in such a brilliant way that I want more on this sport. There is a book on this and I will read that book soon.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eLast Chapter\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eJust one line: \"Anyone can betray anyone.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis book contains a good deal of very entertaining scenes. I liked the imagination of author.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eTHINGS I DIDN'T LIKE\u003c/b\u003e (\u003ci\u003enot that much\u003c/i\u003e)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eNicolas Flamel's Intoduction\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis book took little long time to introduce Nicolas (\u003ci\u003efriend of Dumbledore and \u003ca class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(view spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\"\u003e[the maker of Sorcerer's Stone \u003ca class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\"\u003e(hide spoiler)\u003c/a\u003e]\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e), 2 chapters (\u003ci\u003earround 30 pages\u003c/i\u003e). I couldn't like it much because Harry was wondering he had heard/read that name before but he didn't remember it right now. I can understand. BUT 2 CHAPTERS! Seriously! Even though we knew where Harry had read that name. In the train when he was coming to Hogwarts. It didn't look good to me or I couldn't find any fair reason to make this topic that long.I didn't completely hate that fact. I liked it but not that much I liked the whole things in the book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eRECOMMENDATION\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eEveryone should read it regardless of their tastes, I mean, favourite genre. I don't think there would be a person on this planet (\u003ci\u003esilly thing to say\u003c/i\u003e) who would dare to hate this book. I have become a very big fan of this series. It is not a surprise who wouldn't be. I highly recommend this book to those who hasn't started reading. This book would be a great start for them.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eCONCLUSION\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI must say author has done a good deal of hard work. She wrote every scene in such a way that there would be no need of any visual form of this. I could visualize every scene of this book very easily while reading. I didn't thought I would read this type of writing style after Rick Riordan's. She is on second position in my list of Author's-Writing-Style. SORRY! I can't replace Rick Riordan's style with anybody's. I liked his style more than anybody's. I am really looking forward to read Parcy Jackson series BUT you know, 2 series of 10 books (\u003ci\u003e5 in each\u003c/i\u003e) is more than enough books for me to read right now. BUT Sooner or later I will read that series too.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eAccording to fact I mentioned above, I would like to give:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e**** 5 Lifelong Shinning Stars ****\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003ePoint out my mistakes and my misunderstanding about this book if there are any. I would be happy to see that!\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003eThanks for your attention!\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eQUOTES I LIKED\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"He didn't know what was going to - but it had to be better than what he was leaving.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"...hard work and pain are the best teachers...\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"Petrificus Totalus!\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"It was one of those occasions when the true story is even more and exciting than the wild rumors.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"...you couldn't have everything in life.\"\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\"'The truth' Dumbledore sighed. So no plot/summary from me haha\u003cbr /\u003eThis series is and will ever be a HUGE part of my life and everything started with this particular book.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eLast but not least: \u003cb\u003eThe illustrated edition\u003c/b\u003e, which \u003cb\u003eis stunning\u003c/b\u003e! disturbing and I LOVE IT xD)\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003ci\u003eSorry if it was a little messy, it's probably not even a review lol but I wanted to share a little piece of class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1783293758' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1783293758' class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1372638695\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1372638695\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Sarah\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3344685-sarah\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Sarah\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1388694025p2/3344685.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1372638695?book_show_action=false\"\u003eNov 03, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Sarah\" class=\"user\" name=\"Sarah\" href=\"/user/show/3344685-sarah\"\u003eSarah\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9781408845646\" href=\"/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=books-i-own-print\"\u003ebooks-i-own-print\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=favorites\"\u003efavorites\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=british-author\"\u003ebritish-author\u003c/a\u003e, \n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=read-in-2015\"\u003eread-in-2015\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1372638695\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer2767526955082208559\"\u003eYes, I realise I already own two copies of this book BUT this one is \u003ci\u003eillustrated\u003c/i\u003e - that makes all the difference surely? It can't possibly be wrong to buy a book that looks this beautiful can it?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs soon as I saw images of \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone: Illustrated Edition\u003c/b\u003e I knew I had to have it, as a huge fan of the series and someone who already owns several print versions as well as the ebook of each Harry Potter story there was no way I could miss out on this beautiful new edition\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText2767526955082208559\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eYes, I realise I already own two copies of this book BUT this one is \u003ci\u003eillustrated\u003c/i\u003e - that makes all the difference surely? It can't possibly be wrong to buy a book that looks this beautiful can it?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs soon as I saw images of \u003cb\u003eHarry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone: Illustrated Edition\u003c/b\u003e I knew I had to have it, as a huge fan of the series and someone who already owns several print versions as well as the ebook of each Harry Potter story there was no way I could miss out on this beautiful new edition. There is absolutely no point in me writing another review of the story (you can read my original one \u003ca href=\"http://www.feelingfictional.com/2011/09/review-harry-potter-and-philosophers.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eHERE\u003c/a\u003e) because I'm pretty sure that most of the people who are going to be looking at buying this book are already going to be Harry Potter fans so instead I'm going to focus on the quality of the book and the illustrations.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eTo put it simply this book is STUNNING. I had high expectations but was totally blown away by how beautiful this book is, it brings back the magical feeling of reading Harry Potter for the first time and I think it's definitely a perfect edition to read with children. \u003cb\u003eJim Kay\u003c/b\u003e has done a fantastic job of giving new life to the characters, he's managed to make them his own (which must have been quite hard to do considering how well everyone knows the actors from the movies) while still making them instantly recognisable.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe book itself is a lot larger than I expected and has me wondering if they'll have to publish the later books in more than one edition. The quality is brilliant with lovely glossy pages and gorgeous illustrated end pages. This is the kind of book that you want to treasure and it would make a perfect gift for any Harry Potter fan. I can't wait to see the illustrated editions of the rest of the series and will definitely be purchasing them as soon as they're published.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI'm going to finish this review with a couple of pictures so you can see just how beautiful some of the illustrations are:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Nho-6QC2PJg/ViQsThLI7iI/AAAAAAAAMrY/crMO6VVUce4/s1600/HP%2BIllustrated%2BHarry.jpg\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n          \u003cimg height=\"400\" src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445211765i/16615269.jpg\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n      \n class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca comment...\u003c/textarea\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\n      \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"clear\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" \u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"section\"\u003e\n      \n\n\u003cdiv id=\"review_1589985572\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\"\u003e\n  \u003clink itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1589985572\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Brian\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1938805-brian\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Brian\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442608867p2/1938805.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1589985572?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJul 18, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Brian\" class=\"user\" name=\"Brian\" href=\"/user/show/1938805-brian\"\u003eBrian\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eliked it\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1938805-brian?shelf=read_with_bel\"\u003eread_with_bel\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1589985572\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer1785899583763076740\"\u003eIt wasn’t much of a shock when the world learned, upon the completion of the Harry Potter octology, that J.K. Rowling was formerly a high ranking agent in MI6. In the early ‘90s the UK was just emerging from the shadow of Thatcherism and a dozen years of painful domestic reform; the Soviet Union had issued its dying fetid breath and the resulting power vacuum offered a unique opportunity for the country to return to its former glory. Rowling’s memoranda and comminiqué had always leaned towards\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText1785899583763076740\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eIt wasn’t much of a shock when the world learned, upon the completion of the Harry Potter octology, that J.K. Rowling was formerly a high ranking agent in MI6. In the early ‘90s the UK was just emerging from the shadow of Thatcherism and a dozen years of painful domestic reform; the Soviet Union had issued its dying fetid breath and the resulting power vacuum offered a unique opportunity for the country to return to its former glory. Rowling’s memoranda and comminiqué had always leaned towards the florid; she was the natural choice when the nation’s intelligence agency decided to “retire” one of their most decorated agents and move her into a new role. It turned out to be one of the greatest propaganda coups in Western Civilization.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThe formerly defunct MI7, created specifically in the early 1900s for the type of work Rowling would be asked to do, was clandestinely revived with the resources to support a lone agent with a singular purpose: create a new British hero. What they did not want was a James Bond reboot - a cavalier, womanizing anti-hero that righted the world’s ills at the draw of a gun. The new world required a new kind of icon, someone with whom the pre-teens of the ‘90s could relate. “I’ve got this,” Rowling was rumored to have said. A classic understatement, in every sense.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eBook One of the Potter series establishes all of the important tropes and themes that any propogandist worth her salt would employ. Rowling even put her prowess at anagrams to good use. Harry Potter: \u003ci\u003eTry Hero Part\u003c/i\u003e. Harry’s feckless aunt, representing the American hegemony, is a personal favorite. Petunia Darsley: \u003ci\u003eEasily Upturned\u003c/i\u003e. Potter is the offspring of two famous practitioners of magic, their deaths representative of the twin pasts of former British rule: supremacy of international commerce and the resulting colonialism. The young Harry doesn’t know about his past - he must learn about it in a classic unfolding narrative that reveals how special he (i.e. the UK) really is. The tutelage and mentorship of Hogwarts has been shown to be a thinly veiled allusion to the European Union. Online chatrooms and water cooler discussions over the past 20 years have been filled with opinions on which EU member is represented by Dumbledore, McGonagall, Snape, etc. - suffice to say that it is another testament to Rowling’s brilliance that she has never offered any opinions to the discussions; allowing the punters their pet views, however misguided, only strengthened the allegory.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIt is said that the creation of the story’s villain was Rowling’s most difficult task. To take on the USA directly, the UK’s closest ally and the last global power, was strictly off limits. Still, that didn’t stop the speculation that America was indeed the antagonist (the whole “don’t-speak-his-name” thing taken too literal), but as declassified documents have shown, Rowling’s intention from the start was for Voldemort to be the representation of all the evil’s of British past, for if the UK was to ever achieve its new ascendancy, it must first not be afraid to speak - and acknowledge - its former horrors; it must learn from those mistakes and grow strong with the help of its new world allies in hope of one day achieving that new Golden Age of the British Empire.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"1785899583763076740\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1589985572\"\u003e\n  \u003ctd colspan=\"2\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"updateActionLinks\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1589985572\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n    \u003cdiv id='comments_for_review_1589985572' style='display: none;'\u003e\n\u003cdiv class='brown_comment'\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"\u003e\u003ca simply, this is a book I'll treasure forever.\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cbr\u003e********************************************\u003cbr\u003e\u0026lt; b\u0026gt;Jan. 14th, 2016. Before reading:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis beauty arrived in the mail today. It was a reaaally late Christmas present.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMy first reaction: I cried because I'd just heard the news about Alan Rickman, and how twisted is it that 3 weeks after this was ordered it would arrive TODAY of all days?\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow a few hours have passed and I finally opened it and it is so GORGEOUS and PERFECT and I'm starting to get really excited to do a slow re-read of this book, and admire all the absolutely STUNNING illustrations.         $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});\n        } else {\n          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});\n var lessLink = e.next();\n            swapContent(lessLink);\n          }\n        });\n      });\n\n//]]\u003e\n\u003c/script\u003e  \u003cscript type=\"text/javascript\"\u003e\n  //\u003c![CDATA[\n             \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1357167929\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer9358891040601519734\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e[OK since no one really reads my reviews, I'm gonna write as long as I want, nobody cares!]\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003eLikes: \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Characters\u003c/b\u003e (Usually everyone in a story has the same personality as the author. But this book had different types of people which was cool!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Storyline\u003c/b\u003e (it was pretty complicated and therefore it was really awesome!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Some ideas\u003c/b\u003e (many big ideas or small details in the story that made it wonderful)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Writing style\u003c/b\u003e (so friendly, and sometimes funny)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Atmosphere\u003c/b\u003e (London, an old castle near a mysteriou\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText9358891040601519734\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e[OK since no one really reads my reviews, I'm gonna write as long as I want, nobody cares!]\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e◾Likes: \u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Characters\u003c/b\u003e (Usually everyone in a story has the same personality as the author. But this book had different types of people which was cool!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Storyline\u003c/b\u003e (it was pretty complicated and therefore it was really awesome!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Some ideas\u003c/b\u003e (many big ideas or small details in the story that made it wonderful)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Writing style\u003c/b\u003e (so friendly, and sometimes funny)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Atmosphere\u003c/b\u003e (London, an old castle near a mysterious forest, where people learn magic... It's no wonder lots of people love it and many authors have tried to write a story like it!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e◽Dislikes:\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Harry's character\u003c/b\u003e (honestly, I couldn't figure out what kind of a boy he was. Sometimes he's a loser who runs away from the bullies, sometimes he's a hero everyone expects him to be, sometimes he's afraid of saying a word, sometimes he dares to fight Voldemort...)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Plot holes\u003c/b\u003e (I think there's no need to write about the many big black holes in the plot!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Wizards' world\u003c/b\u003e (I expected the wizards' world to be different. I didn't expect them to educate in schools like the real schools, or play basketball on brooms, or play chess with alive pieces, or have a ministry, or hospitals or a bank. Everything was like the real world with a little difference. It wasn't magical enough.)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Muggles\u003c/b\u003e (this book tells us that magic is so cool, and Muggles are useless and dumb. And I, the reader, AM A MUGGLE! It's just insulting me!)\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cb\u003e• Long chapters\u003c/b\u003e (the chapters weren't exactly loooong, but I couldn't read the story as fast as other books for some reason, and every time I checked how much more till the next chapter, and saw OMG there's still 10 pages to go!!)\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"9358891040601519734\" href=\"#\" href=\"/review/show/1410869250?book_show_action=false\"\u003eNov 26, 2015\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Christine (weereader)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Christine (weereader)\" href=\"/user/show/39719286-christine-weereader\"\u003eChristine (weereader)\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9781408845646\" href=\"/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n          \u003cdiv class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\"\u003e\n            Shelves:\n              \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/39719286-christine-weereader?shelf=read-2015\"\u003eread-2015\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1410869250\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer7530585011228308967\"\u003eThis my first time rereading this book in four years and it is just as magical and brilliant as I remembered.\u003cbr /\u003eThe artwork by Jim Kay is absolutely beautiful and it's so exciting to see the world we know and love re-imagined! I can't wait to see the rest of the series illustrated. \u003cbr /\u003eThis time reading it I found myself feeling a lot more emotional about Harry and his life. He is so young! I feel so sorry for him and angry that he was left to have an awful upbringing by the magical world. Whereas when\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText7530585011228308967\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eThis my first time rereading this book in four years and it is just as magical and brilliant as I remembered.\u003cbr /\u003eThe artwork by Jim Kay is absolutely beautiful and it's so exciting to see the world we know and love re-imagined! I can't wait to see the rest of the series illustrated. \u003cbr /\u003eThis time reading it I found myself feeling a lot more emotional about Harry and his life. He is so young! I feel so sorry for him and angry that he was left to have an awful upbringing by the magical world. Whereas when I read it multiple times as a child I was mainly just excited about the magic.\u003cbr /\u003eThe world building in this book is absolutely phenomenal and it's just amazing the way that JK Rowling manages to create such a believable and detailed magical system that fits in with the world we know. This time reading it I was happy to notice more of the references to the real world that went completely over my head when I was younger.\u003cbr /\u003eI love reading about the blossoming friendship between Harry, Ron and Hermione and it's so great to read about Harry finally finding a place he can call home.\u003cbr /\u003eI can't help but see Dumbeldore as being very manipulative from the start, so it's interesting to read about him with a new perspective. I also just can't bring myself to like Snape, nothing excuses someone being so horrible to wee children!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThis isn't the best review because this book is just perfect and I can hardly even put into world everything I love about this book!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"7530585011228308967\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return            \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer80584153\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer4458404964642675402\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e “It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.” \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI've sat at my desk for over an hour and I still, after all these years, do not think I can review this book properly. All I can say is that \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e feels like home, and every page of this book feels like magic; and not the magic that has to do with wizards or Hogwarts, but magic that has to do with love that is all encompassing. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis book was published nearly twenty years ago, but when I opened this book to the first page it felt lik\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText4458404964642675402\" style=\"display:none\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e “It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.” \u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI've sat at my desk for over an hour and I still, after all these years, do not think I can review this book properly. All I can say is that \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e feels like home, and every page of this book feels like magic; and not the magic that has to do with wizards or Hogwarts, but magic that has to do with love that is all encompassing. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis book was published nearly twenty years ago, but when I opened this book to the first page it felt like not a day had passed. I really don't have any amount of words that I can string together to tell you how this book makes me feel. J.K. Rowling will always set the bar for how a series \u003ci\u003eshould\u003c/i\u003e be written, because \u003ci\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/i\u003e is written with love, and it makes all the difference. \u003cb\u003eAlways.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429509074ra/14597460.gif\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1115415851\" /\u003e\n    \u003ca title=\"Abigail\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/32620550-abigail\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Abigail\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469056069p2/32620550.jpg\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\n  \u003cdiv class=\"left bodycol\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\"\u003e\n        \u003ca class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1115415851?book_show_action=false\"\u003eJan 05, 2016\u003c/a\u003e\n\n      \u003ca title=\"Abigail\" class=\"user\" name=\"Abigail\" href=\"/user/show/32620550-abigail\"\u003eAbigail\u003c/a\u003e\n\n        rated it\n        \u003cspan class=\" staticStars\"\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003eit was amazing\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003cspan class=\"greyText\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\n          \u003ca class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780545790352\" href=\"/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone\"\u003ereview of another edition\u003c/a\u003e\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1115415851\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer15496886452789301210\"\u003eFirst Read: Summer 2009 \u003cbr /\u003eLast Read: January 2016\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFive stars, of course!\u003cbr /\u003eThere is no greater home than the Harry Potter books. I adore these books more than I can ever express in words. The first major series I ever read, the books that got me into reading, my favorite series. \u003cbr /\u003eIt was so nice to read this book again and the pictures were an added bonus, Jim Kay is a wonderful artist. J.K. Rowling's words are so great. Being back with Harry, Ron, Hermione, Neville, Fred and George, Hagrid, and everyon\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText15496886452789301210\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eFirst Read: Summer 2009 \u003cbr /\u003eLast Read: January 2016\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFive stars, of course!\u003cbr /\u003eThere is no greater home than the Harry Potter books. I adore these books more than I can ever express in words. The first major series I ever read, the books that got me into reading, my favorite series. \u003cbr /\u003eIt was so nice to read this book again and the pictures were an added bonus, Jim Kay is a wonderful artist. J.K. Rowling's words are so great. Being back with Harry, Ron, Hermione, Neville, Fred and George, Hagrid, and everyone else made me so happy. There are some things that I had forgotten like how much I dislike the Dursley's, the purple and black fire walls scene at the end, and how much I love Dumbledore. So those were great to revisit. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eIf you haven't already, pick up these books. They are so worth it. \u003cbr /\u003eI'll keep waiting on my Hogwarts letter, even though it almost feels like I've already been.\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"15496886452789301210\" title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer677488321\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer17606148631170401092\"\u003eMy boyfriend and I are read this book together this summer. My goal was to get him to read more since it is one of my favorite hobbies, so I let him pick the book we read. He chose Harry Potter. Well, I guess it was about time I finally read this book :P Not to brag or anything… but finished before him ;) haha. I enjoyed this book. It was a really good kids book. It is a fast, easy read, but like I said earlier it was defiantly written for someone younger.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI would give this book a 3.5 stars, so I\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan id=\"freeText17606148631170401092\" style=\"display:none\"\u003eMy boyfriend and I are read this book together this summer. My goal was to get him to read more since it is one of my favorite hobbies, so I let him pick the book we read. He chose Harry Potter. Well, I guess it was about time I finally read this book :P Not to brag or anything… but finished before him ;) haha. I enjoyed this book. It was a really good kids book. It is a fast, easy read, but like I said earlier it was defiantly written for someone younger.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI would give this book a 3.5 stars, so I am rounding it up to 4 stars!\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca data-text-id=\"17606148631170401092\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\"\u003e...more\u003c/a\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003ca class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40080783-jungbook?shelf=books-i-own\"\u003ebooks-i-own\u003c/a\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n        \u003cdiv class=\"reviewText stacked\"\u003e\n              \u003cspan id=\"reviewTextContainer1336880109\" class=\"readable\"\n              \u003e\n            \n\u003cspan id=\"freeTextContainer1014731924402268865\"\u003eI loved this book, I loved how there was a mystery that Harry had to solve among being new to Hogwarts school of witchcraft and wizardry. It was beautifully written, and although marked as a \"Childrens book\", I being a teenager still loved it. When you find out the teacher that was working for Voldemort I gasped so loud my mother received a noise complaint. I read it in the summer and finished it in a matter of days. Overall: 5 stars\u003c/span\u003e\n\n          \u003c/span\u003e\n        \u003c/div\u003e\n\n\n      \u003cdiv class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\"\u003e\n          \n\n\u003ctr class=\"no_border class=\"loadingAnimation\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"loadingError\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u0026middot;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca
